Several things in our room needed attention: the tub didn't drain, the air conditioner was not working, the patio table was broke, the sink was cracked , the hair dryer wouldn't work and the last morning the toilet wouldn't flush. When we called for service everything was taken care of right away, however, we felt that for the price we shouldn't have had to deal with all those issues. The resort was isolated and because we did not have a car it was an issue to get anywhere. Thus, we were inclined to eat there more and buy items from the gift shop, which was pricey. The floor in our room was very dirty, as someone else has stated. The first night I walked around the room in my socks and the bottoms were black after 2 hours of walking on the room floor. It was quite a walk to get anywhere on the resort, so if you have trouble walking this would not be the place for you. Overall, it was a very pretty place and generally the staff was exceptional. The food was good and the beach was quiet and clean. Downside - pricey, isolated and not quiet. Shuttles would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but wouldn't recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: Jenks99
Reviews.Content: Remote & because of that they charge exorbitant prices for everything. Cleaning is haphazard to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Very Underwhelming and will not be back”
Reviews.Author: beatlesclark
Reviews.Content: This is a family holiday, 2 adults and 2 kids. Booked over the internet.......and from the pictures displayed thought it would be fabulous.......NOT SO!!!! The pools and facilities were nice, but our room was not. We were assigned one overlooking the carpark and my first thought was " caravan park". The rooms although roomy were dated and as we adjoined another unit could hear EVERYTHING going on. From showers, and crying kids to flushing the toilet. We travel alot and in comparison to other accommodation we have stayed in, this place is extremely overpriced. We understood there was a parking tarriff ($25 per day) , but were also charged a non negotiable $15 levy per day for use of internet and basic facilities. I am convinced there are better deals and resorts around San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, but they nickel and dime you!”
Reviews.Author: Eastcoast2
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and nice. Resort is beautiful being right on Mission Bay with many water features and much space to walk or ride bikes. Very relaxing atmosphere. Resort rooms had been remodeled but done in a "quick" remodel way with many older features still showing. I am really picky and still found it nice and comfortable. Staff is friendly and helpful. Upon check in we were informed of a 25 dollar a night fee for parking which is ridiculous seeing each unit has its own space (it's not like there was a parking garage or lack of space for parking) but we were told this was because there were no resort fees. However, they charged 10 dollars per person per day to use their gym, they charged to rent bikes and to play golf on their miniature course. With no resort fees, we thought these activities would be free to guests. One heated pool (there are more on property but not heated or as large) fills up quickly each day. The resort is located in a convenient location, out of the city but only 10 minutes away and was easy to get to any of the local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love!”
Reviews.Author: karenb9236
Reviews.Content: The resort was great, but the SPA was outstanding... great space, great massages, fabulous all the way around. A+++++

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: well_traveledNyc
Reviews.Content: It's old and dated. The floors in our room were filthy. The food was expensive and skimpy on the ingredients (Cobb salad was nothing but lettuce for example). This place is waaaaay over priced. We did have one nice guy working there who was very polite. The view from the business facility was nice too. Would we go back? Not a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Already Have Return Reservations; Best Spa Treatment Ever”
Reviews.Author: KRuthless
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, family-friendly resort (although this trip I went with some women friends). I definitely felt like I was in Hawaii, without the plane trip. The main pool by the spa is designed to be like a beach and I can't wait to bring my 5 year twins here -- I made reservations to return in three weeks. The suite we had was very nice; there is a little "fraying" around the edges (like in the bathroom), but it was still lovely and very large. We also had spa treatments, which were fabulous. I received a treatment from Lea, who is among the best "therapists" I have ever had. She literally anticipated my needs. The rest of the spa staff were friendly, helpful and informative. The two steam rooms were terrific; when/if the spa is remodeled, I vote for an in-spa jacuzzi. One small negative about resort: very steep daily parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “We are already planning our next stay”
Reviews.Author: llevybuch
Reviews.Content: My three best girlfriends and I came to Paradise Point last weekend to celebrate one of our birthdays. None of us had been to the property before and we were all very impressed by the beauty of the property and how it truly takes you away into a feeling of being surrounded in paradise. We had a wonderful room and found all of the staff to be helpful and accommodating. The second day we went to The Spa and each treated ourselves to a 50-minute spa treatment - and that was the highlight for all of us. From the minute we walked into the spa and were greeted by the warm and welcoming staff, to the time I literally feel asleep in the peaceful relaxation room before my treatment, to my appointment with Annette for a skin wrap, it was a truly lovely experience. Each of us tried a different spa treatment and had different therapists, and each of us came out with the same satisfied feeling of having been given a gift. We will absolutely come back, and in fact, we started planning our next visit (this time with our kids) before we left that afternoon. We are going back in a few weeks from now.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point is the absolute best!!”
Reviews.Author: caroline4444
Reviews.Content: My family and I always look forward to our stays at Paradise Point Resort and Spa. We have held our family reunions at the resort for the past four years, at times my family and I have stayed twice a year. We love to stay at Paradise Point because it offers us Paradise. The tropical plants around the resort are gorgeous. Paradise Point offers so much that there is no need to travel elsewhere; such as biking, sailing, jet skiing, motor boating and our absolute favorite kayaking. The resort has five pools, our favorite pool is the main pool beause it offers movie night, what matter than swiiming under the stars while watching a family friendly movie. My family and I also love the breathtaking ocean views, the whole resort is surrounded by the beach. At night we all go down to the fire pitts and make smores, and just have fun. The staff is friendly, kind and helpful. Paradise Point really offers the guest PARADISE!

Reviews.Title: “a mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Starby1967
Reviews.Content: A bit of everything here. We stayed for 6 nights in July and I would suggest the hotel is more suitable for shorter stays. Overall, our issues were dealt with swiftly and satisfactorily by hotel management. The good: nice location, pretty grounds, good-sized, clean & comfortable rooms, excellent management responsiveness to issues raised. The disappointing: very expensive food & drink for what it is; only one restaurant where it's feasible to eat each night, resulting in wait times for dinner and patchy service (even at breakfast); hygiene standards near pool and with room service could be better; mandatory charges ($15 per day, per room) for wi-fi, gym access and a few other things even if you don't want them. Felt like we were charged for EVERYTHING. Tip - negotiate with management if you're not happy - worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Veious
Reviews.Content: This was an unexpected and pleasant surprise. All of the rooms were bungalows which provided for a much quiter and relaxing stay. The staff was first rate, and were eager to assist. I will definitely return with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Jamkal
Reviews.Content: We are beyond impressed with this resort. From the lush location and all of the amenities (Great Pools, Mini Golf, Beach Front rooms) this place has alot to offer. We are so happy and can't wait to come back again. This has been the location for our family vacation for the past 4 years and we will always come back! Thanks for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: runningmom_11
Reviews.Content: We scored a great deal on Priceline but after reading other reviews, we were concerned as they were not stellar. But we found the grounds gorgeous, the bungalow right by the water in prime location, and the service excellent! We shared with them it was our anniversary and they comped one day's parking, upgraded our room, and even brought us a bottle of wine on the house! The bungalow did need some repairs, but still a very nice room. We enjoyed our stay and only wished we were staying more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical, nice place for families too vacation with lots of activities!”
Reviews.Author: Luvem2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during his convention. The buildings are al one story and ha e been renovated. Many units are on the beach, others are throughout the grounds that are very lush & tropical. There are several pools with hot tubs and fire pits for the evening. There is one Adult Only pool, which I found very relaxing & quiet. There are 2 restaurants, one is a casual & one that is open evenings that is more expensive. We seemed to have consistent issues at the casual restaurant...from bringing the wrong order, forgetting to put the dinner tag in and waiting an hour to be served, to serving us and never returning. Good news is there are plenty of fabulous places to eat nearby!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun 4th of July stay at Paraddise Point Resort in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: lori8brink
Reviews.Content: We experienced our first stay at Paradise Point 4th of July weekend... The room was beautiful comfortable and with all the ammenities of home.. There was so much to do, bike rentals,pools, spa,golfing,corquette and so much more and we did them all.. Not to mention the great restauarants great menus and unbelievable staff.. Security director was "Super Great" he completed our stay as did the great staff Ludy at Island Market along with Mary & Alyssa at front desk and the gentleman with our bike rental... Thank you all so very much for a stay to remember.. I will be ther againvery soon and recommended you to friends that will be staying there in August... Again thank you all so very much.. Lori Jim and family...

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Dr Den
Reviews.Content: The website looks tremendous But We booked a family room, which turned out to be a double room, and a rickty old sofa which opened up. Room was small, smelt of stale stuff, would never recommend . Complained, and was offered the 'only' free room, which was a great suite, kitchen, lounge, room for kids, but cost me another £2000 for the two week stay upgrade. Cleaning staff were great, laundry which was good, but would not recommend to worse enemy Sorry guys. The promised that a refurb was due soon, but was an expensive holiday to begin with, turned out to be an even more expensive holiday. Still, live and learn, don't believe all you read on the net, other than trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Super holiday but watch for the hidden extra charges”
Reviews.Author: magsB
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel and checked in easily. The room was a great size and the bathroom spotless. The bungalow type accommodation is very pleasant. We had some patio furniture to sit and enjoy the sunshine. We ate at the barefoot grill. The food was quite nice but the service leaves much to be desired. I don't normally complain about service but my husband and I both found that the waitresses were more interested in flirting with the waiters than seeing to their guests. We ate here at different times of the day and found the behaviour exactly the same, perhaps they need a supervisor in charge. It is not cheap but not too extortionate. Lots of restaurants in San Diego so wouldn't really recommend it. We didn't try the Baleen restaurant because it was always empty and we like a bit of ambiance. The room was lovely and quite spacious. The bed was enormous and very comfortable. The bathroom was spotless and plenty of towels. We had to ask for extra coathangers as there was not enough. No problem, we had them within minutes. There are 3 pools, we didn't really use them but what we saw was really nice. They were clean. The grounds are very nice indeed and well kept. It is very relaxing. We walked everywhere and used public transport. We had no car and found this not to be a problem as the public transport is excellent. One word of caution, watch out for hidden charges. We were charged for the passport to paradise, even though we did not use any of the facilities. When I enquired about this, it was removed from the bill. However I was warned by the young lady at reception that if I return for another visit I would have to pay th $15 charge each day. Not really a recommendation to return. I cashed travellers cheques each day and heard people complain about hidden charges every day. We did not have a car but they charge for that as well. Still it is a beautiful place which is well kept and we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation for 4 including 2 older childeren. Better than we dreamed of!!”
Reviews.Author: KristenKeller_TX
Reviews.Content: This resort is an excellent place to take your family. I searched for a nice location that would also be appropiate for our 2 boys (10,11 yrs old) I couldn't have picked a better place. We recieved the luxuries you look for as an adult on vacation and the children were able to run around and be kids and have the time of their life without me having to get on to them to be still or quiet or stay in one place. They had they run of the resort on their bikes and weren't "bored" for a single second (first time for everything) Everything at the resort was beauriful and close to most things we wanted to do while in San Diego. We had a small issue at check in but the manager Matt (very nice man) stepped in and took excellent care of us after that!! Issues are expected in life but how you deal with them is the valuable lesson. Matt dealt with the issue wonderfully and we can't wait for our next trip to Paradise!!! If your looking for a family friendly place to stay in San Diego look no further...Paridise Point is it!!

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: chris6333
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Paradise Point annually for the last 7 years. It is a beautiful "island" getaway in the middle of everything in San Diego...Shamu is literally across the street. My family enjoys it here for the following; room, location on beach, activities, pool, and friendly staff. It is great for young families. The only negative is the price keeps rising every year. Tip: become a member and look for deals.

Reviews.Title: “great, would go again”
Reviews.Author: timothylwhitelaw
Reviews.Content: and the best part is, if there is a problem they will go the extra effort to make it right. This was a family vacation, the first of this length ever, nine days total. We stayed the first five nights here and the resort is very nice, but do stay on the water, the difference is beyond comparision. We spent the first night after driving all day in a "garden room", too crowded for the four of us (two teenagers). They had sold out of the two queens we had already paid for, so we were stuck for that night with a rollaway. The next morning they made us a great upgrade for a discount due to the trouble. The beach front bungalow is awesome, you step out your front door on to the sand. On our last day some rude inconsiderate selfish jerks that were not even at the resort (its all public beach) camped their fat pontoon boat and fat arses right in front of our unit. We complained. Hotel could not do anything, but did make it very worth our while in their response comping our last night and the head of security, Phil, personally delivered an armload of beach goodies to us as we spent the previous day making a sandcastle that the family of 12 was now parked around. He came over again as we were leaving the next day to see how the day had gone and was truly great. We would highly recommend this place and will return. We left all of the beach goodies for other families that were just beginning their vacation as we were checking out. Oh, do plan on having bonfires and smores if that's your thing. The front of the cabanas are totally set up with fire pits. The casual restaurant, the only one we went to, was very good. The gift shop had just about everything from aspirin to boutique clothing (as in, from simple, inexpensive necessities to nice expensive things). We would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: jimmyathwal
Reviews.Content: My wife, 18 mth old daughter and I stayed at Paradise Point for 4 days and definitely enjoyed our stay. It was definitely a nice break to stay at something different than your standard hotel. The property is beautifully landscaped. When we checked into our room we did notice some rust on the bath tub which was something we did not want when bathing a baby. The front desk staff were very understanding and upgraded us into a massive executive suite. Once we settled in, we really enjoyed sitting by the pool side. There could have been another server or two around the pool area for drinks and food. We mainly ate all three meals a day at the Barefoot Grill and found the selection and quality to be pretty good. After drinks at the pool, eating at the resort was a very good option! I found the beds to be a little too soft for my liking...back was sore each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing trip”
Reviews.Author: bgleeson08
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was well kept and so relaxing to stay in. Cleanliness of the whole resort was immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time - kids loved the beach.”
Reviews.Author: 7373Houston
Reviews.Content: The beach was great. My kids had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point is just that, instead going to a far away place”
Reviews.Author: jf_kent
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this beatiful resort located in a major city instead of in the Carribean some where. Elizabeth at the Island Market, on site gift shop, was wonderful. She went over and above the call of duty to make sure our trip was nothing short of fantastic. She put together a list of things to do, places to eat and various happy hours. She scheduled activities and continually called to tell what was planned next and to make sure we were having fun doing each and every thing. She should be doing this as a living and not stuck in gift shop letting her talent, expertise and enthusiasm go to waste. Elizabeth is major asset of Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay at! stayed in a villa. very roomy/”
Reviews.Author: craftyNj
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference here in july 2011. also had time to enjoy the resort. we stayed in a villa with bedroom, living are (which was quite large) and bathroom/kitchen. very nice and clean. the grounds are beautiful! the bed was soooo comfortable. went to the main pool which had a hot tub and a bar if you needed a drink:) Excellent. beautiful pool:) Had a drink at the barefoot bar and grille. it was good. friends of ours ate there and said the food was delicious. this resort is in a great location. across the bay from seaworld so you can view the fireworks from the resort. some rooms are on the beach and you can have bonfires on the beach. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: borabora2
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful & unexpected stay at Paradise Point. We had not planned on staying in San Diego or Paradise Point. My family and I were booked for a trip to Cabo San Lucas and once we got to the airport we found out that my daughter's passport had expired two weeks prior. After all of us were very disappointed we couldn't go to Mexico, we went home and I immediately checked online to see where we could fly out to that same day. We decided on San Diego and after several reviews on tripadvisor we decided to go to Paradise Point. I called and spoke to a wonderful lady at reservations and explained our story. I think she felt sorry for us, and booked us into a wonderful oceanfront room. After a very long day filled with disappointment, long plane rides, and a daughter who got motion sickness on the airplane(s) we finally checked into Paradise Point. What a pleasant surprise we had once we checked in. The room was large, with a beautiful view of the ocean, and great sand beach. Check in was quick and painless. I traveled with my Husband, 6 year old daughter, and 2 year old son. The resort is large, but doesn't feel so. They have several pools, although we spent our time only at the large main pool, there were plenty of seats, the service was excellent, and the food was good at the pool. I would rate this hotel more of a family resort, however, we only went to the main pool and there were several families here. All of the other pools were very quiet and more adult friendly. I think this resort does a good job servicing everyone. We had dinner once at Baleen, the food was very good, a little slow getting out, but a beautiful view, and a little pricey. We ate lunch & breakfast each at Barefoot Bar & Grille, the food is very good, however, the food is VERY slow getting out. Each time we had to wait over an hour for food, keep this in mind if you have small children or if you're in a hurry. We also ordered room service several times, this is also slow. The location of the resort is perfect, you are literally across the bridge from Sea World and about 10-15 minutes from the airport and Gaslamp District. You can actually see the fireworks from Paradise Point. They offer a ferry from Paradise Point to Sea World, this is really nice since you get to come in the back way, no lines. Although, the last ferry leaves at 7 pm which is unfortunate. I believe the fee is $9 round trip. If you are concerned about staying at Paradise Point don't be. I read some of the negative reviews and was a little concerned. It's a beautiful resort, that has been completely remodeled. It is well appointed, relaxing, and the service is excellent. My only complaint is the wait for food. We travel frequently, and like to stay at nice resorts typically 4-5 star. I would give this resort 4 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Our 5th Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: PeeweeontheRoad
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for families. We had 4 rooms next to each other. The grandkids all had a blast. Swimming, pool time, just lots of fun. However, it's very expensive! When you're spending over $2,000 per day (for all four rooms), and that they call themselves a "resort", it seems that they are really missing some resort items. For example....no bathrobes, no slippers, no turndown service in the evening, poor (even bad) housekeeping, no lotions, shower cap, soaps, and other bath amenities. Housekeeping is very disorganized. Watched supervisors and all they did was reassign staff to rooms that were screaming the loudest for service. They should have spent their time checking on the quality of the work - which is spotty and not consistent. One day, they even forgot to leave clean towels. Disappointing, to say the least! Will we come again? Probably. But, the management needs to focus on improving so that more value is seen for the huge cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good property letdown by underwhelming service and overwhelming cost”
Reviews.Author: Traveller32Sydney
Reviews.Content: We were one of three families meeting at Paradise Point. The grounds are quite nice, well laid out, good pools. All three families had the same experience - very poor in-room service. For instance, our 1 bedroom came with a "kitchenette", which had nothing additional of use to the normal suite - there was no cutlery, no dishes, no glasses or mugs. We had to request these to be provided, which took several calls. Calls for any in-room service were consistently responded to in a friendly fashion, but there was often minimal follow through (requesting something that arrived 7 hours later). The resort was quite expensive for the value delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Magnificent - Hawaii in California - All You Could Wish For!”
Reviews.Author: enelraonaps
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at Paradise Point this year and the resort is magnificent. It is like Hawaii when you go into the complex - gorgeous and lush! There are 7 pools - all fabulous - adults only pool, and poolside dining at the main pool. All the rooms are beautiful and within easy access to a pool. The bayside bungalows are gorgeous with awesome views from the private terraces right on Mission Beach. Restaurants are terrific whether casual or fine dining with outstand menus and service. The resort offers every amenity you could want from biking on a 4 person bike, basketball, miniature golf, and other activities to all water sports. They also offer pickups at rooms to transport guests to different areas in the resort. Ferry over to Seaworld and San Diego Trolley Tour Bus Stop right on premesis. Note: Catch the Tour Bus at 8:30 at the Gift Shop for a great day of sightseeing. Don't miss Balboa Park (San Diego Zoo) and Old Town, Del Coronado Beach, and some tours of ships along the bay in the city. Also, public buses stop right outside the entrance to take you many places if you don't have a car such as Pacific Beach. The staff are absolutely wonderful, and made every effort to get us everything we requested. Gino was exceptional and made our anniversary a memorable occasion and one we will always remember. We have travelled to San Diego twice a year for the past 11 years to visit our son, and Paradise Point is THE BEST resort in San Diego! We have stayed at various beach and city hotels and none compare to Paradise Point. We tell everyone going to the San Diego area about it and absolutely love it! You will too!

Reviews.Title: “THIS TRULY IS PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: strgzr1126
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this resort! My family and I had the best experience here! Everything about it was awesome! It was one of the best vacations we’ve ever had-perfect from start to finish. My granddaughter made the honor roll all year in school, and this was trip was her reward. Pricilla at the front desk rewarded her again by upgrading our room to a beautiful bay view suite! That was so over-the-top for her to do for us, but that’s just the kind of resort Paradise is, the entire staff was so accommodating and gracious. That is a big part of what made our stay a trip we will always remember! It is a great place with lots of amenities and is completely family focused. The kids had an absolutely great time! They loved the freedom of riding their bikes each day all over the sprawling resort grounds, and we felt perfectly safe letting them. Each day, we would pick a different pool to swim in, and we loved dining outdoors at the Barefoot Bar Restaurant and feeding the fish in the pond. It reminded me of being in Maui, very tropical and the grounds are immaculately kept. The resort is especially beautiful at night with the extra special lighting, fire pits and tiki torches. We stayed for 4 days and didn't want to leave! A fabulous stay. Would go back again and will next year ..

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Indeed”
Reviews.Author: photoiq
Reviews.Content: I wavered slightly after finding a handful of lukewarm reviews on Tripadvisor for Paradise Point. I’m glad I’m a glass half full kind of guy and went with the many 5 star reviews, booking 2 rooms for 6 nights in July. Our stay here was faultless. Lush planting, covered gazebos, fire-pits on the beach, beautiful lagoons and swimming pools, bike hire and all 5 mins from Seaworld (by water taxi from the hotel restaurant!) We booked base rooms (half price offer on Expedia) and they were great – overlooking the main pool (pictured) . If you are going for a special occasion book a cottage on the beach front – unforgettable I’d say. Only negatives – 25 dollars a day parking, no booking system for beach fire-pits and fairly limited dining options for a resort this size. These are the kind of niggles you encounter everywhere so I just sucked it up and had a relaxing time in San Diego. My wife had a spa treatment which was excellent, food in the Barefoot Grill was excellent and atmospheric under fairy lights by the beach, I used the fitness center every morning (busy) and the main pool always had free sunbeds and clean towels. None of us wanted to leave.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME, WONDERFUL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: SbSbi
Reviews.Content: Just completed a deltightful stay at PPR with family and friends. We dropped several teenage girls on the resort and let them have some rare autonomy. We felt perfectly comfortable allowing them to enjoy the various pools and many activities. Ortake the water taxia to the private back entrance at Sea World. The highlight of each day was the sunset fire pit and smores combo. The kids loved it. By day's end they were happily exhausted. It was even possible for mom and dad to enjoy some rare quiet time together. It is also worth noting that the staff at this busy resort really trys to go the extra mile. We visit many such vacation spots in a given year, and we can honestly say that PPR has some of the best, most caring folks on their team that we have experienced.. We'll be back again next year! RC Duncan

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Chaseme303
Reviews.Content: I was quite nervous staying at Paradise Point after reading all the mixed reviews here at Tripadvisor but I had a few real life recommendations for this place and decided to give it a try...so happy we did! The front desk staff (Alexa? Alexis?) was awesome, our room was clean and housekeeping did a great job the whole 5 days we were there. We broke a bottle and called for some help, left for breakfast and it was taken care by the time we got back :) I loved the bungalow style rooms, it was much quieter than a standard hotel, I'm a horribly light sleeper but slept well the whole trip, no ice machines, slamming doors or kids running down hallways all night. The grounds are BEAUTIFUL! Loved having the beach right outside my door, I could have never left the resort and had a great vacation. We kayaked the bay, rented a speedboat, smores at the firepits and swam in almost every pool onsite. Yes, it's not cheap....but nothing in the Mission Bay area is! The parking fee stinks, but it's the same price charged at all the hotels in the area. The $15 a night resort fee should just be included in the room price, but again these fees are the norm in that area :/ We ate one meal at the The Barefoot, the food was okay, the service was slow, I was enjoying my beer and the scenery so much I didn't care. In comparison I Pricelined the Hilton Resort and Spa for one night during my trip, it is a nice hotel, exactly what I expected from the Hilton, but I enjoyed Paradise Point a lot more!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Feet, Grounds Are Neat! (bring slippers)”
Reviews.Author: Soomba
Reviews.Content: We returned again this year with the whole family. The grounds are really beautiful, and it's a great place for a family vacation if: 1) You don't expect quick service anywhere on the premises; and 2) You don't mind dirty floors and musty room smells (bring your slippers). We had a great time because our family was there and the kids loved riding their bikes around the grounds. I do believe that the resort is VERY over-priced. For $450/night, I expect clean rooms, updated fixtures. It has a very "motel" feel.

Reviews.Title: “"Over-priced ~ Underwhelmed"”
Reviews.Author: lalucyboom
Reviews.Content: The property is tired and overpriced. There are several other high end resorts close by with exceptional features at half the price. The property location is very nice for Sea World, but not worth the premium. The big pool and spa were cold. The Barefoot restaurant food was very average, but expensive. Breakfast was the best value. Our room was spacious, but house cleaning was sporadic, late, and not thorough. The landscaping is very nice, and provides some space between neighbors. The noise between rooms was an issue, as we were able to hear our neighbors shower, and snore at night. All in all, a big dispappointment for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty grounds, friendly staff, great spa”
Reviews.Author: spalovingirl
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay at Paradise Point this month. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, and the ponds, gardens and walkways well maintained and great to walk- early in the am especially. It is very family friendly- I do not have a family, and so sometimes do not have patience for this- but the presence of an adut only pool area and morning or evening strolls around the resort kept me relaxed and enjoying "adult time" If I did have children, I would take them here in a HEARTBEAT. Lots for kids to explore and safe places to run around and play The spa is cozy and charming, one of the best parts of the hotel. Well trained therapists and a fantastic spa menu. Try the lime body scrub or bamboo massage- you'll love it! I enjoyed a satisfying sandwich- BLT with avocado-(yum)- upon my late check-in and dined at Baleen the next night. The sea bass dish was to die for, and the service was great, friendly but not intrusive. I was traveling alone, so I enjoyed the water view and atmosphere while dining there, sometimes it can feel a bit awkward when dining alone as I was, but not here. The room was comfortable and clean- nothing fancy but everything was in great condition and it resulted in good nite's sleep. There were guests in the bungalow next to me, but I never heard a peep. I have paid less for more lux rooms, it's true, but the location and grounds are the best in the area, and worth the extra few dollars. I stay at fine resorts all of the time, and did not think the prices for parking, facilities, etc to be more than other resorts of this caliber, as some other reviewers reported. I am looking forward to returning as soon as I can!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Pt. Is PARADISE!”
Reviews.Author: keepItReal04
Reviews.Content: More than excellent. Best Cust. Svcs. in a long time. Every detail is thought of. We've stayed in many hotels/resorts in San Diego & I'm a native of S. CA, but Austinite now! I highly recommend Paradise Point Resort & Spa. (we didn't use child care or Spa, so I can't rate those), but food, pools & resort activities were so fun for our family of four. We stayed five nights & even saw a few wedding parties! They try to accomodate it all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Break for my Family!”
Reviews.Author: tex1330
Reviews.Content: May to August in Texas is killer HOT. My family and I were looking for a place to stay where we could get away from the heat. We found Paradise Point on the Net and booked the trip. We had never been there and did not know what to expect. We stepped off the place and first the weather was AMAZING! When we arrived at Paradise Point we were WELL taken care of. The folks at the front desk got us in and out fast. The young man who took us to our room/cabin on the beach helped so much get us settled in we felt at home in no time. The room was great and the beach was right out the back door. We were in close drving range of tons of stuff to do. The places to eat are within walking distance and the food was the best. We will be back many times and everything about it was A+.

Reviews.Title: “Listen to What the other critics say as well....don't waste your money here”
Reviews.Author: 2boyz1girl_11
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at Paradise Point for 3 nights but we should have checked out after the first one and moved on like we did for our 4th night. While the property is beautiful, especially at night with all of the tiki torches in the common areas our room itself was not pleasant. As soon as we walked in the door the odor in the room was very musty. When I went to make a phone call I noticed that the phone was dirty and completely dusty. Our bathroom was very outdated and not clean. Our refrigerator did not work and the air conditioning unit leaked water all over the floor and ran very loudly. The maid left a dirty sheet on top of my luggage after supposedly cleaning the room. While trying to utilize the chairs on the back patio the sprinkler system kicked on and the chairs were completely soaked. The layout of the resort is very confusing and poorly lit by the individual units making it very hard to see our room number. When you check in they give you a "passport" detailing all if the "free" activities you get there compared to other resorts. That was a total gimmick as they charge a daily resort fee on top of a $25 parking fee to park directly outside your door. It is not as if they are valet parking your car in a secured garage. We were very dissapointed with how much we spent to get a sub par room. We will never return to the resort. We spent the last night at the Marriott on Coronado Island and I highly recommend that hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Wow! 5 star really is there such a thing as 10star!! Resort is an amazing 10 star hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Watsontravel
Reviews.Content: The staff at this resort are more than just amazing!! We had friends visit us for the day, when tragically their 12 year old dog ran away from their vehicle on arrival. The resort staff worked so well together and found and returned her in less than 7 minutes . Remember this is a 44 acre resort !! How amazing and kind for them to respond to our friends pet as if it were someone's child. Bless everyone who helped!!! Return a Childs bestfriend

Reviews.Title: “Great Setting”
Reviews.Author: Sonny30
Reviews.Content: Adjacent to Seaworld, but will need a car for downtown visits. Suggest the trolley tour which leaves from the main lobby, very informative! Enjoy your stay, I did every minute. Great meals at the Barefoot restaurant. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: myicey
Reviews.Content: We paid over $350 a night for our dirty room...then, upon check out, they nailed us for $50.00 for parking our one car in front of our room and another $30.00 for using their amenities which equated to swimming in their pool...what a waste of money.....should have stuck with the Bahia...no parking fees and even have a gameroom for the kids...Oh by the way, the "waterfall" pool was filthy...

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Old, Smelly and Bad Service, stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: enmichels
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I traveled to the Paradise Point Resort in San Diego to celebrate my 25th birthday. We are frequent travelers, taking around 3-5 vacations per year (please see my other reviews) we stay at the most luxurious hotels so I have a lot to compare to, and let’s just say I wouldn’t even recommend this hotel to my worst enemy, that would be too mean! Airport: The airport is very small, around 20 minutes from Paradise Point. We rented a car from enterprise, it was quick and easy. They had a bus waiting to take us to the nearest Enterprise location, and we were able to pick out our car. We had GPS so it was easy to get around, and the traffic is not bad at all in San Diego. Check-in: Our check in person was Gino, wasn’t he pleasant….not. He first started with asking us to upgrade to the beach suite, I thought he was giving us a free upgrade for my bday, so I said is this for my birthday? And he goes No, we only have 1 left and it would be $150 extra per night (which we passed on). Also the Lobby smells like Mold, you will notice the entire resort smells like mold! We had a room right next to this filthy lagoon; this resort would be pretty if they kept it clean! Our room had a Full bed (which they call a queen), sleeper sofa, tiny bathroom, and a desk, the run and table were missing for the couch, what a basic room for 350 dollars per night, not microwave even! The next morning after sleeping in this tiny bed, I looked at my fiancés travel documents, to see that he actually paid $30 extra per night for a king size bed. I called to speak with the manager Matt Quick, he apologized and said that he would switch us to a new room, and not make us pay for a parking for our 3 night stay. We switched rooms, the new room was bigger about 100 sqft or so, with the worst smell ever, it just hits you as you enter. The air conditioning was broken, the refrigerator did not work, our bathroom was covered in rust and mold (I took the quickest showers of my life there because I was so disgusted), but the bed was a king! We called about the air conditioner, and they replaced the entire thing right away. We actually left that day to LA and Disneyland so we did not have time to change rooms again, but there are no windows that open to get fresh air, just a patio door with no screen. There is Shampoo, Conditioner, Body Wash, Hair Dryer and Coffee Maker, no other amenities offered in the room besides the wireless internet that you will pay for when you check out. LA/Disneyland: The road trip was beautiful, we took the Pacific Hwy all the way there. It was only a 1 hr 45 minute drive to Anaheim where Disneyland is. We love Disneyworld, and we loved Disneyland just as much. We started at downtown Disney, $15 dollars to park there and only a short walk though to Disneyland. We ate at the ESPN Zone, which is our favorite. Disneyland also had a park called Adventure Park that we did not go to, but they have Tower of Terror, and a lot of fun roller coasters. The lines at Disneyland were very long, 80 minutes per ride; we only were able to go on 4! But the experience was well worth it. After Disneyland we met with a bunch of our friends that live in Manhattan Beach. We went to Hermosa Beach to have drinks and dance, The Shore was so much fun, great music and great crowd. We ended up staying out late, so we got a deal at a near Wyndham hotel for the night to sleep, even that hotel which was $100 dollars a night was nicer than Paradise Point; at least they had a microwave, working fridge, living area, and clean! Downtown San Diego: So beautiful! I wrote down a few hotels that were there that looked nice, Marriott Marquez, and the Omni. We ate at Lou & Mickies, the food was excellent, the service was good, and they had a wonderful wine list. And the price was not very high, for the two of us with wine our bill was $68 without tip. Next time we visit San Diego we will be staying downtown. Barefoot Grill: The first night of our trip we ate at the barefoot grill in the Paradise Point. What a disappointment. It was a 30 minute wait, and when we were seated we waited another 20 minutes for our waiter to come with our drinks. After we ordered, it was like he forgot about us, never came back for another 45 minutes, all we ordered was a burger and turkey wraps. We had to ask the bus boy to find him because we thought he might have gone home. Finally when he came back with our food, which was all seasoned with something that tasted similar to Dill, I ordered my free dessert that the hotel gave us tickets for. I had the S’mores Chocolate Cake, and I must say that it was beyond delicious. Beach/Pool: The Beach is quiet, and it was nice to have right at the hotel, but it was filthy, there was trash, glass, sand flies everywhere. We decided to sit there for an hour, then head to the Adults only pool. We had a Friend who lives in San Diego come visit us for the day to lay by the pool, we are between the ages of 25-27. When we arrived, the ‘security guard’ asked for our ID’s, we don’t look like we are under 18 so it was ridiculous. Then I had my room key, since you need that to get into their gated pools and she still asked for my room number. Then when she saw that we only had 2 people on our reservations, but there were 3 of us, she told us our friend could not use the pool. So we were told to leave! I didn’t even know what to say at this point. We just went back to the beach. Check Out: The day before we left I called for a late check out, and Stephanie informed me that I need to call back the day of our departure (our flight did not take off until 6pm). Typically this is not a problem for most hotels, they will give you an extra hour or two, especially if they do not have the facilities (shower, etc) to use. When I called the day of our departure, Stephanie answer, and I started asking for a late check out, literally before I finished my sentence, all she said was “NO, we are booked, sorry!” I said all we want is until 2:00 pm (check in time isn’t until 4pm and It doesn’t take over 30 minutes to clean a room and half the people arriving aren’t arriving at 4pm anyways). After telling her all of the things we dealt with on this trip, the moldy smell, the broken air, fridge, and given a downgrade in the room, she said sorry you are disappointed but we don’t make exceptions. I asked for her manager, and she was eager to get him on the phone. Matt Quick was the manager I spoke with again, and he did end up accommodating me 2:00pm request. So if you call, do not speak with Stephanie, she was horribly rude. I did inform her I would post her name on Tripadvisor for her rudeness and she said “go for it.” At check out, we knew we would be charged the $15.00 fee for absolutely nothing, but it is not just $15 it is $15+Tax. They also charged us $25 per day for parking which Matt Quick said we would not be charged for. I did have her take that off the bill, we were just happy to check out! Overall, our experience was horrible, I read reviews before we left, but the resort looked so beautiful online and was so deceiving I ignored the bad reviews, I know better then that. Just take my word for it, choose another hotel, you will be disappointed in The Paradise Point, this hotel makes Motel 6 look nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it appears”
Reviews.Author: rwhitson
Reviews.Content: When I called to book a San Diego vacation with your company, I went with the advise of your attendant. So I am writing this review so you may know the real dealings behind Paradise Point so more formative information can be conveyed to your clients. The only Paradise in this place is to the owners and stock holders. There is nothing free in this place and if you do decide to eat, lounge or use there facilities it will cost-not just a fair amount but they gouge you. A smoothie at the pool restaurant is $6 served in a small cup, bike rental for one hour is $25 and to play putt-putt in their make shift little course was $10 a person. I have stayed at many resorts and I don't mind paying a reasonable amount to play but that was ridiculous for what you got. Now let me tell you about the room, the room was very small and the bathroom was made at an angle which shortened one side. It was also connected to an adjoining room, you could hear everything that was going on in the other room-not very restful. The refrigerator barely worked and if you wanted a microwave it was an additional $25 a day. They tell you at check-in that you have this so-called passport which offers many free services compared to other resorts-its bogus. Once you check out, a hidden charge of $15 dollars is added to your bill for each day of your stay whether you used them or not. They also charge $25 dollars a day for parking which I new about but that is crap-there is parking every where available, just another means to rip you off. Now let me tell you about the service. My son and his girlfriend ordered a grill cheese and tomato soup entree from the Bare-Foot restaurant (it was a little cold outside) and it took a hour to receive their food, then instead of soup they gave him a cup of marinara sauce (spaghetti sauce). I questioned the waiter and he just blew me off like I didn't matter. The whole 5 day stay that I was there the pool was never cleaned. When I arrived, the bottom of the pool was covered with dirt and during our stay, it only got worse. Paradise Point is a big resort; however it only has 4 washing machine to accommodate hundreds of families-they are not even centrally located. they were located way on the other side of the resort and the only way to get there was by foot unless you were staying in that section. I was in San Diego for 9 days, I stayed at the Holiday in Express and the Sheraton by the Harbor. I got way more for my money- which by the way was half the price- at both these places. Free internet, refrigator, microwave, breakfast. The sheraton even had activities for the kids to do-we loved movies every night by the pool. The food at the Sheraton was reasonably priced with good portions. One last thing, I charged a plain coffee to my room one morning. it cost $4 and some change. When I checked out, I questioned a charge on my bill, they said some one charged $43 to my room from a coffee cart or something. They were accusing my kids of doing it. I assured them they didn't and I wanted to see the receipt. It took awhile but they found the receipt, they charged my room $43 for my regular coffee. I have a lot more complaints but out of time :)

Reviews.Title: “We look forward to many more Trips to Paradise”
Reviews.Author: kimberlyhw
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked through the fromt door we were greeted with exceptional customer service. Your staff is a great example of Team work and excellent management. My 6 year old daughter absolutely loved all the bellman and their eagerness to make her giggle. It was great every day walking to breakfast and being greeted by your staff with warm smiles and well wishes. We never left the property other than to take the water cab over to Sea World. What a fantastic visit to paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, lots of things to do, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: mjabele
Reviews.Content: We booked one of the Hibiscus bungalows at the Paradise Point Resort in late June - July 2011 and thoroughly enjoyed our weeklong stay. The grounds are beautifully landscaped, with tropical flowers and blooming trees everywhere; kids will enjoy feeding the ducks and fish that populate the ponds and streams throughout the property, and there are bikes as well as 2-person and 4-person covered surreys available for leisurely pedaling. The resort is located on an island in the middle of Mission Bay, fringed by a beautiful mile-long sandy beach and calm waters perfect for small children to play and swim in. Mission Beach is located a 10-minute drive west for those who want wave action. Sailboats, jet skis, and kayaks are available on site for rental, and a 15-minute water taxi ride will take visitors to Sea World, circumventing the need for parking and waiting in long lines to purchase tickets (tickets for the park as well as for Legoland, the San Diego Zoo, and the Old Place Trolley can all be bought at the centrally located resort shop adjacent to a small mini-golf course). The fitness room is well-equipped with a couple of treadmills, exercise bikes, ellipitical trainers, free weights, and 8-10 weight machines; we didn't try the spa, so can't comment on that. There are five pools on the property, ranging from small and shallow for the kiddies to a large and occasionally somewhat crowded main pool adjacent to the lobby, resort shop, and fitness center / spa. Staff were uniformly friendly and very responsive to our requests throughout our stay. The Bareback Grill has excellent food, a nice view with indoor and outdoor seating, and an entertaining but occasionally somewhat annoying resident egret (?) named Harold who'll definitely make a go for your lunch if you turn your back once too often. Ask the staff for the Tabasco water sprayer if you plan on sitting near the edge of the patio dining area (!). About the only (slight) negative was that our room appeared darker than the online photos and could have used some updating. Nevertheless, I'd hasten to add that it was clean, the decor tasteful, and the beds comfortable. We were hoping to book a suite with kitchen facilities, but weren't in time to manage that; our room had a microwave and refrigerator, though, which enabled us to prepare simple meals from time to time to keep down costs. Keep in mind that parking is $25 extra per day - not sure why the resort does this, since most guests seem to have cars, but so it is. There's also a $15 extra per day resort fee, necessary to access the fitness center as well as certain other things which I can't remember, but this doesn't seem unreasonable. All in all, a very restful place to stay, with lots to do for the kids and memorably beautiful grounds / plantings.

Reviews.Title: “dirty”
Reviews.Author: bbanks1582
Reviews.Content: gardens were very well maintained on a daily basis its just a pity the rooms were not shown the same care. after waiting 2 hours to get in the room because it was being cleaned,imagine the shock when we went into the room and the very large rug was thick of food,hair and debris from the previous occupants the coffee table still had cup stains all over it. I then checked the kitchen the benches were full of old food in particular tomatoe sauce as was the fridge. the microwave was splatted with all kinds of food and had a bad odour.Due to the poor service we recieved at the front desk i decided to clean it myself with the exception of the microwave( i had no intention of using it) Throughout our 6 day stay the sinks, floors,funiture and kitchen were not cleaned or damp dusted although the bed was made. the saving grace was the view and the fact we didnt spend much time in the room. would not recommend this hotel at all if you like things clean great if your not botherd.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay, nice room with beautiful views.”
Reviews.Author: kcat24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for half our our honeymoon and were very pleased. When we checked in we were greeted with a great surprise - our room had been upgraded for free and our nightly parking fee had been waived. We got to our room, which was right on the harbor with beautiful views of the bay, and found a bottle of champagne and a plate of chocolate covered strawberries. The room was gorgeous and much bigger than we had expected. We spent hours sitting on our back patio watching the harbor and enjoying the sunset. The room itself did have a little bit of a musty/humid smell and feel to it but nothing that was really much of an inconvenience. The resort was very nice. There was a ton on the resort itself to do. The swimming pools and hot tubs were great. However, they did charge a $15 a day fee for a bunch of stuff that we had no interest in using. Also, there is a hefty nightly parking fee as well. If our fee hadnt been waived, we would have been charged an extra $25 a night. Those start to add up quite a bit. So be prepared to pay an bunch of extra when you check out. The resort is very close to so many things: Sea World, the Airport, Downtown, Mission Beach etc..... Couldnt ask for a better location. The staff was friendly and helpful as well. No complaints at all other than the extra fees.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: AdrianLloydy
Reviews.Content: We booked Paradise Point for 4 nights as part of a trip as we were renewing our vows after 10 years of marragise and to celebrate my wife's 40th birthday. With the initial part of the trip being 5 days in Vegas, we wanted a place to 'relax' and recharge and Paradise Point certainly met this criteria. The resort was fantastic with a beautiful room in a fantastic location. The resort is so clean and fresh with fantstic views, delightful service and excellent breakfasts !! The close proximity to San Diego downtown, Sea World and the breach, meant that we could put away the car and enjoy. We loved it and are already planning as trip back to the resort next year, which considering the distance from London, speals volumes for the resort and San Diego as a whole.

Reviews.Title: “Staycation”
Reviews.Author: GGRN
Reviews.Content: Our childrens school function was held at this resort in April & we stayed over. We loved it so much my husband & I booked fathers day plus 3 nights here at PP along with 12 other families & friends & recieved GREAT RATE for all families!! Friends & families loved it as well that we are hoping to make it a tradition! Absolutely loved our room!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced motel with "resort" stamp”
Reviews.Author: M0mmyG
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point looks beautiful in pictures and from far away, but up close, it is NOT nearly worth what the resort charges per night. We used various special offers (conference and credit card member rates), and got great deals on all our rooms for a 1-week stay. The rooms were spacious and fairly clean. Pools were adequate/small, and all the "recreational" activities included a sky-high deposit. Parking was close enough, but the roadways in the different villages are worse than a bumper car course! In truth, Paradise Point Resort reminded my family of an older Hawaiian hotel - insanely high rates for the ambiance, but no real substance or bang for your buck. A few times we took advantage of the water taxi to Sea World, which was fun and convenient enough, but honestly overpriced as the park tickets were sold at face value so there was no real 'savings' by buying from the resort. The nightly Sea World fireworks are fairly visible from the entrance to the resort and from the observation tower by the lobby. We also ate at the Barefoot Bar and Grill three different times (for breakfast, for drinks and appetizers, and ordered room service). This place is.... again, adequate. Serves a purpose, but you better bring your patience along with enough money to pay the bill. Food is subpar and service is slow, but it IS all delivered with a smile. My group of 7 people (ranging from ages 2 - 70) stayed in 3 adjoining rooms in the Hibiscus Village (where you see and hear EVERY car that enters and leaves the resort). Each room either had plumbing that leaked, tile that was uneven, missing door screens that let in huge mosquitos; and ALL the rooms had phones that didn't work right, hotel tv menus that never functioned (we couldn't even check out from our room!), and old fridges and microwaves that should have been replaced 5 years ago. Rooms were cleaned daily, but at various hours, and we never had the same maid twice. However, there were plenty of times when other cleaning staff dropped by to chat while the maid worked (while we were sitting outside with little kids, waiting for the room to be done!). Cleaning staff also drove their carts way too fast, all while chatting on their phones. The bathrooms were also very small and sparce, almost like a motel room bath (in fact, one of our rooms didn't even have a door closing off the bath/toilet area from the sink!). For as much as the grounds staff mowed the grass (which we could hear for hours and hours in the afternoons - NOT at all a quiet and tranquil resort!), there were huge spiderwebs everywhere - on the flowers, all over the patio furniture, along the gates, etc. Seriously? THIS is what the resort is charging almost $400 a night for?!??! If you're still going to book at this resort after reading these reviews, do yourself a favor and make sure you snag a good deal from Priceline or Expedia. By no means is Paradise Point Resort a bad place, there are just much better and smarter options for spending your money if you do your homework. Paradise Point needs to seriously fix the problems at this resort. My family doesn't regret staying here, but we're definitely not planning to return any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “High Priced, but great Location”
Reviews.Author: BrokerPaul
Reviews.Content: Signed up for the Paradise Point Club program last year. Thought the program was a good deal when enrolled but a different program rules and regulations showed up with multiple restrictions and blackout dates. Not happy with the outcome, because the desk clerk fought you for redeeming coupons. Great idea, but a Poorly run program left a bad taste in my mind. Great location and nicely kept grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Strong Potential, Great Stay, Recommended Impovements...”
Reviews.Author: IL2AZ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent four nights here celebrating our 1 year wedding anniversary. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly staff who were eager to make our stay special. After a short conversation with the woman who checked us in, we were given a generous upgrade of our reserved room, and managed flexibility with the parking fee. This left us with a good initial impression of the resort. The young man who showed us to our room was also very friendly, and extended himself as a resource during our stay. We were quite impressed with the aesthetics and location of the room, as it sat facing bay with two Adirondack style chairs on the linai. There was a small private beach with fire pits, and while we didn't use them, we did benefit from the smells of the fire enjoyed by the other guests. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The food was above average, as well as the service. The only aspect that we could offer some constructive criticism towards is that there seems to be some lacking in the attention to detail. For example, doors were difficult to open, fireplace in room had very low flames, beer can left on linai from previous guests filled with ashes and cigarette butts, somewhat non-thorough room cleaning. We only say this, because we feel this place has too much potential for these kind of things to be overlooked. We really thought the staff and grounds were wonderful overall. If something was not to our liking, we have to say they were responsive and wanted to correct any problems. We would return and recommend a stay without hesitation. Plus we were sent a bottle of champagne to celebrate our special day, and this was very appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: JKobr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled here with our two boys (9 and 4) for 2011 March break for 4 nights and had a wonderful time. We had begun our trip with 5 days at Disneyland, then drove down to SD (no more than 90 minutes), flew back home to Toronto out of SD. The rooms are sectioned off into your own little "bungalow", some along the beach, others inland surrounded by little ponds and/or gardens. Read some reviews where people felt rooms needed updating, but not the case at all for us. Two very large queen size beds, cozy bedding and good space to move around. Bathroom was fine, albeit a bit small, as was the closet storage space, but we made do. Our boys loved the miniputt, we played a number of games even though a few of the holes were missing flags. And we loved explorign the grounds, feeding the ducks and fish. Very relaxing. Unfortunately, we hit a cold spell and never swam in the pools as it was quite cool, but they sure looked nice. We ate breakfast at the on site restaurant by the marina and each dinner was just perfect to start the day. SeaWorld was less than 5 minute drive away, nice and close and easy to find. The staff gave us recommendation on a few places to eat dinner in town and their selections were spot on. Great stay, loved it there, would highly recommend going back.

Reviews.Title: “Pics misleading, not a luxury resort”
Reviews.Author: EricAnaheim
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website make this place look like an upscale luxury resort but it's far from it. This place used to be called Vacation Village which were (and still are) a bunch of brick boxes situated in tropical-style landscaping. I wish I knew this; I was expecting an actual hotel especially because of the pics, rating, and price. The rooms were "renovated" but that only means a new coat of paint and furniture. We reserved a bayside room but upon check-in they said they didn't have any available and that Orbitz overbooked it (I've never had that happen before). Therefore they gave us the executive suite that was large but had a slow-draining sink, 30 year old fridge, a microwave from the 1960's, slow-flowing shower, smelly sheets, hair & crumbs on the carpet, creaky bed, squeaky door hinges, thin walls, and a slight musty smell. Had I known this was a bunch of brick boxes from the sixties that had a new coat of paint I would have gone elsewhere. Ya, the grounds are nice and there are a bunch of pools and some activities for the kids but those are the only redeeming qualities but definitely not worth the price. I don't know how so many people can give this place such high ratings. Maybe they think brick-box rooms and superficial renovations are luxurious, but it absolutely does not justify the price. If this place was going for $100 - $150 per night and if I knew these were brick boxes instead of an actual hotel I wouldn't complain. Oh ya, parking is $25 bucks per day to park next to your room and there is a $15 per day mandatory resort fee (when you check-in they hand you this "passport to paradise" showing how the pools, internet, gym are free but they didn't tell us about the $15 per day fee, but it's not like you have a choice). You'd think for the price per room all of this would be included but it's not. Bottom line: I feel misled. I wish I knew these were 1960's brick-boxes with new paint. And all the high ratings for this place really surprise me. I don't know if they're reviewing the same place or have different standards of what luxury and resort means. I could not in my right mind call high-priced brick boxes luxurious, paradise, great price, fantastic, outstanding, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience Across The Board”
Reviews.Author: whatever003
Reviews.Content: My suite was clean, well furnished and perfectly situated in front of the fire pit. Service was excellent and room service menu was exstensive and resonably prices. My bed was luxurious, as well as, the bath towels. I will spend my vacations here from now on. A must stay resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business or families”
Reviews.Author: sancarlosdoc
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at medical conference. Nice conference facilities. Hotel has lovely, mature tropical grounds with water views. Rooms are bungalows. Clean but feel a bit dated esp the bathrooms. Our towel rack had been pulled off the wall and the area where it came off was not repaired. Refridge so loud we had to turn it off to sleep. There were no windows that could be opened for fresh air. This is an expensive place so you expect more. Nice pool areas and good gym. If you arrive late bring food as there is no late night dining in the facility. One of my pet peeves is the extra $15 fee for things that should be free like the gym-reminds me of airline baggage fees. Parking fee steep. Overall an ok place if you can find a good rate on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back in 2012”
Reviews.Author: Scotty272
Reviews.Content: Came for a conference and loved it, the facilities were outstanding and everything was a short walk from my room which, by the way, was very spacious and came complete with a huge comfortable bed. The room service was a godsend after a full day of seminar although the Barefoot Bar provided relaxed dining with super friendly staff. The pool area looked great from the observation tower although I didn't get time to enjoy it and the coffee bar at reception made delicious coffee to enjoy next to the fireplace. All in all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “We loved every moment at Paradise Point Resort and Spa!”
Reviews.Author: Eciccoianni
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of our car to the moment we left we were greeted with kindness and open arms. We had an amazing experience. We played, we relaxed and we enjoyed every second. Paradise Point had everything we wanted as newly married couple. We rented waverunners, bikes and dined eating great food and awesome service! Paradise Point is great for families too and retailed about bringing our family some day! Loved it there so much and was sad to leave, but excited to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: barefootmemories
Reviews.Content: We've lived in San Diego for decades, but we'd never been to Paradise Point. With airfare so high, and already living in a vacation town, we decided to go for a "staycation" in our home town. The resort is AMAZING. The staff is SO friendly. The Barefoot Grill was definitely a favorite, but the highlight for my kids was the jetski/waverunner rental we did through the resort's marina. SO FUN. We will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: gmamaof2
Reviews.Content: Our 3 nite stay at Paradise Point was memorable. Our 2.5 year old loved feeding the ducks and the fish (ask the front desk for food and they'll give it to you for free). Even though the resort imposes fees (eg parking, microwaves for non-suites and resort fee), you can ask the front desk to waive them. Housekeeping didn't clean our room until 8:30 one nite so I requested they waive the resort fee. My bill came out to less than a dollar at checkout. The Barefoot Bar and Grill wasn't great, but you can buy certificates at Restaurant.com which made the meal very reasonable. Overall we had a very lovely stay, and we would recommend this hotel to family and friends. We booked a vacation package on Southwest and got a great deal on this hotel. If you need anything printed out (eg airplane tickets) call concierge and they will print and have someone deliver it to you.

Reviews.Title: “A fake overpriced stay”
Reviews.Author: Garbear311
Reviews.Content: I found it hard to stay here for more than one night, and not because the weather is bad, but rather it was not worth my time or money. My wife and I felt like it would be a paradise escape of sorts but instead we were stuck in murky mission bay with overbearing employees and restless families. I took my business elsewhere because for that price, even though the food and drinks were great, I can get a room twice that size with a fantastic view and much better people around.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on a Travelzoo special and really enjoyed this property. The room was large and included a sitting room with a pullout couch, chair and desk. The bed was really comfortable and had high quality linens. The room included a safe, which is pretty unusual in the USA, but comes in really handy. One little nitpick is the TV doesn't get great reception and doesn't have that many channels. They do have pay-per-view, however. The landscaping reminded us of Hawaii and it was really pleasant to walk around on the property. They also have boats and bicycles for rent. The kids we saw really seemed to be enjoying themselves but after dark it definitely became more of an adult resort, so I think you will find whatever you are looking for here. We don't swim, but noticed an adults only pool along with a pool for kids, which is a great idea. We had several meals and cocktails at the Barefoot Bar & Grill, which is part of the resort, and recommend it highly. My husband liked the gym and said it was a cut above the usual hotel gym. Bottom line is we loved it and plan to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great finish line for a mrathon”
Reviews.Author: shoelesssean
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon Paradise through Hotwire.com. What a gret find. The grounds were beuatiful, the staff freindly and extremely helpful in finding places to go and things to do. I ran in the 1/2 marathon and could not have asked for a better place to retreat to. Definately a wonderful sight driving in at night.

Reviews.Title: “Take extra fees into consideration when booking”
Reviews.Author: Elkenel
Reviews.Content: I had booked this room through a third party and paid in advance. At check-in I was informed of additional charges:$15/day resort fee and $10/day for parking. The rooms and grounds are nice and the beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Far From Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Grimleyfiendish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family members - 10 in all. Agree with most other comments - the primary memory I will take from here is of being fleeced for cash at every corner. Grounds are nice, but in truth nothing special - pools are OK but did not appear the cleanest. Rooms adequate but certainly not got a wow factor. Check-in not possible until 4:15 which seems late. We upgraded at significant cost to a one bed suite, but not worth the significant upgrade - the annoying piece of this room was that although it included a kitchenette (fridge, microwave, cupboards, sink etc) there was no utensils provided (eg bottle opener, plates, cutlery etc). Blinds in bedroom very flimsy too & let in too much light The "passport to paradise" ( a compulsory $15 per night charge) we did not use at all. The shop on site is exorbitant - $4.50 for a bottle of water a typical price - given the location means a drive to any other shop, this appears excessive. There is also a car-parking charge of up to $25 per room per night which we avoided by simply stating we had no car. Firepits on beach are good (although purchasing wood from the shop should be avoided at $12 Overall although a good holiday, we would return to San Diego but definitely not to Paradie Point. This hotel is more concerned with extracting every penny from its guests instead of focussing on driving repeat business.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay for the family”
Reviews.Author: TexKS
Reviews.Content: I picked this resort after much seraching and was pleased with the result. I took the family - my wufe and I, one daughter and husbanc, and older daughet with husband and 2 kids. We were there for 6 restful nights. I never heard any late night noise. The grounds are closely monitored and the pool area was cleared around 10:00. Location: As a base for our daily activities, we wre never a long way from anything. We sailed in the bay, toured on the trolley, went to baseball at Petco, enjoyed the wildlie at the zoo, and surfed at La Jolla - each event was no trouble to reach. Facilities: A very large complex of smaller units with 2-6 rooms each, the grounds are expansive, but that tends to mask how busy the facility may be - we arrived the day before the San Diego marathon and there were no rooms to be found, but ours were prepaid and ready. The rooms were all spacious with our junior suite the largest. it's not really a suite, just an extra large room. All of the beds were comfortable and sized as advertised. The pools were convenient so we ended up using only the small one near our room the entire trip. One small negative was the housekeepping. The tile floors never really were totally clean. Our 1 year old grandaughter had filthy feet whenever we let her roam without shoes. I could tell the facility was built many years ago, but the recent updates makes it more than acceptable. for a first time visit, I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: phvenab
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is physically beautiful! Lush, mature landscaping greets you at every turn; there are several pools for individual taste; and the location cannot be beat. What is lacking is customer service, and service problems can ruin any potentialy great vacation. Room cleaning service was marginal - had to call several times for cleaning that just was not done initially. One of the staff at the Barefoot Bar got so frustrated at our questons about the bill that he actually threw the menu in a corner and walked away. With comprehensive staff training in customer service, this would be a world-class resort! Without it, it's just another place in San Diego that's beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: sext9652
Reviews.Content: I was very worried about what I would find when we went on our vacation due to all of the varied reports on this resort. I'm glad we never changed our mind. From the time we checked in to the time we checked out this morning EVERYTHING was wonderful. We were put in a garden villa for the first part of our vacation but opted to upgrade on our anniversary and was upgraded to an executive suite (which is a double upgrade which was a surprise). We explained this to Mary at the front desk who helped with the upgrade and sent us champagne and choc covered strawberries for our anniversary. She also gave us a break on the parking charge. The resort is VERY big but set up so that everything you need is in the same area. Ate at both restaurants and the food was wonderful, yes Baleen was on the high side but you get what you pay for, it was outstanding. The bartenders at the Barefoot Grill are great and remember you when you return. Our room was cleaned by the time we came back to our room every day. If you have the time get a massage that was great too. I can't say enough about this resort. We will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: treasurelife
Reviews.Content: The resort was excellent. Beautiful surroundings,beautiful pool, staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make your stay comfortable. Food was great as well at the restaurants. We celebrated our sons 5 birthday and he had a blast. Resort is right on Mission bay with sandy beaches and fire pits . We took the new water taxi on the resort to Sea World my son thought it was the coolest thing, no waiting in any lines. Would definitely make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: sdchic421
Reviews.Content: The view from our room was fabulous! We overlooked the bay and had a private beach to lay out. The staff was courteous and the stay was well worth it! The room was beautiful and we were able to lay by the pool before check-in. All around a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point is the Hawaii of California”
Reviews.Author: AlohaCA
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is an amazing and unique resort for the entire family. The grounds are beyond beautiful and we needed to keep reminding ourselves that we were not in Hawaii. The staff is awesome, from Pat who helped arrange our stay, Gino who checked us in, Maria in housekeeping, the team at the Barefoot Grill and Captain Bill who took us to Sea World on the water taxi - everything was first class. We were a little concerned about the one story bungalow type rooms but they are what makes Paradise Point so different from the average vacation hotel. There are pools scattered throughout the resort, bonfires on the beach, bicycle rentals and so much to do. We spent one day in Legoland, another at the San Diego Zoo and then onto Sea World. But what was the most fun, was coming back to the resort and spending the evening in our own private paradise. This was our first visit but we are planning to make this an annual family trip.
