Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 with 3 kids under 10 who travels a couple of times a year. This is the first hotel in 20 years that I didn't leave a tip for room service. This hotel is filthy and was a complete disappointment. We had two king suites on the bay beach and stayed for 3 days. The only reason we continued our stay is because we were gone all day at the SD zoo and SeaWorld - otherwise we would have changed hotels. I can't believe American Express recommended this place. The furnishings look like the pictures but the rooms we stayed in smelled of mold and animal urine, the carpets were filthy and the travertine tile in both our suites had not been mopped and had hair throughout the suite. The rooms we stayed in had stains on the walls that could have been easily wiped up. The rooms has very poor ventilation and moisture builds up at night which intensifies the poor smell. You won't find a telephone book or a clock in these rooms or any kind of utensils other than the two tiny dirty glasses in the bathroom. So if you want to drink a glass of California wine - good luck. If our housekeeping was indicative of everyone else's experience, the entire department should be fired. They were very inconsistent. One day they brought coffee and one day they didn't. One day they forgot soap and then gave 2 soaps the next day. They made the bed and gave new towels but didn't clean the floors or vacuum the rug. Also - the beach on the side we stayed on is sad. The bay is not the ocean. Right outside our suite was some kind of concrete runoff gone amuck. It was a danger enough that I didn't feel comfortable having my 7 and 10 yr old play football in that area. To top it off, my 3 year old with sensitive skin got a rash all over his face the one night he slept on the hotel pillow rather than his pillow pet. I mentioned the cleanliness issue to the front desk as I checked out. She responded that it was an issue the hotel was addressing and took off my parking and internet charges. You won't see us back here. Stay at the Grand Pacific Palisades up in Carlsbad and you will have a much better experience!

Reviews.Title: “Taking the benchmark to another level...”
Reviews.Author: sonia_london
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the fabulous Paradise Point for 5 nights. It was ultra luxurious! I cannot recommend it enough. Highlights - Gorgeous mini villa's facing the seafront- personal and makes it feel like home! - You can light a fire on the beach or near the pool and have toasted marshmallows. The hotel provide all the ingredients. - Go and have a Balinese massage- totally divine! - No interruptions- you are left to holiday in peace. -The entire hotel is beautifully groomed all the time Final note: I would not stay anywhere else when I re-visit. Well done Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point was a true paradise.”
Reviews.Author: mkhines
Reviews.Content: This was our family's 1st trip to California. We chose to stay at Paradise Point without knowing what to expect. We read some reviews prior to booking our stay. We arrived at night and could tell it was going to be beautiful. The grounds were amazing and exceeded our expectations by a mile. There was even a movie crew on site making a commercial. Although the appearance on the outside of our building was nothing spectacular, the interior had been updated with current decor. The bathroom was not fully updated, but nothing to complain about. The pools were heated and clean. There were palm trees, lily pads, ducks, huge beautiful trees along walking trails with bridges. It also had a private minature golf course (which we did not take advantage of...but wished we did). We would highly recommend this location for business or leisure. It was a wonderful retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Like Something from a movie set”
Reviews.Author: tohellor
Reviews.Content: Its a nice hotel and alot of effort has been put into keeping it look well, however found the staff to be a little rude and not very helpful. Pool area is very nice, however its very e xpensive to buy food/ drinks and you are not allowed to bring your own in. Situated about a 10 or 15 minute drive from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “How the comercial says it "Priceless".”
Reviews.Author: cheddarstyle
Reviews.Content: We (Family of 5) were greeted at the door by wonderful staff including the Resort host -Mr. Quick. Our view from our room was like a screensaver on my computer that I sit and dream about all day. Beautiful wooden floors, flat screen tv's and 10 min after settling in, we were greeted once again by magnificent staff who were delivering milk and cookies for my children. Being 30 ft away from the ocean is a plus, watching my kids play in the sand while my wife and I relax on the patio furniture and enjoy the sun.... Priceless! Room service was great, resort store was clutch (milk for my 1 year old) and the all around hospitality was well above par. Couldn't ask for a better and more relaxing time. Thanks,

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved it.......parents...depends on your expectations”
Reviews.Author: easthamcapecod
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights at paradise point. The kids loved every minute of our stay. My husband and I enjoyed it once we accepted it for what it was (not a luxurious resort with upscale service and amenities) Pros: Grounds were pretty, kids enjoyed running about feeding the birds and playing in the pool. Spa was very nice my daughter and I had ice cream pedicures Michelle and Amanda were delightful! Main Pool was kid friendly and fun Cons: For the money (beachside bungalow over $300.00 a night ) we expect a higher level of amenities and service. NO CONCIERGE Room was nice enough although odd. Microwave (didn't work) fridge and sink. A Kitchenette without a single dish, utensil etc. Bathroom was old but clean although our room was not cleaned until after 5:00pm and a phone call and they did not fill up the empty shampoo, soap, etc. two days in a row . another phone call.. Restaurant service was horrible of all the meals only once did they get our order right. Repeatedly had to ask for things. Tea came about 20 minutes after dessert and that was only when we reminded the server (again) 5 Pools HOWEVER only one is heated during march. poolside bar/restaurant not open. $3.00 charge for duck food since the lobby was "out" of the free duck food???? We met a number of people who were very unhappy with their rooms so I would only recommend this resort with caution and only after you have done much research. For $300.00 or more a night there are better places. May be fine for half that price.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful and relaxing resort with the most welcoming and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: rosegang
Reviews.Content: I was planning a very spontaneous trip for three friends and I to celebrate our friendship and help us heal from some rough periods in our lives. We came upon Paradise Point Resort and Spa and decided to celebrate a week there and enjoy the city of SanDiego. The resort itself was beautiful and welcoming and provided us with a the relaxing environment we were looking for; yet close enough for easy access to all the sites of SanDiego. However, the absolute best part of staying at this beautiful beach front resort was the caring and helpful staff. Every one we spoke to, before our trip and during, had our best interest at heart. We want to particularly mention Elizabeth Markling and the staff at Island Market. She was always there for us in directing us to the best places to eat and things to do, and would follow up with us to make sure we got there and enjoyed it. One time we were walking lost trying find a restaurant North of Paradise Point when Elizabeth called to check on us and helped get us directed to the right place. She and the staff at Island market helped us daily mapping out our adventures for the day . Elizabeth's skills and knowledge were most helpful, but most of all she did it all with a smile and personal touch. Thank you Elizabeth, Island Market Staff and Paradise Point for the most wonderful vacation stay! Mary, Ann, Mary and Judy (Our rooms were magnificent! Know that our travels have included Africa, Hawaii, Alaska, Dublin and throughout the United States)

Reviews.Title: “Best Place EVER!”
Reviews.Author: shannonlafayette
Reviews.Content: We had such an amazing experience at the Paradise Point Resort. My husband and I flew in from Austin on March 10th to have a couples romantic weekend before the birth of our second child. When we checked into our room, we realize something wasn't right. The room hadn't been cleaned! However, we called the front desk and the manager, same lady who checked us in, made it right in every sense of the word. She was extremely apologetic and explained that an error had occured and the room we were given wasn't ready to be rented. She then upgraded us to the most amazing bay front room. It was perfect, and everything else from that moment on was perfect. Awesome room, lots of privacy, excellent food, very clean room and great maid service. We were beyond happy with our stay here and will certainly tell everyone we know about this place. Thank you again for such awesome hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “NOT a paradise”
Reviews.Author: WillKos
Reviews.Content: We reserved this weekend through Vacationist based on the info and pictures provided. Needless to say, we were disappointed. They first assigned us to an ADA accessible room with old mis-matched towels and dingy furniture. They did switch us to another room, but this one smelled like mildew - a very strong smell. Although this trip was prepaid, and no refund per the Vacationist rules, we decided to cut our losses and leave. We did not stay at all and actually ended up at The Hotel del Coronado - one of our favorites. We will not be going back to "Paradise" Point.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Venue with Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: AimAtw
Reviews.Content: San Diego weather in January cannot be beat. Paradise Point gave the feel of being away in a tropical paradise although convenient to the airport and downtown. The conference facility was well maintained and flowed well within one building. From top down, the service was unmatched. Each and every person who supported our conference was polite, respectful, professional, and at the top of their game. We wanted for nothing. Our needs were anticipated each step of the way. The staff took the ball and ran with it and never looked back. Paradise Point MADE our event a success!

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: CKarnitz
Reviews.Content: Loved the resort, loved the location to all the San Diego attractions. Fabulous marina staff, huge thank you to Rob and Matt! Two on site restaurants, gift shop, heated pools ( though not heated enough for the kids to swim in windy March). The rooms were lovely and spacious, the grounds well kept, and the staff was exceptionally friendly. I did have to call and have the room re-cleaned. Also, don't leave any food out, small black ants!(our fault- the kids had donuts). We had room service one morning, fast hot food. Helpful concierge, cabs waiting to drive you anywhere. Not luxurious, but I would say 3.5 star experience. I would stay here again with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: Esca51
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at the resort. All I can say is wow from check in to check out it was fantastic. The property is beautiful and more than I expected. It's close to downtown, Seaport Village, and many other places. We ordered room service each morning and breakfast was delicious. Our room was very nice and clean. The gift shop was great and the employees were very courteous. I highly recommend this hotel. We plan on coming back with our children and are considering having our anniversary party here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: whitemntstraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights total. The staff was very accomodating. Our room had been remodeled and was a great value. We found the area very quiet at night. A great value. We traveled around California and on our last night out, we booked again. We were even upgraded to a bungalow, what a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to relax”
Reviews.Author: francisvg
Reviews.Content: After finishing classes for law school and taking the BAR this was the perfect place to go relax and unwind. The noise level was nonexistent, the staff was friendly and the room was nice. The grounds were beautiful and made for a calming and beautiful walk every night. This hotel was not far from many of the places we normally visit when in San Diego which made it even more delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Charge for everything”
Reviews.Author: Mopower
Reviews.Content: Grounds are 4 star, rooms are 2.5 star. Bathrooms are in serious need of an upgrade, You can hear the TV next door plain as day. The only thing included is the Pool, everything else is extra. Fitness center $12, Parking $25 per day, Internet $10, Mini golf $10 per person, bike rental $10 per hour, you get the picture. They have mastered the art of extracting money. On the upside the grounds are wonderful and the location is excellent,

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach in room...”
Reviews.Author: jms760
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Paradise Point several times before and been pretty happy with my experience. This time, however, was different. I checked in late one evening and the next day, housekeeping never showed up. I was out on business pretty much the whole day and they never came. Also, there was a HUGE cockroach in my room that I couldn't manage to kill (but managed to the next morning). The hinges on the doors were rusty to the point that there were streaks of rust running down the doorjamb onto the floor. One of my towels was dirty. The bed was comfortable but I could hear my next door neighbor's TV through the wall. Also, the garden area outside my room had some small pieces of trash that hadn't been cleaned up. Don't think I'll choose to go back with so many other good choices in San Diego. I used to recommend this place to friends. No longer. Oh, and parking is $25 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: scubedo
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place to stay. I wish it was warmer so we could have taken advantage of all of the amenities. The room was beautiful, two Queen beds, kitchenette and a HUGE bathroom which was wonderful with two teenage girls. It was huge but divided into different areas! Right across the street from Sea World, 15 minutes to the San Diego Zoo and 30 minutes to the Safari Park.

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing and beautiful resort. I was there on business but wanted to play!”
Reviews.Author: robyngoby
Reviews.Content: This is the best kept secret. I am so glad we brought our company to Paradise Point. The service is exceptional and the meeting rooms are beautiful. So you can work and then relax in a beautiful setting. It's also in a great location -- easy to get to/from the airport and to local attractions and dining. I would highly recommend it for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Michi0509
Reviews.Content: I have a 5 & 1 year old. We stayed in a bayside bungalow for 3 days (2 nights). I love this place, it was our 2nd stay. The pools are saltwater, so our skin didn't get all dried out. I love being right on the beach, my son can just go straight out the front door to play. There's also a fire pit, we roasted hot dogs and marshmallows. I'm not a camper, at all, but this is a really nice compromise to have a luxurious, fun, active family vacation. We're definitely planning to go again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall...beautiful grounds...met our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: SassyGRL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and 2 year old daughter for 2 nights. Went in having read all the reviews, so I didn't want to get my hopes up...got a great deal on Hotwire, so we didn't really have anything to lose...just wanted to get a place close to Seaworld and this place was right across the street. Check-in was a breeze.Lobby area was welcoming. ROOM: Yes, it was a little strange having our"beach-style" bungalow right next to the road where the guests would drive by. The view outside of our door was the road and then the lagoon. So not much privacy if you open the shades. Speaking of which, the shade covering the door was too sheer and the lights of the cars would shine really brightly into the room, which was a minor annoyance. The decor was tropical island inspired and modern. The flat screen was nice, the refrigerator worked well, bed was firm and comfy. No dresser for clothes. Like other people said, the renovation on the bathroom was a quickie one. Coat of paint slapped on. They should have replaced the showerheads. Looks old and outdated. The water pressure is awful. It took forever to take a shower. Killed some bugs each day. Not a big deal though. GROUNDS: The landscaping and lagoon was so lush and beautiful. That part really felt tropical. We loved walking around with our little one, exploring the resort. They have many little pools scattered around (some for adults only and some for the family) and fire pits. You can make smores and stuff on the fire pits (they sell kits at the gift shop for $25, along with firewood...really expensive....byo). They have bikes for rent and a miniature golf area....very family friendly, but everything is expensive. LOCATION: Very close to Mission Bay, Seaworld, LOTS of great restaurants. All of the places we ate at nearby were good. We just looked on Yelp for recommendations. Also ate at Barefoot Bar for breakfast both days and had no problems. DO NOT feed the birds. They are VERY aggressive and we saw this other guest who had left his table outside for a second and the birds swooped in and started eating his food. Baleen is the higher end restaurant, right next to Barefoot. Didn't eat here during our stay. We also went to Balboa Park which was only 15 minutes away. So everything is very convenient. CONS: Yes, parking is $25 a night. They charge for internet too. The items at the gift shop (Island Market) are expensive. Lots of activities cost something. Our experience overall was a really pleasant one. I think this place is great for families and I think I would come back when my kid is older. Easy access to many places, beautiful lush grounds and overall friendly service people.

Reviews.Title: “Desperate need for renovation of rooms”
Reviews.Author: JCMad
Reviews.Content: I will certainly not choose this location again! Upon arrival, I drove to my "bungalow by the beach" which was a brick block that looked like a garage with glass doors on front. There was a tiny patio area which sat right on the road. Across from our bungalow, there were 7 roofers making repairs and looking right across into our room. Certainly did not look anything like the advertised location. As we settled in, we discovered the toilet was not working, the shower had little pressure and the internet was not working. I spend the first hour dealing with repairs and afterwards I found 3 more things broken but at that point I was tired of dealing with repairs and gave up. There are so many other good hotels on Vacation Road and in the San Diego area and this was certainly one of the worst hotels I have stayed in for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “This is why it is called Paradise Point....”
Reviews.Author: m_michalek
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point on Mission Bay is one of the few places I can really relax. You really don't need to leave the property! There's a beach, pools, spa, restaurant and acres of beautiful gardens to walk around and enjoy. We have been coming here for 10+ years with our kids -- and at every age they have looked forward to it. They can bring their bikes and razors and explore the tropical grounds or rent a quad bike there. There is also a small miniature golf course on the property that is fun for kids too. I would HIGHLY recommend this for a great family trip--it might just become a tradition like it has for our family!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Wonderland”
Reviews.Author: Marabesque
Reviews.Content: Our son who lives in San Diego was married on 2/19 to his fiance who hails from Ohio. We are from Maryland. She arranged for a 50 room block on the property with many extra benefits like parking, internet, etc. The property has recently gone through an ownership change after a complete updating. We had a lovely bungalow right on the water near many family members and friends, and planned a breakfast for all the out of town guests on Sunday morning at the Dockside Room of the Conference Center. The wedding and rehearsal dinner were offsite, but Paradise Point couldn't have been more convenient or helpful in allowing shuttles and accommodating the extra needs of such a large group. The breakfast on Sunday hosted about 120 people: good food, beautiful room and ambiance, and a fitting end to a lovely celebration. Kudos to the Catering Manager, Karen Cipolla, for helping me get that together!!!

Reviews.Title: “Manager Dave-You've got a long way to go buddy.”
Reviews.Author: Tad1000
Reviews.Content: I am at the "Resort" now. This is the 3rd room I have been in. The same ugly "painting" in each one. Not enough housekeeping staff and they are not trained. I have had broken glass on my floor for 2 days. Stayed the first night in a duplex and "upgraded" to a "private bungalow" which meant a quadraplex facing a stagnant lagoon. Puddles of water (I hope) on the floor when we checked in and the place reeked of bleach. Listened to babies crying, people fighting through the walls and the sound of the pond circulation pump grinding through the night. The same hairs were on the floor in the bathroom when we left as when we got there despite a note with a tip to the housekeeper to clean it up-she took the note and the cash, so I know she got the message. We also had room service the first night and the dishes were still on the table when we left 2 days later. Decided to downgrade if that was an upgrade. Now in a single room that is like being in a bomb shelter. Concrete block with only a door for light-no windows and definitely no view. Left a note for the housekeeper to clean up the broken glass and she just crumpled it up and left it on the night stand. I come to San Diego almost every year to see my friends and we are going back to the Mistral in Coronado next year. Sorry Dave. Hope you find a new job soon.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: kndavis18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our wedding at Paradise Point in February 2011 and it was amazing! The catering staff was so accomodating and all of our guests were very complimentary of everything from the property to the food to the spa. The resort is gorgeous and we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Room old in need of refurbishment.”
Reviews.Author: judielilylake
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful facility but the accomodations are far below standard for the price charged. Facility is under an ongoing refurbishment and if you plan to stay here be sure you get a newly done room. Ours was smelly, dirty and generally not satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: Italtraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in San Diego at Paradise Point and we were completely satisfied. We went to San Diego for tourism and unfortunately we didn't enjoy all the amenities that this resort can offer: once, early in the morning, my son and I walked around the pond....nice and peaceful. I really suggest climbing on the observation tower to enjoy the view of the bay and the wonderful skyline of this resort. The room was spacious and comfortable (a big walking closet is unique in a hotel!). Personnel are extremely courteous. The parking fee is right $25/day (probably pricey). In the night is quiet and you can really relax. Considering the spectacular place I release a 5 stars rating even if the room is in average 4 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service & attentiveness was terrific”
Reviews.Author: dtwo2
Reviews.Content: Held an annual conference at Paradise Point this year. A great property that offered all the features we needed to hold the event and the service from the staff was outstanding. Whatever we needed, a quick call was all that was needed and it was taken care of. Catering was fantastic. The property offered an nice, tranquil setting which was great for the non-business parts of the event and also featured an excellent array of meeting space that lent itself well to the various types of business meetings and functions that took place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome customer service”
Reviews.Author: Chickadee59
Reviews.Content: We held an annual customer event at the Paradise Point Resort. The attentiveness from the event staff was the best! They were available by cell phone all hours of the day to assist with whatever we needed. The bell staff was very accomodating as well - just call for a golf cart and they were right there! I stayed in a beachside bungalow - I would recommend doing the same - it was wonderful to enjoy the beach and bonfires! A good place to bring the family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a family retreat and couples get away simultaneously”
Reviews.Author: aimeeallen
Reviews.Content: My experience was phenominal from start to finish. Making reservations I felt as if I was talking to a family member who was trying to get me the best location on the property for my family. I booked a party for my teenaged daughter's birthday party and it was a breeze. Hassle free. once there my room was not ready right on time (10 minutes late) and the front desk manager added $50 to my room tab for anything on the island. The rooms were gorgeous. we didn't want to leave at check out. the front desk gave us an extra hour not a problem. It is it's own island (you can walk around with cocktails in your hand) and there is plenty to offer. My daughter had fun with her friends at the pool and putting green - which is manicured better than any course I've been on - while my husband and I enjoyed alone time at the wonderful restaurants, adult jaccuzi and bayside bonfire. It was like a romantic get away and family vacation all in one. Personally, I couldn't ask for more. Oh and the fitness center was plush.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Paradise! Clean, beautiful and full of activities! No need to leave the property!”
Reviews.Author: hbmick
Reviews.Content: No reason to go anywhere else! From the moment of arrival the staff was friendly and attentive. Marc the bell captain always greets with a smile and an offer to assist. The front desk is consistently friendly and accommodating. The grounds are clean and beautiful and the newly renovated rooms are comfortable and stylish. The location is perfect being only a few minutes from Sea World but the property is quiet and relaxing. Lots of fun activities both for adults and children. The day could be filled with miniature golf, fitness, a leisurely bike ride around the property, fun at one of the many pools, feeding the fish and ducks or simply relaxing by the bay. On our most recent stay we did not even leave the property one time. Paradise Point is located conveniently close to many local attractions as well. I recommend the S'more kit at the gift shop (or bring your own supplies to save a bit). You can build your own fire at one of the fire pits on property or walk on over to the Lagoon pool to enjoy the pre built fire nightly. We have stayed here several times and plan a return trip soon!

Reviews.Title: “New high prices... same old place”
Reviews.Author: Vacannes
Reviews.Content: I was totally surprised to recently see a huge price increase in room rates for this family resort that has only updated its rooms (new furnishings and decor) and not that much more. We have been staying at at Paradise point for the last 5 years with our young children, and though it does have many advantages, the new rate does not compensate for this huge jump in price. If you want beach front access and a family style place to stay you can stay for the same amount of money at the Hotel Del Corando with greater amenities and a lot more atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “beautifully clean grounds and friendly staff - extras pricey”
Reviews.Author: suezinmn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at PP and the grounds are exceptional. The resort takes most of the island except for parkland adjacent to the grounds. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My husband and I did not bring a car and conveniently San Diego bus #9 stops outside the resort on all days except Sunday. That makes it easy to go to Old Town and Pacific Beach where prices are more reasonable. The pools and spas are wonderful. The internet is $15 to $20 per day and the bike rental etc is quite overpriced for the San Diego area and the quality of the bikes. The TV is streaming Lodgenet, which was a bit slow to start up and you cannot channel surf, so to change channels you have to go back to the menu but there seemed to be no guide to what was on that we could find. It seemed to encourage spending oney rather than watching free TV. The bed was rather hard but not terribly uncomfortable. The in room coffee was of average quality and brewed by the cup or two cups and it was quick. Would I stay here again? I think I like Pacific Beach better and will look for something there the next time I am in town. We felt we had to get out to find reasonable entertainment. This resort charges for all extras including the firewood for fires on the beach that would be nice to have included in the price. There is a $25 dollar charge for parking per day and this seems quite unnecessary. They were very generous about early arrival and late check out. That was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii like environment & great staff”
Reviews.Author: ReluctantTraveler00
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the second half of a 5 day trip to San Diego/ Tijuana for medical treatment and a few days of relaxation following. Spouse's parents stayed in a separte room and a good friend stayed in an ajoining room here with us as well. Grounds were beautiful. All of the staff we encountered were sincerely helpful and freindly, very accomodating. They do charge $25 per day for parking which seemed high to us but our charge was waived because we had an issue with someone knocking loudly at our door on the second night of our stay sometime after midnight which startled us out of a sound sleep. Parents had a little problem with light and noise in their room the first night but were accomodated with a move to a better located room. Laundry facilities are available which I really appreciated. There is a nice little gift shop that sells laundry soap etc... as well as all of the normal touristy stuff. My only complaints would be that ther isn't a normal coffee pot in the room, they have the type that uses the little pouches to make single servings and they charge for internet $10 per day which I was not willing to pay but would really have liked to have. There is a mini frigde in the rooms but no microwave. Nice pool areas. We didn't try the restaurants. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1judyblueeyes
Reviews.Content: We flew into SanDeigo. Our flight arrived late... We were so pleasently surprised to find that not only was there a smiling face at the desk when we arrived but John took excellant care of us and made us feel like we were important. Our room was more than we expected it to be!!! The veiw was breath taking!!!!! More than exceeded our expectations!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: HJ2010_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our honeymoon through travelocity to stay at Paradise Point Resort and Spa. I was a little nervous because when we normally book trips on-line, we are somewhat familiar with the city and hotels. For this trip we had to total trust customer reviews and the hotel website pictures because neither of us had been to San Diego before or heard of Paradise Point Resort. We got a great rate, and upon arriving at the hotel, the staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. When I happen to mention in passing that it was our honeymoon, they upgraded our room (even though we had pre-paid through travelocity). Throughout our stay they were accomodating of our needs and extremely helpful with suggesting restaurants, local attractions, etc. We enjoyed our guest room and found it very comfortable and cozy. We had a suite that you walked directly into from the driveway, and it had a private patio with a little creek behind it. It was very relaxing and very different from a traditional hotel experience. The location was great too. We rented a car and found it very easy to get around San Diego and its surrounding areas. It would only take between 2-10minutes to get anywhere, even downtown. And, our room had a parking spot right next to the door, so parking was extremely convenient. Although we were spending our honeymoon there, we were also impressed with how family friendly Paradise Point is (yet, we didn't feel over run by kids- definitely a plus for newlyweds just wanting to spend some quality-quiet time together for their honeymoon). We feel as though when we have a family we would definitely go back and stay there. Overall, Paradise Point was a great experience that I would recommend to family, friends, colleagues and anyone else. The pictures that you see on-line are a true representation of what you see and experience when you get there. I would go back in a minute and as my husband says....that means/says a lot considering that I am a picky traveler when it comes to cleanliness, comfort, and quality :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: IslandGrl74
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful, excellent service- note that this is a large resort- the nicest rooms are farthest from the restaurants/meeting rooms and lobby, but you cannot beat the bay view rooms if you can stay in them. Plus you can always call for the golf cart to come get you to take you anywhere around the property! Rooms need a few changes- tile floors made room chilly- probably not a problem in the summer, but in the winter time at night- made it chilly even with the heat on! Shower curtain was too short and water got all over the bathroom floor and made it slippery. For some reason housekeeping forgot to clean our room on 2nd day- but was not that big of a deal. Was just odd because we had the "Service Please" sign. Would definitely go back- food was also excellent! Internet was spotty in the conference space.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are highly overated”
Reviews.Author: bdlesch
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at this resort. The staff has been very curteous and helpful except for the girl who waited on us at check-in. The grounds of this resort are very tropical and the scenery is beautiful. However, the room has fallen far below expectations. The door frame at the entrance to our bungalow is rotted at the bottom, our first indication of neglect. We have had flying and crawling bugs in this room off and on during our stay. I found a spider crawling on my hair this morning when I woke up and found one crawling on the wall next to our bed, That is the final straw and prompted this posting. The air conditioning unit is very close to the bed. The fan is loud and cycles on and off continuously. There is one small towel rack in the bathroom. There are no hooks in the bathroom, not even on the back of the door. The flat screen tv had poor reception on 40% of the stations. I would not recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent”
Reviews.Author: Eggnog8610
Reviews.Content: This was the 6th Hotel we stayed at on our Honeymoon tour down the coast of California. The bottom line is we WILL return here. The resort is located on an Island in Mission Bay and is very clean and gives off very relaxing ora. On arrival we checked in, the member of staff on reception was extremely friendly and helpful. She asks what made us come to San Diego and we say we are on our Honeymoon and have been travelling down the coast from San Francisco. She congratulates us as do the other members of staff around the reception area. As it was our Honeymoon she very kindly upgraded our room. We are then shown to our room which was situated next to the beach. The room was spacious, relaxing clean and tidy with a great view over the bay. There’s not really much I can say about the complex, everything was immaculate, very close to what I would call Paradise. Staff always remember your name and always say hello and constantly make every effort to make your stay comfortable and relaxed. We had a problem with the Key card on our room, sometimes it unlocked the door sometimes it didn’t I advised the staff of this and they quickly rectified the problem. The beach’s are fitted out with fire pits and logs and food are available at the sight shop as is drink which is all very reasonably priced. If you prefer you can just sit around the fire pits next to the swimming pools in the evening and just relax. To round it off, this hotel was everything we wanted and more. Sea World is located about a mile from the hotel and if walked would only take around 20-30 minutes. Staff are genuinely friendly and don’t seem at all pretentious. The sight is clean and tidy and the facilities are great. I only wish we had spent an extra few days here as there is so much we didn’t get around to doing. I would definitely recommend staying here to anyone looking for a relaxing comfy holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Better than perfect...”
Reviews.Author: MABBERO
Reviews.Content: This place exceeded all my expectations in most every way. If in San Diego again I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. Right from the beginning of the stay I was pleased with our experience. The resort itself is impressively located on an island in Mission Bay and was pretty much immaculate. Staff were friendly and helpful, even the gardeners went out of the way to make us feel welcome. Facilities on the island are great and the chalet type rooms were just what we wanted with great facilities and plenty of space. Everything was clean and tidy and we even had a patio with pond (and ducks)! We had a choice of five or so swimming pools, tennis courts, spa, etc so wanted for nothing on our stay. The resort is nice and close to La Jolla, San Diego downtown etc if you have got a car and also just far enough away, so that you can get some peace and quiet. I recommend wholeheartedly and really don't think I have ever enjoyed a stay away from home as much as I did at Paradise Point - I look forward to going back. We went at a nice quiet time of year (straight after New Year)

Reviews.Title: “More than expected... MUCH MORE!”
Reviews.Author: jpgarcia1029
Reviews.Content: This is the spot to be at with the person you love! I had the best time of my life, better than any other hotel I have been in... INCLUDING VEGAS! It's so serene and calm. All the workers and employees are wonderful and helpful with anything my fiance and I needed. Every hot spot is within like 5-10 miles of the resort, so you can always be spontaneous and say "Hey, lets just go to Sea World! It's only around the corner!" Truly the BEST BIRTHDAY EVER!

Reviews.Title: “Best in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Richrandal
Reviews.Content: If looking for the best in San Diego coastal, here it is! I've stayed at Bahia, Catamaran and in my opinion, this tops em all! Kid friendly, but perfect for a quiet romantic getaway. Sea World is next door, but we never had to leave the property. The only downside is the restraunt / bar is a little pricey. But I guess that's expected for this quality resort. All and all, 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay if you have kids.”
Reviews.Author: ChaneyKay
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic! I was totally unhappy with my hotel when I arrived in San Diego. At midnight I called a couple places and had a hard time finding a last minute room. John at Paradise Point Resort said he would take care of us no problem. Thirty minutes later we were walking into a beach side bungalow with a kitchenette and living room. We were astonished that the winter rates were so low and how much we got for our money. The decor was excellent, the bed and bedding were excellent and the service was top notch. We started each day with breakfast in bed and loved everything but the weak coffee. We thoroughly enjoyed the 40 plus acres of resort, they have everything you could ask for from a vacation resort. Even though the resort is on an island, we found it very easy to drive up Interstate 8 to lots of food and shopping. My son had a great time playing in the sand just outside our room. We enjoyed the sunset each night from our little porch and we had full view of hundreds of sailboats, wind surfers and people kayaking. The atmosphere was full on recreation, vacation and fun. They had all sorts of spa services, equipment rentals and pools/water features. I can see coming back to this place for many years to come as my children grow up. It's perfect for all ages and anyone can find something they like even if they like doing nothing. It's around the corner from Sea World and many other San Diego must see's. I enjoyed my stay so much that I truly did not want to leave. This place far exceeds all the other places I have stayed in San Diego in room quality and cleanliness. The tile floors and pretty wooden Balinese style bed made me want to stay for a month. It is a huge resort and they have plenty of room during the winter, I am sure they fill up in the summer months. My complaints are minor. The shampoo smelled good but was watery. There was an unfortunate rust spot in the bathtub that kept leading me to think it was a huge spider. As I mentioned, the coffee from room service was more like tea, very very weak. Otherwise this place was perfect. The bed and bedding were my favorite part but the exceptional service really made our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Ellieczy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Paradise point twice now, and each time i've loved it. It's so peaceful and beautiful! There is limited choice of restaurants on site, but the food is ok. It is in a great location, right next to seaworld and about a 15min drive to San Diego, where theres great shopping. Paradise point has beautiful clean pools, and they were never that busy either. The rooms were great too,a good size and clean and the beds very comfy too. I would definately stay here again, it is a little pricey, but better than a lot of places in the UK

Reviews.Title: “Our family wants to make Christmas at Paradise Point an annual event”
Reviews.Author: davidacarmody
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 3 children (ages 24, 27 & 30) spent 4 wonderful days between Christmas and New Years at Paradise point. In the mornings the boys went to the fitness center, my wife and daughter went to the gift shop, and I slept in. We met for breakfast at 9am at the hotel restaurant, where I enjoyed the excellent eggs benedict. Then we would walk the grounds and enjoy the South Pacific like setting, or have some friendly family competition on the putting course, croquet lawn, or tennis court. In the afternoon and evenings we were a 15 minute drive from any of San Diego's attractions. Best of all, the hotel staff are all genuinely happy and helpful people. Very contagious. Truly remarkable. We have decided to make this an annual event.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Bailstorm
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect place to stay after the chaos of Disneyland. We were able to check in at 10:00 am as it is the quite season. We were immediately upgrades to a bungalow on the beach with a kitchenette. The unit was gorgeous, clean, with gorgeous views of the bay. We had the resort to ourselves. With two kids, their favorite thing to do was feed the ducks in one of the lagoons or swim in one of the 5 pools that they had to themselves. The kitchenette in the room was basic with a coffee maker small fridge and microwave only. They should stock it with a few basic supplies. However, I called room service and they delivered cutlery, plates etc. for four people within 10 minutes at no charge. In fact, any time we called for something the service was exceptional. The coffee maker packed it in the last morning and we were given a $20.00 credit to our room. We took a cab to Vons grocery store 5 minutes awayfor groceries.The the ride cost $15.00. The food in both restaurants was excellent but expensive for a family. We opted to eat dinners in the restaurants. The San diego Trolley tour comes to the lobby each morning, which was a great way to see San Diego. We stayed 3 nights.... the kids can't decide which they preferred, Disneyland or this resort, that alone says a lot about the resort if you are coming with a family. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: lucky19691961
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very nice, Staff was especially nice and helpful, especially assistant front desk Manager Loic Pichardo who went above and beyond. The Location and amenities this property provides are awesome. Everything is immaculately maintaind including the pools, rooms, restaraunts, lobby etc. The property was built in 1962 so it has been there a while but it has been refurbished pretty well. It is very close to Sea World and beaches as well as oold town and gas Lamp. If possible try to get a room along the beach/inlet.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place, we will be back again and again!”
Reviews.Author: trlc2112
Reviews.Content: My now Husband & I live in San Diego and were planning our wedding and decided to 'stayhoneymoon' and support our local economy. We checked out several locations and we wanted a hotel with a lovely view, privacy, good food and a feeling of comfort and relaxation. We found it at Paradise Point. The service was great, the room was just right, and the memories are irreplaceable. We will definitely be back again and again.. Thank you to everyone for making our honeymoon fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: BigGuy57
Reviews.Content: I brought my wife here for our 25th anniversary, We had a wonderful stay, despite some unusual weather. If you want quiet and relaxation this is a very nice place to get both. The hotel's extra charges are an annoyance but didn't spoil the experience. Maintenance has small issues, as well. Having said all that, we loved the setting, the grounds are beautiful, and the staff was friendly and helpful in the extreme. We ate twice at the barefoot grill. The food was outstanding, and sitting on the deck next to Mission Bay while you eat could become addictive. I didn't want to leave !

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Irritating”
Reviews.Author: KayOGee
Reviews.Content: Not a great stay, but not entirely bad. Wouldn't recommend it for others with small kids. Read on for a, hopefully, nuanced description of our stay. We are currently at the hotel and leaving this morning after a 4 day night stay. We rented a very expensive bay-side bungalow which has a "kitchenette" (more on this later), separate bedroom and living area. The porch opens out onto the bay beach. This is a family trip and we have two small children with us. Pros The location is right on Mission Bay with great views day and night. The beach is good for small kids to beachcomb with 19 fire rings for a late night smores fest with the kids. There are five pools and multiple hot tubs that are heated. The ambience of gas-lit tiki torches down the main drives is beautiful. You're within easy driving of restaurants/bars in Pacific Beach and not too far from La Jolla with a huge range of choices. Great location for seeing the sights in San Deigo and environs. Cons It's very irritating how the hotel nickles and dimes you on everything. They charge a $25/day parking fee (which they'll waive under certain circumstances) for parking in front of a $400/night bungalow. There is a fitness center, but that's an extra $12/day/person. There's a village store where you can buy a small wood pile for a beach fire, but, oh, did you want a starter kit for that. It's extra. Need matches or lighter, more yet. Did you want a late checkout? That's $50/hour. The service is horrible. The first night we needed extra blankets (none on the pullout in the living area) and had to call 3 times over more than a half hour. We had similar experiences later in the trip. However, the room cleaners were good and eficient.. The bungalow "kitchenette" consisted of a microwave and a small cube refrigeratot. No plates, no cutlery, nothing. The doors on the kitchenette are hanging badly on the hinges and wouldn't close properly. Hard to describe it as a kitchenette. The bungalows are in serious need of being refurbished. It's clear that someone made an effort and slapped a coat of paint on everything, but things are old and dated. A sink spigot in the bathroom was so broken that it was hard to shut off. Our bungalow was very near the noisy causeway crossing Mission Bay making the "sitting out on the porch" experience one of listening to the sound of Harleys and trucks go by.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Ashashin
Reviews.Content: Wow! so Much to say about this place! This is the last place we stayed at in the 7 days we were in California! 7 days five hotels! We came on a budget and no plans and no ideas! We used the priceline app after we planned each day! Great prices on mostly great hotels(all 4 stars according to Priceline)! One bad experience out of the 5 hotels at the Hilton in Anaheim but to compare them all to the Paradise Point Resort is next to impossible. The drive up to the front desk I knew my wife and I were in for a treat! The staff VERY friendly very helpful!!!! BEST experience of the 5 by far! Upgraded my priceline reservation to be on the beach! A beautiful suite with deck chairs to look at the ocean! A truly breath taking scene! Beach with fire pits and a paved walk to see more of the picturesque area! A tower in the middle to climb to the top for more spectacular views! The rooms were spectacular and spacious 2 bathrooms were a plus! Bed was also the nicest and most comfortable that we slept on too! I cant wait to come back to this place! MY wife and I have already are planning to come back next winter! With a 7 day stay at one hotel this time! This hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay again or advise anyone to stay”
Reviews.Author: freddie92
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a complete rip off, the room are old and smell of Mold. There is no comfort here. Bathrooms are old, cold and outdated. They have roaches and water bugs. You have to pay for everything, there is no luxury or comfort about this place. I was completely fooled by the pictures on the web site. If you plan on staying in San Diego this is not the place you want to be....

Reviews.Title: “anniversary time”
Reviews.Author: cpfamilySanDiego
Reviews.Content: It rained and rained - but who cares? we had a great time. We were given a free upgrade upon check in and enjoyed our room, the ballet, and local restaurants. We are from San Diego and just wanted to have a quite peaceful time for our 20+ years together. We did and would recommend it to others and even come and take our friends to the barefoot cafe because we liked it so much. The spa was good and the hairdresser wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant property”
Reviews.Author: ynleung
Reviews.Content: Four days well spent, off season, recouperating from a high stress life. Reviewed hotels online and this was the best price for a 4.5 star resort in a park setting for my goal of walking, yoga, massage, reading and swimming. Good beaches, well kept. Multiple swimming pools. Two good restaurants but cheapest is a bit pricey still. Loved spa massage. My sleeping cabana was on an inside lagoon perfect for relaxed sun and reading. NOTE: December maybe in the 60's but its cold and damp so bring at least one heavy sweater or coat to enjoy outside. I flew in from -10F and still was chilled. Room heat was personal control and good. Loved discovering the baby sharks and skates in the small tidal pools.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jparc
Reviews.Content: I attended a meeting at the Hotel this past week. From the moment of arrival to departure the staff were friendly and helpful. It was really an outstanding stay. Priscilla at the desk and everyone else made you feel very welcome. I feel they were truly sincere. The hotel was beutiful, and very clean. Highly recommend...

Reviews.Title: “One of the best experiences I have ever had......”
Reviews.Author: sabrinaloves97
Reviews.Content: We chose this resort as our stay for the day before and day of our wedding. It was beautiful for pictures and great experience. The staff was amazing there. The best part of it all was: The day after our wedding my husband and I were to leave very early to LAX to fly out for our honeymoon. I turned out that I forgot several of my belongings. Some to be Jewelery that my husband had given me the night before the wedding and vintage jewelry that I rented for the wedding. I was going crazy looking for it. I finally decided to call Paradise Point to see if they had seen it. I get a call back within less than 10 minutes from the head of security telling me that they had my belongings and I should go pick it up. I couldn't believe it. ALL my jewelry and my couch makeup bag and more were there. I was so grateful. I would recommend this place to anyone, mostly because you can trust them to take care of your every need. SMG & GG

Reviews.Title: “best fun loved everything about it ,felt as excited as a kid again”
Reviews.Author: ukgirly5
Reviews.Content: we booked late had no idea what kind of hotel it was but squealed with delight when we pulled in Mark our Bellman was so helpful and and was so excited to tell us about the hotel ,very cool guy ,the rooms were spotless and had everything we could need inside. We parked our car right outside our room which was really helpful as we had small kids. The pool was great and there were 5 and they were heated and had jacuzzi's .The restaurant was awesome kids loved having the water right next to the looking at the marine life while the ate breakfast .The only problem we could find was how sad we felt to be leaving .

Reviews.Title: “It Could Have Been Great”
Reviews.Author: IvesinAZ
Reviews.Content: When planning my vacation to San Diego, I found a great deal on a hotel. The hotel was rated 4 stars and met my criteria. It was close to SeaWorld and had direct beach access. At that point it would not have taken much to impress me. Unfortunately, I was not impressed. While driving from Phoenix, we realized that we would be arriving much later than we anticipated. I tried to call to make sure our late check in would not be a problem. I also wanted to make sure the room had 2 beds. It has happened in the past where I have reserved a rooms with 2 beds and still received a room with only one. I was on hold for 20 minutes and when I finally got through I was told that there was no way to connect me with reservations or the front desk as it was after hours. The person on the phone informed me that I had been on hold for so long because no one was picking up at the reception desk. My call finally rolled over to her and she was at a different location. Upon our arrival, we found driving around the property a bit confusing. The small signs indicating where the check in location was, were not lit. In fact, the entire resort was not very well lit at all. I’m all for ambiance but I would still like to see where I’m going. During my reservation process there was no mention of the fee for parking, which adds $25 a night. I would have rather paid a little more for the room ($10 at most) then be charged for parking. San Diego is a place where vacationers have cars. That being said, pretty much everyone will be paying for parking. Separating it out is only beneficial to a small portion of guests. When we went to park our car in our “assigned” parking spot, there was already a car parked there! In addition, the $150 a night for incidentals was a lot. The receptionist had to reduce the amount by $100 as the total amount was higher than my credit card’s limit. The room was lacking in some conveniences. A coffee maker would have been nice. There was a coffee “cart” on the other side of the resort. I am sure I’m not the only person that does not want to have to get dressed to drink my morning coffee. The first morning I tried ordering coffee through room service. There was a fee for “delivery“ AND fee for “room service”, as well as a 20% auto-gratis that the attendant told me was pooled so I gave him an extra tip. This brought my total for coffee and 3 small pastries to almost $40. I ended up buying coffee and a coffee maker at a local CVS. I also bought myself a mug at the store, which room service took when they cleaned the room the next morning. I called the front desk to let them know but it was never returned. A pair of sweatpants that I had bought for the trip was also taken. The room was nicely decorated however I would not consider the room all that comfortable. The mattresses were lumpy and one bed had a cheap blanket while the other had a down comforter. Of course I was the unlucky one who picked the bed with the cheap blanket. The heating/cooling system only seemed to operate on hot or cold (no in between). There was hardly any pressure in the shower, even with the adjustable head. These things were aggravating however the problem I found the most frustrating was that there were ants EVERYWHERE. They were in the bathroom, under the bed and worst of all in the bed. I woke up with ant bites all over me, even after they came to spray twice. Honestly I think they should have either moved our room or compensated us somehow. The last night we were there we went to have drinks by the pool. Apparently the pool bar closed before the sun even set. We used the phone near the pool to order drinks through room service. It took almost 2 hours for 2 drinks to come. Everybody by the pool was ordering drinks through room service so I’m not sure why the bar was not staffed later. There were several amenities such as WiFi and a Fitness center however all were a significant additional price. The restaurants were decent but not great. If I am paying $70 for breakfast, it better be more than decent. Overall I would say I was disappointed. I would have rather stayed at any number of chain motels that has comfy beds, free parking and coffee in the room. I would have saved money and been more comfortable. My experience left me wondering exactly what makes a resort 4-star? I looked it up and the rating is somewhat subjective, however Paradise Point did not even come close to meeting the 4 star rating standards. Perhaps they have not been reviewed in a while? Maybe they were tipped off to who the reviewer was? Or maybe... they give service according to how much one pays for their room? The hotel emailed me and asked for a review and when I sent it to them, I never heard back.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point is my mini heaven!”
Reviews.Author: gusbeever
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to San Diego. A friend made the brilliant recommendation of Paradise Point. This is not your typical hotel stay. It's more like having your own little house, with your own little beach, in your own little world. The landscaping is beautifully upheld, all the pools are heated, and the staff would even wave (and smile) when we drove through the resort! The rooms have everything you need (fridge, fireplace, flat screen tv) but you will probably find yourself outside, sitting in the two wooden, white chairs placed in your little backyard area, staring at the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely setting for a vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: jer1275
Reviews.Content: The layout of the room was wonderful. We stayed in a bayside bungalow and were able to take advantage of the refrigerator and microwave. We liked the two dressing areas on either side of the bathroom. The room was comfortable and felt just like home. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - My new favorite place in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: sdionjones
Reviews.Content: This is not your ordinary hotel room. The bungalow-style rooms feel more private and exclusive and homey than any hotel room I've ever been in before. We stayed at Paradise Point in November and had a gorgeous room with double doors facing the bay. The bed was super comfortable, the bathroom jacuzzi tub/shower enormous, and the fireplace in the room a giant plus. The grounds of Paradise Point are to die for. I honestly plan to stay here for any future visit to San Diego - I can't imagine a better vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family reunion.”
Reviews.Author: Kin_travel
Reviews.Content: It felt like going into a lush Polynesian paradise as we drove into the resort. Most of the rooms/bungalows were right on the beach and had been recently renovated. The reservations staff were able to give us rooms for 50 people reasonably close together. The entire staff was wonderful. Everyone was happy with the beach, swimming pool, spa, tennis courts and great location. It was so easy to get to the airport and most major San Diego attractions within 20 minutes or less. We'll definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Family Reunions/Groups!”
Reviews.Author: cheryl5418
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a family reunion at Paradise Point. A nice set up for family reunions or group meetings. Lots of connecting rooms and a variety of things to do. Also this is a good place if you're interested in Sea World, San Diego Zoo, Legoland, etc. If you're looking for a warm beach vacation, this is not the place. The beach isn't that great for sunning/swimming. The sand is gross and nobody swims in the bay -- the water is nasty. The bay is good for kayaking and sailing though. The resort has been recently remodeled so the rooms were nice. They all had a mini-fridge. There are fire pits out on the beach for campfires. Be sure to hit a grocery store for wood, s'mores, booze, water/soda, snacks and breakfast . The restaurant on the property was good, although it lacks ambiance indoors. The pools are heated, remodeled and most had hot tubs. There are bike rentals and put -put golf. It gets really cold at night - bring warm clothes!! Email me any questions.

Reviews.Title: “nice place but needs more attention to details”
Reviews.Author: nkf00
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the hotel for 2 nights because it was very close to Sea World. the location is great and it gives the feeling of being in an exotic place on a secluded island.The Front Desk are very nice and helpful. we were helped by a very nice lady, her name was Tobay I think. the parking is expensive ($ 25 a night). Our room is on a ponf, close to the beach but not directly on it.the room is nice, but it has low ceiling, I dont know why they opted for that, but low ceilings bothers me a lot. the interior is nice. The floor is like stone in a shape of hardwood so it is perfect for the summers but it is cold for winter..I wish they had slippers waiting for us, something that I would expect in a luxurious resort. the powder area is nice but the toilet/tub area is very mediocre, and the shampoo/conditioner/shower gel is low quality.our room was not clean when we checked in, had some food stains on the table and the shower had hairs..which was pretty disgusting for us. I cleaned the table and sprayed the shower myself..we were very tired and didnt feel like leaving the room so that housekeeping clean. I was very disappointed in that, I mean how can you expect this from a luxury resort. In addition, the coffee supplies were not complete and there was no tea provided in the room as an option. we asked for a pack n play, it was delivered with a sheet that has a huge stain..again, not up to my expectations...I suggest that they have some sort of a housekeeping supervisor that inspects the room after cleaning.We ate at the barefoot grill, the menu is limited and most of the items had pork in them. it was average, expensive and the portions are small, but the ambiance is very nice. our room overlooked the pond, but we wish the doors had screens, it is impossible to leave the door open if you have toddlers (dangerous), but we felt some mosquito around at night. we walked at night around, it is very nice and we saw bonfires on the beach..very nice environment, but it needs a lot of attention to details to ask for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Three star at mostu”
Reviews.Author: Broncopea
Reviews.Content: Good location, service, and nice grounds. Too dark at night. Uncomfortable bed. Room not clean. Room service and bar food terrible. Chocolate cake was dry muffin split in half with fake whipped cream. Maids took no trash including empty cans and room service tray. Rooms are cinderblock and clammy. Wouldnt complain if not touted as upscale resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and scenary”
Reviews.Author: ssmurphree
Reviews.Content: This resort is located in a stunning part of Mission Bay. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. We also liked the location which was convienent to the airport, downtown and the beaches. The rooms are located in 3 - 4 unit clusters scattered around the resort. They has some updated features like flat tv's, granite bathrooms and nice beds and bedding. The basic structure, however, was pretty dated. It appeared to be a '60s vintage and the couch felt like it had been there 50 years. The room also had a rather moldy smell - we couldn't tell if it had just been not used in a while or actually had a problem. The a/c was also ancient although you probably don't need to use it much with the beautiful weather. We ate several times at the casual restaurant overlooking the bay. THe food was actually much better than I expected from a place that really had a capative audience. Al in all, we had a very nice time and the hotel staff was great. With a major room refurbishment, this could be a world class resort. As it is, Paradise Point is a very nice place with a few things you must overlook.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, great location, and fun for all”
Reviews.Author: hejee
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a wonderful stay at the Paradise Point. Originally went for business and took the family but turned out to be a fun and relaxing trip for the whole family. We chose a one bedroom bungalow with king bed and sofa sleeper right by Paradise Cove (got a great deal). The spacious room was nicely renovated and had a mini kitchenette. We were just steps away from the sandy beach which the kids loved. We spent part of the day at Sea World which is within walking distance (but we opted for the short 2 minute drive since we have a little one), and then spent the rest of the day just playing in the sun and sand. At night, there are fire pits to keep warm and for making smores. The rest of the hotel has a lot to offer and service was excellent all around. There are several pools, two restaurants (ate at Barefoot which was excellent), miniature golf, bicycle/mini carriage/boat rentals, and more. Unfortunately, we didn't have time to explore a lot of the hotel since we only stayed three nights and the kids wanted to go to Sea World for two of the three days. We could have easily stayed at the hotel the whole time and enjoyed every minute. The only negative I can say is the high parking charge ($25 nightly), the beds were on the hard side, and the sofa sleeper was not comfortable at all but when are they ever comfortable. We will definitely go back and hope to stay longer to fully enjoy all that this place has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful , can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: kraziek234
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a business/leisure trip and I must say the resort is gorgeous. The service is fantastic and I can't wait to go back. My only complaints are 1) No real dresser to unpack your belonings. 2) the rooms are not very sound proof, it literally sounded like the other guests were in the room with us that's how thin the walls are. Overall everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: anaohlandt
Reviews.Content: Going to Paradise Point at the prices we found online, we expected mainly adults, Quiet/peacefulness. Online some of the place we found are advertising this place for over $400 a night! We drove in expecting a pretty high end resort for that price. We were quite upset we still had to pay $50/day for parking and the food there was quite expensive and the quality just wasn't that great. Needless to say we expected more. Having to still pay for internet access seemed pretty frugal for the price too. I happened to need my eyebrows waxed so I figured the spa there would be a great place to get it done. Needless to say I ended up getting my money back because the beautician waxed off half my eyebrow. I wish I was joking. Needless to say the $30 wax wasn't worth it. Oh and gratuity is automatically added to whatever you get at the spa. You don't have a choice. The resort isn't very easy to get around either, lots of one way streets and confusing turns. Just look at the map. Our room was nice, not super clean though. The set up in our room was very awkward too. Our bed faced windows and the T.V. was on the left wall. Therefore, we had to lay in bed or sit on the couch and look over our shoulder to watch T.V. The bathroom was beautiful, until you got to the toilet/shower part. Marble around the sinks and then the toilet/tub was super small and awkward to say the least. Definitely expected more from first walking in the bathroom. The windows in our bedroom were also well covered, but our room had two doors each which led outside. The doors had curtains, but didn't cover any of the edges. And both doors were by the bathroom or closet, where you had to walk past. It was definitely awkward to know someone could be walking past and could see you. We also had to report our shower head when we got there because it was spurting water out of the pipe instead of the head. They close the 'Adult' pool at 10pm, which is a little ridiculous for any hotel I think. Never experienced it closing that early at any hotel we've been to. Overall, we expected more. That is what my husband and I both walked away feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Family Retreat can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Toothfairy1977
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort for 2 nights but wished we could have stayed longer. The grounds reminded us of being back In Hawaii with lots of palm trees and flowers everywhere and very clean. We were able to checkin earlier than their posted 3pm which was nice as we could enjoy the afternoon by the pool. The staff were always very friendly and accomodating to our needs with a 10mth old! We were staying In one of their lanai patio rooms which was newly refurbished, quite large and close to one of their 6 pools! We only tried one of their 2 restaurants and liked the atmosphere on the patio more than the menu but still worth It. The resort Is a definate must stay but beware of the $25 parking fee per day which we felt was a little steep considering the room costs to stay here. Would definately return though for a little longer next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly A Paradise”
Reviews.Author: dhamlin
Reviews.Content: This was a very relaxing four day getaway that I planned online and after reviewing the web site I thought this would make a great mini vacation. It was more than we expected. From the minute we got there until the last goodbyes it was a stay I will share with family and friends and we are already planning on going back. We only wish we had more time to take in all there was to offer. We ate the The Barefoot Bar and The Baleen's Restaurant and the food and staff were excellent. I especially wanted to thank Marc and Chad for escorting us around the grounds. We woke up several mornings to ducks greeting us at the door and the native birds and landscaping were over the top. Thanks again for a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ItsMelanie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were first time visitors to San Diego, and it definitely won't be the last. We were a little nervous about booking this hotel based on the reviews. But, we took the chance, and it really did pay off. The grounds are immaculate. Our room had been renovated within the last 6 months. It was spacious, clean, and very comfortable. The pools were lovely. The Bare Foot Bar and Grill was a pleasure. The employees were wonderful. The bellman took his time with us, and gave us plenty of suggestions of places to go and things to do. The young lady at the front desk made sure our room was ready within half an hour, even though we were there 3 hours before check in. I'm a New Yorker through and through and would never have thought there would be another place on Earth that I'd be willing to live. But, San Diego is extremely alluring. The city is beautiful, clean, and has tons of restaurants, I never felt overcrowded, or rushed. Between the dog friendly Balboa Park with all it's museums, the incredible San Diego Zoo, Hip Pacific Bay, the mountains in the distance, and the very chilly but beautiful Pacific, give me seven more years, and I may be looking for a transfer.

Reviews.Title: “Charming family resort!”
Reviews.Author: hheerlein
Reviews.Content: The property is tropical & eclectic. The service was great & we had a blast at the Barefoot Bar! The property is older & the rooms could have been cleaner, but overall we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great Fall value on Travelocity”
Reviews.Author: foodrie
Reviews.Content: This was a great place for the cost. It is sort of isolated, but that is part of the charm. We had a basic room, but we had access to all of the pools and baysides. The resort restaurants sort of have you as a captive, it is difficult to walk to any other places to eat. Their restaurants were right on the bay and have a great atmosphere, but they were sort of pricey and the food was just fair. The gift shop was also a very pricey place to have to buy your snacks. Parking is expensive and the fitness center wasn't free to guests. The rental of boats and water equipment was very convenient. All of the staff was very friendly. Overall we were very happy with our stay, but it wasn't without some cost.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic family vacaton spot”
Reviews.Author: Alexaknowsbest
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion and stayed at the Paradise Point Resort in San Deigo and were pleasantly surprised by the activities availalbe for children. While the resort is now a bit dated we spent hours walking along the beach collecting sea shells, swimming in the shallow sand bottom pool and watching the fish and sharks in the reef pool. Overall a very good value and as my mom stated it feels like you are in Hawaii for a third of the price. She plans to go back with her sister in Feb 2011 so escape the snow in winter.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Wedding Weekend Exceeds Every Expectation”
Reviews.Author: kaacord
Reviews.Content: The incredible staff at this lush, lovely hotel provided for our every need with grace and charm. Their professional attention to every detail is truly noteworthy. The wonderful creations from their kitchen set a new standard for banquets. Can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great home base for a family vaction”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelfoodwine
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful family vacation to San Diego. The resort is a quick drive to the airport and easy access to all beaches, attractions and interstates to get anywhere you want to go. The location on a separate island makes it a quiet place away from traffic. We avoided the crazy parking fee and charge for a roll away simply by asking. We stayed in a garden suite and watched the internet for rates and booked directly through the hotel. As others have mentioned this is a nice place, but it is not a five star resort, so make sure you don't pay full price. We had a double vanity, a comfortable king bed, nice fold out couch, sitting area, dressing room and a patio. The "kitchenette" was hidden off to the side with a counter in with a small fridge, microwave and coffeemaker. The bedding and towels were of high quality. The pools were great, the morning coffee/muffins/fruit available in the lobby was nice too. The kids loved all the plants, fountains, birds and climbing the observation tower. We didn't golf or play tennis and we went to Coronado island to use the beach. Seaworld is essentially next door. Old Town is 5-10 minutes. LaJolla is a 25 minute drive, Legoland is less than an hour - but we drove the highway and made stops. We ate at Baleen one night and the food was beautifully presented and quite good. We had lots of privacy and it was so much nicer than staying in a large hotel surrounded by other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “If the weather was better...........”
Reviews.Author: pepi4health
Reviews.Content: Have been to this resort twice in the past (across from Sea World) so when I saw it on skyauction.com I tried for it and WON! Stayed for 2 nights & 3 days. The grounds are just gorgeous; it's like a mini Hawaiian island. If only the weather was nicer it would have been perfect, but it was rainy, foggy and overcast. We had a Bayside Lanai room so you just walk out your door to a beach on the bay. Lot of good that did us this time! We had dinner at the Barefoot Grill & Bar which was yummy and satisfying. We have friends in San Diego so we got together with them & had a good time and our highlight was getting to see our son who had driven down from Eureka, Ca. for a friend's wedding. The room had a mini-fridge (no microwave) that made a noise & we had to unplug it at night to get to sleep but we brought a cooler so that worked out. Also they charge $25.00 per night fee for parking but I had read another review where someone asked for a reduction, so I did too & they reduced it to $12.00 per night. Hopefully next time will be better weather!

Reviews.Title: “Own private beach!”
Reviews.Author: paulie13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of our recent honeymoon. On mentioning this, we were upgraded to accommodation with our own section of private beach. Fantastic! Staff were very friendly. Not a single cleaner passed us by without saying hello. Breakfast was beautiful and dinner in the Baleen was out of this world. We liked it so much we stayed an extra night! Perfect location for a honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “JUST NOT WORTH IT!”
Reviews.Author: 31230Betty
Reviews.Content: oK, too much $ for what you get which is: rough towels, no phone book, or paper or pen. $25/day to park, come on now! You have to PAY for internet . ONE soap. I do not like shower gel. NO blankets, except a light one on the bed. But great location and as they say location, location, location! And at least they did not charge for tennis.

Reviews.Title: “A World Apart! Luxurious Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: HappyResorter
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest resort we've stayed at in any city. The desk clerk suggested a room we'd like, and she was right!!
