It had to have been an upgrade from what we paid for, but the bill did not reflect that. The design of the resort made you think you were on a tropical isle - and indeed it was an island. You could walk along the foliage lined paths and enjoy the wildlife in the lagoons and trees or walk on the sandy beach and enjoy watching the sailboats. We were also able to walk along sidewalks across the bridge to restaurants and stores in Crown Point. (We found the restaurant good but expensive.) We could have continued to Pacific Beach if desired. Comfy bed with perfect pillows. The room was inviting and clean with a back patio to view the bay. Lots to do -we didn't have time for it all. We mostly enjoyed a pool & hot tub reserved for adults. (There were 3 or 4 more pools for families.) The staff were very helpful and pleasant and made us feel that we were valued guests. The only drawback were the thin walls. Our 2 room bungalow had a rather loud voiced lady in the next room the first night. We could clearly hear through the walls. Outdoor partiers were annoying another night. Other nights were quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: karinw9912
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 2 year old son on a 5 night/6 day trip to San Diego and wanted to stay close to the water so we booked a stay at Paradise Point. We paid $500 a night for "Bayside Bungalow." When we were taken to our room by one of the staff, we were told that the resort had recently been updated. If that is the case, I would hate to see what it looked like before. Here is our pro/con list and keep in mind the cost per night when reading the list. Pros: -Very good food. We ate several meals (including all of our breakfasts) at the resort. Everything was very good. -Helpful, courteous staff. Everyone was very nice and they went out of their way to give us excellent restaurant recommendations. -Location next to the bay with easy access to sand and water. This is helpful when you are traveling with a small child, especially one who likes to play in sand! Cons: -Poor quality physical environment. For the price we paid, we were VERY disappointed with what we got. It simply looked like they redecorated rather than refurbished these rooms. We have stayed in far nicer hotels for about half the price. Even our honeymoon at a luxury resort in Anguilla was cheaper and far superior to this one. -Poor quality amenities. Towels were hard and uncomfortable. Not many extras in the room. No notepad and pen. No lotion/mouthwash. One phone. These things don't sound like much but when you pay that much money, they had better be in the room. Even the Days Inn has a notepad in it. -Paper thin walls. We could hear the baby crying next door to us (as I'm sure they heard our son crying as well). Wasn't expecting an exclusive Bayside Bungalow to be connected to another one (perhaps this was my own fault). -Everything was extra. I know this is common for resorts, but parking was $25 per night. The gym was $12 per visit (hence we didn't workout) and internet access was $12.95 for 24 hours (also didn't use it). -Location is not the best. It wasn't bad and not hard to drive downtown but there is not much going on immediately outside of the resort. If we were to do it again, I would have either stayed in La Jolla or at a hotel downtown. Don't waste your hard earned money here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting but needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Jjrd67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a nice setting spread out over quite a huge piece of property. There are pools around each cluster of rooms as well although the main pool was a hike from our room but worth the walk. The lagoon area by the main pool was in disrepair but had potential. The outside of the rooms were not very inviting which made us nervous at first. However, the interior of the rooms have had a facelift (new pillows, furniture, etc.). The bathrooms needed more work - lighting, ventilation, tile. The front desk staff was very pleasant and service & food at the restaurant was fine. Also, the gift shop was quite extensive and was run by a very efficient and friendly manager. There was a neat coffee cart with yummy muffins and drinks each morning. We were traveling with our 10 year old daughter and 7 year old son so the proximity to Sea World was nice. The Zoo and Airport weren't far either. Our kids loved the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location BUT.....”
Reviews.Author: scatmanHawaii
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 day stay at Paradise Point and here is my plus and minus review. Plus side Great location, Easy driving distance from the airport, Sea World, Old Town San Diego (great restaurants in Old Town), parks etc. The resort feels very lush with many pools to choose from, and the fire pits are a nice touch. Staff was helpful with directions and at check-in. (your on your own getting to your room) The Negatives: Stayed in room 158, the beds are the worst I've ever slept on. The beds in the room need to be replaced, they are saggy, and every time you moved the springs creaked like a cheap motel 6 bed. (Wife and I had the worst sleep ever on a bed here) As mentioned from a previous reader, resort is quite large and when we checked in, we got a map and basically had to fend for yourself to find the room. It was kinda funny watching people wander around looking for their room especially at night when its dark at the resort. Not cool. Their high end restaurant (Baleen) is way over priced and average food. Wife ordered the steak and I had the halibut dish. Both were very salty. This is to bad since the location is lovely and the waiter was nice. Their other restaurant (Barefoot) has okay, breakfast food nothing special, their dinner wasn't great. Again nice location. The waiter/waitresses were average Paying $25.00 per day for parking and $9.95 per day for slow internet is ridiculous. Isn't the rooms expensive enough?? My one major recommendation if you stay in their garden view rooms is request a room that isn't facing the road around the resort. Ask for the rooms that you have to park and walk around the building,they are facing the ponds, grass etc. They are a lot quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort and conference facility”
Reviews.Author: LukesDad
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 4 nights at this resort for a conference. It was very comfortable and had excellent facilities for the conference. The rooms were small separate huts that were actually very nicely decorated and comfortable. My room faced the bay, had a fireplace, and a very comfortable bed. The staff were friendly, for the most part, and helpful. Although there were only 2 restaurants, the conference food was some of the best food I have had at a conference. There were a few negatives - at night the resort was dark and slightly scary (take a flashlight). The rooms were hard to find and the layout of the resort is a bit confusing (a map was given at check in, but I did not always carry it). Better directional signs would be helpful. There were a few other minor concerns with the room, such as the TV reception was poor and my double doors to the patio had a dense haze throughout the windows decreasing the beautiful view. Otherwise, the resort and the room was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, lush, and tropical!”
Reviews.Author: calimama902
Reviews.Content: This resort was amazing. We live in San Diego and actually felt like we were away on vacation on an island! Its very lush, and tropical. Has many awesome pools with sandy bottoms. Great resturants. Theres a fancier one which I heard great reviews about, but we went to the more casual one. It was right on the bay, outside seating, very cool! I'd definately recommend it, can't wait to go back myelf!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: skisy
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location! However it was oversold the day we arrived and they asked us to be bumped to a 2 star next door! The nice thing is you get your own bungalow with a tiny patio. Needs updating but the restaurant the nice one on the water was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: MRocha19
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to sea world, great for small kids with a fun pool, beach area. about a mile from the park, you could walk there..

Reviews.Title: “Pretending to be Something it is not.”
Reviews.Author: ExprncdTrvler3333
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend during September after finding a good deal on some of the "Garden Lanai Suites" for under $150 (supposedly retailed at $300+). From my understanding this hotel has recently been taken over by a new company which has begun/ already completed some major renovating. The grounds are pretty and very well manicured (reminded me of Hawaii) and the hotel is unique because it sits on its own island right in mission bay. The location is good if you're looking for a relaxing , resort-like feel, and want to be close to the beach. Although I would not advise you swim in the bay, it is very close to the Pacific side beaches and other San Diego attractions. There are tons of pools and water activities The hotel's unique setting is about the only thing I found charming about this place. The rooms LOOK nice but a closer look would reveal that it is a small facelift on a VERY old hotel. The rooms all seemed to be a good size and have neat outdoor lounge areas (some with great views). However the beds are not very comfortable and the bathrooms still seem to have the "original" hardware. I would guess the original hotel must have been built in the 60's-70's and it shows. Many of the exterior buildings, pools and facilities show hints of their age which just made it feel.....old. The service seemed to be average. Nothing above and beyond. We did eat at the more upscale restaurant between the few that are on the property and it was a very good dinner but it was a bit on the pricey side. A lot of nickel and dime-ing (25$/ day to park!!! = ridiculous) Basically, I feel like this hotel is pretending to be something it is not. I give it credit for trying to be some sort of 5-Star resort, but unfortunately the pools, rooms, structures, design, service etc. just are more of a 3-Star which makes the room pricing a bit ridiculous. I would NEVER stay at this hotel if the rooms were anymore than $150/night (for the more standard rooms anyway). Overall we had an enjoyable average stay. Good for just a weekend trip. I have stayed at MANY 4-5 Star hotels and this just is not one of them. For the prices they command I would really look into staying other places. Just don't expect OR pay 5-star because you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Like being on your own island”
Reviews.Author: Brnidgrl1961
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place to stay, with beautiful well kept grounds. Beautiful trees, shrubs & flowers, birds everywhere. Kind of like being on your own island! There were 5 pools to choose from and they seemed to be all kept up well. A few of them even had fire pits and tiki torches lit at night. Concierge's were very nice and helpful, especially Elizabeth who seemed to go out of her way to make us happy! We told her that my husband and I were there to celebrate our 30th anniversary and she had a bottle of wine sent to our room! Thanks again Elizabeth! The restaurants were all good, especially the Baleen, although spendy but so worth it. One thing we didn't like about this place was how far we had to walk to get anywhere. We did see a lot of other people getting rides from the hotel staff on golf carts, but we didn't know how to go about doing that and never asked or were told, so we just walked. At least we got our exercise! If you stay there, and don't have your own car or rental car (we opted not to since we were told there was a $25 per night parking fee), you do have to pay dearly for taxi's or the trolley. We liked the trolley and took that 3 times during our weeks stay. It took you to many places around San Diego (Little Italy, Gas Light District, Old Town, Balboa Park/Zoo, Midway Museum, Coronado Island) and you could get off and on as many times as you wanted providing you got back on at a certain time and it would take you back to your hotel. There was just one thing that made us kind of mad is that there were no phone books in the room, and when we called and asked for one they said they didn't have any. We feel that the reason for this was so you didn't call for food delivery from somewhere else, but we called googles free 800 # and got Pizza Hut delivery one night anyway! We also feel that the outside of the rooms/bungalows were kind of neglected. The air conditioner next to the entry door to our room had spots/dirt all over it and made the place look pretty dumpy from the outside for how nice the rooms were on the inside.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: travlspleasure
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews on this and other pages and had some reservations about staying here on our trip to San Diego. I finally decided to go anyway and see for myself. We arrived on a Friday and had no problems checking in. The staff was very attentive and helpful. I joked when I went in about the parking fee and asked if they would reduce the price and they did. The room was very nicely done and the grounds were great. This is an older established resort so don't expect everything to be perfect or completely pristine. Go into it with an open mind. It is a little pricey for the quality of room, but I found the grounds and location more than offset for the difference. The dinner we had at the restaurant was second to none. Great service and excellent cuisine. The full course special they had along with one entree was more than enough for two, and they have specials on bottles of wind daily. Look for specials and discounts on the rooms from travel dealers online. For me and my wife we able to spend three days there for around $600 dollars along with spa treatments. The location is easily accessible via the highway and we had no problem using the area. We will go again and next time we will take our two kids. They have lots of pools and jacuzzi along with adult only pool areas. After staying once we have been offered up to 20% discounts on return trips. They do have coffee makers in the room along with small refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Love this resort!”
Reviews.Author: jdsmithphx101
Reviews.Content: We went on Labor Day weekend for our anniversary and it was beautiful! We loved our room, the staff and the bar! It was a crazy weekend but not at the resort, very private place! We visited the zoo and the seals at La Jolla and could not have asked for a better place to stay! The bar had live music and a very friendly staff. The room was very clean and we got everything we wanted from the housekeeper, she was so great! We walked the grounds every night and stopped by the firepits at the pools, very romantic! We have stayed at many resorts but this one we will call our home in San Diego! Thank you friends for making our anniversary so nice!

Reviews.Title: “Total Aloha Pow Wow”
Reviews.Author: alohagidget
Reviews.Content: We used Paradise Point as a back drop to a corporate meeting that was long over due. We rented a bungalow right on the bay to host our group of 6 young hip entrepernuers/ surfers. From the minute you drive onto the island we were instantly infused with NATURE - and the sense of balance and serenity that veils the property. We didn't have to go wait in lines at an airport, or get on a 5 hour flight to Hawaii or Mexico we just drove down from our local towns Los Angeles, Orange County, Del Mar, Salina Beach and Encinitas for our backyard staycation/retreat. The convienence of fire pits steps from the front door of the bungalow just added all the more ambiance to our stay we even enjoyed a pow wow with S'Mores. Final Review Highly recommend, Family, corporations, just a quick retreat - can't wait to bring the family back.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Treatment!”
Reviews.Author: TemeculaTroy
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paradise Point Resort & Spa's fine dining restaurant, Baleen three times this year for special occasions and have been treated like royalty. The food and service are terrific. Thank you for making our special occasions really special.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: santorinibaby
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to the resort and we loved it. We traveled with our 2 small children who had a blast. Everything was perfect from the minute we arrived. We were greeted by extremely professional staff that knew our name and knew our children’s names, which made us feel extra special. We had a beautiful bungalow on the bay, which I would highly recommend. The bungalow was beautifully furnished and decorated. The bed and bedding were very high quality and extremely comfortable. The living room looked onto a beautiful seculded beach and right onto the bay, it was breathtaking and so peaceful. They had 2 low back chairs on the patio, perfect for enjoying a glass of wine and watching the beautiful sunset while the kids play safely and within eyes view at the water’s edge. The resort had numerous pools, which the kids loved, and we enjoyed the restaurant on the premises, they had live music and was a very busy and buzy hangout. We enjoyed beautiful walks on the beach; you can rent boats, jet skis, kayaks etc. Outside each bungalow are large fire pits, where at night you can enjoy toasting S’mores, which we did every night. They had a great gift shop at the resort and sold amazing S’mores kits. They also have mini golf courses and bike rentals. On our last day we were supposed to leave really early to go to Lego land but we couldn’t tear ourselves away, it was just so relaxing. We will be booking to go back next year and will make this our annual family get away! Loved it, Love it!!! The Orr Family Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “World's best employee!"”
Reviews.Author: billophoto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paradise Point last weekend for the 2010 Bayfair Airguard Championship Unlimited Hydroplane Race. Because I was on an extremely tight time frame, I needed help leaving Sunday after the race. I called the concierge, Elizabeth Markling. She made certain that my airline boarding passes were printed accurately as there was some misinformation from Alaska Airlines. Elizabeth handled this, going the extra mile to double check the tickets. I needed a cab waiting for me at 4:45 and it rolled up right at 4:45! She also made sure that I knew which terminal the commuter airline used, so I wouldn't miss my flight. During the entire process, Elizabeth was courteous and was concerned that my Paradise Point experience would be great! Thanks to her dedication, the experience was wonderful. That's why I refer to her as the "World's Best Employee!"

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: mattjab
Reviews.Content: As newly weds, my wife and I traveled to San Diego for our honeymoon.  My father booked us reservations at Paradise Point Resort.  Upon arrival, the resort grounds were amazing.  Lucious greenery surrounded the private bungalo type rooms.  It was fantastic.  During our stay, the staff at Paradise Point was exceptional.  The consigiere service was tremendous.  They assisted us in getting spectacular Padres tickets, as well as setting up rental cars on two separate occasions.  Specifically, Elizabeth Markling made our trip one for the recordbooks.  On our second to last night at the resort, we decided late in the evening that we would need a rental car for the next day.  We called the consigere desk, and spoke with Elizabeth.  This was after 5pm, and we had even requested a convertible to drive up the coast on our last day.  Somehow, Elizabeth made this happen, and she called us that evening to let us know it was done, and ready for us the following day.  After our trip up the coast, my wife and I had an early flight back home the next day, and left for the airport around 5am.  Upon arrival at the airport, I realized that I had forgotten my sunglasses in the rental car.  I called the resort before we boarded the plane, and spoke to Elizabeth again.  She went to the rent car, and when we arrived back home, I had a message from Elizabeth letting me know that she located my glasses, and was shipping them to me.  She explained that she had a similar experience, and that she would be more than happy to send these back to me on her own dime, not at the expense of the resort.  Sure enough the sunglasses arrived in Texas a few days later, and Elizabeth even called to ensure that they got here safely.  Needless to say, these are things you never forget, and one of the brightest points to Paradise Point, would be Elizabeth Markling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...could improve some small things!”
Reviews.Author: stronger123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days and liked the place. This resort definitely had a tropical feel to it, the property is huge and lush with lots of trees and plants, lagoons, pools etc. It was very confusing to get around though, I always got lost-I guess you could request a golf-cart ride to your room from the main lobby-if you find the main lobby that is! Propert appeared fairly clean and well-maintained. It was very nice to walk around the property especially around the private paradise cove in the evenings. The rooms are all bungalow style and our room had a walking access to the shore which was nice! Parking is quite expensive but right next to the room. Also, there is hardly any grocery store etc. within walking distance to this place. This resort is right next to sea world. Now the room itself: we got a newer room. It was one long room with a couch, flat screen TV, a king bed, a small closet space with a safe, a coffee machine and a bathroom area. The door and the adjoining wall was made of glass and covered with white curtains-no separate windows. The curtains look nice but did not offer complete darkness during the day. They also did not close well enough for complete privacy-especially the one on the door-it kept pinching on one side. The bed was comfy but oddly placed at a slight angle to the TV. The lamps next to the bed never worked. Internet was $10/day-needed IT help to set it up. The service was good most of the time except for the last day when the housekeeping did not come all day long (8-4PM even with "service please sign on") and then when I was back in the room at 4PM, trying to take a nap, they called and said that it could only be done in the next hour as the maids leave at 5. But they had extra towels, so it was no big deal. Also, if they could add a small bottle of lotion and a small vanity pack (q-tips, cotton etc.) in the bathroom, it would be quite helpful! The restaurants-baleen and barefoot grill were good. The tropics bar and the island markert coffee cart remained closed all days. They also offer golf, tennis, water sport activities and have a big spa which I did not try. They charged extra for the fitness center. The conference rooms were super-nice for our meetings. Overall, nice hotel, could improve some things mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “The most OUTSTANDING people and service!!!”
Reviews.Author: blosserl
Reviews.Content: This is a place I will always come back to. While San Diego is a place of dozens of perfect locations you can never really find THE one because it depends on what you want to be close to. I have opted to stay where I am treated the very best! From Check-in, shopping their lovely store, enjoying a blissful treatment at the spa, you are treated with professional focus and interest, and of course a smile that let's you know you are in Paradise. This will carry throughout your stay even with the minor details; such as a forgotten toothbrush, your desire for 'way too many feather pillows' (they would never point that out!), and dropping your purchases in your room to save you a trip. If they have not gotten to it first - all you have to is ask! I promise you, you will not be ignored or feel foolish. They will respond with such pleasure, as if they were silly not to have thought of it first! Try it and see for your self!!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: shyanuario
Reviews.Content: Great customer service from the Concierge to the Spa staft!! LOVE the Soa Staff!! Elizabeth in the Conceriege is very sweet!! Ron is great also!! Beautiful resort on the bay. Only ate from the Barefoot Grill, but EVERYING I ate was delicious!! Who would of thought of a vegetable panini using rosemary focaccia?? Since it was a birthday trip, I didn't use any restraint when it came to treating myself, but others may need to be aware, the resort is NOT inclusive. So, if you are on a budget, be wise when ordering and using services. Short distance to Mission Beach and area churches. Need a car to get around, but less than 1/2 an hour from Balboa Park and great museums, by taxi. Live in DC so used to FREE museums, once I got over having to pay, it was woth it. Not into the zoo, but the zoo is close too. I totally loved my birthday stay!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! An awesome family vacation - can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: timberrex
Reviews.Content: We are grandparents (ages 49 and 53), daughter and son-in-law (ages 31 and 34) and three children (ages 3, 6 and 9). Our stay was for three nights. We had two bayside bungalow rooms (adjoining.....may want to re-think that as the grandkids had "easy access" to grams and gramps at 6am! haha) that had "awe-mazing" views of the bay, were clean, quiet and beautifully decorated. Bed was comfortable and linens were crisp and clean. The kitchen and bathroom were great - good water pressure, plenty of storage and lots of towels. Our plan was not to have to leave the facility at all and to enjoy all the resort has to offer and we had great success! We rented tandem bikes, played the mini-golf course, went to the main pool several times and spent a lot of time on the bay's beach. The lagoon area was a huge hit with the kids, as they have hundreds of ducks and birds that the kids can feed (the cranes were amazing to see!). We rented two jet-skis one day and a large motor-boat another day so the entire family could experience Mission Bay together. SO much fun! The marina staff were knowledgeable and friendly, the vehicles were in great shape and the prices were reasonable. We ate at the Barefoot Bar & Grill three times and ate at the Tropics Poolside Grill once. The food was good and the prices were reasonable (there were 7 of us and the tabs ranged from $70-$100). The staff at each were very nice. We loved the fire-pits on the beach and had a fire going every each night. We made s'mores each night and cooked hot dogs one night. A GRANDPARENT'S DREAM: We hardly had the TV on at all during the trip and the kids never asked to play Nintendo DS or video games - there were SO many things to do, it was great! As for the bad online reviews that were somewhat scary to read before we left....... a few things: 1. The $25 parking fee. Your parking space is right by your room - super convienent. The fee prevents "non-resort" people from coming in, using the facility and clogging up the roads and the beach area. It was worth it and seems fair - would you want "Joe Blow" parking next to your room? No. 2. Ants, bugs, dirty floors and old rusty fixtures. This is a beautiful tropical, sandy beach setting - you can not help but track in some sand (the grandkids did a great job of that! haha - felt sorry for the housekeeper!). I saw one spider - the horror! (LOL) and a few ants...big deal. The room was recently re-modeled, so did not see any old rusty fixtures, but even if I did, c'mon this place was originaly built back in, what? The 1950s or something? They have done a great job keeping it current. 3. "Nickeled and Dimed". Not really! We paid $20 an hour for the tandem bikes, $8-10 for the mini golf, $95hr each for the jet-skis and $150hr for the large boat. ALL REASONABLE. The ONLY bad thing to say is that there were one or two lagoon areas that needed some TLC. We could understand why some people would not appreciate having their room facing them. It seems like they are upgrading the lagoons though, as the ones on the west side of the property looked great. We all had such a good time that we are thinking of coming back next Summer. The only thing wrong with our trip was that it ended all too quickly!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful location but not worth the price and only for families”
Reviews.Author: Nucita100
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on an "island" in Mission Bay Park and sourrounded by a lovely beach. In front of the bayside rooms lies a small grass area then the beach, water is cold and not very clean. The hotel is huge and caters mainly for families, not ideal for couples or singles that seek out a bit of privacy (nowhere to be found). Service and room equipment is not what you expect for over 300 US a night, excluding parking (another 25)! Rooms are redone and nice. Bathrooms, however, are still very old style and cramped, even though newly painted. For the rate they ask one would expect vanity mirror, drink glasses with minibar (empty), body lotion, corkscrew, more than 15 tv channels, free internet etc., but nothing is provided (internet costs). All in all, not worth the really steep price. Pity, because it is a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “This is no 4 star resort”
Reviews.Author: relaxfam
Reviews.Content: I had booked this resort 3 months prior to our stay. The entire family was looking forward to this vacation. The web page for the resort was breathtaking. It made it seem like we would be on a tropical island. As we drove up the drive way it seems tropical. But as we pulled up to the lobby there was no bell man to help with the luggage. That should have been the first clue that this was not a 4 star resort. I walked into the lobby while my husband waited in the car with our kids. The lobby was small and looked a little out dated (clue number two). The gentleman at the front desk told me that we would be charged $25.00 a night for parking, that we had not been told at the time of booking. And if I wanted to park for free that it would be a 15 minute walk outside of the resort grounds. Once we had been given our room number we got back into our car and headed out to find our room. As we drove around we noticed the flat roof style huts with one door but two room numbers. They don't show you this at all on the web page (clue number three). At this point we don't like what we saw but hoped that the inside of the room would make up for the exterior of the buildings. We open the door to our hut and notice two more doors. One to our room and that of another room in the small hallway that connected us, the foor was discustingly dirty. It looked like it hadn't been swept in weeks. Cobwebs all along the walls with dead bugs in them. Once we walked into our room the smell of mold over powered us!! The beds where new with nice headboards and a new flat screen TV, but that couldn't block the smell out. The shower head was rusted and half falling out. All along the tub we could see the mold, crack and rust. The tropical view from our room was one of a fence with dried out plants that gave us a view of the busy street outside the resort. I couldn't believe this was the same resort I had seen on the web. I felt robbed and cheated. Who rated this place more then 1-2 star was crazy. We were not in the room for more then 15 minutes when I called the front desk and asked for a full refund and checked out. This resort is fine if you expect a 2 star place. But if your looking for 4 star or above look elsewhere seriously!

Reviews.Title: “super fun!”
Reviews.Author: akLowe
Reviews.Content: it was really fun and i loved how it was right on the beach. my favorite was the four-wheeled-bike-things!

Reviews.Title: “Final Summer Blowout for the kids”
Reviews.Author: HummerDad
Reviews.Content: So I have written about this hotel before and had a nice time on our last visit, but this time we stayed for a week and WOW, they exceeded our expectations !!! We had a great room in Building 4, right on the beach and could not have asked for a better week of weather. The staff was extremely friendly, Housekeeping service was great, I read some peoples reviews of housekeeping and cleanliness If you are expecting a Ritz-Carlton, you are at the wrong place ... This is on the beach resort with years of history in Mission Bay, I work in the hotel industry and could stay other places for allot less, I stay here because the staff rocks, the rooms are great and the location is perfect !!! That said, The kids had a awesoem time, from swimming on the beach, to Miniature golf. to jet skis and lounging in the pool, this is the best place to be and stay in Mission beach area

Reviews.Title: “It's beautiful lush atmosphere made us feel we were back in Hawaii but without the airfare”
Reviews.Author: TeresaDulla
Reviews.Content: Truly enjoyed our stay at this resort. The staff was so friendly and helpful. I lost count how many times the landscapers would offer to take our photos and suggested areas for family shots as well. The Baleen was wonderful and staff was as well. The beach was clean and easy access to everything. We will absolutely return for another family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't feel like a resort”
Reviews.Author: scarr3
Reviews.Content: I went to Paradise Point for a few days to get away, but I should've heeded the reviews I read before booking. It was generally a nice place, but it's cut off from everything; there's nothing around. The place didn't seem like a resort but the prices were those of a resort. If you're looking for a quiet get away, this is NOT the place. It's packed with kids; all of the pools are loud and streaming with kids. There isn't much to do on the grounds of the hotel, and the beach that surrounds the hotel is on the bay; I went to the beaches on the ocean every day because they're MUCH nicer. But you have to drive. Parking costs $25/day, which is more than my local airport parking. All in all, I would call this an average hotel with nice rooms. It's not a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ellie2SanDiego
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned home from an 8 night stay at Paradise Point. We live in San Diego and have stayed in many hotels/resorts on Mission Bay within the past 2 years. This was our favorite. The hotel staff was exceedingly helpful and friendly (every single one of them). The room (a bayside 1 bedroom bungalow) was clean, roomy, stylish and very comfortable - with a gorgeous view of the bay and bridge. The property is expansive with many beautiful paths and lagoons to enjoy. The public parks that border the resort are equally lovely and offer endless places to just sit and relax and gaze at the bay. For half our stay we were joined by our extended family. All were as pleased as we were with their rooms (basic lanai and not on the bay) and with their experience as whole - including our 2 young grandchildren. It is pricey but no more so than other San Diego resorts. We booked 4 nights for the price of 3 (still available at the time of this review) and felt we got our money's worth (we stayed 8 nights for the price of 6). The restaurant (the least expensive of the two) was actually very well-priced for a resort; although the menu seemed somewhat limited. Reading some of the other reviews, I'm truly mystified. I can't imagine what more anyone would want from a resort, or a vacation. It was a perfectly wonderful experience from the first through the last day. We will be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected stay turned out well”
Reviews.Author: LPamelaA
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego overnight for a Seaworld weekend with our 3 year old daughter. We originally booked a room at the Doubletree based on good reviews and our budget. Upon trying to check into the Doubletree, they were sold out and sent us to Paradise Point, fully paid. While annoying to have to switch, at least we were getting a free hotel room for the night. We were pleasantly surprise by Paradise Point. It was much more of a unique experience than the Doubletree would have been. I thought the resort layout was cool with all the little winding streets and bungalow style hotel rooms. The room was furnished nicely and included a mini-fridge and microwave. Great for a family but we didn't really take advantage since we were there just one night. I will admit that the rooms have seen some wear-and-tear. It's the kind of place where you look around and think, "Gosh, this must have been really awesome right after it was built." We didn't get a chance to check out the pools or amenities other than having a Sunday brunch down by the water. There was a wait, of course, but our daughter was easily amused by playing near the water, in the grass, looking at sailboats, etc. Brunch was pricey, as to be expected, but we didn't mind the splurge since we got the room for free.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but not worth $300”
Reviews.Author: wicked51
Reviews.Content: Overall, the room was nice and clean. No problems as the other guests had experienced. Had to pay $25 for the parking. Decent room but was not worth the $300. Stayed at a Holiday Inn the night before and was almost as nice. The hotel charged an extra $10 per night for access to the Internet. Too many charges.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: happyKc
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a family vacation.The check in took about an hour,there were only two guests in front of us. The parking charge was $ 25 a night, there was plenty of parking around the resort.I don't know why they have to charge for parking. The garden lanai room was dirty. The pergo floors were extremely dirty. My socks were black on the bottom. The bathroom floors were dirty with dust and grime. The shower was dirty and the sink was cracked. There was cobwebs with spiders in the corner of the room.The a/c had dust and mold on it. Always had to ask for towels and tiolet paper daily because there was not enough. Tile was coming off the wall in the bathroom also too. The gardener was trimming trees at 8AM , Saturday, right outside of our patio room. Besides the low budget, dirty room , the grounds were beautiful and the pools were fun.We roasted s'mores at the fire pit at the pool every night. The kids enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced disappointment”
Reviews.Author: lawgalkc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paradise Point Resort & Spa from August 4th to August 9th for a vacation/conference. We stayed in a Lanai Garden Room, the cheapest room at the resort, for $310 a night after taxes, etc, which was the negotiated rate for the conference. We didn’t have to pay for parking, internet or the gym as they were included in this price. I found the internet speed to be VERY slow and am very happy I didn’t have to pay for it. Room: The room was nicely decorated but the bed was hard as a rock. The bathroom had paint peeling off the walls and the toilet was way too close to the door. I’m not sure why it was placed so close to the wall when there was plenty of room to in the bathroom to move it away from the wall. We had a small fridge in the room that wasn’t working when we arrived. We called to have it fixed and maintenance was there quick to fix it even though we called at 10:30 pm. View: Our view was supposed to be of the “Garden” however we had a view of vehicles who parked in front of our door or the building across the street. We asked about an upgrade and were told we could pay an additional $100 a night for a bigger “Garden” view, we decided to stay with the room we had. Location: They will tell you Sea World is a 10 minute walk, this is NOT true. It was more like a 30+ minute walk. It’s a $20+ cab ride to anywhere (Old Town, Downtown, Balboa Park, etc.). They don’t offer any shuttle services so a 6 day trip got expensive quick. Pools: There were multiple pools. The only ones we visited were the main pool (to eat at the diner) and the adult’s only pool. The main pool was very loud and crowded. The adult only was nice when there were no teenyboppers running around. There was no hotel staff there to enforce the adult only rule. Restaurants: There are 3 restaurants on site. Since everything else is so far away you pretty much have to eat there. We visited all 3 of the restaurants over our 6 day stay. They are all over priced with slow service. The food was descent but not worth the price they charged. We paid $15 for a burger and $13 for a salad (with no meat) on a regular basis. Spa: I did visit the spa one day to have massage. It was probably the best part of the resort. It was a little pricey, but not outrageous. I paid $210 for a 90 min hot stone massage (price includes 20% tip). If the price had been all inclusive it would have been worth it, but otherwise I would not recommend staying here unless you were paying closer to $150 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Ant problems in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: GypsyGirl21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights during the last week of July. We had planned to stay longer but after an issue with ants in 3 rooms over 2 nights, we had enough and checked out. Ants can happen anywhere but obviously there is a porblem at this "resort" since we were moved 3X and still no relief. On the first night with the ants, our room was sprayed and we were assured the problem was gone. Not true, so another spraying and we could barely breath upon entering the room, due to the overwhelming fumes from whatever was used to kill the ants. Far from Paradise. Overall, besides ants, we did not find rooms very clean - very dirty floors, previous guests towels hanging on the back of the door in the bathroom, housekeeping needs a wake up call. Will not be back and will not recommend. For the prices you pay here, pest free and cleanliness should be a given.

Reviews.Title: “An outrageously priced Motel 6 with a bad service- a total rip-off”
Reviews.Author: vacationlover101
Reviews.Content: We arrived there on a Friday afternoon this July 2010, excited to be staying at a high end resort. We had paid more than $750 per night for a room on the bay (after getting a group discount). We had two people in front of us in the check in line. It took us more 45 minutes to finally get to the counter to a rude and arrogant clerk who also informed us that we would be charged an additional $25 per night per vehicle. We got our room keys and we were guided to our room by another clerk who opened the door and let us in. The room seemed okay, but not the high-end, $995 per night resort room on the bay we had been dreaming of. We left the room to have dinner and drinks at the bayside bar in the resort for a couple of hours. When we returned to our room that night the keys refused to open the door to our room. We took the dreaded LONG walk to the lobby in the dark to have the keys reprogrammed. Again with only two people in the line in front of us, we waited another 50 minutes to get to the counter. We were told that we were staying at the wrong room and we would have to move. They gave us a new set of keys and sent us out with yet another clerk to show us the correct room. Needless to say that we had to repack our stuff and move to our assigned room under the supervision of a suspicious clerk. Our new bay side room opened to small body of water and a beautiful noisy freeway bridge. From this point on we felt that this place was an absolute rip-off and not a high-end resort we had expected at this price. Two cheap paper cups for four people (no glass cups), loose screws on the door locks with multiple- trial- screw holes, a wrong size shower curtain that was too short and too wide (too many holes for the number of hooks) causing the bathroom floor to be flooded with every shower, a noisy bathroom fan that shook the bed posts in the next room but did not suck the bathroom air, a hungry ant colony in the kitchen that immediately covered the complimentary two-day old cookies and the leftover food from our dinner of just an hour earlier, a highly over-priced nacho chips plate with a dab of cheap frozen imitation guacamole and a few drops of SqueezeIt imitation cheese, $12.99 for an in-room movie, $4.50 for a 95 cent bottled water. We felt as though this place was making a genuine attempt at every step to cheapen our experience. We were glad to leave this glorified Motel 6. They should be embarrassed to call themselves a “resort”.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced camping spot.”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl12th
Reviews.Content: I agree 100% with the other reviews. Rooms have mold, chipped paint, dirty drapes, rough sheets, uncomfortable beds, old shower fixtures and no water pressure. The property is old and the lagoons look like swampy water with bird poop. If you upgrade to bay view be prepared to breathe bonfire fumes night and day. I do not camp. So this is my version of camping. We bring camping gear and cook our food. We do this trip with other families and have a great time doing Stand Up Paddle Surfing (we bring our own gear) in the bay, running, and hanging out. We travel quite a bit and for the $350.00 we spent a night (not including parking) we could have a beautiful room at 5 star hotel. I have never stayed at Motel 6 but I am sure this would be about the same. If you are looking for over priced camping spot. This is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Barely passes for a resort”
Reviews.Author: InSA2010
Reviews.Content: OK - Let me preface my remarks by providing a comparison. I hope you find this review helpful before you book your trip. I have vacationed at a Sandals Resort in Ocho Rios, Jamaica, a resort in Cancun, Mexico, and the Hyatt Hill Country Resort in San Antonio, Texas. Paradise Point in San Diego does not come close to any one of these other resorts and the San Antonio resort I mention doesn't even have an ocean, lake, river or any type of body of water around except for their excellent man made lazy river that runs around the entire pool area. First of all - It is over priced. The grounds are not gated and while enjoying a nice quadracycle rental in the property we noticed what appeared to be a local police officer talking to a guest about what looked like a car break in. We also had someone run through our patio that hotel security staff was chasing. The pool area was not impressive at all - its a little larger than the average hotel pool but no slides or diving boards or anything really unique like you would find on other resorts. The room was old - averagely cleaned - we had purchased some food for breakfast one night to find ants crawling all over it the next morning. After complaining to the front desk - received a $100 credit at one of their restaurants - the food was bland and very average for the price - we tried to use the credit at the restaurant but we chose to eat out the rest of our trip. Also - cheap pergo flooring and knock off scandanavian furniture does not make it a 4 star room and the old noisy window units....really? We took a drive to La Jolla about 15 - 20 minutes away. We saw the real paradise in La Jolla. In La Jolla - you can really enjoy the beach - "not" the bay. The bay at Paradise Point is nice but you really don't want to swim in it - kayaking and fishing are fine but actually putting your body in there - at your own risk. We have concluded - our next trip to the San Diego area - will be in La Jolla. Anywhere relatively near the beach is fine - Wow - what a beach! You have it all in La Jolla including the aquarium and the zoo and Balboa Park are only 20 minutes away. In conclusion - Paradise Point should be called Motel 6 on Paradise Point. Happy Trails!

Reviews.Title: “A SHAME”
Reviews.Author: swissagency
Reviews.Content: We reserved there for our 4 last nights of our honeymoon. We paid all in advance with our travel agence (1200USD). Just arrived, they asked us to take a caution of USD 400 on our credit card. It was the end of our trip so we didn't have enough on it. They just gave us the room with 200 cash (otherwise no room and we paid one month before !!! and it was written on our confirmation :"Don't accept any extra charge". So they gave us the worst room on the side of the street (It was our honeymoon!). No room service... A shame for this price... When we went to the bar, we had to pay all cash, they refused to charge it on our room. If they new we had 2000 cash for 4 days and night... We just spent our money outside the hotel... Don't go there, they're not serious.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Paradise Dirty and Understaffed”
Reviews.Author: Trip in the Sun
Reviews.Content: For starters, the lobby bathroom was completely filthy. There was trash overflowing from the wastebasket, blood on the toilet sit and no toilet paper! The grounds are not very well maintained. There was trash on the ground in front of our room and lots of duck feathers and bird poop on the roads and sidewalks. The outside of the cabanas needing painting or cleaning, they seemed sooty or just plain dirty. Our room had a horrible musty smell in the bathroom and there was mold around the rim of the sink. The beds were comfortable although a little creaky. The refrigerator hummed loudly all night. There were no screens on the doors to let fresh air in so we had to use the air conditioner. Housekeeping did not show up until 4:30 even though we were out of the room all morning and into the afternoon. Parking was $25 dollars a night and $12 a day to use the gym! The hotel must be under staffed or going through management changes. I highly advise staying at this "resort" for the money that they are asking or if you are concerned about hygiene.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort! Great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: KNV793
Reviews.Content: I called ahead to let the management know that this was a special trip. The manager, Matt, was extremely helpful and courteous. When we arrived, we were told that we had been upgraded to a bungalow room. The room was amazing and the entire resort was beautiful! The food at the resort is pricey, but there are plenty of restaurants just a few minutes away by car.

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mbhakta
Reviews.Content: As much money as I paid for the paradise effect I didn't get what I paid for... I was disappointed...the view was great from my front door but that was all that was great about my stay... it could have been better. the room could have been bigger b/c I was with my whole family anb I would certainly not come back again....

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Sugar47
Reviews.Content: I think we all seem to agree that the grounds on the resort are beautiful! We too felt nickel and dimed for everything, the Baleen restaurant had awesome food but the service was awful, only 1 waitress on for the entire restaurant which was very busy. Overall it wasn't worth the expense! The food at the Barefoot Grill got "old" real quick, it was good, but not a huge selection on the menu to choose from. Our room lacked the lanai that it was described as having, lacked an ice bucket, bottle opener, and having to pay for internet was a shocker!! We did ask twice for an ice bucket and at time of departure still had not got one. We also had issue with one of the concierge's. He seemed too eager to have us pay for a tour package despite the fact we only wanted to see 3 places ( limited time available).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: leecypoo
Reviews.Content: I didn't book this hotel in the first place because of the reviews I read here. So we ended up at another hotel, which turned out to be so bad, they didn't argue, as released us with a refund from our non refundable reservations. I managed to get us a three night stay with two queen beds in the $200 range, same price as we had payed for the slum. As we were refugees running from our other hotel, we all agreed, we were now in heaven. The property was beautiful. We drove in the the lobby, the staff was very friendly, and we followed Tattoo in his golf cart to our room. Our little half a duplex with garden view was updated, clean, comfortable, quiet, even with a putting green right behind it. The grounds were beautiful. We spent most of our time running around San Diego as when we travel, we go to see other places, not other hotels. We did use the pools, gift shop, laundry, and have fun walking around the grounds. We agreed if our kids were smaller, they would have been able to occupy themselves for hours with the putting green( all the resort kids were playing mini golf on it!), riding the rental bikes, playing on the private beach, hanging out. The common area in the center has ponds, ducks, herons, and an observation tower to climb. You can see the fire works from Sea World nightly from many places on the grounds. We generally stay at hotels, not resorts, so maybe I am easy to please, but I've payed as much in San Diego in high season and gotten much less. The only negative was having to pay for internet connection, so we went without. We over heard a couple of women in the gift shop snottily discussing the clothes ($50-200 items). "They are soo ugly. O, that must be the clearance rack!) So, if you are a Regular Joe, like us, I think we got a fair deal for high season. If you are Thurston Howell the 3rd, maybe it won't live up to your expectations, but I don't see why.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: trayfamily
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd of 5 hotels in which we stayed on our 2-week vacation to California and Arizona, and it was by far the most disappointing, although it was the 2nd most expensive! Yes the location is great for seeing Sea World and the Zoo, and the room was spacious with comfortable beds. That's all I can say good about it. I felt nickelled and dimed to death the whole time. We did have to pay the $25/night parking fee. (We did not have to pay at the previous hotel, as we were allowed to find free street parking.) This was the only hotel on our trip that did not provide complimentary internet. Even the "ammenities" provided were nailed to the wall, literally. The shampoo, conditioner and lotion came from squirt bottles attached to the shower wall. When we arrived we had no soap or glasses of any kind. I called to ask for them and they did respond promptly. My children enjoyed the pools. We did not eat or shop here so I cannot speak for other things on the property. Were I to go back, I would not stay here again, especially if I were mainly going to see sights in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “It's not a 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: Soomba
Reviews.Content: A good family spot, but feels very dated, even post-remodel. The floor in our unit is filthy and we wonder when it was last cleaned. The bathroom was only partially remodeled and does not feature a "cascading shower." All that said, it is a nice spot for families, with the many pools and beach nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: mzgrinch
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this vacation. I went on-line to read the reviews and was pretty worried that this place would be a dump. We arrived at the resort about 2-3 hours before check in. Our room was not ready so we parked our car and went to the grill for lunch. it was a nice spot on the water; yes a little pricy for lunch but that is expected when you are eating on the resort. we walked around the resort to see where the five pools were, the gift shop and just got the lay of the land. Our room still wasnt ready so we just hung out in the lobby. After about an hour of waitng our room was finally ready. They upgraded us to a Presidential Suite for the same price we originally booked our room for. Now how sweet was that! They also waived our parking fee as we were staying for 8 nights. The pictures on the website were dead-on. Room was awesome! One of the pools was right out side our door,,,, The grounds were well kept, clean. Expcet for the bird droppings but they were there long before we were. Just walk around it. Staff was friendly. Location to everything was great...... all in all an excellent vacation and would definately go back!!!! We also found out that the MTV show "Tough Love Couples" was recorded there; in April, right next to the room we stayed in......

Reviews.Title: “Great location- overall nice place”
Reviews.Author: Tiffkat2000
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a great vacation spot. I would stay there again Positives- -Gorgeous grounds. It makes you feel as if you at a resort rather than just a hotel - Very large rooms with kitchenette and living room (if you stay in a beach bungalow ) - you never need to leave the resort if you don't want to. Stores and restaurants on site. - new modern designs of rooms (stayed in room 544) - spa treatments were some of the best I've had (they add 20% gratuity and the treatments are pricey, but worth it) (try the hot stone massage!) Negatives- - the rooms do not have blackout shutters so when the sun comes , up so do you - the bay is not really private so boats can drive up it all night making for some noise (I am a light sleeper and was awakened several times where as my husband never heard a thing) - they charge you for EVERYTHING extra. Parking is $25 a day, mini golf costs, etc (even Internet) One last tip- we decided to walk to sea world from the resort as there is no shuttle. The front desk lady said it would be a 15 minute walk. It was more like a 35 min brisk walk so if you are with kids you may want to f skip this walk Still the place makes you feel as if you are on a tropical island rather than in San Diego and it is a great place. -service at the Baleen restaurant was less than amazing but the food was great!! -

Reviews.Title: “An island, for better or worse”
Reviews.Author: mehudson1
Reviews.Content: Super fun to be on a resort on an island. Also, super boring in an exciting city like San Diego because you're miles from the great restaurants, nightlife, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Surrounded by paradise”
Reviews.Author: birdsley14
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is the place to go if you're looking for atmoshpere. It's located on an island in the middle of Mission Bay and has all the look and feel of a tropical island. You are surrounded with beautiful plant life and relaxing environments. There is no giant bulding breaking up the skyline on this island. The rooms are scattered across the grounds in single story buildings that typically only house a few rooms per building. Each room has its own parking spot right outside your front door (we read multiple complaints about high parking fees, but by staying for 5 days we only paid $12.50 per day.) There are multiple pools (including an adult only pool) and lagoons within a few steps of most rooms. Being on an island, there is also plenty of beach front. However, the beach was somewhat disappointing. A lot of the sand seemed to have washed away and overall the beach was just not in great shape. This didn't get us down because we knew going in that there wouldn't be a lot of in the water time anyway (the Pacific is cold!) The main pool will provide you with all you need if you're looking to lay out in the sun. The spa is adjacent to the main pool and there is also a poolside bar. The resort is only about a 10 minute drive from the airport and is within 15 minutes of the zoo and Gaslamp Quarter. Being located north of the city also puts you closer to L.A. (less than 2 hours if you're up for the drive) and close to La Jolla. While you're in town you obviously want to hit the zoo, but an unexpected bonus to our trip and one of the highlights was the U.S.S. Midway. You can do a self-guided audio tour of the entire aircraft carrier in about 2-3 hours and is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice For Families, But Not Plush”
Reviews.Author: juliem1006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a Bayside Bungalow for our 4 night trip with our children to Paradise Point. Here's what you need to know: The Bayside Bungalows are located on a public, not private, unmanicured beach. These are by far the best rooms on the property, but they are dual unit buildings, meaning you are not getting a private, quiet bungalow, and you share the fire pits they mention with your bungalow neighbor, the other bungalows, and the general public coming to use the beach. That said, our room, 541, was in a nice location on the beach, definitely one of the quieter sections, and just what we wanted as far as being able to go right out our door to build sand castles and find shells. The room is not fancy, but it was clean, bright and had a cute beachy feel. There are very few ammenities-the beach bungalows do have a coffee maker, microwave and fridge, but no lotions, soap, etc., that you would expect-so you feel like you are staying in a condo, not a $450 a night hotel. But AGAIN, I thought the room was fine for our family (the bed and pull out couch are super comfortable!) on a beach vacation. For our children, the highlights of this hotel were roasting marshmallows poolside and swimming after dark (there is one pool with two giant fire pits which they light at 7pm: skip the beach pits and come here, then swim in the 85 degree pool or the 104 degree hot tub!), followed by feeding the residing ducks and checking out the shark and other cool marine life swimming in the lagoon at the Barefoot Bar and Grill. The hotel grounds are somewhat tired and misrepresented in phonts, however, I would recommend this hotel for families as a kid friendly, not a plush, hotel. Ten minute walk to Sea World also makes it a great location!

Reviews.Title: “TOO MUCH MONEY-TOO LITTLE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: VanNess4
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed at the San Diego Paradise Point every time we've visited San Diego. It used to be the San Diego Princess. It appears the new owners updated all of the rooms and then doubled the price to stay. We were also charged an additional $20 per night to park our car. All these new charges left me wondering what happened to the personalized service and beach hut feel this resort used to have. It looked like all the old employees we remembered were gone and replaced with 20 somethings that couldn't believe we had a problem paying an additional $20 to park when we were already paying more than $400 per night. Don't get me wrong, the new rooms are great and it's a great location (right across the street from Sea World.) The issue is they charge too much and lack the great customer service they used to be famous for. There's a great resort in LaJolla, The Lodge at Torrey Pines. If you want to be pampered for $400 per night, go there.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: mickeynewkirk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked the Lanai Garden room at Paradise Point while visiting Cali for a wedding. ThenanI saw the reviews on Trip advisor and was upset to think the place we were staying at was "dirty and looked nothing like the pictures" When we arrived I was literally blown away by how beautiful the resort ACTUALLY was. The landscaping was beautiful and there was five pools instead of just one! The room looked exactly like how it did online. My only complaints were the $25 a-day parking charge and the cocky bartender. We rented a convertible from fox chase (excellent rates) and if that hadn't been enough we paid a hundred extra bucks for parking. But what can I say our stay other than that was literally complete paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated.”
Reviews.Author: frogfan63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference and although initally driving in you think, wow this place looks nice, take a better look around. It's only the gardens that look nice. The bungalows look like little dumpy cubes. They really need to improve the external look if you want to match the landscaping & cost to stay here. This place is not a quiet romantic getaway type place. It is located within walking distance of Sea World, so you have a TON of family/kids, and if your prepared for that then you can go in knowing the noise level will be annoying. Having an adult only pool doesn't work, because you always have the losers that bring their kids here to get away from the other noisy kids elsewhere. No hotel staff around to let them know-adults only!! Many places like this are overrated. It is so frustrating to pay and arm and a leg to stay in a place like this, and then they turn around a charge you more for everything you want to do. $12.00 a day to use the workout room, parking fees, fees to use the tennis court. etc. etc. Are you serious? I don't call that a vacation when your raked over the coals everytime you want to do something "extra". Maybe for some this is "fun". For me I'd rather stay in a nice chain hotel that appreciates their guests. Spending more doesn't make it memorable, but if you don't mind opening up your wallet to be drained......this is the place for you.For me it was overrated, really don't have an interest in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly NOT recommended”
Reviews.Author: windycty
Reviews.Content: Well I knew that there are conflicting reviews of this place when I decided to make my reservation, but when I was given a good recommendation from a friend, I thought I had to check it out! YES, this place is great for families. Lots of things to do, but we never had an opportunity to try any out as we LEFT after one night stay. We were at Disney all day and knew that we would be arriving late. Upon arrival we were directed to a Presidential Room (the 800 buildings). I thought we were lucky to have gotten this suite. I wanted to check out the room before unloading the car. I went in to find only a king bed (we are a family of 5). We reserved a 1 bedroom garden view. Called front desk and she informed me that our room is having maintenance issues and that we would have to change bungalows (tis was NEVER mentioned upon checking in) We explained the room would not accommodate all of us and she stated that she could put us in a one bedroom bungalow with a bayside view, but we would still have to change since this room is reserved for another beginning the next day. After some discussion with her, she agreed to find something else for the other party and let us have this room the entire duration of our stay. So now I thought that we were on a great start of our stay at Paradise Point. When we got to the room, well their description of newly remodeled is...musty smells from the bathroom shower area, in wall air conditioning units with mold growing on the outside of it, new floors throughout and granite counter is the bathroom, but the paint looked like it would peel off an minute, sticky to the touch and the cabinets throughout were just painted over not NEW. I thought the kitchen are would have more than a microwave and tiny refrigerator...no utensils, stove, plates, coffee maker...not a full kitchen! The window treatments were faux wood blinds that were not working. Our particular bungalow was the last in the row with a beautiful hedge on the side. Since we arrived so ate we were not able to see the grounds, but in the morning my husband walked out side, popped his head over the hedge to fine that there were public restrooms on the other side with HOMELESS people sleeping of the floor. Security was a huge issue for us with three children! This was enough for us! For the amount of money per night and then for all the extras, we were able to make reservations at the Grand Del Mar and pay just about the same amount (I am going to write a WONDERFUL review for them in a few moments). We went to the front desk and told them how dissatisfied we were and they refunded us our money (which after 1 1/2 weeks, I am still waiting for the refund to show on the online credit card statement). The negative reviews are right on! I reread through them and after being there I absolutely agree!!!!! Don't waste it here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value - tons of fun.”
Reviews.Author: RyanPatano
Reviews.Content: We had a bayside bungalow which was amazing. Located right on the beach in a quiet bay. The kids could play in the sand and swim in the ocean. The facilities are great - very family friendly. We rented a wave-runner one day and played in several of the resort's five pools. The staff was helpful and friendly. The food at the restaurants was very good. Located just minutes from Sea World and Mission Bay, this resort is great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ralriver
Reviews.Content: The location was great. The grounds were beautiful, except the "natural" lagoon outside our door looked like it needed to be refurbished. There is a $25.00 a night fee to park that wasn't mentioned on their web site. To get morning coffee you must use the coffee cart and spend another $4.00 per cup. There is a charge for internet service etc. There was no major problem, but attention to detail was lacking - the drapes didn't fit the window, there was no ice bucket, the room wasn't made up until 4:15, the patio needed to be cleaned...basically, there were enough little things wrong that made it irritating. I don't think this hotel is looking for repeat business so I'll try another spot next time.

Reviews.Title: “hands down amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tonilynmarie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best I have ever stayed at. I went with my family, right on the bay! I went with many of my Aunts, Uncles, Cousins, and Siblings. We are all different ages and we all had a blast! I am 18 and live here in San Diego. This wasn't like anything I had been to before. Every aspect was great. When we asked for extra blankets they were right there with them, and were very informative; some employees could even tell us some history on San Diego! The shopping at the hotels gift shop was spectacular as well, it had many San Diego inspired aspects and a very nice theme. The s'mores packs they sell are very handy when sitting by the room side fire pits! The tower was fun to climb in the morning to get my blood pumping and see a pretty view of Mission Bay and even some of sea world! I have been to this hotel before it was renovated, and although nice before, the rooms are spectacular now! I enjoyed the clean bathroom which had complimentary shampoo, conditioner and soap that were very luxurious. The pool side movie was great to occupy my two young cousins while the rest of the family relaxed in the huge hot tub! As a San Diegan, this was the nicest hotel I've seen here by far. Perfect for all ages and occasions. I can't wait to stay at the beautiful Paradise Point Resort again!

Reviews.Title: “This is not a resort.”
Reviews.Author: secretagent2112
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Memorial Day weekend and were thoroughly unimpressed. The grounds were beautiful as we drove in and it seemed like a somewhat classy resort with a very cool tiki/south pacific theme. The party ended when we got to our room with a "lagoon" view. Ok, it's a nasty little pond with a bunch of kids running around it. It seemed more trailer park than hotel. There's also very little privacy. On top of that we didn't appreciate the $25/night parking fee as well as being charged for internet access. I will say that the room was nice and the bathroom was clean, however it didn't make up for the summer camp crowd and lack of class. If you're looking for a romantic getaway this is NOT the place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, beautiful island, great San Diego location”
Reviews.Author: DaveInCa49
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at Paradise Point. It's located in the heart of San Diego on Paradise Island in MIssion Bay, close to nearly everything and yet set apart and very quiet. It also has a variety of equipment available for use on the bay (sailboats, paddle boats, etc.). Coming from the north, as we entered the Mission Bay area I noticed a sudden change from busy city surroundings to a quiet island setting. Part of this quietness, I think, is due to efforts by the city itself: we witnessed the bay patrol stop a speeding jet skier on the bay and asked him to slow down. This reduced both noise and possible hazard to vacationers who were using leg or wind-powered craft on the water. We ate primarily at the bar & grill, where the food was impressive (presentation as well as quality) for a simple family patio restaurant. It made me want to try the main dining restaurant, but we had no time during our 2-day stay. The rooms were very comfortable and decorated in an appropriate island motif. One of our friends said that the entire resort had all its rooms recently redecorated. The only comment I would have is that the hotel could do with a better coffee cart service, especially in the morning. While they had one, its quality was not on par with, e.g., the national chains, and the location in the bay makes it difficult to drive out for a venti half-caf in the surrounding area. We actually made a suggestion about this when checking out. All in all, it was a most enjoyable time. I wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: Livinandlovinlife
Reviews.Content: Booked this resort online. Read other reviews, but decided to give it a shot. Driving in to the resort, it was beautiful! Lobby was nice, front desk help friendly. That was where it ended! Drove to our room, through basically a maze of little side roads, a bayside bungalow, and not cheap! Exited the car, and noticed all the empty beer cans ,and beer cases, on the patio of the bungalow next to us, not a good sign.Also, there was litter on the ground next to the rocks, surrounding the bay. Opened door to room, el cheapo sheers on front windows, broken cheap blinds in bedroom! Room had a very funky smell, combination of must, mold, and pets! Decided to turn on the WINDOW air conditioning unit, to air it out a bit! Mold all over the window sill under the unit, and a horrible moldy smell being emitted from the unit! Also, there were several personal hygiene items, left in the bathroom, from the previous occupant! We immediately went to the lobby, and asked for our money to be refunded, and went elsewhere. They did not argue at all, I got the feeling that this happens ALOT! If you have any mold allergies, this is not the place to be staying. What a disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “The Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Breidt
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at your hotel and I had such a nice and relaxing time. The grounds are beautiful. I also really thought the remodeled rooms were so nice and tasteful, not to mention clean. The housekeeping staff were efficient and did a good job each day. In the lobby area, all the staff were gracious and helpful. They always said "hello" when passing by (all staff did throughout the grounds). Your manager, Pat R, was extremely helpful . . . he even escourted us to our room. We dined at the Barfoot Bar and the food was good, the ambience, amazing. I also ejoyed a spa service . . . a body wrap/scrub that was so indulgent, a can't wait to go back. I look forward to returning to your hotel this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: AFL95
Reviews.Content: This place is great. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. There are a wide variety of flowers, plants, trees, lilly ponds, and the beach that make walking the property just fabulous. We had a Bayside Studio Suite that really was 20 feet from the beach as advertised. The room had an excellent view of the beach/bay, was 20 feet from the sandy beach, and was well kept. The rooms are on the small side, but this place isn't about staying in the room. You want to be out on the beach or walking the grounds to see the beautiful landscaping. They have fire pits on the beach, and chimineas on the patio of some rooms. They sell firewood and fire starters on the property so you can have a romatic fire on the beach - excellent!!!!! We really liked that.... The staff is friendly and provide very good service. We had lunch and drinks at the casual restaurant/grill and enjoyed the food and views. I will go back, and recommend this resort to anyone looking for a nice romantic getaway.....

Reviews.Title: “WOW.... Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: HummerDad
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at this hotel several times in the past and every visit just keeps getting better and better. Everyone is Super friendly, I mean way beyond the normal hospitality, but almost a Ritz Experience. When we checked in the landscaping was looking great, the front drive was busy from some groups that were checking in, but they still made us feel special, like we were the only ones there. The rooms was perfect, we went to the Barefoot Bar for Breakfast and our server took our kids around and taught them all about the fish in the pond from sharks to whatever fish are there. Pools were clean and well maintained. This is a super kid friendly resort, close to everything, Sea World, Beaches, SD Zoo You cannot go wrong by booking a room in this hotel for a night or a week

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point is a "must-stay" oasis, a great place for the whole family.”
Reviews.Author: eunderdahl
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in to the reluctant day of our departure, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the resort. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The new style of the rooms was very inviting, fresh and accommodating. The many pools, fun activities, shops and spa amenities on the property were all terrific. Finding a hotel that is fun for our children, relaxed yet refined for us as adults is no easy feat....and you have hit the mark. There are so many fun-filled activities to take advantage of on property, yet it was easy to find peaceful retreat areas too. We really enjoyed exploring the beautiful grounds of the resort - impressively maintained. Best asset is your incredibly friendly and professional staff - they did not miss a beat. Pool attendants went above and beyond, housekeepers were thorough and fast, concierge friendly-creative-informative, and room service staff thought of every detail. We have stayed at many highly rated hotels and resorts over the past 20 years - this is one we will continue to visit! I have told many family members and friends that this resort is a must see and a must stay - a hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family stay and vacation”
Reviews.Author: family063
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this resort over the last few years and it keeps getting better and better. The new remodeled rooms are excellent and the staff does everything possible to make our stay enjoyable. The check in was quick and easy as was all the staff at the restaurants, poll and boat dock. The live fish of white sea bass and yellowtail at the Barefoot Bar and grill are always a treat and remind my son and I we need to get out on the water soon for fishing. The location is awsome in SD with great weather and right across the street from Sea World. We were also able to rent bikes, play tennis and rent a sale boat right from the resort. We cant wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The grounds are beautiful but the rooms are disgusting!!!”
Reviews.Author: MelanieSacramento
Reviews.Content: When we pulled up to this hotel our whole family was excited because the grounds are gorgeous. We checked in and were escorted to our room and shown where to park.
