Since someone was parked in our designated spot we were told the $25 parking fee would be waived for the night, which didn't happen. At first glance the room looked ok and we left our bags and headed out to dinner. We didn't use the bathroom so didn't notice, until the next morning, that not only was there a lot of mold in the shower/tub but that it hadn't even been cleaned. (There were wet towels in the tub.) After calling the front desk, they assured me that it would be taken care of while we were out for the day. It was not, and we were back too late to try and move two very young children. The next day my older daughter found cobwebs while playing in the curtains and my younger daughter, who is barely walking, discovered mold growing under the air conditioner. Please see attached pictures. Needless to say we will never stay here again and could not wait to check out. There are no excuses for mold and cobwebs in a room!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worse customer service in the reservation department!!!”
Reviews.Author: freeman12
Reviews.Content: I was charged 4 times the amount of the actual stay on two different occasions. The reservation department didnt even offer to resolve any inconvience I suffurd instead they offered that i could cancel if id like, then at the time i had to call them back to dispute another charge the women that answered the phone actually yelled at me as if I did something wrong and hung up while i was still on the phone!. I have NEVER been treated as bad as this place has treated me. They are on a high horse and could care less about the actual customer, they only care about who is next in line and how much money they can rake in with all there extra charges. I cant even explain to you how let down i was. Please reconsider before staying here, unless you like to be treated like you are extremly un imporatant and you have a million dollars to pay for the reservation before you get there. what a joke this place is. I DO NOT RECOMMEND

Reviews.Title: “Like going to Hawaii without the flight”
Reviews.Author: S&S
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where all the crticisms for the resort come from, but we were very satisfied overall with the experience. All the staff were so friendly and helpful and the grounds & location were great. The pool was fantastic for our 3 year old and we had a great time renting a little boat from the on site marina. There are a few cons, such as the paper thin walls (we listened to our neighbors every night) and the way they nickel & dime you for everything ($10 to 'rent' a putter, $15 for internet, $25 for parking, $15 to use the gym, etc....) So, when you reserve, be sure to take that all into consideration. And, I agree with everyone else that putting a coffee maker in the room would be nice for what you pay. Overall, we had a great family vacation and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Internet”
Reviews.Author: msprichsiliconvalley
Reviews.Content: Bayside room is nice and clean. Big resort pools small. $15 per day for slow Internet connection and $25 to park is a friggn joke. These people over charge for things that should cost 1/2 the price. Don't bother with this dump. Stay at the Del and you will be better off

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: izzyaunt
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Travelocity and was quite hesitant after reading some of the comments left by others. I have to say that my stay was delightful. There was a group of 4 of us and the room was nice and big and we didn't feel cramped at all (and that is a lot due to the amount of luggage we all brought for our cruise the next day). The decor was very nice and the beds were very comfortable. We had a room that opened to a lake (I think it was called a lagoon room) . We opened our patio doors in the morning to enjoy the fresh air and to our delight we had a family of ducks join us in our room for the morning. They were very friendly and just came and went as they pleased (where else can you have that happen), We ate breakfast at the restaurant overlooking the ocean and both the food and the service were up to our standards. Overall we enjoyed our stay and I hope to return soon with my kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Aleatha
Reviews.Content: I went out West to look at colleges with my daughters. My younger daughter saw this resort on Jon & Kate and was just dying to stay there. After a fair amount of research and speaking with Annette Ross, the reservations manager, I felt confident this would be a great place to stay with kids for 3 nights, one of whom has a walking disability and daily therapy. We arrived in the evening down a tropical path illuminated by tiki torches and were greeted by very friendly front desk staff and checked in promptly. Upon arrival to our "upgraded" suite we entered a room that was dirty (sink with food particles in the drain, bugs in the bathroom area, dirt all over the light switches, paper on the floor, cob webs in the corners... obviously not the clean I am used to even in the most basic hotel. I phoned the front desk and explained the condition of the suite and was moved to an "executive suite" within 30 minutes. Upon arrival to our new suite, we encountered some of the same problems in terms of cleanliness and no bedding for the pull out sofa sleeper. The pillows for the second bed were wet and once again debris on the floor, the bedroom door would not close without slamming and putting weight into it making it just as difficult to open, no soaps, a tub faucet that was falling out of the wall with a huge hole above it. I phoned housekeeping and asked for bedding and was informed that they were out of pillows, linens and blankets and had nothing to send us. I again phoned the front desk and then asked to speak with the manager on duty. I was told there was not a manager on duty and that she would send someone to another empty room to retrieve the missing bedding. Upon arrival the linens smelled of cigarette smoke. I gave up and 4 of us, slept in a king size bed - suffice it to say it wasn't a pleasant evening. The next morning I did meet with a manager (not the GM, he was on vacation), who listened, admitted the resort dropped the ball and did not charge us for the room night, and then offered to move us. Unfortunately, there weren't any rooms available, and the manager had the current room cleaned from top to bottom, reduced our rate if I wanted to stay. That said, the property while may have been renovated, it's not the caliber of resort my family is used to. The pools are small, the beach dirty... The restaurant was good. The rooms (2 that we were in) essentially had yellow paint slapped on the walls to cover up the old and a few new pieces of contemporary furniture. The rooms do not look like the pictures on the website, so I opted to move our family to a more suitable property. I would like to say that while the property fell very short of meeting our expectations, the manager did try to make things right. The problem is that it was the quality of rooms and housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, too many extra charges”
Reviews.Author: Mtnlover2185
Reviews.Content: Pros: The resort has beautiful well maintained grounds. They have 3 pools (1 is adult only), one has a grill and bar. The rooms were nicely decorated, spacious and comfortable ( we had a garden view room). Outside of each unit are 2 patio chairs and small round table for relaxation. The staff could not have been better. Every person we encountered from front desk to grounds keepers were top notch. Very close to Sea World. Cons: Although each room has an assigned parking space, you are charged $25 per day to park. Internet was $15/day, Each day I was charged 6 taxes totalling $36/day. The on site grill was very overpriced for very plain average tasting food. Nearest off site restaurants about 2 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Past its sell by date - poor service and standards”
Reviews.Author: sunnytimthesecond
Reviews.Content: We had hoped for better. The rooms are in blocks of chalets which are packed tightly together with parking spots outside so it's more of a motel than a hotel. Room OK but small compared to other hotels in USA - clean but buildings are old with old (and so noisy aircon, fridge, bathroom ventilation). Noisy plant room outside (possibly the pump for the duck pond water feature). Housekeeping was terrible - they often didn't turn up till after 4.00pm. Got locked out of the room at one stage due to a faulty door lock - I think they are old too - took ages to sort out - couldn’t get to see a manager (all too busy apparently). The barefoot restaurant only has about 8 dishes on the menu which is the same for lunch and dinner - never changed all week we were there. The coffee bar is only open in the morning. The shop (Island Market) had helpful staff but was pricey. There are no other amenities nearby unless you drive. It's only saving grace was that it is just about within walking distance of Seaworld for children (about a mile) - there is no hotel shuttle to Seaworld though. If that’s where you want to go to then that’s the only good reason for staying here - there are many much better places to stay in the San Diego area for the money. Don't stay any longer than 1 or 2 days though and think of it as an overpriced motel with swimming pools scattered around the car parks and you are less likely to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “OHMEHDANG. AWESOME.”
Reviews.Author: Jneppsdude
Reviews.Content: Soooo relaxing. Very amazing. I want to go back there, it was AWESOME. (:

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here”
Reviews.Author: bcfc123
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this resort to anyone we loved it here. I too read a lot of negative reports before we went and considered cancelling and booking elsewhere. I am so glad we didn’t. The location couldn’t be better, close to sea world, restaurants and beaches. Easy drive to the Zoo, down town and La Jolla. The rooms were clean, spacious and modern. The staff were very friendly and helpful. On the first day we had a slight problem with the shower tap, I called reception and a maintenance man arrived to fix it within 5 mins. He was also happy to answer some of our questions regarding best beaches and restaurants to go to in the area. Our only gripe would be no coffee facilities in the room. We had to queue every morning at the coffee cart to buy some. The food at the Barefoot Grill was good, but not alot to choose from. Didn’t go to Baleen as it was a bit pricey. We booked through Virgin Atlantic so didn’t have to pay the parking fee. I’m glad because $25 a day is ridiculous! Altogether a brilliant week in San Diego!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: dejlim
Reviews.Content: I usually don't write reviews for hotels but had to sign up to write one for Paradise Point. Before going to the resort, I have read a lot of reviews and did read a lot of negative things about it so I was kind of hesitant with the place but still gave it a try since my little daughter loves the beach. Got there at 2 pm and immediately got a room. The room was really nice, cozy and spacious. Bed was really comfortable. Love the lagoon at the back of the room. It was very quiet and relaxing. Need to bring slippers, no carpet which makes sense since sand will be all over the floor. My daughter got to feed the ducks (they give you a free pack of duck food). It's walking distance to the beach and a lot of activities in the resort. Staff were friendly and the resort was really clean. There is a $25 parking fee per night which is a little pricey and the food in the resort were also a little pricey so I suggest you buy food outside and just bring it. They have a lot of fast food around Sports Arena Blvd. Overall, it was great! Will definitely go back...but maybe next time we'll get a room closer to the beach :)

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced and Lacked Service”
Reviews.Author: CottonwoodSierra
Reviews.Content: Check in was at 4pm did not get a room until after 5:15 pm and had to raise a fuss to get it then. Spoke to the manager he waived the parking fee for our trip. The next day or should I say nite 12:21 am a security person entered our room with a pass key without even knocking or announcing his arrival. Spoke to the manager again only to get a so sorry. A taco was 9.00. Rooms are clean but dont expect to see a maid before 3pm.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and dime you.”
Reviews.Author: jeannatalie
Reviews.Content: Nice location and landscaping. We were quite a walk from the main pool. Our bungalo faced a pond that had scum on it. I think if you were facing the beach or pool you'd enjoy it more. But we did go for a lower priced room. No coffee pot in the room, and it was a 5 minute walk to the coffee cart were you could stand in line and buy black coffee for $3.50 a cup. You even had to pour that yourself out of a hot pot. It took four hours to get more toliet paper delivered to the room. They only provided two glasses and no ice bucket. The exterior light was burned out so it was dark approaching our room at night. For $22 you could get a smore kit but firewood and a lighter cost extra. They offered us a complimentary newspaper on the way out but it was a day old. And they had someone else's room $82 room service charge on our bill. If money isn't an issue then go for it and get a beach front room. You'd probably enjoy that. They do provide a fridge for no extra charge. Parking is $25 per day. It was nice dining by the water at the barefoot bar and grill. There are boat rentals but we didn't have time to try that but it looked like fun. I must say that the room was quiet and dark, good for sleeping. $10 for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Experience, good price.”
Reviews.Author: aleigho
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline. I was pretty worried when I read the reviews, but I figured we weren't really going to be in the hotel much anyway. It ended up that we did spend more time in the hotel than we thought, so here is my experience. To start, we arrived at 12 noon. Check in time is 4pm, but I was hoping we could unload our things and go do a tour and come back. I was told there wasn't a room clean yet, but that she would call me when the room was available. I was also surprised to find out that parking is and extra $25 a night for a 'dedicated' parking space. They take your credit card when you check in for 'incidentals' okay- no big deal, but don't use a debit card, it freezes $300. I told the front desk clerk I didn't have a credit card with that amount on it :) and she said well I can just charge you $150 on your debit card. We left, and by 4:30 were ready to go back and relax after driving all night and doing a tour at the USS Midway. (If you have kids- take them! Very cool.) Noticing I hadn't received a call yet, I called the hotel only to be told that our room still wasn't ready. ? Check in time was 4:00 I thought? Sorry- still not ready. So I arrived there at the front desk at 4:45 and after waiting 10 minutes in line (again) and they "gave us a new room." The room was very nice. I was worried about the remodeling issue after reading the reviews here, but our room seemed to have already been remodeled. It had nice furnishings, a flat screen TV, new flooring, fresh paint and a nice sink area and closet space for luggage. The only part NOT remodeled was the tub, and toilet area. You could tell that was a leftover 70's project they did not get to. While clean, I don't understand why not just re-tile the tub and behind the toilet and finish the job? It was a little odd. We had a private entrance, and a semi-private patio area off the back of our room. We never heard any noise from either neighbor beside us, only from people outside walking by to the pool. I would request a 'cove room' or room on the outskirts of the property next time to avoid people walking by with noisy kids, but overall it wasn't too bad. We were happy to find out there are 5 pools at this resort, all with hot tubs. One pool is heated all the time, and the rest were solar heated for the season. The pool closest to us was very warm, and had two fire pits which they turn on at night. There was also croquet, and a very nice hot-tub. Towel service was great, they have a basket at the pool with clean towels. We would grab a few and take back to the room to supplement the 4 exact towels they left in the room. Pool hours are 9am-10pm. They have tiki torches all around the property and pool at night which was a nice touch. We went swimming at night several times after being out all day, and sat in the hot tub. Nice way to relax after walking all day. The beach was nice, nothing spectacular. It's actually an inlet, so don't think you are going to go surfing or anything. They did have a bunch of things to do at the resort (all at extra charges) but we didn't get a chance to do any of them, although the sailing looked fun. The concierge was very helpful and very nice. The landscaping was beautiful, and the location was perfect. It's literally 1 minute from Sea World and close to everything else. I was very impressed (as were my children) with the entrance. When you drive up into the property, the first impression is that of a 5 star resort. After looking at the menu for the restaurant, we decided to head down to Denny's each morning for breakfast, which was great. It's about 3 minutes away, just over the bridge. We planned ahead and had a list of dinner locations we wanted to eat at based on advice from local residents and reviews on line, so we skipped the overpriced gourmet tourist food. Overall, our stay was really great. I would stay here again, but next time I'd try to get out of that parking $25 sham, (Our 'dedicated' spot changed each night, and while across from our room, there never seemed to be an issue with finding a spot, and the place was booked.) and I'd request a room a little more private. One thing they do need to fix are the road signs. There is one major place on the property where there are two signs, one says NO RIGHT TURN and one says NO LEFT TURN, in the same spot!! The road is supposed to be one way, but I'm not sure if anyone ever just goes one way? For the price, ($98) a night, this was a great deal. One final thing- They do charge you $1.00 for a 'room tax' upon check out. What is that? Why $1.00? Wireless internet is an extra $10 a night, be warned. I didn't feel like taking the time to find out, but I thought it was kinda odd. You can check out from your TV, which is what we did, and back home we went.

Reviews.Title: “A great family resort in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: tvfishingguy
Reviews.Content: The Paradise Point Resort has been nicely updated and has a lot to offer families with kids. Between the bay-front beach , selection of pools and numerous on-property activities for the kids....mine could not get enough time feeding the ducks....it is a place you don't have to leave to have a great time. Nice rooms and 2 waterfront restaurant options are a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great zero entry/heated pool & loved being on the bay beach!”
Reviews.Author: foolishtoad1
Reviews.Content: If you're staying in the San Diego vicinity w/children, they will LOVE the heated, zero entry pool! It's one of 5 different pools. There is a nice sandy area beside the pool for little ones to dig. Pool side service of beverages and food make this relaxing. It feels like you're in a tropical location (minus the cold wind when you get out). Nice hot tub. Worth paying extra to stay in a room on the bayside. Our kids 2 and 6 LOVED being able to dig in the sand daily and find seashells. We even saw seals and otters in the bay. Could swim in it too, but it's was chilly when we were there. We all LOVED the shark lagoon over by the marina and Barefoot Beach restaurant ( i think that is the name). Great place to eat outside, but watch out for the birds! They stole my husband's salmon one night! Nice lava waterfall there. The kids were really entertained while waiting for their food b/c of being able to watch the leopard sharks and flounder fish, rays. Really neat! Baleen restaurant was really good too! Excellent food and service! It's a little fancy, but we went early to dinner and they were great w/the kids there too! The only downside about this hotel is that there are no coffeemakers in the rooms, but there is a coffee cart near the Gift shop. And the ventilation in our room was poor so our wet suits/towels never dried out unless we put them outside in the sun. Would be fun to go back in the summer so the kids could try the kids camp. Great proximity to Seaworld too! Less than a 5 min. drive! Nice mini gold course on the grounds too! We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stepping from bed to beach- nothing better”
Reviews.Author: Caseiful
Reviews.Content: Waking up to a beautiful view of the ocean and getting to have my coffee on the beach was perfect. I loved walking up and down the beach picking up shells- a great beach with soft sand and very clean. We rented kayaks for a few hours which was a great way to see the area. LOVED the passion fruit mojito at the grill! It was a very relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for the whole family!”
Reviews.Author: TeamPete04
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is a wonderful getaway from the real world! Nestled in the midddle of the city, the whole family can relax and have fun. From playing on the beach, feeding the ducks, exploring the acres, riding bikes, playing miniature golf, swimming in the pool, watching the fish...there is always something to do! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!!”
Reviews.Author: fungirl61
Reviews.Content: My husband, college age daughter and I were at the Paradise Point for our Spring break in March and we can't say enough about the accommodations and the staff and the whole experience. It really is geared to families with young children but we had a wonderful stay and all the little kids weren't annoying at all. Our room was beautiful, clean and we had a great view on the bay. The staff was Johnny on the spot with anything we needed. I highly recommend this to any age. It isn't the least expensive but well worth the cost!!

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat secluded - very much relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Citybrarian
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in room 454 - near Mission Bay. Overall the amenities were great. I love that the room came with an empty refridgerator, but nothing beyond that in terms of cutlery or dishes. Not built for independent living. The room was nice and quiet, beds comfortable, tv was modern and internet connection reliable ($10/day). The bathroom was my only complaint - bathtub not suitable for soaking, was very shallow and old-fashioned. I didn't use any of the spa services or pool so can't comment on those. Food seemed a bit expensive so I made the 40 minute trek to Trader Joe's and had enough supplies to get me through my breakfasts and lunches. Conference facilities were really nice and I was happy to see that my wifi connection extended there from the room. Planned on using the fitness facilities but it was an extra $13/day, so I ended up using the running trail around the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great rooms, terrific staff, beautiful grounds, good value”
Reviews.Author: AUFan73
Reviews.Content: My wife, grown daughter, and I stayed at Paradise Point for her spring break. We could not have picked a better place in San Diego. Just minutes north of the airport on Mission Bay, this location allows easy access to downtown, Sea World, the zoo, Coronado and all other area attractions; that is, if you really want to leave. We stayed in recently renovated, spotless, comfortable, quiet rooms on the bay beach with great sunset views (while having a glass of wine in our Adirondack chairs on our patios). The room price-point was very good. While free internet would have been nice, it was not a big issue. The extensive (44-acre), lush, garden-scaped grounds are immaculate and beautifully maintained and include a cool miniature golf course. The spacious, multiple heated pool areas are equipped with Jacuzzis and fire pits for evening relaxation. There is a full service, casual Barefoot Grill on the bay along with a marina where you can rent boats, paddle boards, etc. Also on the grounds is one of San Diego’s best fine dining establishments, Baleen, which is well worth a visit. I cannot say enough about the helpful and efficient staff. From the front desk, concierge, bell services, hotel phone operator, etc., every one of our requests was handled promptly, cheerfully and professionally (nice robes). We were unable to take advantage of the inviting spa services this trip. Overall, a superior experience. When we next visit San Diego, I cannot imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Camping Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: jkcain04
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the resort to a beautiful landscape, my husband and children and I were very excited. The first room we were assigned was dirty... dirty floors, dirt and hair in the beds and even bugs in the beds. Second room is where the thought of paradise started to feel more like camping. NO HEAT and very chilly nights bundled up like an eskimo. How kind the hotel offered us extra blankets??? Not to move us rooms or fix the heat as their repair man was not there. So in the freezing morning my thoughts flashed to a hot shower. OH and to my NOT so surprise, the shower didnt work either!!! They then moved us to another room ( so 3 out of 5 days was spent packing and unpacking) in which I required the manager inspect himself to be in working order. NO HEAT, NO SHOWER and DIRT N BUGS... Sounds like camping doesnt it? Not too mention the HIDDEN FEES: $25 daily parking fee and completely overpriced meals... For a couple omlets and some scrambled eggs... $60!!! Would never go back, such a shame for a beautiful place to be such a dissapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here.. can't wait to go back again next year!”
Reviews.Author: kebj
Reviews.Content: This was our first family trip vacation... and we searched countless different hotels and resorts that would fit our expectations for a first famiily trip vacation and so glad that we went with Paradise Point. We had a magnificent time in San Diego as well as our stay at Paradise Point. We stayed in the Lanai Garden Guestroom, which was really nice and clean. House keeping and workers were great. Our rooms were cleaned, beds were made, as well as new towels provided to us everyday. The beds were really comfortable and we got really good sleep every night. We won't be searching for any other hotels or resorts next time we go to San Diego because we have found the perfect place to stay at already! Can't wait to visit again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: Bobkatevan
Reviews.Content: Okay, let's start out with the good... beautiful grounds include a lagoon, bridges, tropical plants, nice pools, clean and updated rooms. They had campfires on the beach in the evening with tiki torches lighting the area. Very nice. However, even with all this good, my biggest complaint is thin walls. I don't want to hear the party next door, and I did, on both sides. Luckily, we got a decent crowd on both sides and they went to bed at decent hours and they were not partiers. I would predict however, some people would encounter these issues. They can fix cosmetic or other easier fixable items, but adding more insulation to their newly decorated rooms will not happen easily. There is a $25 parking fee to park your car, right outside your room and the bar and grill is pricey ($14) for order of nachos. We ate appetizers, two beers and one iced tea and our bill was $80. However the view was gorgeous, so your paying for the ambiance. It's very close to sea world and right next to Mission Bay Park, so location is wonderful. Beds were comfy. Rooms newly decorated and very clean. I would recommend, but warn friends of the thin walls.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: JeniSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed with the family and had just an awesome time! Our kids are still talking about the ducks. the room and landscaping were incredible. Definitely going back this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: kkmcan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Hotels.com and chose the std no view room. After staying one night we decided to ask how much it would be to upgrade to a bay front room. We were quoted an extra $45 per night for the same room we had but on the bay. We loved it and thought it was a great deal! So nice to walk out your door onto the sand. There was a fire pit right in front of our room and after a quick trip to the grocery store to get smores making supplies and wood we enjoyed the evening on the beach in front of a fire. Our kids had the time of their lives swimming in the gorgeous pool, doing the mini putt golf course and building sand castles on the beach. The $25 parking fee stinks but oh well, all San Diego hotels charge exhorborant parking fees. We also brought our own small coffeepot and took our coffee out to walk on the beach in the mornings. No need to even leave this resort. We came to relax and take advantage of the resort offerings and activities. Newly renovated rooms are gorgeous! Super clean, freshly painted with wonderful tile floors and beautiful furniture. We can't wait to go back- we miss our ocean paradise already!

Reviews.Title: “OMG the hidden charges are totally STUPID!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shage
Reviews.Content: So, here we are at the Paradise Point resort and spa in sunny San Diego! Ok place...DON'T TRUST THE RATES you get from Travelocity or other sites because the room rate is the least of your worries. How is $4 for a cup of coffee? No coffee in rooms, sorry. How about $10 a day for WIFI...and only a single PC can be on at a time (sorry, we have two people...only on can be on...and the first time you register the first PC, the MAC address of the WIFI card sticks to the username so forget ever having the second online). How about $25/night to park your rental car!!!???!!!?? NO KIDDING! So, think again about the price of this place. Plus there are ants and spiders EVERYWHERE in these ground-level rooms... Also, when you check in, you will be given the worst possible room with the worst possible view, farthest from the lobby. If you don't cry and whine, you will be listening to the highway; not the surf. I have never written a bad hotel review before...and I have written many good ones. I travel a lot for pleasure....DON'T stay here unless you know about the countless hidden fees and ruse staff. Also, they have these crappy little refrigerators that hum louder than the frequent helicopters...except the fridges never fricking stop. You will not sleep well unless you unplug the damn thing.

Reviews.Title: “Dude, it is 7:30AM. Stop drilling on my door.”
Reviews.Author: Phinaddict
Reviews.Content: So we arrive early afternoon, room is not ready yet. No worries, the front desk gal will call me when it is ready. She suggested lunch. Off we go. 5 minutes later, just as we pull out of the hotel grounds, the phone rings, " Sir, your room is ready". Uh, Ok, why not tell us it was going to be 5 minutes in the first place. So after lunch, we check in and are happy with the room and grounds. They did a great job at creating a unique resort. So the next morning, at 7:30 Am, we are awakened by the sound of a maintenance guy drilling our door and hammering with a chisel to replace the lockset on the door. Im laying in bed thinking, this is not the Paradise Resort and spa I was planning on. Like any red blooded male, I open the door and tell the guy in no uncertain terms he had better cease and desist or I will have my girlfriend kick his a#%. He split promptly. The rest of the stay was uneventful. Clean room, quiet and not crowded... Low season. Three days later at checkout, the young lady at the front desk was not too personable, maybe she had something else on her mind.... A week later, we had a billing question. I called at 7 pm. it took me four tries to reach the front desk. Once I had someone on the line and explained the issue, the woman corrected the problem and credited us but, like our checkout experience, she was almost rude. Having to pay $25.00 for parking, per day, and 10.00 per day for internet connection seemed like being robbed. In short, great property, poor staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, the rooms are a bit rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: tickets_money_go
Reviews.Content: The property is very nice, on an island in Mission bay. The rooms must have been built a very long time ago and show some signs of wear, we did have mold on the ceiling in the bathroom and the patio roof had wood rot. The decor in the room was nice. They do charge you $25 a night for parking. Over all I liked our stay at Paradise Point, the location is perfect you could almost walk to Sea World and it was fun exploring the beautifuly tropic property.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Relaxing, great all around resort.”
Reviews.Author: CJFCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I was greeted by very the efficient, pleasent front desk personnal. Check in went very speedy and since it was already dark was escorted to my bungalow by the bell service. He offered to unload my car however I declined as I was anxious to meet up with my group and start my weekend. My room was more than I expected. Very large and spacious with all new decor and located very close to the area we were given for our ladies weekend. We had a great stay most sleeping very little however I took advantage of having a room all to myself and throughly enjoyed my weekend away from the hussle and bussle of daily life. I have already booked my next stay which will be with family and friends over the Easter holiday.

Reviews.Title: “RELAX IN SAN DIEGO”
Reviews.Author: MatildaP
Reviews.Content: When I think of San Diego I think of this hotel. It is a paradise of trees, flowers and beauty. I would never consider any other place

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pieret1
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in San Diego. The hotel room was really beautiful. I heard the rooms were just renovated - They did a really great job. The grounds were really nice too. Everything was so clean and the staff always greeted you and were always so friendly if you had any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Grounds are stunning, rooms are hugely disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LFoley
Reviews.Content: My husband was attending a conference at Paradise Point, and I tagged along, I'd always wanted to visit San Diego, and this was a good chance. My first impression of the resort was "wow!" The grounds and lobby reminded me so much of our stay in Maui. Really beautiful. It all went downhill from there. Check-in took FOREVER because they were having a hard time finding a room that we could stay in for the duration of the conference as well as the weekend before which we had booked for our own enjoyment. The room itself was a big disappointment. Shabby describes it best. It was fairly clean, but other conference attendees were complaining about bugs and mold in their rooms. Housekeeping was unpredictable. One day we'd get one fresh towel, and the next day we'd get four. Sometimes the shampoos would get replaced, sometimes not. It was bizarre. What irritated me the most was the duck poop right in front of our door that never got cleaned off. The ducks are everywhere - which I don't mind at all - but they've got to stay on top of the poop and feathers, seriously. Our first evening there we decided to eat at the casual dining restaurant since we were both tired from the flight and didn't want to travel off-site. The service was inattentive, and they managed to completely mangle what could have been a nice filet mignon. It ended up more like a pot roast. I got a pedicure at the spa, and it was very nice. The spa is lovely, and my attendant was delightful. We enjoyed the enormous hot tub one evening, and that was very relaxing. The place is badly in need of an overhaul to the rooms. It's a shame to have such beautiful grounds and such neglected rooms like that.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Stay in San Diego yet!!”
Reviews.Author: karasmith731
Reviews.Content: I vacationed at the Paradise Point Hotel and Spa over Valentines Weekend and I can't say enough about my stay. I have been a guest at the Resort in the past and while my experience has ALWAYS been amazing, the new remodel was a VERY pleasant surprise! As always the service was amazing, every single request was reached with personalized service. We ate at the Baleen each night because every menu item is unique and delicious! We spent our days at the spa and having drinks at the very casual and well-priced Barefoot Bar and Grill and then we even rented a boat right from the bar through Action Sports Rentals. I cant wait to head back to San Diego and stay at the Paradise again.....there is always something new and pleasantly surprising!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl1211
Reviews.Content: The Paradise has been completely redone and it is AMAZING! My husband and I stayed here a few years ago and the hotel was incredible then but now, oh my goodness, it has been completely redone and looks phenomenal. The new furniture is so nice and all of the usual amenities and charm of the Paradise are still there...the staff is so friendly and helpful, the Spa is so relaxing, the food at Baleen is excellent, and of course, the location is the best. My husband and I feel like we're worlds away as soon as we step foot on property. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best - but ok value for the money I guess?”
Reviews.Author: chichichicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days at this hotel over Presidents Day weekend. Take this review with a grain of salt - we typicallly stay at Ritz Carltons. We picked this hotel because we were visiting a relative who lives very close by - and it was recommended. It was inexpensive - we had some package that i think the room ended up being around 150ish a nite. The room was large - there was a big sofa as well as a king sized bed. Unfortunately the first night the heating/air unit leaked a huge puddle of water and there were ants around the bath tub. I called maintenance in the morning. We returned home late at night (1030 pm) and the heating unit had been fixed but housekeeping had never come to the room. Unmade bed and wet towels. Ugh. I called the front desk (I was furious) and they offered to send housekeeping over. I turned that offer down - we were exhausted and wanted to go to bed. I told the person i would like to speak to a manager. She said a manager would not be in until 3 PM the next day. I said "have the manager call me so I can express my irritation with him/her. If i dont hear from him/her I will post it on trip advisor so they can read it there". Obviously I never got a call. The ants remained our entire stay - but they were only in/and around the tub so we didnt bother reporting them again. The restaurant Baleen is nice - we had a good dinner and good servcie there on valentines day. The service at the bar (at Balleen) is BAD. We stopped by one night for a drink. No one else was sitting at the bar. We asked to see a wine list. The bar tender gave us a list and then proceeded to rearrange the liquor bottles and also fill waiters orders (from the tables). I am not kidding - 10 minutes go by and his back was to us the entire time. Finally i say "excuse me sir - i am sorry - do we need to sit at a table to order a glass of wine?" I said it very nicely and of course he didnt get the fact that i was being sarcastic. He said "oh - you can order here what can i get you?" Whatever. At the casual restaurant by the water - i went there alone for breakfast one morning. I waitied 10 minutes for a menu - 10 minutes for coffee. The omelet was very good. Had to ask 3 people to find the waiter to get the check. There was plenty of staff - i guess they were hanging out in the kitchen talking to each other. The place wasnt crowded - no excuse. The internet service at the business center is afortune. If i recall it was like 9 bucks for 15 minutes . Ridiculous. They charge 25 bucks a nite to park there. The workout room was pretty nice and not crowded. The have a multi -use pass that they dont tell you about - but it is much cheaper than the stated fee of 12 bucks a day.I think it was 35 bucks for 5 visits - and two people can share the pass. I hope this is helpful. I dont usually stay in hotels like this so maybe this is what you get for 150 per nite. It is NOT as nice as the sister property in Naples. Not even close.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal, Great Place”
Reviews.Author: PoolsandWiFi
Reviews.Content: The grounds are Hawaiin style and gorgeous. The updated room number 132 was situated between the adult pool and pool with two gas fire pits for communal chatting and smore making. The restaurants and boat rentals were all comparable. The bay is clean and calm, a nice break from the wicked ocean winds while we were there. The ducks are incredible. Yes, the are cheeky, especially the Grandma and Grandpa Mallards but that added to the experience. It is not a Best Western with all the free stuff. But on travelzoo we got $100 on weeknights and $129 on weekends, half the price of more of comparable hotels on the bay or the beach. Within 5 minutes of Sea World, Ocean Beach, and Pacific Beach, tons of restaurants, and not in a very complicated area. People with bay beach firepits would come to the gas firepits due to ease and no smoke. We did not get charged for parking. I am happy but not sure why. I had planned it in. That is standard on close to the water places. If you love incredible landscaping and garden style apartment versus high rise, you will like this place. We ended up doing christine's day spa in pacific beach for less money for three people than one treatment for one. Highly recommend that trick to save money. Not super posh but the effect is the same. There are huge conference areas. They could easily have three large events at one time. There were a few weddings and one conference while we were there in four days. Nice patio on room 132. Not all patios are created equal in privacy but they all have them.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: RAKSAM
Reviews.Content: Good location for the business I had to do. Great amenities, friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point provided an unexpected first quality Tahiti Like resort experience minutes from the city.”
Reviews.Author: CarriageKansasCity
Reviews.Content: I was personally surprised with the quality of the rooms (private villas), the food was exceptional, atmosphere casual, service fantastic and prices were right. Anyone traveling to San Diego for buisness or pleasure should stay here. Rick Miller

Reviews.Title: “Rotten Valentine's Experience - Worst Hotel Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: tikisuz
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Paradise Point before for a conference and decided to give it a shot for a romantic weekend stay. First, there was someone's room service tray strewn on the lawn in front of our room when we checked in at 2PM. After going out to dinner and coming back to the hotel around 9, the dirty dishes and napkins were still on the lawn. I went to the front desk and complained that this wasn't the quality I would expect from this place. They apologized and guess what, it was still there the next morning. Also, around 7:30AM on the morning after Valentine's Day, we woke up to the sound of a leaf blower outside our room. Seriously, what a romantic morning? Ugh. Another call to the front desk and the ambitious gardening was halted until after 8AM. We also ventured to the grill for dinner on Monday night and food was pretty sub-par on top of being expensive. The location is great and the resort is a great idea, but it's currently poorly executed. I'd compare this with a 2-star experience for a 4-star price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 5-day Getaway...”
Reviews.Author: sunshine0213
Reviews.Content: Needing a break from the frozen tundra, we headed west to San Diego. We stayed at Paradise Point Resort & Spa for 5 nights and loved it. This tropical island resort offers a variety of activities…so many that we didn’t get a chance to do all of them in our short stay…5 pools, a beautiful sandy beach, lawn games, volleyball, and even a full-service marina offering water activities. Our garden bungalow was very private and only a few steps away from the breathtaking views of the bay. I enjoyed relaxing on the patio after a long day…very peaceful admist the lush tropical gardens. The rooms were luxurious, comfortable, and kept very clean. The staff was always very helpful and polite. Conveniently located within minutes of many San Diego attractions including Old Town, Sea World, and the Zoo. This is a wonderful place for couples and families. I am excited to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Sad Vacation”
Reviews.Author: 2xlr890
Reviews.Content: Nicely remodeled but the tile floors need throw rugs because they are ice cold. Hard to believe that a hotel of this cost doesn't even give you a micro wave or coffee maker.Great location wonderful lay out. The heater/air conditioner made so much noise we had to have it off during cold weather when trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for all..”
Reviews.Author: gogirl40
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times and enjoy it. The last time we scored an amazing room rate (usually $200+ a night, was only $99) and I noticed a few changes... no coffee in the room, less amenities, overall not as high-end. Perhaps with the economy in the current state they are trying to appeal to larger crowd. The rooms are a bit outdated but comfortable. The restaurants are fun especially in the summer months when there is live music (I heard they cut the live music last summer because of the economy.) Love movie night by the pool. Love feeding the ducks. Enjoyed the Fine Dinning restaurant. Can get VERY crowded especially on Holiday weekends and beware of the jellyfish! The Bayside rooms are the best.

Reviews.Title: “The renovated rooms were nice, but the bathroom was a bit dirty.”
Reviews.Author: tropicalM
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this resort for Thanksgiving last year. We had the garden-view room. The room was renovated nicely - nice hard wood floors and nice beds. Our "private" garden was amazing. However, some parts of the room still showed how old/run-down the room used to be. The walls and the bar/counter area were dated. The microwave and the fridge were a joke (but at least we got to use them for free). The bathroom was the least satisfactory. The bathroom had an open sink area with a closed shower/toilet area. The sink area wasn't too bad - it was bright - but the floor tiles felt dirty. The shower/toilet area was very problematic because it was VERY small. The water in our toilet kept running. The trade-off for a room like this is that you do get bugs inside. We saw some interesting insects and a few spiders...! All the renovations were done INSIDE the rooms - meaning the exterior of each room still looks like public washrooms you see in any parks. BUT - make sure you visit their ballroom area. Man, that was one of the NICEST ballrooms I've ever seen! It was very pretty and beautifully decorated. Only if the rooms were like that... Definitely over-priced. I'd say it's a 3-star resort that should only cost $90/night, including parking.

Reviews.Title: “A rip-off”
Reviews.Author: LACat
Reviews.Content: Two words: tourist trap. The decor is reminiscent of Disney World's Polynesian Village. Gag. Horrible customer service. Check-in took forever. There was a wedding party in front of us trying to check in. The bride-to-be was frantic. The front desk service did not seem to care. There is no disclosure of the parking fees, which are about $20/day. A 'valet' in a golf cart will insist on escorting you to your "cabin". Let him, because otherwise you will never find your room. The layout is confusing and there is NO signage. But be prepared to tip this guy. Although we reserved a double room ,we got a Queen bed with a pull-out sofa. When we complained to management, they rudely told us that because we made the reservation via a "discount site" (Priceline) they did not guarantee the "type" of room, only that it could "sleep two". The location was not convenient to any other areas of San Diego, either. Don't waste your time or your money here.

Reviews.Title: “New rooms are incredible!”
Reviews.Author: threeplustwo
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed with our 3 kids. we stayed in a brand new room on the bay and it was out of this world/ i felt like we were in Hawaii at a fraction of the cost. The service was first class and we will return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: SaddleRock2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paradise Point many years ago and WOW has it changed! I remember it being a nice beach themed resort with some much needed TLC and I was thrilled with their newly renovated rooms. The room I had was designed with a kind of Balinese feel and it was gorgeous. Fantastic beds and large TV's. The lovely grounds are still beautifully kept. Walking around at night with the tiki torches lit up...it feels like Hawaii!. The Spa is fantastic (Ask for Lia for a facial and Annette for a hot stone massage). It is small, intimate and also has a Balinese feel. The restaurant is great (Baleen) and I can imagine what it wold be like in the warmer month to sit outside on the deck and watch the boats go by. All in all a great hotel and I was surprised how close it was to the airport. If you like big boxy hotels there are plenty of Hiltons and Hyatts around but Paradise Point is truly unique.

Reviews.Title: “great destination for families”
Reviews.Author: ZeppelinTSi
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time there. The rooms aren't the greatest, but we stayed on the Lagoon side and the view was AMAZING! Bring plenty of money to feed the ducks, they are lots of fun!

Reviews.Title: “The resort was more than I could imagine in comfort and beauty”
Reviews.Author: cookie4962
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego doing the 60 mile walk for breast cancer. Our team staed at the resort. The service and accomidations were impecible. Each day after the walk it was so convenient to only have to cross one more street and with so many pools and jacuzzis we had plenty of room. The food was wonderful. Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “Very dark and tired MOTEL”
Reviews.Author: KarBear03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the PP/SD November 26&27, 2009. I received a $77.00 per night rate on priceline.com. I will say after receiving my hotel confirmation from priceline I came right here to Trip Advisor for the reviews and I was not happy with what I was reading. :( We arrived Thanksgiving a.m. and Front Desk clerk checking me in states that they had me down for 2 queens. I then requested 1 king and she told me she was going to give us a complimentary upgrade to the king with a view. We were excited!!!!!!!! The bellhop had us follow him over to a room in the 500 block. UPGRADE this was NOT. It was a very dark and tired room with ONE queen bed. I called the FD clerk from the phone in the room and she informed me that this was my complimentary upgrade.....confused by going from 2 queens to one king to a DARK DREARY ROOM with ONE QUEEN BED, I then requested to be DOWNGRAGED. She informed me that getting a king was impossible on the holiday weekend. I told her she JUST told me she was UPGRADING us to a king room with a view. She said she could not help me BUT that she could give us the room with 2 queens. I requested to SEE that room. I asked FD clerk about this room, does it have at least a view. FD clerk told me she does NOT know what the different rooms look like and I was to ask the bellhop. I turned to Keith, the bellhop, btw, who was an extremely nice young man, and told him FD clerk does not know the room and she said YOU would know the room with the 2 queens. He nodded and told me he did know this room (now in the 100 block) was newly renovated BUT no view at all, nothing, just the parking space for our car. We went and looked at the room and yes it was newly renovated. We decided to take this room AS we had plans and were meeting people and had to get going. I tipped Keith nicely as he was very helpful. Upon using the bathoom in our room, the door FELL OFF.....yes, indeed. I went outside to the parking lot and called to a hotel personel driving around on a golf cart and she called for an "engineer" to come fix the door which they did! There is nothing in the room. No coffee maker, no hair dryer, no water, no DO NOT DISTURB sign to hang on your door. There is a free fridge in the room, which we loved. The bed was VERY comfortable. The walls are PAPER THIN. We could hear both families on either side of us very clearly. Check out is at NOON, at 9:30am on the morning of our check out, housekeeping was knocking on our door very loudly wanting to know when we plan on checking out. They woke us up with all their noise. My husband told them we will be leaving at NOON. Parking is $25.00 per night. Check out is easily done on TV. Paradise Point is like a MOTEL as you drive up and park in front of your room. We did not enjoy our stay here at all. Thankfully, we only slept here. We went to OLD TOWN San Diego and that is fabulous. Many shops and wonderful homemade Mexican food. While there we ate at both Old Town Mexican Grille and Coyote Cafe. A+ for both. We also spent all day Friday at Torry Pines State Reserve and hiked throughout all their trails. A+. We drove to Rancho Santa Fe and Del Mar and did some sightseeing. All in all in was a wonderful weekend with friends and family. Paradise Point gets a C+ from me.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise, not!”
Reviews.Author: galshepherd
Reviews.Content: This place is far from a paradise... Amenities??? aside from the pools and hot tubs, everything else is mediocre and or highly priced. Parking $25 p/ day??? No coffee maker or bottled water in the rooms, come on!!! Mildew all over the room, shower tile old and tasteless, let's not talk about the tub! Nothing like what you see online, very disapointing. I guess the resort could look like a paradise until you enter their rooms. Extremely disappointed about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Vin004
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right across the street from Sea World and right on Mission Bay. The grounds are beautiful. The rooms themselves are big, but the furniture and interior felt a bit tired. Great pool. The daily parking charge seems a bit unfair since the grounds are huge and there is no other parking options.

Reviews.Title: “Awful room”
Reviews.Author: dockster
Reviews.Content: The grounds were beautiful. And our kids loved the pool. The food was very expensive, but really good. Our room, however, was tiny, outdated and musty smelling....more like a motel. Within 15 minutes of being in the room our children's feet turned black. Absolutely disgusting. The shower curtain also had mold spots on it and the beds/pillows were horrible. The baby crib also had a terrible, musty smell. For the cost of the room (very expensive given it was a holiday weekend), I did expect a nicer room, but most of all I expected a clean one.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: roq21
Reviews.Content: We really loved it here, so many pools and you can walk around inside the resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “One word: RIPOFF”
Reviews.Author: brasskitten
Reviews.Content: Here's a brief list of the things you must pay for in addition to the room charges: internet ($10/day/computer), parking ($25/day), poorly-equipped gym ($12/day/person), 3.50 per cup of coffee at kiosk (no maker in room). There is, however, a small bar fridge in the room. So you can manage a cold breakfast without having to pay through the nose at the "resort" restaurants. There are five pools, but none of them are over three feet deep. Ample lawn chairs near pool area. The rooms are dark, dank, and musty-smelling. Our toilet started leaking from the base when we turned on the shower. This is more like an old motel rather than a resort. Unless you are here for a conference, it's best to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: B_Family03
Reviews.Content: I hosted out-of-town guests at Paradise Point Resort this weekend. As a local resident, I highly recommend this hotel. The service staff members throughout the resort are excellent! My friends thought the room accommodations were lovely. The bathroom had been remodeled. The carpet and furnishings were clean and attractive. In the evening, the resort roads are lined with tiki-torches. The grounds of this resort are beautiful. The main pool is even better than the web site photos. We enjoyed roasting marshmallows over a bonfire situated next to the pool. The hotel staff lit the gas bonfire pits as a courtesy service. We also had the option to build a bonfire on the beach overlooking the bay. The parking fee of $25/day guaranteed that our car was within just a few steps of your room. Thumbs up to anyone who is considering making a reservation at this hotel. My special thanks to Janeice from San Diego Consierge for the discounted room rate.

Reviews.Title: “This place is truly awful.”
Reviews.Author: cambridgeTravelor
Reviews.Content: The reviews here are correct. I unfortunately got this room via priceline. When I checked in, I asked for a clean room, and was given instead their usual worst offering for priceline customers. The carpets were both stained and dirty and the bathroom had bugs and the paint was peeling in the stained tub. I was too exhausted so I stayed in this "patio" room for 1 night. Plus the staff at the desk was being rude to an elderly lady when I checked in, so I figured I shouldn't bother complaining. BTW patio rooms on the website are described as "all marble" but I think there are several rooms they give to hotwire/priceline people and they do not have marble anywhere in sight. For the second night of my stay, I asked for a better room, sighting the stains and was given a "garden" room. This did have an updated bathroom. The marble had seen better days, but it was clean, and there was minimal mold. The carpets in the second room were stained, but looked clean otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, think twice, it's just another day ... in Paradise (Point)”
Reviews.Author: AZBluebird
Reviews.Content: Booked one bedroom bungalow ($500 for three nights) that turned out to be on lake/pond. Kids enjoyed feeding ducks - I didn't enjoy avoiding what came out the other end of the ducks. I appreciate the fact that the rooms are due for an upgrade, however, the standard was very poor. Bathroom needed demolishing - paint was poor standard, bath had seen better days, screws left in wall where handrail had been, saw a few bugs. As others have mentioned, the furniture paintwork has the distressed look - which doesn't help the overall distressed look of the room. Fridge in closet tried its best to work. The beds were very uncomfortable and squeaked at any opportunity (my wife is currently attempting to re-align her spine and pelvis due to the mattress). $25 a day for parking is a complete rip off, especially when someone parks in your space for the night. We reported it and were not charged for parking for that day. Looks like the place boosts its income on weddings and corporate functions as it was full on both evenings of the weekend. 'Resort' staff were friendly and did what they could to rectify issues. I think the housekeeping staff do a great job to keep the rooms as clean as they are under the circumstances. Very disappointing considering the glamorous website and location.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: gpayne3
Reviews.Content: we had a relaxing time at the resort.This time of year not very crowded.The room was a beachfront suite with a nice view of Mission Bay.The room was clean but could use some upgrading in the bath area.25.00 for parking seemed like a lot of money

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Lost”
Reviews.Author: BrunoBrody
Reviews.Content: If you go here hoping for a clean, serene, resort-like atmosphere you will be sorely disappointed. It felt like a campground. The pictures on their web-site are highly misleading. The room's are old and dirty. The furniture is cheap and worn. The room's air conditioning unit was loud and rattling. The bed was uncomfortable and the bedding was old and coarse. I didn't feel comfortable walking around barefoot in the room and there were insects in the bathroom. We paid extra for a bay-side room and the minute we walked out onto the terrace we knew that was a mistake too. We had no privacy. While sitting on our patio, we had people sitting 10 feet to the right and left of us without any separation. Kids were running by us and there were empty cups and bottles littering the area in front of our terrace. How they get away with advertising this place as a 'resort and spa' is beyond me. We were traveling without our children for the first time and this was NOT the quiet, secluded atmosphere we were told it was. We left after the first night and would warn anyone to stay far away. The accommodations were sub-Super 8 and the price was 4 times as much.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelersagain
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this resort. I had read some bad reviews, so i was actually on guard. But our room was great. Freshly painted, great carpeting. Everything one could expect. We did joke that the paint was peeling off the furniture, but it was "antiqued" and in perfect condition. The only negative is that they chrge you 25.00 per day for parking, even though there is a multitude of spaces on their fabulous grounds. I wish they would just include tha in the room price to be more accurate. Oh well. It seems like this is a trend. Didn't try the restaurant, but our friends had. They said it was expensive, but really well worth it. i wouldn't hesitate booking tthis fabulous property.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise it is NOT!”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelled87
Reviews.Content: Not sure how anyone could give this resort high marks for the grounds, the rooms or the amenities. They would either have to be on the payroll or they are not well travelled. Given what we believed to be the amenities of the resort, our intention was to stay a week and travel around So California from there - knowing there would always be plenty to do right on the resort grounds. I saw the resort on TLC's Jon & Kate Plus 8 and given Kate's stated penchant for clean, we had high expectations. The place is filthy. The grounds are neglected. There are potholes in the crazy roads that take you around th resort. The rooms are dark, dingy, old, tattered. We had a ferrell cat sitting outside our door on arrival. It was just yucky. We were taken aback by the amonia/urine smell as we entered the lobby to check in. That was the first clue but we decided to proceed. The first room we were given was in front of the main pool with a sandy beach (why this is necessary given their private beach is beyond me. It just makes the pool a dirty, sandy experience). The bathroom had been updated but the floors were dirty with hair and sand, the rest of the room was painted a brash yellow and the furniture - which they call 'distressed' looked like it came from Walton's mountain. The tv was an old 36", there was no coffee pot in the room (you have to schlep to an outdoor vendor cart in the morning to get coffee), and the smell of mold was overwhelming. They graciously offered to move us. I have nothing to say about the staff we encountered. They clearly know that they are the only thing that would keep a guest at the facility. So, we felt as another family did that they try hard to be pleasant. The next room was larger but overall in worse shape. The yellow paint must have been a bargain because it is everywhere. We were afraid to walk on the carpets in bare feet so we put on socks. We put a towel on the floor of the tub so we did not have to touch the dingy, dirty bottom. The black on the socks was something I had never experienced anywhere. But it was the hair on the bathtowel and the bugs we found on the bath curtain that had us spend a day of our vacation in Paradise visiting other area hotels. There are great resorts nearby and they were a better value. We stayed in Torrey Pines and LOVED it. The hotel is going to undergo renovation but I would suggest that the housekeeping and grounds staff will not likely be renovated. So, if you get in early ... right after the renovation, your experience may be much different. (Though the pictures of the renovation showed that they were keeping the yellow paint which tells me they will not be truly rehabilitating the place but rather putting in new furniture.) I will bet that after one season of tourists, the place will already look worn. There is no way to mask mold, mildew and dirt.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded, Private, Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: UpANDatEm
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend here once, grounds are beautiful, private, and lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Another week in "paradise"”
Reviews.Author: welshvacationer
Reviews.Content: We returned to "Paradise Point" two years after our last wonderful visit (Sept); this time it was better than ever. The staff were very helpful especially the receptionist Priscilla who worked hard to get our three rooms close together in the orchid area. Everywhere was clean and well maintained. and made for a very relaxing vacation. The hotel is well placed for seeing the sights of San Diego,visiting the beach and for restaurants. We hope to return in a few years to see all thye renovations taking place over the next six months.

Reviews.Title: “The bad reviews are mostly true, just know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: WillOrangeCounty_CA
Reviews.Content: I recommend asking for a clean room. When they knew we had read the bad reviews here, they gave us a clean room that was still pretty worn, as they all must be. Our refrigerator barely worked and was loud. The room key lock was messed up. They try to keep up good service, apparently because it costs them little extra to coach the employees. It is obvious they won't spend a penny right now on the rooms. The grounds are very nice, which puts it above all the other Mission Bay resorts for me. But one more complaiint - they nickel and dime like a luxury resort, but the luxury isn't there. Example - it's $10 per person to play the little mini golf course (grass only, no fairytale houses, etc.) Ok, fine, but the course is not kept up very well. But the location is outstanding, so if you want to go there, I'd wait for the renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point - a great family getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Seinard
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. The furniture and rooms are a bit dated but the common areas and the grounds are the best we've seen. Pools are wonderful. Not terribly impressed by the Barefoot Bar & Grill but would try it again. January was awesome here but the warmer months would be incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation at Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: jazzinj
Reviews.Content: Really late posting of this review, sorry! I will post pictures too at a later date, I took a lot of pictures of the place just for TA. So here's the (long) review: I booked my family (2 adults and 2 children) into the Paradise Point Resort in March 2009 - I came across their website through my searches for beachfront properties in San Diego, and there was a 48 hour online sale ($207 a night for a bayside 1br bungalow suite). It seemed like a great deal, especially with a full bay view, and a great location, so I booked it right away. The website showed a beautiful resort and rooms. Then I started reading the reviews and got worried, but I was still getting a really good price for a bayview room. I called the resort to ask some questions and raise my concerns about what I had read in the reviews. I called the 1-800 number, the reservations desk forwarded me to the concierge (thinking I wanted to ask questions about activities at the resort). The concierge told me that he would get the manager to call me back and talk to me - the manager (Joe) called me within 10 minutes. I expressed my concerns about the reviews I read (cleanliness, bugs, condition of rooms), he told me that while the rooms are older, the rooms were clean. I asked about the parking costs and he reduced it from $22 a day to $12 a day. I asked a few more questions and felt comfortable with his responses. We stayed at Paradise Point Resort from March 12 to March 19. I've tried to put all the details that we experienced while staying in this resort in this review, so it's really long... We arrived in the evening, around 8:30pm. When we arrived, there was one person at the front desk, and the lobby was empty. He was courteous and friendly and checked us into our room. He also gave me a card (it was a birthday greeting card from the resort, I mentioned that it was my husband's birthday when I called to ask questions). The front desk clerk (Jarrod) mentioned that the manager (Joe) had put us in one of the nicer bayside bungalows. The bellman showed us to our bungalow (he drove a golf cart and we followed him in our rental car). He opened our door for us and helped us with our luggage. We had bayside bungalow #542 (3rd from the last one on the street). The first thing the we did was whip out our cameras and take pictures of everything so I could post it in this review :) The 1br bungalow was clean, bright and really nice. The bar/kitchen area had a mini-fridge, sink, microwave, and coffee maker with complimentary coffee. There was a side table and metal ice bucket too. All were clean and ready for use - just note that it was more of a bar area than a kitchen. There are no utensils, or cooking things, or dishes, nor do they advertise it as such - we knew what to expect, so we came prepared with disposable cutlery and dishes and paper towel. The dining/living room area was nice and open, dining for four, with a large patio window overlooking the cove, two chairs and one ottoman in the living room area, storage coffee table with some magazines on top, two side tables with lamps, and a double sofa bed. There was an older but functional tv in a cabinet with drawers in the living room, and a similar set up in the bedroom. The drawers were clean. There was a newer wall air conditioner/heater unit in the living room and in the bedroom. The bathroom was an interesting design - there were two sink areas with large countertops (one in the bedroom, one in the living room) sandwiching the toilet and bathtub which had doors on both sides so that it was accessible through the living room or through the bedroom, and there was a big closet next to each of the sink areas, with two luggage stands - we could have used more hangers, but we made do (I didn't call and ask for more). The bedroom was big, with a king sized bed (nice bedding), and small bench at the foot of the bed, night tables, digital clock radio, phone, and lamps. The sink areas and kitchen areas were well lit, the bedroom was only lit by the side table lamps, the dining room and living room had adequate lighting, and the toilet/bathtub area had dim lighting with noisy fans. Everything was clean, I did check the corners and base mouldings (from reading one of the reviews), and they could have been cleaned a little better, but they weren't filthy. The carpet was clean but older. The distressed furniture style and mismatched furniture style doesn't quite match - it doesn't match the nice granite kitchen and sink countertops, or the crown moulding and chair railing, or the bedroom linens. The toilet and bathtub are old but clean. The towels were white, we had enough for 4 - they weren't very soft and plush because they're the ribbed kind, but they looked newer. There was gel soap bars in the sink areas and an oatmeal soap bar for the bathtub, as well as shampoo, conditioner, and something else (either lotion or body wash). Outside the front door we had a great view of the bay, and we had two outdoor chairs and table. The buildings are older, but we felt pretty good walking into our unit and checking it out. While we were taking pictures, we received a phone call. It was a clerk from the resort, welcoming us and asking whether everything was to our satisfaction. We mentioned that one of the bedroom lamps needed a new lightbulb, and within 5 minutes a maintenance man came and replaced the bulb. The sofabed is not very padded and you can feel every spring in it - it sagged in the middle a little, too - when I had asked the manager about it when I called the month prior (I saw some reviews mention how uncomfortable the sofabed was), he did mention that they could bring something to pad it more for us if we wanted. I would have called to ask for that, but the kids didn't once complain about it, slept well throughout the entire trip, and the only complaining was more about who was hogging more of the bed. I don't know how they slept on it - I tried it out just to see, and there was no way I would have had a comfortable sleep on it - but it worked for them. Our king sized bed was really comfortable, I slept really well all week. Bugs - I did find a centipede crawling on the air conditioning unit in the bedroom on our first evening, but we didn't see any other bugs in the unit until after our 3rd day there. It isn't surprising, though - by that time we had walked on the beach and tracked in some sand, we were using the kitchen area and had fruit and food items there, and we bought firewood to use in the firepits in the evening and they were inside behind the front door - plus, when housekeeping comes to clean, they leave the door open because they leave their cart outside while they clean. All in all, in 7 days, we saw 1 centipede, 3 spiders, and around 30 ants - the first time we saw some ants on the ceiling in the kitchen area (after day 3) - I left a message for housekeeping about it and they cleaned the walls, ceiling, floors, etc (it was pretty evident that they did). the next couple of days there weren't that many ants, just a straggler here and there, but then my kids found a bunch of them crawling on the floor in the closet where we kept all our shoes - which is why I suspect that we tracked them in with our sandals and slippers from the beach. I left a message for housekeeping to please clean the closet areas, and they did. Usually I'm quite phobic about bugs, but these were tiny little ants and they didn't really bother me - the spiders were small house ones. The kids actually enjoyed finding the ants in the closet. Our unit was a short walk to the nearest firepit on the beach in the cove, so it was a bit of a chore to lug the heavy patio chairs to and from the firepits as well as the firewood and supplies, but it was better to be where we were because it was a quieter unit being closer to the end and not being directly in front of the firepits and beach. We bought our firewood from the nearest Von's (the Island Market was selling firewood at just over double the cost of Von's), but we bought the Smores kit from the Island Market for $22 because it included the long wood sticks to cook the marshmallows. We enjoyed an open fire for three of the nights that we were there - the kids had fun playing on the beach in the dark and making Smores. They even caught some tiny baby fish or shrimp (not sure if these were baby grunions) the size of the eye of a needle when they scooped up water from the shoreline. We didn't have a problem securing the closest firepit on all three occasions, even though the entire resort was booked (and the firepits technically are public use). Each unit only has 2 patio chairs, so I called housekeeping and asked them for two folding chairs - the fellow who came couldn't find any but brought me two conference type chairs to use - they were just fine, and we kept them for the entire trip to use out on the beach. Our unit was also directly in front of the tennis courts and bike rental place, so we just walked across and rented a quad bike for just over half an hour and biked around the resort - the kids really enjoyed that. We used the main pool once, in the evening - there's not much lighting, and to me the pool didn't seem very warm, I was freezing, but my kids didn't seem to have a problem and happily swam about for over an hour. We did find one of the filters had come off and notified one of the maintenance crew. I didn't use the hot tub because there were a bunch of young adults using it (being spring break), but it seemed really nice. We got to the main pool by calling the front desk and asking them to send a cart over to our unit - it arrived in just 2 minutes. The walk from our unit to the pool wasn't really far, but in our slippers and suits at night it was better to hitch a ride. We also got a ride back from the pool. When we were dropped off my door key card stopped working, luckily we were able to flag the cart driver to let us into our unit - the next day we got new key cards. I called to ask for robes, and they brought us two large fluffy robes to use (only one size, XL), they were really warm and comfortable but they were really old and showed their wear. We hung out on the beach in the cove for one day for a couple of hours. The kids had fun playing in the sand and exploring the rocks down the way, looking for little crabs. The sand did have a lot of broken sea shells, and my daughter found a piece of broken glass, but other than that everything else was fine - the kids were running around the beach barefoot and didn't seem to have any problems. It was really nice being so close to the beach and cove from our room, we had leisurely breakfasts looking out at the view every day. SeaWorld is just a two minute drive from the resort. We decided to walk the distance - it just seemed so silly to be so close and drive two minutes to pay another $10 in parking and then have to walk in from the parking lot. My kids are 10 and 6 - and with a bag full of lunch, snacks and water, and a bag with warmer clothes for the evening, we walked from the resort, across the little bridge on Ingraham Road that separated the resort from SeaWorld, and up to the front of SeaWorld - it took us 15 minutes door to door each way. The walk was actually really nice because we walked pass Ski Beach and park, took in the view, we got to look down at some boats and fishermen when we were walking across the bridge, as well as some birds, and before we knew it we were there. On the walk back, we chatted about all the things we saw at SeaWorld, and it really made the time pass quickly. There's a view tower near the lobby and pool, we went up there on our last day, you can't really see much through the bars at the top, but on each stair landing you can get a good view of the pond and the pool. The spa is next to the main pool, the treatment costs are really extravagant, we didn't try any. We did not try out their restaurants since we bought food to eat in, and also ate out of the resort.
