We didn't have time to try out the mini golf, either, but we saw a lot of people out enjoying it. We also saw people enjoying the tennis courts, too. We checked out early in the morning, there was one person at the front desk, the lobby was empty again, and she printed out my receipt and that was it - she didn't ask me how my stay was, but was friendly and courteous. All in all we had a fabulous stay, all the staff were friendly and helpful and met our needs every time, housekeeping cleaned our room well every day and met all our requests (extra towels, extra coffee). I can only comment on the 1br bayside bungalow that we got (room 542) - and although it does show its wear in places, some parts of the room were updated and the overall atmosphere was comfortable and relaxing, and it was very functional for us. I'm really happy that we experienced this resort and even happier that our experience was one of the good ones. One note - as much as we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and experience at Paradise Point Resort, I would say we got our money's worth (based on the price we paid) - I wouldn't have stayed there for full price, and after looking at the rest of the resort, I definitely wouldn't stay anywhere but in a bayside 1br bungalow - the whole point was to have the view and the beach, the other areas seemed gloomy and backed onto parking lots, roads, and other units. And I agree that the parking fee is unnecessary and should just be incorporated in the cost of the room, but I was satisfied with a discounted rate, better than nothing! I also think that they should just have a shuttle to SeaWorld, it's sooooo close!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise it is not!”
Reviews.Author: SL01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paradise Point Spa & Resort Aug 14-16, 2009. . We stayed in what they call their Bayside Bungalow, which opens up on to the Bay. This was one of the reasons we booked this room because we have two children and thought it would be great for them to be able to play on the sand in front of our room. How wrong we were! The Bay is dirty and is never cleaned, so all the crap from the bay gets washed up on shore and is just left there. There is no way the children could have played on the sand. It was nice to look at from the room but that's about it. The room itself needed lots of updating. We paid over $600 a night for the room and they couldn't even supply two beds. The pull out sofa bed in the living room was broken and it was the most uncomfortable night's sleep we've ever had (had to sleep on it with one of the children). The bath tub and bathroom itself were so outdated it wasn't even funny. We had a wet bar in the living room and the sink drain was rusty and disgusting. When these things were brought to the staff's attention, they didn't seem to care. The hotel was very busy over the weekend and there seemed to be a lot of people staying there but I for one will not be returning. I would much rather have paid an extra $200 a night and stayed at a real luxury hotel as opposed to this has been!Oh, and they charge you $25 per day to park outside your bungalow. The main parking lot is only a 5 minute walk, so I would definitely use that and forego the added expense

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN - Nickel & Dime you to DEATH!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beach2Mountain
Reviews.Content: DONT STAY HERE!!!! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!!! They nickel & dime you with costs (parking / putt-putt rental / internet ) Rooms are marginal at best!!! When you need service, it may or may not come! If you choose to stay here, you have been warned - You will likely end up writing your report right above mine!

Reviews.Title: “Left early...super depressing”
Reviews.Author: tripboss09
Reviews.Content: After waiting for a very long time to stay at this resort I was so disappointed. My room was so bad - very old - bathtub had been painted and was peeling. Carpet was old and stained. No coffee pot in the rooms - needed to get up in the morning and wait in line to pay mega bucks for a cup of coffee - Free newspaper delivered to your room...NOT!!!! Not enough hot water for 2 showers. Took a shower and floor was flooded - $25.00 per night to park your car - All of this to be told they were remodeling in 2010 - no kidding - wish I knew I was booking at a very dated hotel. After being gone all day walked into a room that had not been touched - I left. Major disappointment. $10.00 per day for the internet....Yikes!!!

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotels offer more than this "resort" hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandshells
Reviews.Content: I'll make this brief: no coffee maker, no lotion, old blue springy warped mattress in a 1970's pull-out couch was our "second bed". Room had a convalescent home smell. GROSS. The parking fee of $24.00 was a slap in the face. I'd seriously NOT go to this hotel unless you get a rock bottom deal on Hotwire or Priceline. The only good thing was the location- you could walk to Seaworld across the street. Grounds were green/tropical...but listen folks, when you stay at a hotel, you sleep INDOORS and your environment inside should be up to par, which this was not.

Reviews.Title: “Was very nice”
Reviews.Author: mikemclaug
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised after reading many negative reviews before my stay. The room, 215 was very clean, brightly painted, and opened directly (patio) onto the bay sand beach. I never heard any noise from my neighbors rooms which were occupied with families with kids; the walls were not thin as other reviews stated. Our bed (king) was comfortable with nice bedding materials. The couch (clean and fairly new) opened into a standard queen bed; not adult comfortable, but fine for kids and teens. The only negatives were- $25 per day for parking in your assigned space next to your room, and $10 per day internet access. They waived my internet fees after I showed them their resort brochure, which implys it to be an included resort feature.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great fun even on business!”
Reviews.Author: HappyVacationer78
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about staying at the Paradise. I saw great things on the Jon and Kate episodes but was discouraged by travel reviews.... I have to say when I arrived I was very happy! The grounds are beautiful and spacious and the people were super friendly. The rooms were separated from each other and sort of like your own little "house". While they weren't extremely modern (and by this I mean the furniture..) they were spacious and comfortable. My room as well as my co-workers rooms were all super clean. The resort had one major pool area along with little pool areas around the property spread out at different locations. Each pool area was also equipped with a hot tub! I thought this was great!! We had dinner a couple of nights at the Barefoot grille which was also good and the drinks were fantastic!! I suggest the GREEN MONKEY!! you will be hooked! :) We also rented a motor/ speed boat right at the resort. This was so much fun and worth every penny! We were able to cruise along Mission Bay right up to Sea World and got to catch a bit of one of the shows! The hotel is super convenient to Sea World, the airport and only about 10 minutes from downtown/ gaslamp district. The ocean and beach are steps away and beautiful views are everywhere! We also visited the hotels spa. The spa is spacious and clean. I got both a massage and indulged in the Margareta pedicure. I will tell you the massage (Swedish) was worth every penny... however the pedicure not so great! It was a very average pedicure with a very average margarita... next time I would just get a spa pedi or something cheaper as I felt this pedi was way over priced!... However the staff was friendly and attentive. Overall I thought this hotel was a good value and I would definitely recommend it to families. Kids would LOVE this place! I will visit again when I am back in San Diego for sure...

Reviews.Title: “I was nervous about some of these reviews, but I LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: peanut895
Reviews.Content: We booked here because of a sale on Travelocity. We got a great preview of the grounds when the resort aired on Jon & Kate Plus 8 a few times. The grounds to the hotel are beautiful! I felt like I was in a rain forest. Many recent reviews are talking about poor room quality, but our rooms were great-- especially for women; the bathroom and closet area is huge! I went with my boyfriend and his family. Everything was clean everyday. The pools are nice, although at times, the main pool is just overun by kids, but there is an adult only pool, which is a great idea. We ate at Barefoot Bar & Grill, and the food is great! The prices are moderate for a resort. If you are looking for more food for your buck or a bigger menu, I do recommend walking over the bridge to the Blue Pearl Restaurant on Dana Landing. The one down point is location. Everything is a cab ride away - restaurant, beaches, etc. But I think San Diego as a city is really spread out in general. Because we were a party of 5, to many to fit in a regular taxi, we had to call for a shuttle every time we wanted to go anywhere. I recommend utilizing the resort's private beach. Our best day in Sand Diego was when we rented a kayak from the resort and paddled and laid on the beach all day! I would go back to Paradise Point in a heartbeat! Great staff, great rooms, great food.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: tracytravels
Reviews.Content: We used Priceline and were lucky enough to get Paradise Point for $60/night. The bungalows are in need of updating but overall, the room was quite comfortable and good size for a family of 4. The grounds are lovely with trails and ducks, birds etc. The gift shop has a nice array of shirts, shoes and souveniers. We didn't eat at the restaurants there or use the swimming pools. We did have a few drinks at the bar ($9.50 each). This hotel is close to everything! Very convenient. We rented a boat at the hotel for a 1/2 day which the kids absolutely loved. This is a very family friendly resort. One downfall- hot water is sparse! We didn't have hot water 2 of our 5 days there! Regardless, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Last time it was refurbished must have 100 years ago!”
Reviews.Author: LondonSleeper
Reviews.Content: When we first drove up to the hotel we thought that it looked fantastic. While my husband was checking in at reception I went to use the toilet in the lobby. The doors had dirty hand marks up them, this should have been a tell tale sign. then I entered the toilets to find a complete mess of overflowing bins full of tissuesby the sinks and inside the actual toilets. When we went to our room it was just as bad, there was thick dust on the headboards of the beds, the furniture had a distressed look which we think is just a good way of not having to buy new furniture. The sliding mosquito net across the patio doors was held on with tape which fell off when we tried to open it. It got worse, There was no kettle in our room so you had to go out to a stall to get tea/coffee. When asked for an orange juice and a tea the man said we have run out of both, we asked for a coffee and a hot chocolate the man said the machine is broke he cannot steam the milk so we left empty handed. Then we went for lunch in the hotel at the Barefoot bar and grill. We had to wait 40 mins to be seated!. My son asked for tea but was told that they had run out!, We asked for 2 glasses of white wine we were told that they had run out!, we asked for Sangria we were told that they do not have Sangria, Pimms maybe? "What is Pimms" they said. I ordered spaghetti for lunch just with a glass of water. When the spaghetti came I asked for a spoon. I waited and I waited, I asked again for a spoon eventually when everyone else had finished their meals I received a spoon but it was a teaspoon, "this is all we have" she said. Do the Americans not twiddle their spaghetti with a fork and a spoon? If you like to eat and stay in nice places, don't go to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: jacupidio
Reviews.Content: This hotel was surely nice in its prime, but is currently in need of a lot of work. While the grounds are beautiful and there are pleanty of pools and activities to keep a young family busy, the rooms were horrible. We rented three rooms, only one of which (the room with the king size bed) was decent, aside from the make up on the counter and the elastic band on the bathroom door both belonging to prior guests. The other two rooms were unacceptable. One room had a grape on the floor, both rooms had tiles falling out of the bathroom shower and one room had a soggy lump in the carpet. The front desk did nothing about the problems when notified, aside from writing the problems down on a long list of what could only be assumed were common guest complaints. Also, they charge a ridiculous amount of money for a parking space. $25 a day in ludicrous and unacceptable. As for the breakfast restaurant, two of our group of six enjoyed a nice breakfast out on the patio, while the other four, who dined prior to us were less than satisfied. The diner who ordered a bagel and cream cheese had to send it back as it was burned black. When a new one was brought out, two of the diners had already completed their meals, and the cream cheese was missing. Another of the group of four did not receive his eggs as he had ordered, there is quite a difference between poached eggs and eggs over easy. The service was slow, which is likely due to the group of eleven our server was serving at the same time. The only thing that saved our stay was that we received an excellent deal on room rates from Priceline. We paid nowhere near the hotel's asking price.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel/resort was such an unexpected pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: duk-duk-dakota
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in 2 rooms during the week before 4th of July. We had our young grandchildren with us. There was so much to do at the grounds, there was no need to go anywhere else. The pools were perfect for the toddlers and the teenagers. The bungalow style rooms were so unexpected. What a great concept! It really felt like our past vacations to Hawaii. The grounds were lush with greenery. The sand/beach to Mission Bay were steps away from the room (it was even closer than walking to the front desk) . There is even a minature golf course on site. The staff was incredibly helpful (the front desk staff, the housekeepers and even the room service staff ). The waiters at Barefoot Bar/Restaurant were patient. The bartender made drinks for us that other bartenders at famous restaurants had not known how to make. It's so close to Seaworld, we probably could have walked.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: pickypersonCa
Reviews.Content: I also read some negative reviews and was quite apprehensive. I am rarely happy with hotels/rooms/service. But Paradise Point was all I had wanted. I wanted peaceful, quiet, pretty and clean/updated. Not a scene like the W or a high rise generic hotel. Booked via amex travel but their hotel site had the same good deal. Stay three nights save 30% on all nights. We had a garden studio lanai. Good choice. Private entrance, private patio overlooking lush greenery and ponds with ducks that come visit. Its like your own little bungalow with a mini kitchen with fridge and micro. Comfy bed with excellent high end linens. Couch and sitting area. Bay views not avail but didnt miss it at all-an entire wall was glass looking on this oasis. very pretty. The grounds are just like hawaii. It's a little like a resort from the 60's but updated enough to be current. Families abound, but we stayed at the adult pool and it was gorgeous and quiet. Didnt try the spa yet but toured it--high end. The marina is good too -we rented a motorboat at the hotel dock-competitive prices. Excellent experience. Do it! Food at marina side cafe Barefoot for breakfast was good as was the friendly service everywhere. Only negative was our bathroom. Just average. I will return. They are just 10 minutes or so from la jolla and that was awesome, too. If you like to sleep in, bring a sleep mask-the curtains dont go up to the top and alot of sunlight floods the room in the morning! They charge alot for parking but no resort fee. that said, they also charge for fitness center usage which is lame. If you complain they will often comp you for one or the other.

Reviews.Title: “"Never judge a book by it's cover" or should I say Hotel by the outside appearance”
Reviews.Author: lv2travel4fun
Reviews.Content: Our drive into Vacation street made us think we should booked for a 2nd night. Only when we entered our great Orchid Room did we realize, we wanted to leave so fast. But since this was done thru priceline and all was paid for and we had nowhere else to go, we had no choice but to stick it out. Where do I start. The first thing we always do when we get into a hotel room and walk around and inspect the place. Here is my list: * children found sand grits in the bed and chairs * DEAD BUGS in the carpet ( i understand this is a lanai room but dead bugs in the carpet is ridiculous) * the sink counter top and dirty from previous users toothpaste droppings * the sink was filthy with the previous users guck and whatever you want to call it (yuck) * Shower curtains were smelly With this much, we were about to leave but by the time my husband and I were done with inspecting we did not notice our children had unpacked and already changed into their bathing suits. Boy do I wish I had left that place. * No coffee pot * No place to hang a towel other than the one towel rod 2 feet above the toilet * Bathroom tiles popping out of the walls ( will attach pic ) * $22 bucks for Parking...be real. We only paid $10 for a hotel right in the middle of Hollywood where there is no parking at all. I can honestly say that the only thing pleasant about this room was it's good shower head. The water came out at a very good pressure. Hey alteast I took a good shower. Also the front desk staff was very courteous. The landscaping was beautiful Even if I was given this room for free...I wouldn't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: anitaplopez
Reviews.Content: We spent July 4, 2009 at Paradise Point Resort in San Diego, the place needs a renovation in and out, the carpet in the room was stained, the furniture needs to be replaced. The Barefoot Bar & Grill is the only restaurant available during the day, it was over priced and the food was was below average. There was a morning coffee cart which always had a line and after paying $14.00 for two cups and two pastries, all we got was a luke warm cup of coffee. The employees were helpful and friendly. We rented a boat at the hotel dock and thought we would enjoy the afternoon on the water, except we ran out of gas in the middle of bay, and had to be towed back! They were so busy they forgot to check the fuel. After paying $280 a night, the only regret was, we didn't stay at the Hyatt down the road for less.

Reviews.Title: “A real oasis within minutes of downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jolpe
Reviews.Content: I guess you could say I stayed here on accident. I used priceline and bid on the location sight unseen. I was just looking for a decent place to stay the night before my niece's wedding. I arrive at about 10:30, and the hotel staff was just fantastic. For some reason, they had upgraded me to a bungalow on the beach instead of my regular room. The next morning, as I was leaving, I got a good look at what I had missed out on - beautiful landscaping and amenities. I'm bringing the wife back for sure for a longer stay. Pricey if you pay retail, but so worth it if you can snag a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Pack your bags and go! It was great!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug1214
Reviews.Content: We almost canceled our stay at this Resort because of all the Negative Reviews we read, we didn't and we're very happy to say we're glad we didn't. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Upon our arrival which was late in the evening we were greeted by an employee who directed us to the Front Desk and advised us that he would take us to our room once we were done with check in, this place is TREMENDOUS so we really appreciated this. The girls at the Front Desk are exceptional. Prior to our arrival I had the pleasure of talking to Renee, I was very concerned about all the negative reviews I was reading and she was very honest and assured me that we would have a great time, and WE DID.... Thank you Renee you're the BEST!!!! We were then escorted to our room, full of all this negative anticipation from the reviews we read we pleasantly surprised. Our room had a King size bed, a sofa with a pull out bed, a desk, Granite Counter tops in the Bathroom with two sinks, a tub/shower with a new shower curtain (not like we read that they were old and smelly) with a cloth interior shower liner which I personally prefer so you don't get attacked by the plastic ones, an in room safe, and iron and ironing board, plenty of closet space, a small refrigerator, and no one on top of us since they are all single story units which is great... but NO COFFEE POT in the room... :-( We had a front patio and the other rooms on either side of us had rear patio's which was nice when you sat outside you had some privacy and so did your neighbors, we did NOT ever hear anyone else from the other rooms and we did have neighbors. We were in the Orchid section which had a nice view of Mission Bay, and we even had the opportunity to see a SKUNK, wow they are beautiful...but then we went in our room :o) We chose to use the smaller pool which was right around the corner from our room, it was nice and quiet with a beach entry, towels are available at the pool for your use, there is a hot tub as well as torches and fire pits for evening relaxing. This Resort is amazing the landscape is something else, the landscapers have some job to keep this place so immaculate, every day they are vacuuming the streets, blowing out the falling leaves, trimming the shrubbery, what a job and it shows, it's truly beautiful. We were very close to Sea World if you were a walker you could even walk it, but we drove it's just over the bridge, we didn't eat in any of the restaurants or got to the Spa, what was I thinking?, so we can't tell you much about them other than they look nice from the outside. We had 2 minor problems, someone took our parking space and since they are assigned we were concerned about parking, the Front Desk immediately offered us alternate parking, the other problem was one day we were not provided towels, let me tell you in less than 5 minutes someone was at our door with warm hot towels. The Staff is exceptionally helpful and attentive to your every need. The one thing that we did not care for was the $22.00 per night parking fee, personally I think that's a lot $10-12.00 would be acceptable to me but every hotel is doing it so you can't get away from it, just hope you don't have a parking spot near the sprinklers. Pack your bags, go and have a great time and by the way, someone posted a photo of a piece of furniture that looked like it was painted and the paint was peeling off, well the motif of the hotel is that distressed look so it's suppose to look like that. I was told the resort will be going through a complete overhaul in the Fall I can't wait to see it after that.... RELAX and you'll have a FABULOUS TIME..you won't be sorry and the person writing this is MS. PICKY that lives in Las Vegas and is use to Las Vegas Hotels. I will go back it taught me something, did you say RELAX!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice time, but wouldn't come back.”
Reviews.Author: Murphy_Jones
Reviews.Content: Went with 3 girlfriends - Sex & The City style. Opened the door to our Executive Suite, and it looked like most of the furniture that was supposed to be there had been stolen! We literally had a dance floor in the middle of our living space! (We pressed all the light switches hoping there would be a disco ball to no avail.) The room had a slightly musty smell, and we didn't get the bed arrangement that we had requested. We got a King bed and a let-out couch. The let-out couch was slanted and the mattress was about as thick as a slice of Texas Toast. The King bed was as firm as plywood. We requested a room switch, but the only other rooms, or so it was claimed, were much smaller so we kept our room. I will say that the bathroom was fantastic. All four of us could get ready as it was a very nice size. Four long showers and still lots of hot water and good water pressure. The staff was excellent - very very friendly. Food at the Barefoot Cafe was good - and like most have said - very pricey. I wanted to get a pedicure, but at $60 for a BASIC, I said "fuggetaboutit". To be frank, we're not a kid-friendly group, but the kids there were active and had lots of options, so it wasn't a problem at all. Stay here if you get a good deal - do NOT pay full price. (Restaurants: Gringos on Garnet for dinner and Kona by Crystal Pointe for breakfast!)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Grounds, disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: casper49
Reviews.Content: We drove up to the resort and I couldn't believe we were going to stay there. The hotel grounds were beautiful. The lobby and desk clerk was nice. I couldn't wait to see our room! We walked in and I was a little disappointed. Then I walked around to inspect the room and I kept getting more and more disappointed. The bed frames were dusty. Part of the carpet was moldy. The shower curtain had a sour smell, and I wasn't convince the bedding was clean. We stayed in a Garden Lani room. There were obviously nicer looking rooms. Perhaps those small rooms are old. Still there is no excuse for smelly shower curtains and moldy carpet. We met some people there that were staying in the same type room and they were not impressed either. They had ants in their room. Everything else about the resort was great. The food and drinks were expensive but very good. We ate by the pool and at the Barefoot Grill. My daughter enjoyed feeding the ducks and fish. The pools were nice. It was cold, even with heated pools, but they can't control the weather. Money saving tips: Go to the grocery store (Ralph's) on Sports Arena Blvd. and buy breakfast stuff (cereal, juice, water, fruit, muffins, spoons plates). A half gallon milk fits in fridge. Guadalajara restaurant in Old Town has wonderful authentic Mexican Food. Go early to avoid crowd. Margarita's are excellent. We usually don't vacation in the same place twice, but if we went back to San Diego, I would stay at this hotel but made sure I saw the room before I accepted it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: Simopel
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our 4 day trip from San Diego. We stayed at the Paradise Point Resort & Spa. We booked 2 rooms for 4 adults and one 4 year old child. We had 2 Bungalow's right next to each other so we were able to open the doors inside and connect the rooms. That was very clever. The staff at check in was nice, Parking as stated in the reviews before is $22 per night. Pretty expensive, especially when there is plenty of parking everywhere. The rooms were also as described in the reviews before. There weren't to bad but a renovation or update would do better. This is a 3 star resort and nothing more. You get what you should expect for a 3 star resort. The rooms could have been cleaner. It wasnt so bad but there was a lot of dirt and spots which could have been easily removed by simply wiping it with a wet cloth. There is one bad thing - the shower or actually the water pressure from the shower. If your neighbor is taking a shower or flushing the toilet, there is no water left for you in the shower. It's simply only dropping. We had Dinner and Breakfast at the Barfoot Grill. The breakfast menu is a little poor. There is no buffet and no continental breakfast. If you are an european you may eat only once or twice there. The food though was excellent. We spent some time at the pool with the little boy and he enjoyed anyway. The property itself is beautiful landscaped and truly a paradise. I would recommend this property for a short weekend trip but not for relaxing or entertainment. Also if you look for something more comfortable where you feel like home or luxury - look for a different place. If you don't attach to much importance to luxury this is the place where you want to be...

Reviews.Title: “Almost Hawaii!”
Reviews.Author: AlyssaLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: For our first ever family vacation, we were debating about flying to Hawaii and having 2 days of a flying nightmare w/ a toddler, or driving down to San Diego...we opted for SD with a touch of Hawaiian perks. Researched every beach side hotel and came up with Paradise Point for location and price. Upon arrival, the property was very well maintained. Tropical folage everywhere and the spread out villas reminded me of typical Hawaiian condo setups. The bayside studio was very close to what we imagined and viewed online. Large room with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the beach. The sand was steps away. The extra money for this room type was well worth it. About $50 more with AAA discount. I wouldn't get the garden rooms. There were a few downsides...the mattress and pillows weren't the best quality and there was no WIFI. Furniture looked pretty well used, so I think they are about due for a renovation. We traveled with our 13mo son and it worked out great. Plenty of room for the playpen. He loved the sand and pool. They even had a firepit on the beach but we didn't use it. Next time! We ate breakfast and dinner at the Barefoot Grill on site. Food was ok, but very pricey. I would recommend going into Mission Beach or Pacific Beach for better food and prices. They are about a 5min drive from the resort. La Jolla was about 15-20min.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds but ...”
Reviews.Author: tsimmis
Reviews.Content: the rooms need to be updated and are not as nice as the pictures in the website. the place seemed to be understaffed. we arrived and their computer system was down so they could not check people in. someone pooped in the pool, so everyone got out of the pool but we did not see anyone drain or scrub it out. we got it thru priceline. if we paid full price, we would have been more upset.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDreaming07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had hoped for a nice romantic weekend away from it all. On the hotel web site the hotel and rooms looked great. From experience we knew that it was a very good location. As we drove in the grounds were pretty, but dated, and lack of maintenance was obvious. The room was next to a pool where rap music blared out. While pets were not allowed in the pool area this was being ignored. The room had not been updated for years! Old TV, door did not shut going into shower/toilet area, toilet ran constantly, and the screen patio door was torn and off track. Patio furniture was filthy. We were short shampoo upon arrival but upon request a maid provided it. Next day no new coffee was provided for the coffee maker? Not what we expected from a 4 star hotel! The restaurant, Baleen, was great! The location was great, next to Sea World. They had a work out facility but at $12. per person per day it was very pricey. Parking by your room was an extra cost also. A number of buses of high school/college age students arrived but did not impact us. Numerous weddings were going on as was a convention so we were told that they were to capacity. Another couple shared that after killing 12 bugs/spiders they asked to be moved and they were. They were initially on a pond/swamp and the new room was not. The grounds were in need of maintenance as were the ponds. There was litter, duck droppings, and filth in the ponds. The ponds have not been refurbished for many years! Fortunately we were booking under a special - had we paid full price we would have been even more upset!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but in need of an overall....”
Reviews.Author: love2vaca4ever
Reviews.Content: 2 girlfriends and I spent the weekend at Paradise Point Resort and Spa as a way to celebrate Mothers Day our way, since although married, none of us have any children yet. As we pulled into the resort, we were very excited as the grounds are GORGEOUS and remind me of Hawaii. It really felt like a vacation (we live an hour north). The check-in procedure was easy and everyone was very friendly. We were led to our suite and from the moment we opened the door, we were very disappointed: stained carpet from the front door all the way back to the sliding glass door, chipped furniture, a missing door on the armoire, a musty humid smell, peeling paint in the bathroom, rusty door joints. But who stays in their room? and so we decided not to say anything. A couple of hours later after walking the beautiful grounds, I decided to ask for a room switch. They gave us the choice between 2 rooms and we took the 2nd room, as it was the least shabby and the carpet was mostly clean. It actually had a nice feel. When I asked the front desk gal for the switch, she did say the property is due for an overhaul in September. That made me excited!! I'd come back after a major renovation!!! We ended up going to Baleen, the onsite restaurant, for dessert later that night...very good. And ordered room service the next morning...not so good. No flavor to the omelettes, eggs, potatoes, toast. The 35-40 minute window took an hour. Busy because of Mothers Day I'm sure. Bottomline: The resort is in a perfect location and is gorgeous. If they really do the room renovation in September, I'll be back. For sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Scenery, Dissapointing Room Service”
Reviews.Author: yd700519
Reviews.Content: It was my first mother’s day and I was excited to spend a weekend at this gorgeous resort with family and friends. After viewing the resort's website, my expectations were high, as we booked an ocean view suite and our brother and sister in law with their beautiful little girl booked a room near the lake. Driving into resort it almost felt like we were in Hawaii. The greenery, the lakes, the fire torches gave perfect touches to this small 'paradise' so close to home. Upon checking in we were given our key to a little bungalow on the beach, Room 541, and a certificate for complimentary desert at Baleen, a restaurant on premises. The room was towards the end of the resort and had an amazing view of the ocean. There were two lounge/beach chairs in front of the door and ducks roaming around. My son definitely enjoyed looking at them. The room itself was average. It had a bedroom with a King size bed that was comfortable and sheets were very clean. There were connecting bathrooms with two sink areas sharing a shower in the middle. The shower showed signs of wear and tear; however, the water pressure was excellent. Clean towels were also provided. The living room area had a pull out couch, two arm chairs, a futon, a small round table with 4 chairs and a small kitchenette with a sink and a microwave. Overall condition was average, but clean. When we first walked in there was a smell of moisture, however, once we opened the door and let some fresh air in and sprayed Fabreze, the smell was no longer noticeable. Our first night there we decided to have dinner at Baleen, a restaurant on premises serving above average priced food. The staff at Baleen were very accommodating, especially with our two babies - high chairs were provided. The food was a little disappointing. I had ordered a salmon dish, but it had a weird BBQ sauce and another flavor I couldn't put my finger on. The server gladly exchanged my dish to Seared Ahi Tuna - it was finger lickin' good. Other people in our party ordered Rib eye steaks, Chilean Sea bass and Lobster Tails - they were satisfied with the portions and taste. We ordered our desert to go and enjoyed it back in our suite. It was chilly that weekend, but the fresh air was very crisp and refreshing. The next morning everyone in our party decided to order breakfast in and enjoy it with the view of the ocean. This was perhaps the worst and the most disappointing service me or anyone in our party has ever received. All of us pretty much ordered egg dishes (how hard is it to make eggs?). It took us 4 phone calls and an hour and 15 minutes to track down and receive our breakfast. When the breakfast finally did arrive it was cold and missing butter for our toast and a large pot of coffee (they did deliver the creamer). We called the room service and spoke with Patricia number of times regarding the condition of our breakfast and the missing items. SHE offered a refund and we accepted. The missing items never arrived and we decided to let them know at which point she stated in a not-so-pleasant-customer-oriented tone that 'were were the ones who requested a refund and shouldn’t be getting the rest of the items". This was absolutely not true and simply an unacceptable way to deal with customers. Although we did receive our money back, it wasn't what we were looking for. We wanted a nice, relaxing weekend with good service but it was cut short after our breakfast incident. We checked out right away with disappointment. I MAY recommend this to a friend, but definitely not the room service. I have placed a phone call to the Service Manager, but have not received a call back. OTHER PLACES TO CHECK OUT WHILE IN THE AREA: Mission Beach - very hip and happening. Nice restaurants, a rollercoaster and lots of other activities.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: springsBoston
Reviews.Content: I was a little scared to book this hotel thru my travel agent after reading some of the reviews on this site. Now that I'm home, I have to say it was well worth it. The reviews are right...rooms are small (but bathrooms were big), TVs were small, furniture was less "shabby chic" and more just plain shabby. But who spends time in a hotel room in San Diego? Th grounds were beautiful, LOVED the adult only pool, perfect location and easy for driving about. Wish the management would smarten up and provide free wifi (if Super 88 Motel can do it, why not PP?), skip the parking fee (we did get a discount), and for heaven's sake, don't charge for the average gym. But management should give kudos to their helpful staff and groundskeepers.

Reviews.Title: “lovely grounds - shame about the rooms & car parking price!”
Reviews.Author: JemimaSuffolk_
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 days out of 9 in this resort, went back to Las Vegas early. The resort itself is very pretty , the pools were nice but the rooms really need updating, very shabby in places. We thought the car parking fees were ridiculous. The Balleen restaurant was lovely, if a little pricey . Very near Seaworld which is great. Overall probably would'nt go back to this resort & found San Diego very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Destination Resort”
Reviews.Author: danver8
Reviews.Content: Our linens and room were kept immaculate. The resort is beautiful with the grounds being constantly maintained. Because of the concrete one floor rooms there weren't any other guests to annoy us with noise. They also had 5 well maintained pools and one for adults only! We played minigolf there too. It is conveniently located next to see world and on a huge island with running tracks along the beach. The staff was incredibly attentive as well. The only set back in the room is a clean but ugly rug. I highly recommend this resort/spa/hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Know what your expectations are prior to booking”
Reviews.Author: gatordoc96
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful vacation and this was exactly the place we needed knowing what to expect after reading all the mixed reviews. If you want a 5 star hotel, this is not the place for you. It is older and this is evident by the furniture and the carpet in the rooms but our room was very clean and the grounds were spectacular! The room reminded me of beach front condos we have rented and have also enjoyed. We stayed in a bayside studio and it was clean and comfortable. It was very quiet! I think that is also dependent on your neighbors no matter where you stay. We loved being able to step out of our room with our daughter to go play in the sand and watch the beautiful sunsets! It also had the convenience of a small kitchen that had a small fridge, a microwave and a full sized coffee pot. We bought our own drinks and snacks. The employees were all very cordial and accommodating. The restaurants had great food. The barefoot grill had a wonderful atmosphere with a great view on the bay. Kids enjoyed feeding the fish and the frequent visits from the seagulls. We knew it would be pricey to eat on the grounds. The hotel IS overpriced overall. The $22 parking fee was no surprise thanks to the other reviewers and when we were checking out other hotels in San Diego, most of them had a $20 parking fee. We were taken by the hotel tax! In summary, this a great place to get away from it all and be with your family. I suggest staying in a studio or bungalow, if feasible, to get a better room judging from the other reviews. Staying on the water is expensive no matter where you stay in San Diego and there is certainly no real value here. Being on the water was a priority for us and this place met our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location, NOT A 4 Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: mattpine
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is a nice hotel. It's best asset is it's location. It's on the Bay which gives you direct private access to the beach and water. It's miles away from downtown San Diego so it provides a relaxing country atmosphere, however downtown is only a 5 minute drive. Now for the bad part. The cost of the room is just that, the cost of ONLY the room. EVERYTHING else you do at the resort will cost you money. If you have a rental car, it will cost you to park it at the resort. If you want to use the fitness equipment, it will cost you. If you want to play a round of mini golf with the kids, it will cost you extra. About the only thing they don't charge you for is use of the pool. So, it is a nice resort because of it's location and service. The rooms are small and just okay. The cost of the many incidentals will greatly increase the cost of your stay. But the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “great location, needs remodeling”
Reviews.Author: dsnbs
Reviews.Content: Great location, the grounds were very nice, but some of the buildings needed repairs as well as some of the sidewalks. Rooms were clean, but needed updating. Paint was peeling from the walls, the outside light did not work, the blinds on the back door were broke and we could not open them. Had a couple of different pools to chose from including an adults only which was nice. The restaurants were way over priced for what you got. The best food was at the poolside restaurant. All the restaurants seems under staffed, not enough waiters and waitresses to serve the amount of people there. A lot of waiting. Wait to be seated, wait for drinks, wait to have order taken, wait for food, wait for bill. $22 a day to park a car was a little much. Each room has an alotted space for parking so I don't understand the charge. It isn't like there was a lack parking spaces. Could be a wonderful resort if they would stick a little money into it which they should have since they have extra charges for everything...parking, internet, fitness center, over priced restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds, rooms need updating!!”
Reviews.Author: sassyv
Reviews.Content: The grounds are very nice, beautiful landscaping. However the rooms are in big need of a re-model. The beds are to hard, and furniture is old. The main pool is heated....nice for little ones. However there's a RIDICULOUS $22.00 NIGHTLY PARKING FEE aside from your room reservation. Would only come back if they remodel rooms...grounds are nice and its a location close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for kids, getting a little long in the tooth”
Reviews.Author: globalnikki
Reviews.Content: My family of four (with two kids under 10) stayed one night as a treat for the kids at the tail end of a wedding trip. As a result, we didn't get to use everything the place had to offer, but next time we're in San Diego, we'll probably stay here again with the intent of doing more at the resort. Our room was nice but musty and the air conditioner wasn't great - it seemed like there was some kind of humidity problem in the room and I don't really want to think about what kind of mold might have caused that smell. I didn't see any, at least. The pool is great - well heated, with a really shallow, almost beach-like side that is perfect for under-4, can't-swim kids, while still offering a lot of space for big kids to swim and splash. The location is fantastic - only minutes from great SD beaches, minutes from Sea World, minutes from the airport (which is noticeable when the planes fly over during the day). But it's an interior part of the bay, so the beaches at the resort itself are a bit stagnant - no waves, and it was slimy when we were there. The concierge recommended the perfect seafood restaurant with a kid-friendly menu. Next time we go, we'll try the miniature golf and the croquet, and maybe check out the bike rentals. We didn't do the s'mores special (the firepits are on the resort's beaches), but even though it's pricey, it was tempting anyway. We ate breakfast at Barefoot, out on the deck, and it was typical hotel breakfast fare at typically expensive hotel breakfast prices. They're pretty good about controlling the birds out there, and hotel staff were feeding the fish in the pond by the restaurant, and let our kids help - which was probably the highlight of their stay. Oh yeah, and they charged us $22 to park there, which I thought was a bit rough considering that the rooms are scattered all over the place, not in one big building. Overall, they try hard and I can't think of a place I've stayed outside of Disney that is more kid-friendly than here.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and undervalue - beautiful spot, but that is it!!”
Reviews.Author: Annjudith
Reviews.Content: Never have I had to pay $22/day to park in front of my motel room! Filthy carpet, abysmal concierge information, cool 'hot' tub, overpriced food, drinks, rooms. Really awful...

Reviews.Title: “Nice older resort close to San Diego Sights”
Reviews.Author: Chicagoanontheroad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend while we were visiting friends in San Diego. The grounds are beautiful and the pool was not crowded at all. Our room was clean and had a nice look to it although there are spots where you can see that it's an older room that has been renovated (wall air conditioners, very small bathroom, etc.) We had a discounted rate and were very happy with the room given the rate we paid. However, we did notice that the rack rates are around 3 times what we paid and we would have been very disappointed if we had paid a lot more. The walls are paper thin and a lot of families with children were there so it was a little noisy in the room. The $22/day parking fee is irritating. This fee should be included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location, rooms could use some major renovation.”
Reviews.Author: eastporter1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paradise Point for 5 days. Loved the location, as it was close to the beaches, SeaWorld, and the highway. The property was paradise, pools were clean and warm, restaurants were fantastic. Didn't love the $22 parking price. Didn't make sense to me, as we had a private driveway. The rooms however, could use a major renovation. Front door casing was rotted and it needed a new welcome mat. The bathroom needed desperate repair, as the tub felt like it was going to fall through the floor. The patio was nice, but needed a little sprucing up. The hotel staff and service were excellent. Would stay again, only if they updated their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View, Ordinary Rooms”
Reviews.Author: waeld47
Reviews.Content: The view and atmosphere was nice. The amenities are standard, but be prepared to pay for parking and internet ($22 and $10 per night, respectively). Central location. Sea World is only a few minutes away. The rooms are nothing to write home about. Just what you would expect, a normal television with cable and a smaller than average bathroom. The staff was very friendly and the concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Shows its age”
Reviews.Author: schreib5
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Paradise Point property a number of years ago on a regular basis and got a tremendous rate through Priceline (Negotiator). The grounds were always, and still are, beautiful. The rooms unfortunately are a different story. We had a basic room just off the bay-the carpets were stained; the furniture looked like it did when we stayed here a long time ago and older and with more cracks and paint chips. All in all somewhat of a disappontment. They have also added a $22 parking fee and a $12 fee just to use the gym.

Reviews.Title: “A real touch of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: RedWi
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful and relaxing and rejuvinating.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: mylilanthony2121
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paradise Point 5 times last year, and everytime was amazing...we always get the bayside bungalow, and being that close to the water is awesome and its just gorgeous!!! the staff has taken care of us everytime we called for something.....the first time we stayed there our toilet was broken and we called the front desk and they comped our 250 dinner we had from barefoot bar and grill.....everyone is very friendly and room service was always sent to us in a timely manner....i love this place and every 4 months when we go to san diego, i always book there....never had a bad experience there....only problem is if you have t-mobile, you dont get great service....but thats not the hotels fault...plus who wants to answer their cell phone when you're sitting on the beach drinking a margarita, enjoying the scenery? amazing place and i will recommend this place to anyone wanting a great place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, nice grounds, good service, empty kitchenette”
Reviews.Author: Bears70
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, with two young children. I had a 1 bedroom suite garden room. Kids slept in pull out couch. Rooms are clean, not perfect, as there is a bit of age and wear and tear. The problem is that the level of accommodation does not match the price. The kitchenette's in the room have a small refrigerator and microwave and absolutely nothing else. Not a single plate, spoon, or paper towel. Thank goodness room service prices are reasonable but with a rather limited menu. No place for 4 people to sit down and eat food. I was an off-season guest which meant poolside service, grill and bar were all closed. Main pool is heated, smaller pools near rooms, have heated hot tubs which my family enjoyed. Nice seaside dining option, but the area immediately outside the resort is an industrial concrete jungle with limited dining options. $10 a day for internet. My family enjoyed our stay but in the end felt the price did not match the level accommodations. We used it as a launching pad for Legoland and San Diego Zoo for kids.

Reviews.Title: “The entrance is great and it went downhill from there”
Reviews.Author: drehan
Reviews.Content: Beautiful entrance to the resort and great location. We had a garden lanai room. We had ants in our room and an outside light that was out. Service was quick to fix the outside light so we could see to use our key... but the light switch didn't work and it illuminated our room all night long. The lighting in the room was not adequate to use the business table set up (we were just trying to play cards). The big surprise is the additional fees parking additional $22.00 per day, gym another $12per person per day and wi-fi $10 per day. Most hotels offer this for free. I wouldn't stay there again, Pacific beach area has same prices and lots more beach to watch, great restaurants and activities. It is nice if you want peace and quiet only...and some ants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Rooms & Grounds Need Upgrading”
Reviews.Author: NortheastJSj
Reviews.Content: On the plus side-very friendly pleasant staff; thought they had an effective confererence site and excellent food, even gift shop clerk was pleasant; the bed was comfortable; decent fitness center & spa. Also had a great room rate (internet special). On the minus side-room was dusty-felt unclean and bath area needed to be cleaned much better-too many hairs that weren't mine on the floor and near the shower. Site has potential to be top notch but instead feels worn/old. Walking around the grounds at night on one's own is creepy with too many dark pathways between the fitness center/spa area and rooms-felt unsafe on my own walking the grounds at night. If hotel room cleanliness-quality matched the great attitude its staff already has, would have ranked it much higher.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Spot, Rooms are Hit-or-Miss”
Reviews.Author: amydd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the resort for nearly a week- the first few days at a business conference, then my family joined me for a long weekend. The conference center was terrific - newly remodeled, modern & tastefully decorated, meeting rooms with walls of windows overlooking the bay. Fantastic! The room I was booked into originally was a garden room and was definitely sub-standard. It was dark, had mis-matched furniture and even a non-matching cover for the toilet tank (a smaller, differently-shaped cover had been placed over the tank - tacky!). The sink counter was not fully cleaned, it was dusty/dirty everywhere but just around the sink. Two times my cardkey de-magnetized (which is a big pain when you are a 5-7 minute walk from the front desk) and one morning I had no hot water! Luckily I was able to be moved for the weekend and ended up with a really nice room, a mini-suite, just behind the pool/pond area. That room was so much better - airy, bright, a little kitchenette, large space with a king-sized bed and queen pullout couch (but even my 10yo daughter complained about how uncomfortable the mattress was). We were very happy with that room. The resort is nice - since it was off season only the largest of their 5 pools was heated (but all the hot tubs were), which was fine for us. We used the compliementary ping pong and the pro-shop let us use the tennis courts for free (usually $20/hour which seems spendy). We ate at the Barefoot Grill and it was fine - usual resort prices. They have all kinds of boat rentals which seemed fun - we just ran out of time as we had gorgeous weather and spent a day at Mission & Pacific Beaches. Bell staff were all very friendly and helpful. I was fortunate to have the conference rate package so was not charged for the $10 internet or $12 fitness center charges (which are ridiculous). Overall, it was a pleasant stay but I probably wouldn't go back - too many other places to try!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Gardens”
Reviews.Author: mm73
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay with two kids (11 &12). Nice check in & lobby area. Bellman took us to our room with luggage via golf cart. Gardens are lovely, beach leaves much to be desired. Not cleaned up, broken glass in places so be careful where you walk. Love the idea of bayfront rooms with personal firepits. We had a garden lanai with two beds, room was pretty small but OK since we didn't plan to be there much. If you stay at this hotel, rent a car or plan to take a cab. Went to the beach each day, apx. $10 one way. This was still less expensive than a car rental plus the $22/day parking fee at the resort. All the staff was very friendly & helpful at all times. Overall, was a nice resort but didn't knock our socks off by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovation and New Policies”
Reviews.Author: Strongbru
Reviews.Content: Compared to other resorts and even other "normal" hotels I've stayed in, Paradise Point falls short on both service and amenities. The first room I was taken to had the carpet pulled up and the beds stacked on top of one another. Thankfully, I got a new room instantly, but even then it fell short of my expectations. There was no real desk, except a hutch to pull out and sit uncomfortably under the TV. The furniture looked quite used (even if they're trying to replicatate an antique look) and the walls were dirty and scratched. The sliding glass door didn't fully close or lock, though it did have a safety bar in it. On the plus side, the beds were big and comfortable and had nice sheets. The $10 a day for internet is really uncalled for in the 21st century of wireless networks; what's worse, you have to plug in an ethernet cable; you don't even have a wifi choice. Room service also charges a $4 "delivery fee." What I've loved about other resorts I've stayed at was the fact that these types of amenities are simply part of the package; here it felt like getting nickled and dimed everywhere I turned. There's also no shuttle services to anywhere and since it's in the middle of an island, it makes it pretty boring or expensive if you don't have a car. As for the service, the bellhops and tram drivers were excellent, but the front desk is on the slow side. Anytime I called the front desk I was put on hold for a long period of time. Once no one even re-picked up the phone. Overall, I just expected much more for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated rooms, shabby service, WAY WAY overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: PickE
Reviews.Content: Front desk aloof and slow, not responsive to needs. When asked a question over the phone, transferred 3 times to different people with same results - nothing! Took 4 calls and 3 hrs to get a crib when told at check in its on its way. Rooms are outdated, kitchen looks like its from the Yogi-bear era. Bathrooms with rot and grout. Carpet smells. And we had a dexluxe garden bungalow-whatever that means. Pool rarely stocked with fresh towels. Food is below average and the worst thing is the price they charge. Only nice thing to say is the grounds, but of alot of it is roadways, and taking walks can be a lesson in traffic avoidance. This one is way way overpriced, and really only worth it if the room is <150 a night.

Reviews.Title: “nice but not fabulous”
Reviews.Author: AZgirl40
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel was OK, but not the luxury resort experience I expected from the website. This ended up being OK for me because I was there for an intense conference, and not paying for a "vacation resort experience". None the less, here are my comments: My check-in process was fine, although when I asked to have my reservation stating I was there with a conference, I was told that because I booked through a third party they could not put that in, but that I would get "everything that all conference attendees get". Not the case. They tried to charge me 10.00/day for internet use, and when I stated I was supposed to get free internet due to being a conference attendee, I was told this was not the case because I had booked through a third party (Orbitz). I had to go to the conference staff, and they did eventually get me free internet. I had their basic "garden" room. My room was OK--I had some trouble sleeping due to the bright light outside my door (covered by a somewhat thin curtain). And noise carried very easily from adjacent rooms, so much so that I could hear other people's conversations. Bring earplugs. The resort itself is pretty with several pools, and you can take a nice walk along the beach around the resort. At night I found the lighting to be poor in certain areas of the resort, which could be an issue for elderly. The food we had for lunches at the conference was delicious. I ate most of my meals after conference hours at the Barefoot Bar and Grill, which had pretty decent food, although somewhat pricey and not a lot of healthy options. I was able to use the fitness center for free (but like other people have said ,their usual charge is 12.00). The fitness center is actually halfway decent, with 4 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, and 2 stairmasters, along with freeweights and some weight machines. I really wonder how much they stick to their policy of charging 12.00 to use the fitness room because most days I just walked right in and no one asked me anything. I did treat myself to an Indian Scalp massage and hand and foot massage at the Spa, which I had heard was good. I was somewhat disappointed--my massage was mediocre at best, and $150 for a total one hour mediocre treatment seemed to add salt to the wound. My massage therapist's name was Jesus, so I would try to book someone else if you go to the spa. The concierge in the hotel lobby was extremely helpful and friendly. I think there is a place at the resort to rent kayaks and go in the bay, which looked like fun, but there is a separate fee for that, too.

Reviews.Title: “Okay not great”
Reviews.Author: cbrstj
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of days at this fairly nice resort. The property was well kept. The ponds were green, but I don't know it that was on purpose or not. Rooms were nice. They had A/C that worked well. Enjoyed the Adult pool. Hated that the ice machines are in the pool areas which are locked up when they close. Had to call room service to get ice. The staff was courteous and professional. Food at the restaurants was a little pricey. We went to the IHOP in Pacific Beach instead.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby room, shabbier service”
Reviews.Author: Travis74
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a nice private resort style get away on the coast in SanDiego, and we got a nightmare. First of all a $22 per night parking Fee?They couldnt just raise their rates to include the parking fee? Well no they couldnt for a few reasons. First of all the room we stayed in was shabby, carpet was dirty, the layout was odd, we had to shut the tv hutch just to get to the bathroom. The first night I take a shower, after five minutes im up to my ankles in backed up water, "gross" so I cut my shower short. Later I flush the toilet and the toilet overflows slightly and we use our dry towels to sop up the water, we call the front desk and they send someone out to snake the line, but dont send any new towels for us. I have to go to the adjacent pool and snag towels from there so we have clean towels. The next day the toilet didnt overflow but just about did and we didnt dare take showers. We told the front desk and they said they will have facilitys look at it, we came back later that day and still not fixed, still backed up. We decided to checkout and find another place. When we checked out we explained how poor the service was, and they just said "we hope you have a better stay next time", I said "never ever again". This is the second worst Hotel experience ive ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Far, far, far below average resort”
Reviews.Author: wyleebeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for a total of 4 nights. We were in an "executive suite" and initially were excited by the prospects of a nice room. The grounds were nice inasmuch as they had mature landscape (albeit a LOT of asphalt). We were a bit suspicious when the bellhop that drove us in a golfcart to the suite simply said that we were in a "big room." Right he was. Their executive suites, as it turns out, double as meeting rooms. You first walk into a big meeting room - with a collapsable wall that separates another "executive suite." In that room, there is a small dingy couch about 20 feet from a really small tv, a very small table and a couple of chairs. Clearly they aim for ease in moving the furniture out when there is a meeting held there. A big closet is filled with tables and chairs, which is weird at best. The kitchenette would be fine enough for a meeting...but not for using on a personal level. In the back is a very dark, small bedroom (two small windows out to bushes left it 100% dark) and a nondescript bathroom. Toiletries are a mishmash of cheap products --- no lotion, no showercap, conditioner was hit or miss depending on if the housekeeper had some in her cart---really unimpressive. My husband summed it up when he said that when you leave the small bedroom, it feels like you walk into your garage. There was a sliding door from the meeting room out ---- but no furniture sitting outside of our room. (though the other executive suites appeared had some). Did I mention it all feels a bit dirty? Our room was enough to keep us from ever returning. But when you couple in the various ways that they try to scrounge more money from you at every turn (from parking fees when the entire resort is one big parking lot -- to healthclub fees for a room that has 2 bicycles and a few other machines), I felt compelled to write a review that would hopefully inspire the owners to give more consideration to their guests, and less to their pocketbook.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Vailite
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice week in California. The hotel staff was on top of everything. Well worth the money. Great rooms and location.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: fampratravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the first weekend of October to attend conference. Prior to the trip, we were promised "luxurious resort at tropical setting" The driveway leads into resort seem luxurious and impressive. However, this is the only luxury part of this so called resort. Our gardenview "suite" has terrible odor like no one had stayed in this room for long period of time. The furnishings inside the suite was outdated to the point that it felt like it was picked out from Goodwill Store. The carpet was old and dirty as evidenced by my 2year old son's feet. The aircondition was very noisy and yet it produce no comfort at all. We were so fed up that we turned off the A/C and open the back patio door because the room was suffocating with terrible stench. The conference center restroom was sadly the only modern facility in the whole resort. The swimming pool water was cold and bottom were filled with dirt and debris. The pond is perfect breeding ground for mosquito that probably carry west nile virus. No housekeeping bother to clean the room until we had to call them twice. The maid was probably mad that she took all of our towels without replacing it and she didn't even bother to leave and soap or any toiletries behind. Those essential toiletries and towels were brought after FOUR calls to housekeeping. Overall, this "resort" is anything that it called itself as. If you like to pay $250 for a room that is so antiquated that is even worse than any motel in teh USA and $22 daily parking to boast, you have found this place is perfect paradise point.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place..”
Reviews.Author: Audi_Chris
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before ,so coming back was to be a welcomed trip, as this was the first 2 days of our honeymoon, before we headed off to Hawaii (Big Island). The place is nice on the eye and quite tranquil. A selection of pools - one of which is adult only, so no noisy kids! The rooms are well decorated and of a generous size. The ones which have a beachfront are obviously nicer and you get a view too. The main restaurant looked really nice and up-market - though we never ate there. The smaller cafe/lunch bar - which also served evening meals, was much more basic but nice too. This place had a wonderful view and was on a large pond full of tropical fish. I really liked Paradise Point and the reception area is something else! I would have no hesitation in returning to this place, however, my only gripe is the expense of the car parking! It was at least $10 per day - check with website. A 5 day visit here would be ideal!

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: tomollie1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for a one night anniversary get away. The room we stayed in was very old (rusted plumbing, peeling walls, loud fan). The grounds around the place were really awesome though. Very tropical. The food and drinks were ridiculously expensive. The wait staff was courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room!”
Reviews.Author: OregonWheels
Reviews.Content: We read reviews and were concerned, but took a chance. We were in room 150 so can only report on that. It was amazing! The rooms were very clean, very spacious, and very quiet. The bathroom was larger than normal. Each room has both a front and back patio. The one negative is the pond does have a odor to it. However, the trails are beautiful and the pool was wonderful! We walked around several paths early each morning and just enjoyed the ducks and fountains. Another problem is there is no microwave in the room and none you can access to warm up baby bottles even. The room service and poolside drinks were far too expensive. They could reduce the cost and still make a lot of money! the pool is beautiful but was a little too cold for my toddler. Overall I recommend this hotel to anyone! Booking through Entertainment book.com saved us a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Pricey Resort”
Reviews.Author: irishmom2005
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this resort after a weekend stay with my family. Driving onto the property the lush landscaping was beautiful, reminded me of Maui. Staff at check-in were friendly and helpful. Proprerty looks nice and probably was wonderful when it was originally built but is in need of an update, at least the parts of the resort we experienced. We booked a Garden suite, which was very outdated, nothing luxurious about the rooms. Very basic, in fact, the carpet in our room was very dirty as evidenced by my 3 year old's feet! Air conditioner was loud, king size bed was uncomfortable. $22 parking fee per day is outrageous. Barefoot bar was pricey for the type and quality of food served. It's a 3 star resort charging 5 star prices. Good location if visiting Seaworld, but not a luxury retreat by any means, and room prices are too high for quality of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Echoben
Reviews.Content: Stayed midweek (3days, 2nights) the week before Labor Day weekend and had a great time. We are a family of 5 with 3 boys (7,5,2). We booked a Garden Suite the day before we left as the rates drop significantly to clear inventory. They were also running a special with increasing discounts the longer you stayed. When we arrived we were upgraded to a larger and newer Executive Suite. Read the somewhat conflicting reviews about it but am glad to say we had a wonderful time. We never left the property. And while some parts did look a bit dated the staff was fantastic, very friendly and attentive. I think being midweek had something to do with this as the resort wasn't really that crowded. The main pool has a beach with real sand that the boys loved. And the grounds are beautiful. It really does feel a lot like being in Hawaii. There are plenty of activities and they're all quite reasonable (bike, boat and kayak rentals), and there's a very convenient market on premises for child essentials like milk. Bring your own firewood though, they charge a lot for firewood. The spa is first rate. The beach is great for younger children since it's on a lagoon and there are no waves. It's more like a lake. The Barefoot restaurant is a bit pricey for the kind of food it serves, but it beats driving off property. The fish and sharks in the surrounding pond are a definite plus, especially if you buy the food to feed them from the market. Seaworld is literally right around the corner, but a bit far for walking. The zoo is only about 10 minutes away by car. The only thing I wish they had was a proper Starbucks or equivalent. Looking forward to coming back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: C6RedVette
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights for a wedding as the father of the bride. Requested a suite with two bedrooms close to the Ballroom. When we checked in with another couple at 3:30pm the suite itself was available but not the 2nd bedroom, which was not available until after 5pm. The 2nd bedroom only had access to the suite via the 1st bedroom. Otherwise, you had to walk around the outside of the building. The suite was not close to the Ballroom, you had to walk the entire length of the row of condos via the drive and then hike through the parking lot. The suite had a kitchenette, but it was not furnished with any dishware or towels or any pots, pans, utensils. I had to call housekeeping to get glasses and cups and dishware. I had to go buy papertowels and dishwashing soap and other accessories. It did come with a small microwave, undercounter frige (no ice cube tray) and coffee maker. Housekeeping was very accommodating but only brought items specifically requested, including 2 hand towels to use as dish towels and wash cloth. I also requested maintenance come to replace the air filter. The dust clogged the filter and hung down from the ceiling mounted air vent in long tendrils. The flow of A/C was hampered by the clogged filter. Maintenance never did come onsite during our weekend stay. The suite fronted onto a lagoon that while quaint did not look well maintained and had newspaper floating in it. After visitors commenting on the newspaper, I found a branch lying on the ground and fished out the newspaper. The room itself was comfortable albeit dated. The bathtub was badly cracked and the porcelain had peeled off the interior, but they tried to hide most of it with a plastic mat. Lights were dim everywhere. No hooks for towels, just one towel bar over the toilet in the water closet. One annoyance was returning to the room at 11pm after the wedding only to find neither my nor my wife's keys worked. They worked at 6pm and were not placed next to any item that would have cancelled the programming. Had to call the lobby via my wife's cell phone to have them send out new keys while standing outside the room. The charge for parking was exorbitant - $22 per night for each car. There is one parking space per room. I had to park the 2nd car in the neighboring parking lot and hoof it to the room. No reason for the charge when parking is free during the day to guests? The suite cost more than $600 per night and the extra bedroom was $400. Far too expensive for the quality of the property. Booked via the phone and wanted to get the AARP discount but was told that discount could only be done over the internet (asked again for the discount upon check-in but was told that the AARP rate had to be booked at the time of reservation.)

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Travelon44
Reviews.Content: We just recently spent 4-day at Paradise Point. It's a tough place to reveiw as I feel it may fit some and not others. Also, feel they need to put more effort in customer service and paying attention to guest. Overall at the price we paid it wasn't worth it to us. Day one room was ready around 2:30, paid $ 600.00+. When we got to the room we had 2-towels? With four of use that doesn't work. I called for some more and no one showed up, I finally walked to find a maid who gave me as many as I wanted. Our room had a kitchnette. Basically a fridge and microwave. Thier wasn't one thing supplied. No napkins, forks, spoons, cups, no ice buck Nothing. At this price per night I think it's riduculous. Rooms were good size, however most of the walls and furniture were nicked up, scratched and capet was rough. The pull out bed was awful. THE SPA IS AWESOME! We picked this resort because it was close to Seaworld, we didn't realize it's so private. You can't walk to anything and the bike paths etc. are all accross the water. It's a great place if you're looking for a quiet place to sit and read, but to me it's not suited for an active family vacation. My wife and I enjoyed walking the ground in the morning, my kids 15 & 12 were bored. Pools and Grounds are beautiful. If I did this trip again I was stay near the beach were we could walk to bike trails, resturants etc. We moved north of San Diego later in the week and stayed at an awesome resort that was $200.00 a night cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Your Expectations Low and You'll Be Happy”
Reviews.Author: Kabillionaire
Reviews.Content: Keep your expectations low and you'll be pleasantly surprised. Overall, it's a nice place and very convenient to Sea World, but the place is just crying out for some renovations. The hotel and grounds are beautiful, but the rooms feel old and dilapidated. We originally had a Lanai Garden room with a King bed and a sofa bed. It felt very run down, old, small and although the room was clean, it just felt a little dirty. Definitely needs some updating. My kids (ages 10 & 7) complained (rightfully so) that the sofa bed mattress was really thin and uncomfortable. It was pretty worn out. I contacted the front desk and they were very helpful. We were moved the next day to a different Lanai room with two Queen beds which was much larger too, but not any better as far as the run down feeling. Nonetheless, we were a lot happier in the new room. Staff was extremely helpful, really went out of their way for us and were very friendly. A few other observations: -We ate at their Barefoot Bar & Grill for dinner and again for lunch. Service was really slow at night and a little better at lunch time. Food was a bit overpriced and the quality was sub-par, particularly for the price. The nearby restaurants in Mission Beach are much better and a lot more reasonable. -We rented a paddle boat and a motorboat from the marina and they were fantastic. Really helpful and the prices were reasonable. -We went to the "Pro Shop" to play tennis and found the courts to be pretty run down; the tennis rackets available to be borrowed were a joke. Old, beaten up, too small and in horrible shape. I think they were paddle tennis rackets. Also, the ping pong table was gone, so we couldn't do that either. -The main pool has a beach which is cool and it was pretty easy to get a drink. We were there in August - high season - and the pool was pretty clean and not very crowded. We got 4 chairs for the family pretty easily, which says a lot about the place. Two thumbs up for having lots of chairs at the pool. The other outlying pools were also relatively uncrowded and were great for kids because they are pretty shallow. -Proximity to Sea World was great. If you don't count waiting in line to pay the $12 to park at Sea World, you're no more than 5 minutes from the front gate. Unless you stay in a Beachside room, just try to plan on being away from your room as much as possible, so you're not bothered by the tiny size. Otherwise, you should be satisfied with your stay.

Reviews.Title: “some bits we loved, other bits let them down”
Reviews.Author: Ilovemypets
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort as the hotel we had picked originally was having their pool refurbished during July and our kids like to swim every day. Paradise point was in our travel agents brochure, and in a good location for Sea World, so we picked it fairly quickly as a replacement. Some things we liked, but overall they let themselves down.
