The landscaping is great - beautiful plants and flowers, lovely beach areas, the pools were well maintained and very attractive, the lagoon areas had lots of birds, paths were maintaned well. Our bathroom was great and looked refurbished. The bedding was spotless, but the rest of the furniture was shabby and chipped and the walls were scuffed. There were stains on the carpet, but they had been hoovered and it was generally clean. Our room didn't smell, but the kids room did smell musty. We suffered what other reviewers have mentioned - our rooms were not ready when we arrived at 5pm! The second room was not ready until 6.30pm, an hour and a half after check in - though in their defense they immediately and without us asking gave us $100 on the room to go and have a drink whilst we waited, but it is frustrating when you've had a long journey. As others have said the parking fee is a bit cheeky and not needed when a room is so expensive. The restaurant food ( Barefoot grill place) was fine, but again, they let themselves down. The outdoor furniture hadn't been treated, so the legs of the chairs and tables were rotting and the seats needed sanding and re-varnishing. The second day, all of the waiting staff had dirty uniforms at breakfast - there's no need for this and the manager should be looking out for this sort of thing. The people who manage the grounds should take over the general management, who need a shake up. The concierge was lovely and exceedingly helpful, as was the lady in the shop.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton it ain't....”
Reviews.Author: racine
Reviews.Content: Just as a side note, we travel a lot and I feel that I have pretty middle of the road expectations. We usually stay at the Hilton Resort and Spa in San Diego. It was pretty booked up, so we tried something new and I don't necessarily think the Hilton is the gold standard in hotels, but it sure beats PP. Paradise Pointe just wasn't our speed. If they're going to charge $400+ for a basic room, they need to step it way up on the condition of the hotel and the details. I gave it a 3 -- some things were above average and others way below. I would stay at the Hilton for the $ before we stayed here again. Coincidentally they're both owned by the same company now. Positives: Location: very close to Seaworld, easy drive to all beach cities. Beach is "private" and pretty nice. h20 sport rental -- boats, jet skis, etc. Shark pond for kids. Gorgeous grounds -- very lush. We were given a credit for inconvenience and other issues -- see below. Shampoo and conditioner was very good. Good h20 pressure in shower. Bell men and staff were helpful, gracious and courteous, save for the kids club debacle. Neutral: We were woken up at 6:30 am every morning by maintenance, but hotel tried to make good with a discount. Food at the Barefoot restaurant was very average and expensive -- $15 + for very average eggs benedict. Limited menu. I didn't dare try Baleen for fear of being disappointed. Service was really good for one meal and then terrible the next -- we waited for 50 minutes for a club, burger and some soup and several other tables that were seated/ordered after us were served more complex meals first. $4 for kids pancakes wasn't too bad. We stuck to a couple of our favorite offsite restaurants for dinner, including the Crab Catcher. Rooms were very average for the price. Nothing luxurious and no view -- peeling paint in the shower, but linens were ok and beds were pretty comfy. Negatives: Main pool was disgusting -- we never used it. Dirty bandaids, food debris and ZERO visibility. Lots of extra people at the resort who had families/friends there and hung out on the beach around the firepit. Felt like Simpson family camping. We were looking for something a little more upscale than folks parking their SUVs with jetskis on the lawn in front of our room and inviting their extended families for a beerfest at the "free" beach. Kids club -- this is a service they offer and one of the reasons we chose the hotel. It was booked the first night and they told us we could call back the next day to book for the 2nd day. When we called the next morning, we were told we should have booked the night before because they didn't have anyone to watch the kids because we hadn't booked 24 hrs. in advance. If you're going to offer a service, make it a standing one. Additional $20/nt to park car on top of room rate -- NO WAY!?! Very poor wireless connection.

Reviews.Title: “Great for July 4th Fireworks”
Reviews.Author: WhirlwindTravel
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the resort on July 3rd. The fireworks show was spectacular. The resort itself is okay. Certainly nothing like the fancier resorts in Mexico, Carribean, or Hawaii. But for Southern California, it's not bad. The property is large, meandering roads, ponds, etc. 18 whole miniature golf was fun. The beach is right there; there're fire pits you can you to make a bonfire. The rooms are small and motel-like. The are 2 restaurants in the resort; a formal and an outdoor bar. Pretty mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Loews is much better”
Reviews.Author: ddjs
Reviews.Content: Rooms - old and are not cleaned well; bugs in room; there was no door to the bathroom sink Bathroom - had stench of mildew Amenities - a lot; had mini golf, 5 pools, basketball court, tennis court, bicycle rental; everything cost money, even to use the courts! Receptionists - showed no initiative of service; stood in line and wasn't addressed at all; they sure need to be taught what service is! For the price of around $300-$400 per room per night, it is better to go to Loews. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: YLMom
Reviews.Content: After reading so many negative reviews of this place I just thought I would give my opinion. We just finished a two night stay at Paradise Point. It was my husband, our 14 yo daughter and me. First of all, we stayed in a Junior suite. This is a little pricier than a standard room but it is a larger room with a sitting area, a tiny kitchette area and a very nice bathroom arrangement. When I originally booked in early March the Jr Suite were pretty expensive so I decided to settle for the standard room. However I kept checking prices and the suites came down in price so I changed my reservation to the Junior Suite. The main reason I love Paradise Point is because our room backed up on to a lovely shaded green belt. We had a small patio with chairs. There was a pond near us and every morning I would drink my coffee, read the paper and sit on the patio while ducks would meander by. I just found it peaceful, tranquil, lovely and exactly what I look for in a vacation rest. I will agree that the rooms aren't 5-star quality. But this is a very old place and what the rooms are, is clean and comfortable. They are freshly painted and the decor is 'shabby chic' or maybe they are just shabby (?) but I really had no complaints. The room was clean, the bathroom was very nice with double sinks and granite countertops. The bed was comfortable and I slept wonderfully. My only real complaint was there were no instructions with the coffee maker. The first day I didn' use nearly enough water. The second day I figured it makes about 6-8 cups. I probably could have called to find out. We played the 18 hole putting green, ate at the Barefoot Grill and my husband and daughter rented a jet-ski and jet-skied around Mission Bay. We all relaxed a lot and in a very beautiful setting. I am a person who reads hotel reviews religiously, am very picky about where I stay and really thought twice about Paradise Point based on some of the reviews. But I think it comes down to what you really want. I've had San Diego vacations where we've stayed Downtown in a high-rise with all the moden conveniences and walked the Gaslamp up and back and took in a baseball game. Tons of fun. And I had this vacation where I sat on a patio, fed the ducks, did the daily crossword, enjoyed an absolutely beautiful parklike setting and just relaxed. Both were great vacations and both cost about the same. San Diego isn't cheap for any quality hotel but for what Paradise Point is, it is unique and we will definitely go back. We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Resort...I think not”
Reviews.Author: plmcpa
Reviews.Content: Soon after dropping your bags in your room/bungalow, we realized how similar this property is to a trailer park. Just proves marketing and location will do wonders to keep the hordes flowing in. The staff - everyone was very nice and helpful. We even left some things in the room, called from home, and they're shipping our stuff right away. (I didn't expect to see that stuff ever again.) Although housekeeping did not make us happy when, on our first night there, we found there was no bedding on the pull out sofa our daughter was to use. Housekeeping showed up 1 1/2 hrs later with sheets only. Then two ladies soon arrived with the pillows and blankets and made the bed for us. Thank god they didn't just drop the stuff leaving me to do their job and make the bed myself. This whole misstep kept our 6 y/o up much later than we'd planned. Not bueno. The room - all the rooms are spread out around this large property, like little bungalows. That can be nice/cute but it results in a whole bunch of walking to get anywhere. And due to the bayside location and inadequate ventilation, there's a severe musty smell which permeates the whole place, especially your room. But the bed was okay and the bathroom clean and adequate. The lovely wife had a problem with the half dozen or so spiders she killed. I think her bigger problem was with the ones that didn't show themselves and take their punishment like good arachnids should. We only ate at the casual Barefoot cafe, for breakfast. Pricey ($3.50 for coffee). After ordering oatmeal w/brown sugar and pancakes, it took us a long time to flag down a server to bring us the brown sugar and some syrup for the pancakes. It's very annoying when everyone at the table has to wait and watch their meal get cold while someone else is waiting for something that should have been there before the hot food was ever served. Ducks and birds all over the place. could be considered cute. But duck poop all over the joint. The lovely took a nap in the room, left the door open due to musty odor. We were all proud of her for kicking out the duck that wandered in without calling security! The pool has an odd green color to it. I think blue works much better for me. Except for the ponds they have with the scummy pondwater that looks like they've added Tidy-Bowl. That's the wrong blue. I'd never go back to PP. Why would anyone? Go to a KOA instead. Next time it's the Hyatt downtown near Seaport Village. To heck with the Green Acres experience. Give me Park Avenue. New, clean, marble, 40 stories....I can drive to Mission Bay without sleeping there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Mission Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a recent conference for three nights. Given the wide ranging reviews we weren't sure what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised. The room was very spacious and the furnishings were more modern than we were anticipating. The bathroom had two sinks and a separate shower/toilet room. The only room complaint was an adjoining door that would make a loud thud every time the next door occupants opened/closed their door. We had a small patio in back that overlooked a stream - was a pleasant site to have lunch. The overall property was very beautiful, with meandering gardens, lagoons and gardens. There are at least four pool/hot tub areas to lounge around in during the day. The beach overlooking Mission Bay is nothing special - I swam some laps there one afternoon but there is a fair amount of seaweed and muck. There are a couple of restaurants on site. We had food prepared for our conference but it was typically of average quality. The views of the harbor from the conference/dining rooms were very scenic however. Also beware that there is a $15 fee to use the not that extensive workout room. We found service at the resort to be not exceptional but good enough. One issue was check-in/out. There can be large buildups of vehicles at the reception area and long lines inside the building (automated check-out was not working during our stay). The location is great for quick access to beaches, Sea World, downtown, etc. However there is no public transportation so a vehicle is needed unless you are willing to rack up expensive taxi fares.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Banker-Rick
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Paradise Point was much more pleasant than we had prepared ourselves for. The grounds (as commented by everyone) were beautiful, and the room more than served the needs of a family of four. After having a very favorable bid accepted on Priceline, we became concerned after reading the negative reviews of the property. Thankfully, these concerns were unwarranted. The room was clean and functionally furnished. The staff was courteous and responsive. The mini-fridge allowed us to purchase groceries and do breakfast in the room - saving time and money during our stay. We did not sample either of the on site restuarants, opting instead for nearby, off-site establishments. Being just a few steps from the waterfront was an added bonus. The location was great - convenient to Mission/Pacific Beach, the Zoo, downtown, and LaJolla. As mentioned in another review, GPS was very helpful to first time San Diego visitors. Overall, a very enjoyable stay at Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Location. . . decent MOTEL”
Reviews.Author: orridge
Reviews.Content: As a San Diego native and resident, I have seen a lot of hotels in San Diego and finally got to spend some time in Paradise Point. I have always been impressed with the lush landscaping and during Christmas when the lights and christmas tree are up, it is delightful. However, the rooms are very dated. This means you get an older squeaky wooden bed, old furniture, a small TV and old bathroom fixtures (and the place smells). My wife and I both agreed that the room was reminiscent of those motels one stays in when traveling across the country. The landscaping is nice, always has been. But thats about it. Since our room was paid for as we were attending a company retreat, we had no problem returning to our condo at nights. If you love motels, this is an expensive one you just might like.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: glenn9999me
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay for a week at the Paradise Point Resort with my friend while I recovered from surgery. The staff where professional, courteous, helpful and very friendly. We had to cut our stay short by 3 days and they refunded us and charged us no penalty even though the hotel was full. I was so impressed that I intend to return for a holiday with the kids. The hotel has no bad rooms just better. The garden rooms have great tropical surroundings, you feel like your in the rain forest. I would recommend the Ocean Front rooms if you have a choice. The breakfast is Fantastic, the choice is huge and the quality is great. The $22 parking fee (that they cut to $11 as we stayed a week) is well worth it your car is parked right outside your room just like being at home.We rented a car and got a sat nav with the rental... a must if you don´t know the area, there is so much to do and the shops are amazing sea world and the zoo are just a few minutes away. There is an outlet in carlsbad (15mins drive) that in fantastic, the prices are soooo cheap for all your designer gear. There is also around 3 malls less than 5 mins drive away. You can leave your car and walk down to the beach which is great. The room service menu is fantastic, there is everything you could every want on there and there are restaurants on site that are great. prices are very reasonable. I own a 4 star hotel on the beach in Spain and I can say that I was very impressed with everything about this hotel. I have also stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels round the world and found this to be one of the most enjoyable because of the super relaxed feel to the hotel, even though the hotel was full you felt like you had your own little tropical island and there is very little noise night and day. the staff where great they seemed to honestly enjoy what they were doing and enjoyed seeing how well they could do and how they could make it better for you. I highly encourage anyone planning on staying in San Diego to give them a try. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point Resort is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: MargeMerced
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Paradise Point Resort and would have loved to have stayed longer. We were in San Diego to attend commencement at UCSD. The location was great - close to Sea World, La Jolla and Old Town. I had read the negative reviews and was concerned about room quality & cleanliness. Our room was very good - clean & in good repair. The grounds are absolutely beautiful - several pools, waterfalls, beach access. It felt like Hawaii. The Barefoot Grill Restaurant (on the property) served a wonderful breakfast with a view of the bay. We had a few minor requests for extra towels and to have the outside light turned on that were dealt with promptly. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. We would definitely look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Venue -- Very Surprised”
Reviews.Author: lvein
Reviews.Content: I am not one who generally writes reviews as I have not traveled much recently and prior I almost always used AMEX Fine Hotel and Resorts, which are generally bullet proof for quality. Now I have a wonderful toddler and she was the priority. I looked at various options that would be easy to travel to from Beverly Hills. I thought Sea World would be fun and looked at around 15 hotels in the SD area including Gas Lamp district. When I came across Paradise Point I was excited that they had the duck ponds, as my daughter loves ducks. HOWEVER, I started to read the less than favorable reviews and became very concerned. I called the hotel and asked a bunch of questions. The agent on the phone was exceedingly helpful and I drilled her with questions. She satisfied my interest and I took the leap of faith. Great Decision! Amalie loved seeing the ducks. My schmoozing of the agent resulted in a very nice room upgrade at no cost. I expressed a bit of angst at the $22 car park charge, not that I can’t afford it but one principle, and they did something nice for me with that. There were other unexpected perks at no charge…and clearly no guarantee you will get the same, but I could not have been happier as my daughter loved the place. Also, they have chairs comfortably placed throughout the grounds to sit and relax, nice gardens, very nice staff and a miniature golf course we did not get a chance to use. The beach was nice for all of us as were the pools. The Spa looked impressive but no time for that with the toddler being the focus. Bottom line, I am one pain in the butt when it comes to hotel stay and I certainly will be back! Lawrence Vein

Reviews.Title: “baaad”
Reviews.Author: tazzax
Reviews.Content: I thought it sounded good and 5star review nailed it but: 1. Rooms tatty - less than 3star standard. 2. Service arrogant 3. location (if you don't have a beach side room) poor - little better than a motel! 4. Not a lot around it to do...which is ok if you don't like doing anything! 5. Supermarket (only one small one which sold nothing!) expensive. 6. Pools packed at weekends... On a good point has loads of potential and nice gardens - but not any better than 3star! honest!

Reviews.Title: “Lush Landscape”
Reviews.Author: DbacksFans
Reviews.Content: Although the resort's landscape is lush and it's on the beach, we thought it was a little pricey because the amenities we were interested in, such as the putting green, tennis and basketball, were available for an additional fee. The rooms are charming, but old. Shuttle service to Sea World is not available, and hotel staff told us it was 1/4 mile away and about a 20-minute walk but it's actually a little over 1 mile away. We probably would've been just as happy staying at a less expensive hotel within walking distance to Sea World and the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel Needs Lots of Attention”
Reviews.Author: cactus13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was built in the 60's and it shows. The rooms are tiny with tiny bathrooms. For a family of 4 you get 3 bath towels. The rooms get cleaned every day late afternoon not mornings. The parking(far from room) fee is $22 a day and .075 for the paper daily that is automatically charged to the bill. The menu movies are $12.99. The Bar and Grill food is not to my liking-worst ribs and steak ever. The mojitos are good but are $12. Food is very expensive here. The steak was $25. The inroom desserts are yummy though-huge chocochip cookies and bread pudding. They call their chocolate cake a lava cake but it was just frosted chocolate cake. The AC units are going out so we heard a loud buzzing sound when we tried to sleep. My husband's back was sore from the stiff bed. The pillows need to be replaced because they are crumbled inside. Lots of skunks running around. There is no shuttle service so taxis cram the front parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: crystalcapen
Reviews.Content: Check-in was great, staff was friendly. First night was wonderful. Pools close at 10pm Erica, at Front Desk opened the pool by our room for an extra hour, we were very impressed! I then tried to access the internet in my room, after three username and password failures received from the front desk, I gave up for the night. The room next to our hotel room is a HouseKeeping supply room, all night a long squeaky sound would sound off and on. There is no parking option other than the one assigned by your room, but since there is no option the hotel adds $22 a night for parking. (What is the other option????????) The area is very confusing with a even more confusing map. Few signs are posted to even give a person a clue. First night I found out the outside porch light did not work, called the front desk and was assured someone could fix it the next morning. (Thanks for the added security for the first night.) Then I also realized this is the first Hotel I have ever stayed in that does not offer a deadbolt or inside lock, not to mention my door did not even shut securely and since we were at the back of the Resort (in nowhere land) it made me feel very unsafe. The next day I applied the “Service Please” sign on the door to receive Housekeeping for the day. (The Housekeepers get there supplies and everything two feet from my room), returning at 5PM my room had not been touched. Day two of trying to get online, called for a computer expert. I was sent a Man who came with a cord for the dataport. Plugged it in, and said is it working, because it must be your computer because when I plugged the cord in I didn’t hear that special “CLICK”, I said but the port is lighted up so it must be connecting!! His response was for me to call the front desk, maybe they could help. (Was this ther main IT Man?????) The pool closest to our room was the Meadow pool, night two, it was completely dark, my daughter was swimming, and I could not even see her in the dark to see if she was ok. One of the maintenance men drove by in a cart so I stopped him and asked why is the pool so dark, and if it had no lights why was it open until 10PM. ----No joke ----for the next hour I sat watching four employees walk around the pool with flashlights clueless. I laughed to myself thinking this is like the joke “four men and a lightbulb”. After an hour of the four men searching for this “magical light switch that nobody knows about” one man claimed finally of having no clue, and would try to fix the problem in the morning. - - - My curiosity is with four men on staff, why in the world would none of them have a clue???? Was this side of the hotel just opened after 50 years or something???? Has anyone ever swam after dark here at this pool ever? It’s open till 10PM! Finally after 2 hours of tapping into the IP address from the hotel I finally got online, but password and username didn’t work, so called front desk for the 5th time. 3 light bulbs went out in our room during a three night stay. I am somewhat clueless of how to feel about my stay here, I think I will try somewhere else next time, wouldn’t you?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise After Airport Snafu”
Reviews.Author: HikerGirl41
Reviews.Content: We ended up at Paradise Point when a security breach closed Terminal 2 at Lindbergh Airport. We called a reservation service from a courtesy phone at the airport and were referred to Paradise Point for $149 per night. I was a little nervous because I'd never heard of the place and the rate seemed cheap on the weekend of the Rock N Roll Marathon when many properties were sold out. The property itself is beautiful...tropical landscaping, lagoons, a pretty main pool, a neat observation tower, lots of outdoor seating areas. It felt like Hawaii. Our room was satisfactory. Nothing special but nothing to complain about especially at $149 per night. We had plenty of hot water. I'd agree with others however that the A/C sounded like a 747 about to take off. We stayed in a little bungalow on the bay and we were just steps from the beach. Fire pits on the beach were a nice touch. This was a great place to be with kids. The beach access was super. There were fish and ducks to feed. Walking paths were nice. There was a movie at the pool in the evening. We used an outside pizza delivery service right to our door. Disadvantages: Like so many other reviews, our room was not ready at 3:00 pm when we arrived. They said they'd call but didn't. We didn't get into our room until 4:30. There was no room service menu in our room. Our portable crib requested at check-in didn't come until almost 7:00. The restaurants were expensive and not really geared to someone with kids. Golf carts to get you around were a nice touch but seemed to disappear after dark...and this is a place where you can really get turned around. No ammenities are really provided. I've stayed at Best Westerns that will give you a toothbrush if you've forgotten one. This place will nickel and dime you to death. As I mentioned, we were there because of airport snafus. We had no luggage. 6 diapers, a pack of wipes, two toothbrushes and a mini toothpaste set me back about $24. All that said, this seems like a great place to come with a family if you are prepared. We met many families from Orange County who come as a getaway with the kids. They bring snacks, waters and toys for the kids. They enjoy the pool, movies, beach and walking paths. It's a gorgeous place with room to explore. Despite some of the negatives, I believe we'd come again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money”
Reviews.Author: Cathy_ann
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference here this week. What a expensive disappointment! The only favorable things I can say about the property are the following: cordial staff and beautiful grounds. The property sits in front of the San Diego Bay and there was a beautiful view from the conference rooms, other than that I was completely grossed out. The bathroom was in need of gutting, but was being held together with tons of plaster, from the toilet to the tub. It was all a mess and for the rates that they're charging; the toilet and bathtub should be replaced. The bathroom had very few toiletries. We had to call for shampoo and hand soap. Don't waste your money on this very expensive dump!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Lost - rather disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DisneyDave23
Reviews.Content: This was our 7th and last destination in our 2007 summer holiday which took in San Francisco (Holiday Inn, Fisherman's Wharf), Yosemite (Yosemite View Lodge), Carmel (Carmel Mission Inn), Santa Maria (Holiday Inn), Beverly Hills (Beverly Hilton), Anaheim (Sheraton Anaheim) and San Diego (Paradise Point). This review is for the Paradise Point Resort and Spa. “Oh, you’re gonna love San Diego” they all told us as we travelled down from San Francisco. Well I’m not sure that we saw the true San Diego (given that we had a 3 night stay and both Sea World and San Diego Zoo to fit in as part of our Southern California Attraction Pass), but overall we were very disappointed. The journey down from Anaheim was hell on wheels. A 4+ hour crawl like nothing we’d seen on the holiday prior to that. We got to the resort late afternoon and at first all appeared fine. The grounds are large and well maintained. I likened it to an upmarket Centre Parcs (for all the Brits reading this) – a series of bungalows with a shared front door which then leads left or right to your room. You park outside your bungalow in a number bay. The rooms were pretty weird. An eclectic mix of aged furniture of all different styles and colours, a drab kitchenette and an odd sliding door directly opposite the beds to the bathroom. There was a patio door to a small patio overlooking a large pond (no, not a pool; a green weedy pond – somewhat of a risk for young kids). Lighting was poor and hot fully functioning and the air con was a beast of a thing in the corner of the room that nearly had the place taking off when it was turned on. Our closest pool was quite small and very shallow: more suited to small kids. There were a couple larger pools on site but not exactly close at hand. The reception building was simply a place to check in and out but the staff were extremely polite and efficient. Eating wasn’t easy. The location, opening hours and offering were not very appealing hence we did our own thing off-site. All in all, the brochure picture looked stunning and this was the second most expensive nightly stay after the Beverly Hilton. What with the journey down to San D and then a nervously early set off to LAX to allow plenty time, we really think we would have preferred 6 more nights in Anaheim (for the same price as our 3 at Paradise Point). If you want to spend loads of cash paying for extra sports activities on site then OK but to be honest, having had such a great holiday, Paradise Point was a big let down – definitely not paradise for us. As for Sea World, well, after Disney I’m afraid it cannot compare. I’ve done Sea World in both Florida and San Diego and I won’t be going back. San Diego Zoo was also disappointing. Some good areas but also quite a lot of very bedraggled enclosures that were really not what I was expecting. The bus tour is useful to get your bearings but overall, the zoo is quite hard to get round and very hilly in places. Food offerings and gift shops at both attractions are poor. Disney 100 San Diego 0

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: anmee2
Reviews.Content: I don't ever write reviews but my experience with this hotel was so incredibly frustrating, that I am going to take a moment and let you all know. From the beginning, the hospitality and courteousness of the hotel was lacking. When we were checking in the front desk clerk, who happened to be the manager, was very rude and a poor reflection of their service. Our rooms were not ready, even though it was past check in time, so we had to wait....and wait.........and wait. We didn't get our room until after 5:30pm! They lied about calling us to tell us our rooms were ready and they had tried to make it seem like it was our fault. Secondly, there was curly hair in the supposedly cleaned bed....GROSS!!! They only had 2 towels in the bathroom, so when we called for new towels they didn't deliver them until 2.5 hours later. The pictures of the hotel do not depict the actual image of the place. It is old, unkept, and their lagoon/pond is full of mildew and debris. Lastly, they charge you $22 a night for parking, which you are forced to do since there are no other places that you can park due to the location of the place. Again I personally will never stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: evelynyoshimi
Reviews.Content: As evidenced by the less than flattering title of my review, Paradise Point is a pretty mediocre hotel with less than great service. We chose Paradise because a friend was having a wedding here. After driving from LA and arriving at about quarter after four, we were told that our room wasn't ready yet and they had no clear idea of when it would be ready--- this happened notwithstanding that the hotel knew we were there for a five thirty wedding on their premises!!! After forty-five minutes were unapologetically given access to our room and therefore ended up being the absolute last guests to show up at the wedding. Overall, the rooms were ok-- but in the morning we discovered both that the hotel had forgotten to put shampoo in our room and that after about fifteen minutes the hot water in the bathroom runs out. Definitely not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: coffeesmit
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort for families with young children. Our group consisted of two families with four children total (ages 5 - 12).The rooms are cottage-style, which means that we didn't have to be overly conscious of our noise level. We all loved the beach surrounding the resort, the marina, the restaurants and the mini-golf course. There was a great lookout tower in the middle of the property that we all climbed every day. We also enjoyed the property's casual dining near the marina, which had a private pond containing a variety of salt-water fish (even a small shark). Sea World is literally a few blocks away and many other San Diego attractions are close as well. We were thrilled with the location of the resort. My only criticisms are 1. The tennis courts were in bad shape and there was no tennis program to speak of, and 2. The food/beverage service at the main pool was poor. All in all, this was a great experience and I would stay there again for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Vlovesyoga
Reviews.Content: I just spent the last few days at Paradise point with my 2 boys. I absolutely loved it! It was my second stay there but my last stay was in 1999. My first visit was just as wonderful. The room was very comfortable and the service was exceptional. I would recommend it with or without children. They have a very large lagoon with beautiful birds every where. Also, the main pool was very beautiful and clean. If your thinking about visiting don't hesitate. I have traveled a lot and the price is very well worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “4th stay in 8 years”
Reviews.Author: conservative1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Paradise Resort at least 4 times in the past 8 years. The first was in 1998. We loved it back then because even though it was a bit pricey it was what we were looking for. We stayed in a suite on the bay side and we had no complaints about the room, the room service, the management, or the restaurant service. The best meals we had were in the 5 star restaurant that was, unfortunately, a few years later converted into a banquet hall (What a bunch of idiots!) On our second stay the prices were higher (both food and room) and our only complaint was that the music from the live band at the restaurant was too loud in the evening (I think it was the Barefoot). Our third stay and the prices were higher again. The room service staff were pleasant and for the most part timely. The pool side restaurant had removed the spicy Buffalo wings from the menu (What a bunch of idiots!) and my wife had several minor complaints (can't remember what they were.) Her complaints were not being addressed, so, she asked to speak to the manager (don't remember the ladies name) and would you believe it, the manager refused to come out to the front desk to speak to my wife! Unbelievable! Our 4th stay in May '07 we had a larger suite with a double bathroom. I didn't like the location because it was next to the storm drain. Which is just an ugle eyesore, and what parent wants their kids playing next to an unsanitary storm drain? Incidently, the storm drain beach is the family beach where all the larger families stay because that's where the bigger rooms are. I have several complaints from our last stay. Maid service has definitely gone down hill; on one instance we asked for some sugar packs and ketchup and we got tissue and cotton balls--slight translation problem here? But my biggest complaint is smokers! Try and relax in a beach chair with a magazine and a great view while some idiot is upwind puffing away on a cancer stick! In the Baleen restaurant there were cigar smokers on the outside patio. So, we figured, "well let's just eat inside." What a bad decision! All the smoke was blowing inside the restaurant!! It's too bad the management could care less about this place, because it used to be a real gem and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TripHHH
Reviews.Content: We won this resort through Priceline for a fantastic price. I was a bit worried upon reading the reviews, but was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The resort is gorgeous. Our room was spotless and nicely decorated. The furniture is antique, distressed style that is made to look worn and old. It is a style, not a reflection of the room being outdated or old. Beds were very comfortable. Nice spa toiletries provided in the room, as well as cotton balls and q-tips. The food at the dockside restaurant was wonderful. I didn't think it was too pricey, probably moderate...although the drinks (even soft drinks) were very overpriced. $3.50 for a soft drink with dinner. The meal itself was very, very good. It was nice eating outside at night even, as they have outdoor heaters that worked wonderfully. We enjoyed the big birds that wandered around looking for food. Not sure what type of sea bird they were (not seagulls) but they weren't aggressive and we found them rather charming. Really enjoyed the main pool. Beautiful with a waterfall, sand area and beach-style pool entry. I would recommend this resort to others. Walking on the beach at sunset for nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: kea23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paradise Point the first week of April with my girlfriends as a girls-getaway long weekend. We had a great time! The rooms were quaint with a patio and chairs in the front and back. The rooms could use a little updating, but nothing major. The pool areas were very nice and clean. For a group of women with no children, the main pool was a little over-run with kids, but there are four other quieter pools to choose from. People have complained in other reviews about things being too spread out. Though you do have to walk to get to places, you are never walking more than five minutes and the ground are beautiful, so it was always enjoyable. The drinks and food were a little expensive, but not more than you would expect for a resort. We only at lunches and breakfasts at the resort, which we enjoyed. The birds bothering you outside while you ate were slightly obnoxious, but part of the experience. I would recommend Paradise Point to others and would return there myself.

Reviews.Title: “Hairy tubes”
Reviews.Author: pstgearman
Reviews.Content: After reservation booked our rooms for the wrong month even though we said we be there Easter night. I checked into the room and their were long black hair all over the floor. I looked at the bathtub and saw several black curly hairs on the bathtub walls. I walked up to the front desk and asked the manager to come look at my room. He came to see the hairs and his first question was did you use the facilities? I pointed out that we just checked in and my wife and child are blond and a redhead and since I have military short brown hair this could not be possible. He sent a maid with a spray bottle and a towel to wipe up the hairs. She didn't get them all so me wife and I ended up cleaning the tube. No discount no apology.

Reviews.Title: “Dumpy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mdmcmanus1
Reviews.Content: Dumpy rooms. The grounds were beautiful but the rooms left a lot to be desired. In it's time I'm sure it was a nice place. The rooms smelled like mildew and were basic. For some reason the hotel put a $5,000 hold on my credit card and it has not been resolved a week later. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: twkrssk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. For the price of the place, we would have expected big rooms, but the room we stayed in was small and stuffy. At least the bed was comfy. I felt it was way overpriced for what we got, the Holiday Inn would have been a great comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: DorothyMD
Reviews.Content: This resort may have been the best value I have ever experienced. We chose the PP Resort because the more classically popular SD options - The Del, Marriott, etc. were asking twice as much for "hotel" rooms with no views. At the AAA rate of under $200/night - on those glorious grounds, I would have been happy with a garden hose. Yet, the showers as well as the rooms were were spacious, quiet (stay near the adult pool), & cool, with garden views we found to be nicer than the beachfront. Our friends who came down from Pasadena & San Francisco, discerning all, found it reminiscent of Hawaii. Glorious tropical feel, unpretentious adorable staff, decent pools (especially the empty adult pool), perfectly fine casual restaurant by a natural "acquarium" where our 4 year old frolicked within a few feet of our table. The hotel was fully booked yet we never felt crowded, nor had to wait for a table in the restaurants. Best of all - the upscale Baleens's restaurant could compete with any, anywhere. We are major international foodies and were blown away by the food, its presentation, and the service. For a family with tot aged kids, the Paradise Point resort is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “What is okay? Not with my hard earned money!”
Reviews.Author: les805
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paradise Point Resort the weekend of March 8,9, 2008. We are a couple whose two children's families also stayed. While one couple professed satisfaction with the resort (they stayed in a beachfront suite) we other two famiies felt it worn and much in need of attention. The good: Rooms were clean and ready upon our arrival. Beds were of very good quality and comfortable. The bad: Arrival: We were greeted at the spartan front reception with little or no sense of care after 'valets' ignored guests while they walked into lobby. At no time were we told prior to our arrival that there was a $21 'parking' fee for our car. When we asked if we could park elsewhere the fee was halved for 2 nights. In our room the blinds did not operate properly on one window and could not be opened. The front door outdoor light was out and we had to ask 3 times for it to be replaced. The resort is surrounded and encased by driveways and asphalt. The foliage is overgrown and borders on dangerous in areas where palm trees are in desperate need of branch trimming overhead. Pool drinks were over $10 for specialties on their menu. The area around the pool was dirty and unswept, irritating when guests were naturally barefooted. The dining room was noisy but most disgusting were the seagulls or other seabirds who were lurking ready to swoop down to your tables, even at night. One was under the table right next to our set of tables. Upon checkout two of our son's bills were placed on our bill, causing a delay while they verified our concern. Our overall view is that.....where is management? Tired is an apt phrase for this resort. Would we return........NO

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY...... SKIP THIS ONE -Better accomodations at 1/4 of the cost”
Reviews.Author: kkgd
Reviews.Content: ROOMS not at all what the pictures show. Broken Toilet that would not flush and leaked constantly. CHARGED extra money for 4 in room and then the sofa sleeper was broken. After bringing it to the attention of the front desk they attempted to add an extra person charge that was already paid for at booking. Service slow and poor at the restaurants. The landscaping and location were the only highlights. WE FELT LIKE COMPLETE SUCKERS when despite bringing our concerns to the attention of management, they did nothing to rectify. We have left 4 messages for the general manager and still no REPLY. This place is arrogant, you will find MUCH Better options at MUCH LOWER prices...... SAVE YOUR MONEY........ SKIP THIS PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Not at all worth the price”
Reviews.Author: goingplaces63
Reviews.Content: We've just come home from our third stay at San Diego Paradise Point and won't be returning there in the future when we head back to San Diego. We booked at Paradise Point again because of our past great holidays there, however, now the hotel is way over priced for what you get. Over the last couple of years they've let the rooms run down. We were supposedly upgraded to a better room when we got there, however the pull-out bed our son slept on was so uncomfortable that we left it as a couch for him to sleep on the last three nights. Our garden view was of a a big tree with the highway directly behind it. This for just about 500.00 a night?? plus parking fees, plus admin tax...the size of the room was small, the amenities they provided were of dollar store quality and one night, we were given one towel to use for all three of us. We had to wait over an hour for bedding for our son the first night and one of the blankets they brought had holes in it. We travel a lot and have stayed places that were half the cost that had much more to offer. The food in the lounge was over priced, especially for the quality. Want to play on the tennis court? Don't expect to be able to rent a racket that isn't crooked. We must say thanks to the great staff at the court who must have known that it was silly to charge us 10.00 for a half an hour to play with lousy rackets-thanks to him for giving us one positive experience and allowing us to play for free. We were very saddened by our experience there as we'd returned because of our great memories. We'll be staying elsewhere next time and would recommend the same as the rest of our trip to San Diego was fantastic. It would have been great to come home to a nicer place at night, but ah well, at least we didn't spend much time there. The grounds are pretty, but for what you get in the rooms, you might want to just stay at a motel 6

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort but rooms.....”
Reviews.Author: Pinaymi2
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms for my daughters March 8th wedding at the Resort. The rooms were discounted for the affair for $259.00/night + taxes + parking( $10.00/night)= $ 311/night. The resort is spread out on 44 acres on Vacation Island which is situated in Mission Bay. The cottages are spread out through out the resort and village clusters are named for flowers: Orchid, Hyacinth, Eucalyptus, etc. Some of the pricier ones are located near the water or beach and some face the ponds. There is a tennis court, basketball court, putt-putt golf in some of the villages. The main lobby is separate and located in the middle of the entrance. You pull up to the curb ( if you have your own transportation) and check in, then a bell boy will lead you by golf cart to your cottage. If you take a taxi you will be loaded into a golf cart and driven to your room. Unless there are several lined up there is a wait unti they return. If youare adventurous you can walk with your luggage. The layout is confusing at first with the one ways and turns. The business Center is in the Paradise Ballroom which is in the same area as the Lobby but not connected to it...it is another walk.Near the Ballroom is the Barefoot bar & grill ( expensive) & the Baleen restaurant( open in evening). There is the Island Market for sundries,souvenirs same vicinty as lobby. The Main pool and Spa are located next door to the Market. There are three lawns to do your wedding, the Sunset, Paradise & Lawn point. The Paradise is the nice one with cement squares in the grass so you walk on something solid. It isn't as exposed but you have the Marina view it is more than the Sunset lawn with is on the opposite side of the Ballroom and is all grass also looking out to the Marina, more exposed so a little more windy and cooler( this is March remember and at 4:30 pm). Both are accessible to the ballrooms. Lawn point is smaller and tucked in near the Marina and Barefoot grill. You will do a lot of walking to get to the Main area or call /flag down one of the many golf carts driving around. Ice machines are located in one area of the village so if you are lucky to be near it Great! If not you have to walk to it. The rooms are not that great..we had a double bed so it was slightly larger than the King. I think the theme is distressed/tropical because the furniture looked like it was made to look scuffed and old. The amoire had a decent looking Tv and a small ref next to it, below a coffee maker with just coffee, no tea. and no plug near it..you have to move it to the bathroom to plug it in. The carpet looks clean but please bring slippers or you feet will be dingy.Smelled musty had to open doorwall but was missing the screen so we just pulled it open little so nothing would crawl in. The painted wooden lanai chairs on the patio were flithy we had to scrubb them before we sat in them. We faced the pond, nice with the ducks. Door mat had grass growing from it. The bathroom was marble tiled, pretty clean, had a hair dryer, ironing board was rusty and unbalanced when you opened it. The one thing was there little ants crawling on bed, bath counter, once inwhile the ref. It would have been nice to have complimentary bottled water in the room for the price you pay for the room. There is # parking for each room. We shared a common foyer with the room next door so you had to use your room key to enter and had a doorbell for each room. I got the same comment from the others regarding their rooms. The only room i saw that was nice was the one my daughter was in but she was the bride so she had one facing the water and it was modern, painted nice, clean had a living area and kitchenette, separate bedroom, and bathroom. This was probably a suite so must be pricey. You have to like that kind of atmosphere, but it was really nothing special i must say ...for $ 300+ we could have stayed at a four star hotel and had a better room. The Personnel were nice and helpful though. San Diego is pricey so can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, but it could be better”
Reviews.Author: happychap79
Reviews.Content: I have to admit to being disappointed at the quality of this resort. It has the potential to be wonderful, but its in desperate need of refurbishment and renovation. For example, the main pool area - facilites are limited and the whole area had a 'tired' feel to it. My family thouroughly enjoyed our stay, and the staff were wonderful, however, Iwouldnt recommend this place as good value for money

Reviews.Title: “great but could be better”
Reviews.Author: travelsalotAlbanyNy
Reviews.Content: ok so I dont know what MOST of the fuss is about..great resort the grounds were beautiful even in the rain-rooms very large with queen size beds-plenty of towels etc....I have two complaints the first is the $22/day for parking that everyone complains about! get rid of it raise all rooms $5 and call it a day also if you are going to get $75-100 for breakfast you might want to work on the service-ok most days- last day was a nightmare $4.50 for a small glass of oj, couldnt get a refill on coffee for nothing. You could get snacks and cereal, milk in the gift shop which we did most days. Also its away from the city and the transportation is fair at best you really do need a car. Overall the staff was very helpful, the place was clean what more did you need.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort - over 44 acres”
Reviews.Author: bhershey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, and the grounds are beautiful. I attended a conference with my husband. I wish I had known, in advance, that the resort is very spread out over 44 acres. If you want to go for breakfast, or a drink, you must walk - pretty far - depending on where your room is located. The shower heads are wonderful. The rooms could be updated. The pools are well maintained. The fitness center is small. We did not use the spa, as the prices seemed high in comparison to the rest of the resort. We would stay here again. You definitely need to rent a car, if you stay here to visit the other San Diego sights.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel.....needs a NEW UP-DO....hestitant to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: theatregirl
Reviews.Content: Disappointed......I have stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels....the room was stuffy, smelling, mildewy smell......others in our group, had similar problems on conference. Hard to get a room, since conference was booked. Old.....NEEDS REFURBISHING BADLY. I would definately not stay at this hotel, if you have options to stay other places. Very isolated from restaurants, shopping etc. Pretty foliage, that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: stef_ray
Reviews.Content: Went here for vacation with my mom, and we had a blast. It was beautiful, there was so much to see and do! Felt just like I was in Hawaii! The room was nice, a little outdated, but still a good place for sleeping. The staff was very helpful, getting us a rental car and advising us on what malls to hit! And the food was amazing! They were very helpful in accomodating my gluten-free diet, and everything tasted so good! Definitely want to go back someday!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: ncdeb73
Reviews.Content: Went to Paradise Point for a business trip. The grounds are beautiful. Extremely spread out. Our room-nice king bed, with couch and two extra chairs, plus a desk and chair. Also had a wood armoire with TV and mini fridge. I liked the bedspread on the bed. It made me think more of home or a bed and breakfast rather than a generic hotel bedspread. Our fridge did not work. It lacked a temperature knob and wasn't even plugged in. There was coffee left for us, but no coffee pot. I'm sure we could have asked about the fridge and coffee pot, but it really didn't matter to us. You could definitely tell that the place was old. The last night we were there, the armoire door came off one of the hinges. It was a heavy door and I didn't want it falling off the other hinge in the middle of the night. We called the front desk and someone came to take the door off completely. It wasn't something that was a quick fix because the wood of the armoire was worn and old. Again, it wasn't something that concerned us cause we were leaving the next day. We did not have a car, but from what I understand, it costs $17-$25 to park your car. ( I don't know the exact number). The bar/grill at the hotel is WAY overpriced. We didn't want to eat there, but we were starving and didn't have a choice. The gym is located in their spa. The gym cost $10 or $15 but we had a reduced rate. Small gym, but they had what I needed. All of the machines are brand new. Each bike, treadmill and ellitical had it's own tv and they gave you water, headphones and a towel. The changing room was very nice as well. The grounds are very extensive and spread out. If you call the front desk, they will send a golf cart to take you to other places in the resort. You really need a car at this resort as there is no other place closeby to walk to. I don't feel as though the prices they charge for this place are worth it. They were charging $185. Considering that you have to pay to park, are limited on the food choices and that it is old, I think you could do better in the SD area. If you could get in this place for under $150, I think it would be ok. The proximity to Sea World is outstanding and that is one positive point. There are lots of restaurants within close driving distance. One other positive point is that the meeting and banquet facilities at this place are outstanding. The rooms and the restrooms are beautiful. Also, the staff was always very friendly. So, I give the 3 circles because we had some good and some bad with our trip. Stay here if you can find a good rate-otherwise, find somewhere else where they don't charge you for every single thing.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not worth 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: smsteffy
Reviews.Content: I don't really understand why this hotel has 4 stars, but I'll say that the rooms are decent. I've been there twice - the first time, the room was incredibly humid and border line clean. The second time was a little better. The A/C units are old, noisy and inefficient, and the beds not that comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay-kind of disappointing”
Reviews.Author: chops66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 12/31-1/4. Hotel rated at 4 stars. Should be rated at 3. Service is not great. Pool was unkempt, no towels available. Waited 45 minutes for more towels, they never came. Housekeeping was hit or miss. No robes in room, bathroom like a motel. Great grounds, unfortunately you have to drive everywhere. Room service was okay, forgot to bring butter for toast. This hotel needs stronger management, and is missing the small touches. Not a great value for the dollar.

Reviews.Title: “more Problems in paradise”
Reviews.Author: travelin___man40
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and thought at first it was going to be a good deal! No soap in the room for the first 2 nights! Rooms were not very clean and to top it all off my wife and baby got food poisoning from the bar and grill restaurant and we nearly lost our baby! Ive spent the last 4 nights in the hospital with my child. I Had to do cpr on him to resuccitate him...doctors said that it was problem someone who handled the food the salad which she had and the strawberries that somehow contaminated it! Will pass next time, beware! Todd

Reviews.Title: “Could be Paradise”
Reviews.Author: GORUk
Reviews.Content: Each time we have stayed here has been through Virgin Holidays (you don't pay the outrageous $20 per day car parking!) and we have always enjoyed the stay. The surroundings are lush and relaxing and the staff are friendly. There are, though, certain frustrations: You do have to check that the room type booked is the one you are given, usually it takes 3 tries to get the right room. Expect hefty prices in the restaurants (there are plenty of wonderful places to eat outside the hotel!) and even the coffee cart is expensive. Always check the signs on the beach as the water may well not be safe for paddling. On the last visit we shared our Lanai garden Room with a family of ants (complained about but not rectified). Having said all that, you are on an island so expect your fare share of wildlife. The pools and landscaping are great and the shop is well worth a visit even if only to buy duck food for the kids. This is a great place to stay to get away from the bustle of this wonderful city. Finally, what is it with hotel telephone charges? The local Virgin rep is in Las Vegas.... be seated when you discover the phone charges if you need to speak with them! I like the place and will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Trouble in Paradise (Sort of)”
Reviews.Author: WorldTrvlrGuy
Reviews.Content: I booked same day for a next lower than bay view on Expedia for $111 ! I grew in San Diego and have seen this property change owners more times than...well, you finish it. A lot. I had never been there. I always stay in the Hayatt or the W in the Gaslamp Quarter as I usually am there for conventions these days. About the hotel, the grounds are as georgous as they are difficult to navigate. What is it with the $20 parking fee? The girl at the front desk must have seen the [--] on my face and she went overboard with "you will parking right next to your room" speil. Expedia should mention that PARKING WILL BE 25% OF THE ROOM COST. As for the room. It had obviously recently been refurbished. It was roomy and had a beachy charm. Even at $111+$25 it was well worth it. BTW the hotel could not have 10% occupied. I was the only person in the Barefoot resaurant and the other reviewers are right. Save you money. Way, Way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some of the reviews”
Reviews.Author: possummom
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference here & and the meeting facilities were nice. Our room was roomy but musty and could definitely use new carpet and paint. We had a view of shrubs and our patio set was too dirty to sit on when we arrived & the next day the cleaning staff hosed it down and it was too wet to sit on. The concierge was helpful and the grounds were beautiful and were being well maintained. There are long walks from areas of the resort to the main lobby. And, this hotel loves to charge for everything including $20/day parking and $10/day internet usage. Would recommend that you ask for a "beach"side room as the view is much better. The pool area was nice and warm enough to swim in in late October.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location with adequate room for short stay”
Reviews.Author: willowy74
Reviews.Content: won hotel through priceline for $100 a night. fabulous location for sea world. beautiful stunning 'island'. Resort grounds are lovely, although not clearly signposted. Gift shop adequate as is the barefoot bar and grill, although service lousy. Reception and porter staff are great, Ring 0 for a courtesy buggy to collect you from your room, The cove/beach is pretty too. Lovely resort for couples or families. Very quiet and i wouldnt wanna stay there on my own. i agree with a previous review - it is like butlins on a paradise resort. shalet bungalows and little lanes. nice and relaxing... i would recommend it for a week or less

Reviews.Title: “Solid, Good for Our Family and Needs”
Reviews.Author: rubytuesday
Reviews.Content: When my travel agent suggested Paradise Point, I was definitely nervous, what with so many mixed reviews here. But I took a shot, and I am glad. Our family, including several small children, really enjoyed PP. We rolled in at 3:15 on a Saturday and no one was around guest-wise. Based on previous reviews, I was worried about not being able to check in. No problem at all actually, I walked right to the counter, quick CC swipe and got the key. The bell staff came right over and gave me a ride on their golf cart while my family followed behind in the van. Parked at the unit, a suite on a little cove, and the bellman took everything in. Suite was perfect for us, a living room with pullout sofa, nice little kitchenette with refridge/micro/sink and then a separate bedroom. No cracks, smells, etc. They had forgotten our cribs, so a quick call and three minutes later another cart pulls up and a man sets them up for us. The rest of the stay was very. Our kids loved the little cove as they could goof off in the sand and chase birds. The firepit was a huge, especially when we made smores. Staff we encountered were nice, efficient. We did not make much use of the pools or grounds due to weather and off-site activities, but the place really is pretty, reminiscent of resorts in Hawaii with all the flowers and foliage. So I feel relief and good fortune for our stay. About the only thing I can say is that I wish it was a little closer or walking distance to offsite shops/restaurants, we took our car out almost every day. Never more than 15 minutes, but might try the Marina or Coronado some time.

Reviews.Title: “What an exceptional Resort”
Reviews.Author: Marissa51
Reviews.Content: The name of this hotel truly describes it. The staff are exceptionally helpful, every part of the resort is immaculate and the pools are all amazing. Would highly recommend this resort for anyone wanting to have a really relaxing holiday but there is lots to do in San Diego if you want. Can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious resort”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTraveler70
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is a highly restful and relaxing resorts at which we have stayed. That is due to the accomodations and the staff. The "rooms" are small but adequate cottages that allow you to relax in comfort and solitude. The locations of the cottages are quite a walking distance from the main lobby, but the staff offers complimentary rides whenever needed just by calling the front desk. The staff were all courteous and friendly. They helped us locate attractions in San Diego, and answered all of our questions. The dining in all locations on property was delicious and relaxing. Only one suggestion is that you should use the safe that is provided for your valuables as the cleaning staff left our door open when they left our room. No big problem, but one should be aware that incidents can happen anywhere. We plan to stay here on our next visit to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: hawkeyelady
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Paradise Point Resort and I have to say I was disappointed. The meeting and conference rooms are very nice and well serviced, but the sleeping rooms leave much to be desired. I found the rooms to be dingy and not very clean. The beds are very uncomfortable and some of the bungalows do not have much room in them. The view was very nice and we had a room right on the water, which was wonderful. We found the service to be good and the concierge was extremely helpful. The drinks at the Barefoot Bar and Grill are a little pricey compared to what we're used to . Expect to pay $7-10 for a bottle of beer...mixed drinks were much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: louisvillemom
Reviews.Content: This resort is WONDERFUL! Four of us booked a trip through Expedia and were a little nervous reading the reviews. I cannot understand any of the negative reviews on here. The only thing we decided is that there are some people that will complain no matter what, they will find something to pick on. Also, there are always people trying for a free room! The grounds are beautiful and the rooms spacious and clean. Everyone that worked here always had a friendly smile and great attitude about helping with anything. The food and drinks were very good, although a little expensive. We went to a nearby store and stocked our refrigerater witch helped alot. The concierge was great with information for the nearby attractions. We all agreed we can't wait to go back and bring more friends along with us - our last couple trips were Cancun and Cruises - we decided this was just as nice without leaving the country.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of paradise in san diego”
Reviews.Author: WelshTraveler
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for eight nights at the end of a busy three week holiday travelling around California with friends. We were a bit apprehensive having read reviews before we went which couldn't have been further from the truth. Although we arrived on their busiest weekend due to the power boat racing in the next bay we found the resort was quiet, beautifully maintained, and a real haven to relax in. The room and ensuite were well proportioned and kept very clean and tidy by a housekeeping staff who dealt with any problems very quickly. The pool we used was very clean with a constant supply of clean towels. Breakfast in the Barefoot grill was reasonably priced, the waiters very attentive and the views over the bay very picturesque. The concierge was most helpful with any queries we had about local attractions and the shop sold a variety of items from foodstuffs, clothes, and souvenirs. The only disappointing part we found was at the Baleen restaurant where the drinks were quite pricey and the service not as good as it should have been. We would certainly return here and would recommend this little bit of paradise to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Lousy Resort!”
Reviews.Author: CA-Thor
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Paradise Point on Mission Bay this month and was really disappointed! Without a doubt this is a great location in the middle of Mission Bay. Hotel is single story with a bunch of single story duplex's scattered all over the place in the lush tropical grounds but the rooms do not measure up to the Resort standard. The rooms are very old and have been painted in bright tropical colors to help cover up the age of the rooms. My room had a musty smell, black mold in the room, the paint on the bathroom ceiling was peeling and bubbling. While walking the grounds in the evening we came across a possum one night, a SKUNK two nights and we smelled a skunk on the third night. To add insult to injury if you have a car they charge you $20 a night to park next to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At This Property !!!”
Reviews.Author: APSCAGuy
Reviews.Content: I decided to bring my parents (seniors) to San Diego after a 45 year absence plus to celebrate their 54th anniversary. Instead of booking through the website - I called the hotel directly to reserve two rooms (Bayside Studio & Garden Lanai). From the conversation with the booking agent, it appeared she was knowledgable about the property in detail. And when price was discussed, she bargained the rates with me (to my benefit). Entering the property, you find it lush and large. There was no valet or bellperson at the lobby entrance after waiting 15 minutes. I asked for an early 2pm check-in when the reservation was made. We arrived at 4:10pm and the rooms were not ready. (They were finally ready at 4:45pm.) BTW: Check-In time is published as 4pm. When we got into the rooms, the Garden Lanai room had filthy sheets, hardly any towels, a broken shower head and smelled of mildew. The Bayside Studio had a damaged amoire, a tattered bedspread and a sliding glass door that would no lock properly. The whole property is in BAD shape - it needs a comprehensive makeover - especially given its price point. The only attribute is its location. I am a world traveler plus work in the hospitality arena. This is one property I will never stay at again and ensure everyone I know traveling to San Diego to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, terrible "resort"”
Reviews.Author: millsisforlovers
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is far from paradise. Upon arrival, we were taken to our room at what seemed like the farthest end of the hotel, adjacent to a main road (rooms 550-560). As we walked in the door, the rubber door lining came off the doorjamb, thus making it impossible to fully seal the door. Once inside, the room itself was freezing! It was about 63 degrees inside the room, and it was in the 70s outside. We turned the AC off and soon realized why it had been turned down so low. The room reeked of mildew. We noticed that the refrigerator was leaking and making a strange high-pitched squealing noise, so we shut it off and cleaned up the pool of water underneath it. As we were taking the top bedspread/quilt off the bed, we saw two large cigarette burn holes on it (in a non-smoking hotel). We immediately called housekeeping to get it replaced. The woman on the phone sounded exasperated, as if this kind of thing happens all the time. The staff didn't come to replace the quilt for at least an hour. Later that night, we ordered room service for dinner. The staff member who delivered the meal told us to leave the tray outside when we finished and he would be back to pick it up later. The next morning as we left for breakfast, we almost tripped over the tray and dirty dishes that were still sitting outside the door. Everything had been picked over by all sorts of animals, judging by the tracks made on the dishes, and there was trash scattered everywhere. We called room service to come pick it up. It had still not been cleared when we got back an hour later. Last, but certainly not least, there was a huge black stain in the closet. At first, we thought it was spilled coffee, until my mom placed her dirty clothes on the floor of the closet. About an hour later, her jeans were soaked. It turns out the stain in the closet was actually mildew (that explains the awful smell) from the standing water all over the floor. We complained and they offered to give us a new room and clean my mom's wet clothes free of charge. The front desk staff were very reluctant to comp us a night, even when we explained that the mildew smell had given us both sinus headaches. They kept telling us how "embarrassed" they were, a line that sounded incredibly rehearsed. We were not offered a free night until we spoke with the manager. Bottom line: if you expect quality when spending over $200 a night, do not stay in this so-called "resort."

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel for couples!”
Reviews.Author: Izzy-Poole
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for our honeymoon after staying at the amazing Hotel in The Mandalay Bay Las Vegas. We were unbelievably disappointed when we arrived & were shown to one of the 'unrenovated' rooms with old marked furniture & a stained carpet. We booked through Virgin holidays & were led to believe that this hotel was a tropical paradise - not the case at all especially if you go there without children! The food was mediocre & surely not even acceptable if you have three screaming children running riot around the outside areas. We switched rooms 3 times & finally got a bayside room which was a significant improvement but I would still not recommend this hotel under any circumstances & would suggest that you book somewhere else should you wish to have a romantic holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch!”
Reviews.Author: ickygross
Reviews.Content: It was really really bad. My sister in law drove 1 hour to review the rooms fro us as we are from the east coast of canada, she was shown a nice ajoining room by the hotel and booked it for two night based on that room. When we went to check in our room was not ready at 4 so we went to the zoo. when we came back 2 hours later we still had to wait for the room and we were give different rooms then we booked. we complained and they sais they were full and there was nothing they would do. When in the room we had to kill 4 spiders. The gorunds were not kept up around our room and the night lighting on the walks did not work. I agree with the other reviews about getting jammed on fees. very expensive. This place is a 2 star dressed up as a 4 star. Stay somewhere elase if you expect more!

Reviews.Title: “Sullies the star rating system”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn711
Reviews.Content: This experience has succeeded in scaring me off Priceline for a long time. Dank smells, Many screaming children,everywhere.,HUGE charges to use Business, fitness centers and nearly everything else and my priceline "Bargain" was only 10% off Published Rates. Oh, how i wish that they had only a pale little star instead of the overrated 4!

Reviews.Title: “MIxed Feelings !”
Reviews.Author: eghamcb
Reviews.Content: As this resort is considered to be a five star, I went expecting the best ! With the dollar at a high against the pound, booking direct made this affordable. But once there - $20 daily for parking, $15 daily gym, Water sports hire $40-80 1/2 hr, Crazy golf $11. All resturants very expensive, in fact everything was extra and at a cost!. 5 Pools - yes but very few seats around the 4 smaller ones and the Main pool was for children to play and you felt like you were sitting in a cinema in rows at least 3 deep! No shade! On the plus side, lovely gardens and settings and ballrooms , although these are only used for outside functions not guests. There is very little to keep you there in the evening. Rooms OK, lots of towels and extras. BUT, a very small old fridge situated high next to the TV comes on constantly all through the night! They do have a lovely beach, but do not provide any chairs or encourage you to use it. The staff are all very freindly and helpful but if only they read these reviews!

Reviews.Title: “the most horrible hotel I stayed classified as "4 star" in my life”
Reviews.Author: yellowpeace
Reviews.Content: I am a resort landscape designer, and frequently traveling and staying in several hotels. this hotel has good protential to be the world class 5 stars hotel if they put some $$ to clean it up. It is the most horrible, scary, and unbearable stays I have ever had in my life. Thank their staff and priceline helped to refund the second day. I can't even stay one more minute after wake up at 5am. Stink, ugly and dirty. spider everywhere.....unreliable...photos on their website are big LIES!!! At the end, to give some credits of refund, I strongly suggest their managing company Nobel House to pay some money update interior. It wastes the beauty of outdoor environment. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: petersoj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room for 2 nights in the middle of the week at this "resort" through Priceline and were expecting a 4-star experience. We would have even settled for a 3-star experience. Not the case. First off, their website clearly states that check-in is at 4 p.m but be prepared to wait. We were in line at least 20 minutes, only to be told by a manager that check-in was "actually between 4 and 5" and that checking-in just meant "checking-in, not that the room was ready". Our room was ready an hour later and we only knew that because we came back to the lobby to inquire about what was taking so long. Second, be prepared to spend a lot of $$$ on hotel services, some of which are not mentioned on their website. Parking is $20 per night for a spot in front of the bungalow. The "free" mini-golf course advertised on their website is actually $10 per person. The fitness center, basketball court, volleyball court and internet are also extra costs. The Barefoot Bar and Grill prices are also extreme ($13 for a drink???). Third, we had not housekeeping during our stay. We were out of our room for at least 8 hours in the morning/afternoon and came back to an untouched room. Fourth, the bungalow we stayed in was not 4-star quality. The room had a bed and breakfast type feel to it except the bed was hard as a rock. The in-room movie would not work and when we tried to check out through the hotel's TV system, we gave up after 3 tries and a call to the front desk. I hesitate to mention the plethora of children riding rented hotel bikes throughout the many parking lots on the wrong side of the road but it is definitely a safety hazard. The hotel claims it only rents to those "18 and older" but this was obviously not the case during our stay. The only positives I can think of are the adults-only pool and the close proximity to San Diego attractions. My husband and I will not be returning, Priceline rates or not.

Reviews.Title: “Good in some ways, but not for us.”
Reviews.Author: philbot46
Reviews.Content: All right. In all fairness to other negative reveiws - I liked the grounds. I thought they were expansive, tropical and fantastic for kids. The golf, the pools, the location - great! It felt safe and family friendly. Our problem is this - We decided to splurge and stay in one of those VERY overpriced suites. We walked in and the room was huge and looked great (I had No issues with the cleanliness/shabbiness).
