This is no place for a light sleeper or persons without children. One positive was the resturant, good service and food. hotel workers were nice enough, although I needed a supervisor to approve cancelling my second night without charge. You see not only do they have a 7 seven day notice to cancel w/o charge, there is a 48 hr notice to change the current reservation. while i made reservations for 2 nights in less than 7 seven days i was required to pay one night in advance....when i wanted to check out (since we could not sleep a wink the first night) the front desk kindly stated that you may leave, but warned I'd be charged for the 2nd night anyway. they put up a small fight, but relented after I described how unsatisfactory the rooms (the 2nd room change) were.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kids...fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Wilane
Reviews.Content: Wonderful property...like being in Hawaii...great pool with food service, perfect for mai tai's! We had a room on the interior...there are rooms that surround the bay with wonderful views, but we really liked our room which had sliding doors that overlooked a pond with ducks! Restaurant has a koi pond (that the kids can feed) with a singer on a stage overlooking the bay. Great buffet for breakfast...Wonderful hotel lobby...has a 18 hole miniature golf course...FUN...also can rent bicycles, play tennis, ping pong tables...has a marina where we rented a speedboat for an hour. One of the best things about the property is that it is 5 minutes from Sea World. It's kind of a big place - only 1 story bungalows with 2 rooms to a building... we rented 1 room and the kids had the other. They have golf carts that will shuttle you around the property. ASK FOR A ROOM with a BAY view and you can roast marshmellows and make S'mores on the fire pits on the sand right outside your room.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Bring a Car”
Reviews.Author: GandalfasWell
Reviews.Content: Loveley setting , great water sports and facilities , but dreadful check in - - - Not ready at 3pm - 'Come back at 4pm' , Not ready at 4pm - ''We will phone you' They phone at 5 pm - 'Rooms ready' We arrive back at reception at 5.45 - 'Sorry 1 room not ready' Also at Check out try to charge us for 3 cars all at $20 a night (a real rip off) . Restaurant also outrageously expensive but good . But still a great setting so would probably go back

Reviews.Title: “First time at Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: dandj6inall
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 2 of our 4 kids, ages 11 and 12. We normally stay at Humphry's half moon bay inn, but were told this was a great family resort. Here is a breakdown of pos and cons: Check in was great. Our phone in request for early check in allowed us to beat the 4:00 p.m. crowed. Rooms were clean and spacious. (Don't think Four seasons, think large apartment). I lwould expect the kitchen to be partially stocked with such itmes as utencils, cork screw, hand towels, possibly popcorn for the microwave. You are welcome to bring food from home, just remember there is only a microwave, small refrigerator and sink. The sofa bed was VERY uncomfortable, yet the bedroom bed (king) was VERY comfortable, my husband who hates hotel beds acctually slept very well! Bathrooms were clean and big, with shower on one side (leaky)and a full bath and toilet on the other, along with two full sinks. The linens were very nice. Housekeeping arrived 10 minutes after our call for more towels and the roll away (comfortable). In room movies - can't pause and no close caption. Room service was quick and well prepared, though remember the 18% gratuity and $3.50 per delivery is added to the bill. Our Garden bungalow was quiet until Sunday morning at 8:00, my 12 year old daughter was woke by 4 screaming children. Bike rental, croquet, ping pong, minature golf ,swimming all available, as well as water sport rental. Bikes ran out quickly. Main Pool was very crowded every day, but it's the only large family pool in the resort. Watch out for extremely fast cart drivers (employees), making housekeeping and room service deliveries! My son was almost hit by one while riding his bike. They need to slow down! Yes, parking is $20.00 per day, but we had our own numbered spot, no searching for a parking spot after a full day at Sea World. We only ate at the Barefoot Grill (room service food comes from here). Very nice staff, good food, good drinks, just watch out for the birds on the patio during the day! The large ones are very aggressive and will steal your food. Overall, a nice resort. A little pricy for what you get. Next trip, it will be back to Humphry's.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point not perfect, but still wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mulchmaster
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 1 week stay and found the resort to be wonderful overall. Much of what I will say has been said before in various reveiws, so folks just have to know what they want. The resort is lush, tropical and very well located in the heart of Mission Bay. Easy access to anywhere in San Diego (once you get the hang of the freeways!) My feeling is that families with children will enjoy it more as it is large and busy with kids. The rooms were nice, clean and really quite quiet given the density of the resort. While we did have a problem with the shower drain, someone came within a few hours to repair. The staff were generally quite accomodating, both at check in and throughout our stay. Prices are high overall. The Barefoot Bar and Grill while very attractive and with good food, was expensive. As were the drinks and the coffee cart. The gift shop has everything but again, like most gift shops very expensive. The best pool in the place is the small but relaxing waterfall pool. Not as busy, but nice to relax and have a drink. Biggest Complaint: $20 per night to park. Its just not necessary! Biggest Compliment: The grounds and atmosphere make it a wonderful getaway. There are ways you can save by going off site (within minutes) to eat or drink, but sometimes you may just want to splurge. I say Paradise Point gets a really bad rap on Trip Advisor and should be rated much higher.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Touristrap
Reviews.Content: My first vacation is five years and I get a tourist trap! San Diego needs a face lift! Someone please tell me why a drink at the pool is $10.00 and breakfast for three is $40.00? This is not Bermuda! If you gouge your customers they will never come back. Overpriced, merky swimming pools, lost five pounds walking just to go to dinner, put on hold numerous times for room service, had to take a cab everywhere or get nailed for 20.00 a day for parking your car! The grounds were well kept, but at least give us bikes to get around, tired of waiting and tipping bellboys to get us in golf carts. Did I mention the overpriced store? Never again!

Reviews.Title: “3-day get away”
Reviews.Author: go2z
Reviews.Content: My wife and teenage son and daughter had a good time at the resort. It was our first visit and basically lived up to our expectations. We would consider returning, but I feel that the rooms are over priced even given the very pleasant surroundings. I think the management needs to take a serious look at what type of resort it "wants to be." It should pick its clientèle carefully, then go after it with more style and amenities(!). Pros: The location and grounds are very good; we found the visit to be very relaxing. The staff (except for our check-in experience) were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. We were located within a few seconds of a pool, which turned out to be great. The room was quiet and we didn't hear "pool" noise. We really enjoyed the water sports, which we thought was reasonably priced. We spent time on the resort beaches, which we all enjoyed. Close proximity to downtown San Diego, Mission Beach and Sea World is a big plus. Cons: The were only two restaurants, which, were over priced. The "barefoot" restaurant had large portions and matching prices. Given the large number of families with small children, the resort could cater for this demographic a lot better. Too much wasted food. Our teenagers felt that that, other than the water sports, the resort had very little to offer them! This is a major gap in the resort or maybe they are sending a message. We found a severe lack of "good" restaurants in the local area. My wife and I didn't see that much for adults to do other than enjoying the surroundings (nice, but more is needed). We did not get the types of beds we requested, and were not told about this at check-in - not good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort, especially for kids”
Reviews.Author: smacthayer
Reviews.Content: I, too, was worried about all the negative reviews I read, but I booked over the internet on the hotel's own website and got a terrific deal. Bed and breakfast (they give you a $36 credit each day) for myself and my two children, ages 10 and 14. That also included parking. Tip -- better rates on the internet. The hotel reservation desk quoted me at least $100 more per night. Upon arrival, I was ready to "do battle" with the snotty staff and have problems with my room. Not so. The check-in staff were friendly and helpful. The room was a delight -- everything was super clean and comfy. The bathroom was great (two rooms helps) and the king sized bed was so comfortable. We did not pull out the couch as my daughter decided to sleep on it "as a couch" and she was fine. That also gave us more room. Breakfast at the Barefoot was really good. Service was quick and friendly. The main pool was a hit with both kids as was the Dive-In Movie night on Wednesday. This is not a hotel for young couples looking for peace and quiet. It really is a family oriented resort. There were many, many children there, and they all seemed to be having a great time. There is a lot to do, and it's not inexpensive, but if you are on vacation, splurge a little and enjoy yourselves. The resort is close to every attraction and the front desk will give you driving directions for everything. We have traveled all over the world and have pretty high expectations and this place was just fantastic. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Are we in Bali???”
Reviews.Author: JAB-I
Reviews.Content: The resort is absolutely breathtaking. I requested adjoining rooms for our family of 5 with easy access to the main pool, and was thrilled when I received my requests!! Just steps from the pool with a beautiful lagoon view with a reasonable rate too!! The grounds were constantly maintained and upon returning from sight-seeing every afternoon found very clean rooms!! Even ordered room service one evening while the kids were watching a movie, and everything came in a timely fashion!! I especially loved the lush gardens and the feeling that you are in a remote & tropical resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Listen to the Bad Reviews! Paradise Point IS PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: theQueenBee
Reviews.Content: First of all, I cannot understand where people are getting negative reviews. They must be completely expecting something different then what Paradise Point really is. I can't even begin to think of one negative thing to say about it. If you are expecting a high rise building with elevators and penthouses, this isn't it. If you are expetcing the Ritz Carlton with contemporary decor and snooty bellhops, this isn't it. This hotel is it's own island located in the best location you could ask for in San Diego. Minutes from Pacific and Mission Beaches, on the same road as SeaWorld, minutes from downtown and the zoo. close to old town, seaport village, coronado island, anything you could possibly want to do in San Diego is no more then 15 minutes away. The hotel itself is goregous. It is HUGE and with exotic plantlife and flowers. There is so much to do here on the resort that you could stay for a week and never leave the hotel. from renting a jetski to lounging at one of the 5 pools, to getting an amazing massage at the wonderful spa, this place has it all. The rooms make you feel like youre right at home. The decor is friendly and inviting, the linens are the best Ive ever slept in- got the best sleep of my life in that bed. The decor doesn't need to be updated- that is how it is SUPPOSED to be. It is rustic, unique and comfortable. The bathroom is HUGE with 2 rooms- one for the double marble sink and the other for the toilet and shower area. The maid service was also fabulous. Our room was steps from the beach (which was sparkling clean despite what other travelers found) even though we only had a garden lanai. At night you could have a fire in one of the many firepits located on the beach. Everyone was friendly (including many of the people staying there) and accomodating- I truly cannot understand what people can find to complain about. I guess some people will complain no matter what. Paradise Point is truly paradise- don't listen to the people who need the toilet to be lined with gold to have a good time. I have stayed in 4 star hotels/resorts and Paradise Point is perfect for people of all ages and I will definitely be going back- it is the only place I woudl consider staying and is definitely the best place to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “I would not go back, ever--Don't waste your time or money”
Reviews.Author: jrconti
Reviews.Content: Simply, it is overpriced. The pictures on their website does not accurately portray the ‘resort’, rooms, grounds etc. The rooms are dark, dank, and the decor hasn't been recently updated. In our room there was not even a full light blocking curtain on our window. Our queen sized bed was uncomfortable and the air conditioner made a terrible rattle all night long, spewing god only knows what into the air. And my bathroom at home looks nicer. And for those who ask, ‘why didn’t they change rooms?,’ we did—and this was the better room. The adult pool that on a Saturday was supposed to have a bar, didn't. And the main pool was murky, yes murky. Although the grounds were tropically themed, not convincingly so. Did I mention the inflated prices? I would not go back, ever.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: karenindiana
Reviews.Content: Our familly of 4 stayed here for 5 days after carefully reviewing the resort website and reading positive reviews several months ago. It was also featured in the travel catalogue "Where to Stay in 2004" so i assumed it HAD to be nice. Don't be fooled! To say we were extremely disappointed when we saw our accommodations is an understatement...and we chose one of the largest beachfront rooms! Outdated, poorly kept, rundown patios...i could go on and on. I hate to complain when it comes to vacation; i'm almost always a happy traveler. But for the wildly expenisve summer prices we feel we were completely misled and, quite frankly, robbed. When i called the San Diego Consierge to see if there was a better resort with available rooms once we arrived, she told me, "i have to be honest, resorts like the one you're in don't update the way they should." We were stuck (and PP demands a 7 day cancellation notice. Now we know why!! No one would stay if they didn't HAVE to). Recent posts on the site have it right -- Paradise Point is like an old Hawaiian hotel from the 70's. My personal opinion is, don't stay in this area at all. It's a tourist trap with a less than nice beach area. We'll never return. We love downtown San Diego and love La Jolla even more. My advice is, stay away from Mission Bay and away from Paradise Point and you'll hopefully have a better experience than we did. (for the record, however, i should point out our 10 year old son thought the place was fine. There were shells and rocks on the beach. That was all he needed).

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Get Away, Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoMoodGoddess
Reviews.Content: I must confess I was a little hesitant to book my 35th birthday "treat" get-away at Paradise Point after reading the reviews on this and other sites. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of service, the friendliness of the hotel and spa staff, and with the rooms themselves. If you take a car, yes you will have a $20 per night fee tacked on to your room charge. One bonus, however, is that your marked spot is IMMEDIATELY outside your little bungalow -- no hiking through a parking garage. We couldn't afford the more expensive rooms for two nights, so we went with the cheapest available. When we arrived, the room was clean, cool and quite nicely and comfortably furnished. Unfortunately, it faced the parking lot. We called and asked if there were any other available rooms that didn't face the parking lot (it was my birthday, yada yada...) They immediately rebooked us into another room that faced one of their many duck ponds. I thought that their signature restaurant Baleen was very good, if expensive. Their pool was crowded, but we didn't even try to go to any of their 4 additional pools because we were lazy and simply sat in the sun drinking pina coladas. I popped into the spa for one of their facials and pedicures (great experience for both my 6 year old daughter and myself). Anyway, I really liked Paradise Point. Everyone was very friendly and my family and I had a wonderful time. That being said, it's a completely different experience than the Ritz/Four Seasons (much more family directed) and more relaxing than anything you can find in the Gaslamp/Downtown San Diego. Just don't go expecting glitz or refinement. Go if you want a tropical get-away on 44 acres of green grounds and blue bay 10 minutes from San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travelerz1
Reviews.Content: Over the past 22 years we've stayed at the Paradise Point probably 6 times. It was called Vacation Village back then...and has changed owners a couple of times and now is the Paradise Point. It basically looks the same as it did 22 years ago to me. A few upgrades in the lobby, pool area, and gift shop...but overall the same place. This past trip we stayed only 2 nights. We were a bit sad that the place seemed overpriced considering it hasn't been upgraded. Our room wasn't cleaned well...and the beach area looked dirty. Lots of fun for kids I think...but not a well kept resort. The first night our parking place was taken by someone else...we were told we'd be refunded the parking fee...but weren't. The movies for the living room TV never worked. Lot's of little stuff that you don't expect for the high price.

Reviews.Title: “70's Hawaiian Tiki Palace”
Reviews.Author: reallypickylady
Reviews.Content: I had chosen this hotel on a recommendation of a friend who'd lived in San Diego years ago but decided to cut it short due to reviews on this site and booked the rest of our stay at the Lodge at Torrey Pines. However, I was unable to cancel outright because they require a SEVEN day advance in the summer months. Very disappointing. We came in late in the afternoon and was somewhat less let down than expected. Our room (beachfront) was nicely decorated and seemed updated. The toilet made noise all night and the pull out sofa bed was like sleeping on cardboard but otherwise OK. The bay is dirty and so is the beach. They should considering having staff clean the beach daily. I was grossed out and didn't let my daughter get in the water. The lobby smells like a musty motel and could use some revamping. The landscaping is lush but has that 70's Honolulu Hilton feel. We had dinner at the casual restaurant - very over priced for Chili's level food but the setting right on the water was very pretty. This place is a tourist trap designed for one time visitors. At these prices, it should be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravelLuvNewYork
Reviews.Content: We got a really great rate for this hotel on Priceline last minute. Stayed here 3 nights. We were very satisfied with everything, especially for the price. Overall impression: I loved the property. It is so big and beautiful. Very impressive. The variety of plants and trees is fantastic. Well-kept. The air is fresh, you can smell the aromas from the plants as you walk around. That is a definite strong point. But, if you're looking for a glamorous room, don't look for it here. Although the room had old furniture and had signs of prolonged wear, it was clean. The bathroom is good and clean. I really can't complain about anything except that it's simple and not brand-new. But I think that the worn furniture is the intended "vintage" style of the hotel (Polynesian theme). Parking is $20 a day. Right outside your bungalow. Our bungalow was stand-alone, so no problems with noise. We had the cheapest room (price is classifed according to beach or garden view), with garden view, which is fine. This place is great for people with children because there are a lot of activities, plus the large territory is great. I would definitely come back here with kids. Since we don't have kids, we didn't spend much time in the resort itself but used it more as a base for exploring SD. The location is good, central for all the exploring. The customer service was very good, very attentive and pleasant. No problems with checking in or anything. Quick to respond to all our requests and needs. They even waived the internet charge of $10 per day for me. I really was satisfied with my stay here. Here are the bad points: --the bed squeaked A LOT, with every minor movement (I had read that other guests before us had the same problem) --the room itself is no more than about 3-star quality--will significantly benefit from a good renovation My husband & I really enjoyed our stay here. However, we would not pay more than $200 per night to stay here. Thanks everyone for writing and keep writing! Thank you Trip Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “Lower Your Expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just finished a 4th of July weekend trip here with our toddler and other family. It was decided afterwards that if we just thought of the hotel as a condo facility- meaning no service, no courtesy, do it yourself room cleaning, and the like- we would have been much happier. Arrived at 3 p.m. for 4 p.m. check in and was told the room wasn't ready yet, which was ok because we were early. However room was not ready until after 7 p.m. with no explanation other than to recant and say check-in "starts: at 4 p.m. They wouldn't even tell us where our room was so we could park the car nearby- we were told to just use the parking lot and wander (for four hours with a two-year-old?).Multiple requests led to no crib either. When it did arrive we were provided with queen size sheets for a portable crib. We were offered no compensation or deals either. Room cleaning was sketchy- used items (coffee, lotion) were not replaced daily, nor was the room really cleaned. The same pre-existing dirt was there when we left too. Room service was also incredibly slow and we had an old menu which led to many ordering frustrations (and repeated requests for an updated one were never met). All of this from a supposed family resort. Would definitely not stay there again- paid over $550 a night and they didn't even seem to want us there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay Great for the Kids”
Reviews.Author: janey_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paradise Point in June 2006 with the family - 2 kids. The price was expensive $200 per night for a garden villa, which pretty much looked on to the road. The rooms we lovely and clean, beds were very comfy. The annoying thing is that the block out curtains only cover the window and not the door, so the room gets bright when the sun comes up . We used the towels from the pool to cover the door, and it worked a treat. The room we stayed are able to be interconnected and the sound does travel. It did not bother us, but it may affect light sleepers. Plus it is a real rip off for parking at $20 per night. The kids loved staying here, breakfast was expensive but nice. The kids loved to look in the rockpool and look at all the fish swimming in it. The pools are fantastic. My kids swam here pretty much all day, and there is sand on the side of the pool, excellend for sand playing. It was wonderful to sit back, relax, watch the kids swim and sip on a (expensive) cocktail. On the downside, during peak summer periods they need to regularly clean the toilets as they get very wet, sandy and slippery. Not a nice combination. On the weekends in summer they have movie night at the pool, which my daughter just loved. Overall we had a wonderful relaxing stay, with resort prices. Perfect for kids during summer. I recommend to save your money and get a garden room instead of a bay view. You will be pretty much in the pool, not in the bay. Try and get out and eat at the local restaurants, as the resort is expensive. Unos pizza at Mission Beach fantastic and great for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “It's just a so-so place...”
Reviews.Author: practicalpointer
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't return or recommend staying here, unless 3 conditions are met: (a) you are traveling with young children (for whom there is plenty to do); (b) you can get a guarantee from the hotel that you will be given a room without any musty, mildewy odor; and (c) the average nightly price falls below $190 or so, including parking. Otherwise, I would recommend the similarly priced, similarly appointed Catamaran Resort Hotel as a better alternative. The Catamaran fronts on Mission Bay (like the Paradise Point), but also benefits from being just across the street from a public swimming beach on the Pacific Ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Sand In The Sheets!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelEscape
Reviews.Content: Don’t disregard the bad reviews like we did!! Paradise Point Resort & Spa does not live up to its name. One would expect the highest level of services from a “resort.” Instead, when we opened the couchbed there was sand all over the sheets! Meaning, they didn’t change sheets in-between guests. Totally nasty and unacceptable. So that night we put a small mark on our sheets. The next night we checked them and they had NOT been changed. Most hotels have a sign if they will not change sheets and towels during your stay. Paradise Point did not have any of those signs. One of the Front Desk clerks was very rude, refused to honor our reservations made a month before for a Bayside Room (saying the hotel was booked up), and told us we could depart the property. A manager finally honored our reservation. They charge $20 PER DAY for parking, when parking is just outside the room but when we got the bill, it was for $40 per day (which we had corrected)! In the bathroom, the shower arm fell to the wall and water sprayed out the side. I wanted to say something nice about this place but every day more and more things went wrong. Beautiful grounds. There are plenty of other resorts to go to in San Diego. They may not be as kid friendly but they have to be better. Paradise Point needs to re-train the staff and housekeepers to provide “resort” level service (since there should be a noticeable difference between a motel and a resort). It would also be nice if they hosed off the old bird poop and grit from the patio furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise point no rooms available”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I am a travel agent and have traveled and seen a good bit. I arrived at Paradise Point (they did not know that I was doing a sight visit) after a very long night of traveling with my 10 year old and my husband. ( I had called the resort prior to arrival to confirm my reservation as well as to let them know that I would be arriving very late in the evening. ) They had overbooked the hotel and had no room for my family. It is 3:00 in the morning our time. After about an hour of them (Norman) calling around for a room somewhere else they sent us to the BAHIA. They had 1 room available. The grounds here are very nice but it is not a resort. It is a motel. Hot, Dirty, worn, and Old. I was told by Norman at Paradise Point that as soon as I woke I could come back and check into my room.....so after no sleep I called around 9:00 a.m. and was told that check in was 4:00. I explained everything to the front desk clerk and she said "sorry..........come on by and we'll buy you lunch... but check in is 4:00. " Long story short.............they did not charge me the $20 parking every day and they took off a charged dinner on my bill. Would I stay here again? Probably not. It is more important to me to be reassured a room when I am traveling with my family. On top of that, I should have been handled by a manager....but it seems that this happens all of the time at Paradise Point so nothing special is done. The rooms are old, just like many of the write ups say. They are very worn and could use as much attention as the grounds get. We did have a room on a little pond with ducks. This kept my 10 year old busy. The bed squeeked, the sofa bed was VERY thin, I cloroxed the bathroom........it wasn't clean enough for me. Everything in the room is worn from years of use. The carpet is very old and dirty. Bring flip flops or slippers .....my sons feet were BLACK from walking around the room barefoot. The grounds here are beautiful. The barefoot grill was very good and has great atmosphere. The staff was pleasant at all other times. It is kid friendly...just not top notch like their rates suggest. Good luck if you go.

Reviews.Title: “Loved IT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing! The rooms are great - each with their own private outside sitting area. Almost like individual apartments. It was so nice to get away for a weekend and be in an all inclusive hotel/resort. Walk to the bars, resteraunts and pools. The place is 44 acres so if you get lost you can get a golf cart to drive you home. How nice is that? Highly recommended and we plan on going back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our stay and our kids loved it even more. The place accommodated our every need, down to making PB & J sandwiches for our niece who eats hardly anything else. The pools were great. The beaches were great. Kids loved finding shells. The conceirge would do everything they could to help you with what you need. They helped us overnight fed ex a package of meat to family back home. The only thing I didn't like was there was no where to wash your feet after being at the beach and coming back to your room (we had a room on the beach). We had to wash feet in the tub, leaving sand and such all over the tub. The carpet would leave your newly washed feet dirty after only an hour of being on it due to all the tracked in dirt/sand that a vaccuume can't get. No wonder the carpets are dark brown - it hides any dirt. Overall though, it was a great place with great service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort...bring walking shoes”
Reviews.Author: candgfun
Reviews.Content: Spent the last weekend in April at Paradise Point Resort for a business conference. Grounds are absolutely breathtaking and soooooooooooo relaxing. This resort has something for everyone (beautiful nature/landscaping, swimming pools, spa, putting greens, beach, wonderful food, courteous staff, and great conference facilities). They even had relaxing "spa age" music in the ladies restroom at the main swimming pool (nice touch). My ONLY "gripe" was the length of time it took for bell staff to pick me up in their golf cart and drive to the conference facilities, as it was not a comfortable walking distance from my bungalow in dress heels. Even so, I'd really like to go back to Paradise Point some day as a leisure guest to really avail myself of their awesome facilities!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: cw_123
Reviews.Content: This resort was midway through our honeymoon in July 2003, after we had been to Orlando, Los Angeles and Las Vegas, and believe me it was a welcome relaxing change. The staff were wonderful and gave us a lovely hand written congratualtions card and a bottle of wine. Our bungalow was beautiful and everything was in perfect working order. We didn't use the pool as we were newlyweds we tried to keep away from the crowds - but we did have a lovely eveing meal at one of the restaurants. We hired a speed boat and had a wonderful day racing around the bay - which was great fun My only bad comment is that the view from our bungalow over the bay also included the concrete highway, but we couldn't hear it so it wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Hope to return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort and nearly had to drag the kids away each morning to visit San Diego area attractions! They loved the pools, beach, observation tower, tame ducks and walking paths. They loved breakfast at the Barefoot Grill, where Harry the heron hangs out ready to dive at plates. They loved hitching rides around the property on golf carts. Room 364 was just across the sidewalk and within sight of the main pool's hot tub, so close that my husband and I could sneak out after the kids were asleep at night. Yet the room was surrounded by lush gardens and was very quiet. The room had two queen-size beds, a large armoire with a TV and mini-fridge, a table and two chairs and another bench in a small alcove. The dressing room was large, with two sinks and a large closet. Showers were hot with great water pressure. We had a small porch with chairs, and a small group of ducks waddled by each morning begging for handouts. The room, nicely decorated in bright yellow and navy, was larger than most four-person rooms we encountered in California. What really stood out was the service. Our first night's reservations were lost (which we discovered just before leaving home.) The management put us up at the Catamaran across the bay and covered our taxi transfer the next morning. That seemed sufficient to us, but they also paid for breakfast at the Barefoot Grill AND paid for our tickets to Sea World. I was very impressed with that show of concern. We encounted that attitude again when the main pool closed temporarily just as we arrived in the afternoon. We went back to our room and called for information about the other pools, since the weather was chilly and we were looking for a hot tub or heated pool. A few minutes later, Ben the bellman arrived with a golf cart and took us to the adults-only pool. I worried about being there with the kids, and he told us if anyone asked, we should just mention he brought us there. A few other families showed up, thanks to Ben, and we had a great afternoon. (No adults showed up without kids -- probably too cold.) We travel a lot with our kids, and found this resort friendlier than most. We definitely hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Nasty Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel was overpriced, but we had driven by it in the past, and the grounds looked amazing, so we decided to splurge on this vacation. Arrived at midnight. It was Christmas night, and one would have expected all the lights to be on - but they were not. The hotel could not find our reservation at first....took over an hour for them to locate it. Not fun with three small children waiting in the car after a long flight. Finally got through the maze to find our room. I have one word for our room - n-a-s-t-y. First of all - the smell. . . mouldy and mildew. Almost unbearable, but it was now approaching 1:30 a.m. and we were exhausted so decided we could put up with it. Bathroom pocket door - stuck halfway open - would not open all the way nor close Broken tv remote Phone was not working - cord was halfway ripped out of the phone which could explain it Had air conditioning central unit outside our door which banged extremely loud all night long. Had to ask them for a pack n play since they didn't note it on our reservation. Brought it promptly, but no bedding. Called them (on my cell, because remember, the phone was not working) for bedding for the baby. They brought 2 pillow cases?!? Bed sheets were mildewy and damp. Shivered all night from damp sheets and woke up smelling moldy. Tub was dirty, had hair in it, and tile was cracked and moldy. Furniture old, worn, and broken. No mention of $20 per night parking charge until checkout. What's up with charging for parking? Woke up to complain to the desk staff who argued with me that it was a luxury resort, but would not come down to the room to see what I was complainning about. Would not give me a refund on the remainder of my 10 day reservation as I had booked through Expedia. (Expedia did refund me though). Did not take time to do anything around the beautiful grounds as we couldn't check out of this place soon enough. Can't enjoy what ammenties the resort has to offer if you can't stand to be in the room, much less try and sleep there. Nasty, smelly, awful, horrendous, terrible room with obnoxious and clueless staff. Finally got an apology letter from the management with an offer of a free nights stay, but wouldn't stay here again even with the free coupon. We went to the Marriott on Hotel Circle and were super impressed with the suite, the cleaning staff, the free breakfast and dinner buffet, the cleanliness, new ambiance, helpfulness of staff, kids bunk room. This is where we will be going back to. Never this "Paradise" (and I laugh at that term) Point.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a family to sleep and enjoy the pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip online and THEN read the reviews of the place on TripAdvisor. We too were a little worried about what we had booked. We took our trip during the last week of March and found the hotel and grounds to be a really nice place. This was a family vacation to San Diego so the most important thing for us was the pool and a clean and quiet room. We visited the attractions through the day and wanted a nice place to sleep and something for the kids to do (play in the pool) in the evenings. Our room was 710, which is somewhat secluded compared to the other rooms. It was very quiet, the large heated pool was great fun for the kids. (Beware the smaller pools on the grounds are NOT heated and they were very cold. Use the larger heated one.) Our room was clean and in good repair. We did have an ant problem but we reported it and they sprayed which solved the problem. Overall a very nice stay. We did eat breakfast on the grounds a couple times. It's a little expensive but not too high priced - the food was good. We stayed a week and really enjoyed it. I would highly recommend it to anyone that finds a good price for this place online. Oh an they didn't charge me the extra $18 a day for parking. They said that because I was staying for a long visit they'd drop the fee. Pretty nice of them. There are plenty of places to eat nearby just ask at the front desk and they'll give you directions. We found everything we needed (fast food, sit down places to eat, laundrymat, etc) within a 5 minute drive. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “It was Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for 2 nights during Easter Break. We had a king sized bed with a sleeper sofa. The room isn't that big but it's good enough for our family. The best part was our location. Room 222 was awesome! It's not a beach front bungalow but the beach is literally 20 steps away, plus we get a view from our room. While my husband and I tidy up our mess, the kids just layed some towels on the grass and watched the boats pass by. It was beautiful! The main pool was the best for us. The high during our stay was 65 degrees but the pool temp was at 82. It was hard to pull the kids out of the water! The casual dining restaurant was relaxing and food was good. A little pricey but the $5.50 kids' meal was the best deal. Bottled water will cost you around $2.50 so make sure you pack some with you and just put them in your little refs in the room. The gift shop is expensive but has a lot of goods to tinker with. A $1.50 duck food will put a lot of smiles in your children once they start throwing them in the lagoon. Try not to have a room starting in the 500s. I noticed from my walks that those rooms get a lot of road noise since it's closer to Ingraham, the main road. Rooms needs a little refurbishing but it's a place I definitely look forward to going to. The serene atmosphere, friendly staff and beautiful gardens will definitely relax you.

Reviews.Title: “Will return to Paradise as soon as possible...LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a great little getaway! I booked this hotel, THEN read the reviews & was sweating all the way down to San Diego...but what a pleasant surprise! The resort itself is GORGEOUS & well-kept, lovely pools, very family friendly yet quiet! The beaches are perfect for sand castles, shell hunting, splashing, & overall running around; the grounds have a really cute little putting green course with little putters for kids & ducks & fish which the kids loved feeding; and the Barefoot bar & grill has an awesome breakfast buffet. We also ordered food to go for dinner one evening from them which was made very quickly & was very good. My picky eaters ate it all! We had a room that was a king size bed with a queen pull-out couch & had just the right amount of room for us (2 adults & 2 kids ages 2 1/2 & 5). We have stayed in very fancy hotels (several Ritz Carltons & others) & quite honestly this room topped the Ritz Carlton in Laguna Niguel where the walls were thin, we had 2 double beds crammed into a little room + furniture crammed in without a fridge or coffee maker. I was very disappointed at that Ritz. We'd come back down to this hotel in a heartbeat. It reminded me of the vacations we used to take as kids ourselves where we parked our car in front of our little bungalow at the beach! So much fun. We also found the service to be super-friendly & very accomodating. No complaints here!

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights on March 30 and 31. After reading all the negative stuff on this site I was a little apprehensive , but our travel agent assured us she had good things. She was right. The grounds are beautiful, the service we received was excellent. Had a problem with out HVAC unit and it was taken care of in 15 minutes. The rooms are a little old, but they were clean and spacious. The bed seemed to be brand new and was incredibly comfortable. Don't be turned off to all the negativity --the place was wonderful---not the Four Season but you are not paying for the Four Seasons

Reviews.Title: “Good family resort - needs a remodel”
Reviews.Author: cougarmountainfamily
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Paradise Point with our two kids. The good points below make it a great family destination. Wish they would fix the Bad and the Ugly though . . . We agree with the prior post that guests should not expect a fancy spa type of resort. THE GOOD: The pool, the location (near Sea World, Mission Beach, airport and more), in-room refrigerator, bay front rooms, small putt putt course. We had a one BR suite on the beach on the bay. Our daughter loved playing in the sand right outside the room and swimming in the pool. Fast access to area attractions was a real plus. We enjoyed the pool side bar & grill, and the large suite. Also a good family friendly restaurant on the grounds, and a very nice gift shop. Room prices were good for the area. THE BAD: Like seemingly all hotels in the Mission Bay area, it seriously needs to be renovated and updated. The rooms have decent decor, with some newer furniture, but the overall feel is pretty worn. The exterior and landscaping is very worn and not well maintained. The maid service is slow and not so good. Bunch of guys driving around in carts doing nothing. They have an espresso bar, but its hours of operations are erratic, and the grinder had some disgusting looking beans around the top. The coffee was not very good. THE UGLY: Our room (and others) flooded during the rain, with brown water seeping up through the floor and pouring down through the light fixture in the bathroom. Judging by the water damage on the baseboards and walls, this was not a new problem. At least they didn't argue when we asked for a partial refund. The room of course ended up smelling pretty musty, but that's typical of the Mission Bay area from our experience during a prior stay at another hotel and other reviews we read before traveling to Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “High maintenace hotel”
Reviews.Author: grayling
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 326 from 3/22-3/28 for a conference on construction. Since we are in construction we thought we should give a review on the phyisical complaints about the hotel. 1. This hotel is a very high maintanence facility. With so many small buildings, each requiring it's own water heater, roof system, and plumbing, it's really tough to manage. It's not built like one huge building with one system to control everything. I'm sure each building also has it's own electrical panel too. The hotel does a pretty good job keeping up considering the challenges. 2. The scale is enormous. It's almost like it's own amusement park with all the paths and vegetation and wildlife. Everyday staff is outside hosing down the bird droppings and trimming the vegetation. The birds are everywhere. They really make a mess. But the exterior is quite clean considering the birds. 3. I don't know how the hotel can charge as little as they can considering the huge staff required to keep the place up. The staff required are 10 times the amount required for a single building high rise type structure. 4. The age of the buildings put them right at the point of being torn down. I can see Paradise Point disappearing and a condo development reappearing.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value for the prices!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Resort is not the 5 star resort it's cracked up to be. Rooms are on the small side and unexceptional, lacking enough comfortable seating in the "average" rooms, carpet stained and worn, bathrooms are spartan, can't believe they have the nerve to charge $18 per night to park outside your room. I can do that @ Motel 6 for free! Everything on-site is ridicuously expensive from meals at the restaurants to take-out coffee and tea at the Island Market. Service at the restaurant is slow -- staff is fine, just not well-staffed at high visibility times. Service seems a bit uneven across the board -- if you're in the low-rent district, 600 block of rooms, don't plan on getting your newspaper before 9AM, if you're lucky enough to get one at all. On the positively exceptional side, the staff is extremely well trained, friendly and helpful at every turn. The grounds are lush and beautifully kept up. For the money, I wouldn't stay here again -- choose the Dana across the water in Mission Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't let the reviews stop you....I surprised my husband with a trip to San Diego and was VERY nervous after reading the reviews here. We've stayed at resorts all over the US and found this to be a very beautiful visit. The rooms could use a little face lift, but the grounds more than make up for it. The heated pools were beautful, the staff was VERY friendly and the location was 10-15 minutes from everything. Only a 5-minute drive to beautiful La Jolla. I thought the bed was ultra comfortable with plenty of clean, fresh linens. The concierge was so great in helping us pick the best restaurants in the area, shared menues with us and offered to make reservations. The only major complaint I had was the $18/night parking fee.....not sure why they charge extra. We came home from being out all day to find someone else was parked in our spot. The resort took care of it immediately. We were just outside the adult pool...great location....ask for room 134. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful family resort.”
Reviews.Author: leflef
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Diego on February 19th for four nights. Our family and the friends we travelled with all loved it. The resort was absolutely beautiful. We loved staying right on the beach, which we mostly had to ourselves this time of year. The kids enjoyed a day in the heated pool. The food at the Barefoot Cafe was good for breakfast and lunch. Room service was timely. Location was good for Sea World, Zoo, 30 min to Lego Land. Would love to return. Only drawback was thin walls...heard our neighbors shower and chatting at 5 am first two days. Then we went to Santa Monica at the Fairmont Miramar and heard street noise, so I guess it's hard to avoid the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, food - for a fortune”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: $189 a night (conference rate) and the rooms leak and have cobwebs. Friend's room filled with water, carpet was soaked like a sponge - they did not move her to another room, just put fans on the carpet. It smelled terrible. My room had no desk chair (despite two calls) and room was twice not made up despite calls to housekeeping. And it wasn't my "do not disturb" sign -none of us had those in our rooms! Rooms often not made up until 3pm or later. Rain knocked out the server, so no $10 a day internet. $20 a day to park your car outside. Restaurant service spectacularly bad. Dessert the waiter told me was rasberry was actually blueberry; waiter argued with me that there was "raspberry IN it" (it was creme brulee. Hard to hide fruit in there...what with all the blueberries and all). Casual restaurant was even worse. Food bland, ordinary - twice, hot dishes were served cold. Sent an e-mail to the manager and answered the "satisfaction" survey with my name and contact info, but no response.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever received”
Reviews.Author: owlcoast
Reviews.Content: Worst service I've ever experienced. Will never return. Had 5 requests for the hotel, 4 due to hotel’s own failure. Staff failed on all 5. Twice requested crib and high-chair for our 1-year-old son before our arrival. Still not there when we arrived; had to wait for people to bring them. Toilet would not flush solids. Took 3 phone calls and 30 minutes for someone to arrive to fix it, despite being told the first 2 times people were coming. Still did not flush solids, but at least toilet was temporarily clear. Maids forgot to leave fresh soap. Requested soap be left outside the door, with no knocking to disturb our sleeping son (at 9 pm). Maid knocked, then laughed like it was a joke when I told her “Sh! No knocking.” Manager was busy upon checkout. Concierge promised to have him call me the next day. No one ever called.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere between terrible and okay but some problems.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok- first. We like to go to different kinds of hotels and don't mind spending the money to do it. I also have never felt like posting something like this before. But a lot of little things added up to: yuck and a rip off. We just got back from staying two nights at Paradise Point. At check in time we were greeted by a friendly staff person. When asked if we had stayed here before, we said no, but had stayed at another Noble House property. He then said the he would waive the $20.00 per night (that we did NOT know about in advance) parking fee for being return customers. The parking spot was right in front of our room. It wasn't like they had to rent a spot in a nearby garage. The bell person was friendly and asked if our daughter would like to ride in the golf cart to get to our room. Being three, she thought that was a good idea. He was helpful. Upon opening our room there was a very musty smell. The room was obviously in an old building. They had redecorated - newer paint over badly prepared chipped walls. The furniture was new. But there were two small cafe chairs paired with a small round and short end table for a "dining area"- odd. The bathroom was a strange mix of old and new. New granite or marble countertops. Old bathtub and tile. AND DIRTY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Dirty toilet surfaces. Mold growing on the walls. An incredibly moldy shower curtain. Hair everywhere. Thick dust on the lampshades. Thin and dingy towels. Mold growing on the closet walls too. We ordered room service that night. It was fine (not remarkable either way). They did not pick up the dishes that were left out all night until after housekeeping came the next day. Breakfast our first morning was pleasant enough. We ate outside and our server was fine. Dinner in the casual restaurant that night was not great. The service in the mostly empty place was terrible. I am a 20% plus tipper and I even said to my husband that we won't be tipping much. Breakfast the day after was ok but with terrible service. We were due to check out and said to post the bill right away. When we went to check out it still was not posted and after three calls from the front desk the embarrased front desk person decided not to charge us. The grounds of the resort are very pretty. But bad service, expensive for what it was and a dirty room added up to NO WAY WOULD WE EVER GO BACK! I did not want to spend any extra time in that room after a long (and lovely) day at the zoo. Now... for a different story... after we went to Disneyland for a few days of impeccable service and a very clean and comfortable room at the Disneyland Hotel we came back to San Diego and stayed at the THE DANA ON MISSION BAY. Part of the hotel is brand new, part of it is old. They have redone all of the old rooms. We stayed in the old part. They were CLEAN, COMFORTABLE, OFFERED A FREE SHUTTLE TO SEA WORLD, GOOD STAFF AND A GREAT PLACE TO EAT WITH OR WITHOUT KIDS. The water main even broke on our way out. We stopped to get a bite to eat in the restaurant and Anna the manager was very on her toes, making it all work out without running water. So, if you need a place to stay close to Sea World this is one. So... Happy Trails. And in the end... what I want is a CLEAN ROOM and GOOD SERVICE. Paradise Point does not have it. Noble House should ditch this property or hire new management.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Xplorer80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife in October of 2005. We were very happy with the resort. The rooms were nice, and so is the outdoor restauraunt and bar. Too bad they did not have smoking rooms. I think the entire property does not have smoking rooms. It is right on Mission Bay which is great for family fun. Sea World, La Jolla, and Downtown are a short drive away. I would definitely recommend this hotel for tourists, families, and lovers.

Reviews.Title: “Great for relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed in Paradise point last July on our honeymoon. We found it a great place for relaxation, especially the adult pool where there was absoulute serenity. The room was lovely although on one occasion we arrived back from breakfast and the room wasn't finished. We were anxious after reading reviews before we arrived but after a hectic week in Las Vegas it was a perfect retreat. The resort shop was a great idea with everything needed for our 7 night stay. Although the driveway was a bit fusty smelling i think this is understandable with the nightly watering of the luxurious grounds and no breeze to carry away the humid air. Overall the staff were friendly, the service fine and the scenery breathtaking!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok at the Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was very concerned about my stay at this hotel. However I have to say that my experience did not match that of a lot of the bad reviews. My room was adequate for my needs of sleeping and showering and the resort was clean and the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Beckyf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a trip to California last August. We had stayed at the Grand Californian in Anaheim for 3 nights, then traveled to San Diego to stay at the Paradise Point for 3 nights. The Grand Californian might be the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in; gorgeous place, fantastic service, etc. Disney's best. While Paradise Point was not the worst place I have ever stayed, it was close to the worst. The joke is - our bill for each hotel was almost to the penny the same! To those on this board who say the "heated" pool at Paradise Point was too cold to swim in Dec or January, note that this pool was too cold to swim in August! The bike rental place closed right in our faces; very rude service there. Food was very expensive. Boat rental was extremely expensive. The bathroom door in the room is louvered (sp?)!! The kitchen table and food area are pressed up against a door you can hear through so clearly you may as well not have a door at all. Totally disgusting. The hotel is sort of isolated and we had little to do. On the evening my husband and son went to a Padres baseball game, my daughter and I were bored out of our minds. We couldn't go anywhere without the rental car, the pool was too cold, there were no bikes to rent in the evening, no evening entertainment at all. The room was dirty. I had to call housekeeping to solicit a room cleanup every day. They never came automatically like every other place in America. If I had to say something good about the hotel, the grounds are pretty. The view from the tower is very nice. That's pretty much it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm a fairly seasoned traveler, althought I'd never stayed in San Diego. Well upon first entering the resort I remember getting an almost surreal feeling. And by "surreal" I don't mean "gosh what a placid, quiescent place to relax for several days", but rather "you have got be kidding me this looks like a run-down Miami Vice movie set complete with groves of plastic palm trees" surreal. On top of that, upon checking in I was informed that my room wasn't ready. Not only that, but I'd have to wait *three hours*. And did the manager have any sort of explanation, maybe even an apology? You know I'd tell you but I couldn't, since he never showed up after my waiting there for thirty minutes. When my room was finally ready, I was escorted to my bungalow on the back of a beat-up stretched golf cart (I'm not kidding). The room certainly wasn't worth $180/night, more like $50. And as another reviewer already mentioned, the nicest part of it was the bathroom. I did dine at the outdoor restaurant one night, and the food was sub-par as was the service. I'd heartily recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Massive disappointment”
Reviews.Author: walkley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into this resort with our two children aged 9&10 for a 10 night stay. Having waited in the lobby for almost an hour, we were eventually told that our rooms were ready. When we entered the hallway of the interconnecting rooms, it was patently obvious that the rooms were not ready, the floors had not been vacuumed, the trash bins had not been emptied, and the bathroom had not been cleaned following the departure of the previous occupants.The rooms were in need of refurbishment, and had a very musty smell. We contacted reception immediately, and requested another set of rooms. We were told that this would not be possible, due to full occupancy. I insisted that a housekeeper attend promptly to make the rooms habitable.She vacuumed the floors, and was about to leave, when I pointed out the other areas that needed cleaning, including ( "I kid you not") at least a quarter inch of accumulated dust on each bed headboard. She used a hotel hand towel to quickly wipe the areas pointed out to her, then promptly left. At no point did I see her use any cleaning or disinfectant materials. When we opened the fridge door, we were appalled that it was infested with ants, as were most areas in both rooms. When my eldest son got in the bath later that evening, I was disgusted to see "PUBIC HAIRS" from the previous occupants floating in his bath water. My youngest son had previously developed a stomache bug, and during the middle of our first night at the resort, had a bout of excessive vomiting all over the bathroom floor. I cleaned the area as best I could, and went straight to reception the next morning, a) To complain about standards,& b) to seek reassurance that the bathroom would be totally cleaned and disinfected. Having been given the appropriate assurances we went out for a few hours, only to return to the overwhelming smell of stale vomit. Whilst the beds had been made, housekeeping had done nothing else to the room. I could go on and on about this resort, but suffice it to say that we checked out on our third day, and booked into the Raddisson La Jolla which was absolutely fantastic. I had read the reviews on this site prior to booking our stay at paradise Point, and came to the conclusion that It couldn't possibly be that bad. IT IS!!!! Do yourself and your family a favour - BOOK ANOTHER HOTEL!!! If You require any further information, then please send me an E-Mail

Reviews.Title: “Ruined Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: TriciaandPaddy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from this hotel; From start to finish we had a disappionting experience. We splurged, since this was our honeymoon, and expected luxury; This is not a luxurious resort! The rooms are all single story bugalows;from the internet description we expected an "islandy" feel. We arrived to a rundown exterior; our room had cracked cement walls and rotting wood chairs. The inside of the room is nice with rustic decor and the bathrooms are the best part. However, halfway through the trip we found a leak in the ceiling which was dripping on the floor and bed. We called twice and were told someone would come out. They never did so we ended up moving the bed to avoid getting wet. The resort does have nice pools, but it was too cool to use them. I definatley would not stay here in the winter, since the pools are the one nice part you can use if it is warm enough. The resort has two restaurants, Baleen and the Barefoot. We had breakfast and lunch at Barefoot, and although the food was ok, we found the service to be very slow. We had booked Baleen for New Year's Eve but were called that day and told we could not be accomodated due to the weather, they had closed the outdoor patio. (Lucky for us the Gaslamp Distict is close by and we found a great restaurant)Another word about the restaurants...make sure you check your bill, we had charges to our room for the restaurant that others had signed off on and clearly did not match or signature or even name. We complained and they did remove them, but beware! I decided to treat myself to the Spa one day, but have to say it was not worth it. I have been to spas all over the world and this is very overpriced and has no added extra's. I had to wait for a shower which was not that clean, and the sauna was not hot. I paid $220 for a 80 minute treatment, and expected to get to use the facilities...but there really were none. They do have a small gym which you can use the day of service, but regular hotel patrons pay $10 a day for. For the price of this hotel the gym should be free! Also the "quiet room" I look forward to at spas is next the main pool were tons of kids were playing, so it is not Quiet! The lasrt night we ordered room service, which tasted ok, but took an hour to arrive. It was pricey but room service always is, but what killed me was an 18% gratuity charge PLUS a delivery charge....more added fees! So we finally check out, and are glad to be done, when we get slammed one final time! As I mentioned before there were errors on our bill, but they also charge $16 per day for parking! Usually I can understand this when the fee is told upfront, but from the way it was presented at check in you thought the parking was included. The spot has your room number on it, so if you don't use it no one else will....just another way to bang you out for a few bucks. BEWARE..BEWARE.....Unless you want to throw your money away and get mediocre service pick another resort!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: GregSt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two young daughters went here just a week ago, based on the generally favorable reviews on this site and the recommendation of a friend in San Diego. While the place was well located (on Mission Bay, near Sea World) it was not worth the $300+ we paid per night to be in a "Bayside Bungalow." The bungalows (their most expensive room type) are generally nice (not great), but the "bay view" is not worth the money. You're not on the ocean; the water is still and the beach is not very attractive. We liked the main pool very much, the grounds were very nicely landscaped and the restaurants were good (Baleen is overpriced with no entree less than about $25+). Also disappointing were a number of things including the fact that they were charging $10 per day for use of the gym/spa -- at $300 per night, that should be included. That added tot he feeling of being "nicked and dimed" (so did a poor $4 latte). Also, the observation tower was covered in bird excrement, which reflected poorly on the hotel generally. There's also a slight "theme park" feel here as opposed to that of a truly elegant resort (which they represent themselves to be). Upon reflection, the Hotel Del Coronado (on the ocean) would have been a much better experience for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: MilesToGo
Reviews.Content: The Paradise Point Resort has everything; you don't need to leave if you don't want too. The resort is structured around a bay and has duplex bungalows. Our bungalow had a small entrace area, a huge room, fridge, mirowave and eating area, large bath area, couch and a small patio. We were a short walk from the bay, the spa and the pool. Our room was very clean and well organized. We enjoyed our stay very much and this would be a great location if you're planning on visiting Sea World which is right down the street. We booked trhough Hotwire at a rate of $119 per night and it was a steal at that price.

Reviews.Title: “hold onto your wallet”
Reviews.Author: sunnygal1900
Reviews.Content: If you have money to burn stay here. Parking is 18.00 a night on top of your 182.00 per night. They do not tell you this until you get there. Too, late then, it was a package. Then, simple fare was quite expensive as well. Any healthy choices will cost you dearly. Lovely view, great Christmas decorations. The worst part, having to leave unexpectantly 2 days early. We had trip insurance and Expedia tried to get our 2 days back or at least a portion. The manager would not give a dime back he said. We were very disappointed as we had no choice and had to leave early. It is up to the discretion of the hotel and they chose to give nothing back. From now on Days Inn it is They do it all...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! I highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My parents used to take our family when I was a little girl to Paradise Point, then called Vacation Village and we loved it, so when my husbands company decided to make Paradise Point their destination for a company retreat, I was very excited to take my own children there. I am always one to read reviews, and was disappointed when I read a few bad ones, however, now that I have stayed at Paradise Point, I will have to highly disagree with the negative reviews. I don't know if Paradise Point listened to the complaints and fixed them or what, but we had a wonderful time there. The rooms were very clean and very cute. The grounds are absolutely beautiful. The service was excellent and professional, and the food was great. The beach area was very nice also. And you can't get a much better location. There were over 50 employees there, and every person we talked to seemed to agree that Paradise Point is a wonderful, beautiful place. I would definantely stay there again! My kids loved it! Thanks for a great trip Paradise Point! Keep up the good work so my children and theirs can continue to enjoy this beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: bensnan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for 2 nights and were very impressed, it is set in a beautiful tropical island with lovely Bali type pogodas with chairs to sit and look out over the lovely lakes. We checked in very quickly and the receptionist was very friendly and helpful. Our bungalow type rooms were spotlessly clean but a bit like the chalet style that you get in a holiday camp but once inside our bathroom was lovely and the room was very well furnished, the beds were huge and the linen was clean, we had a lovely lanai with two chairs and a table overlooking the lake,it was very tropical and very relaxing.The Bayside restaurant was very good but we asked for cappuchinos after our meal and was told to go next door to the Baleen restaurant which was very expensive. We were charged $22 for four coffees.The pool areas were lovely and very clean. A beautiful place with lots of lush tropical plants but the rooms were not as luxurious as the island. Would stay there again and we loved San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised- gorgeous resort”
Reviews.Author: honeymoonusa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon. We paid an extra $50 a night to upgrade to a bayside view room- 233. To be honest, I was a little nervous about staying here because of the reviews on here, but we had a great time- don't be put off. We found staff to be helpful and friendly. The grounds are really amazing- gorgeous gardens and pools, with blazing torches at night- it was a shame that we had lousy weather as we would have enjoyed it much more with a bit of sun. Having said this, the pools are heated, and we loved the adult pool with the hot tub at night- it is pretty much deserted and very romantic with changing light colours in the pool/tub at night, with clean towels provided at the pool. If the weather had been hotter we'd have loved to have stayed on the loungers there. The bayside view was really lovely too. We ate at the Barefoot Bar and Grill every night and for breakfast one day- we found the prices to be reasonable and the food nice- eg $6.95 for 3 massive pancakes and syrup. Service was very good too. If you feel like eating out one night and don't have a car, take the no. 9 bus into Old Town, where there are lots of nice Mexican restaurants. The bus stop is at the end of the entrance to the hotel. the Baleen was too expensive for us. Sea World is a short walk away. We wanted to visit Coronado, so took the Old trolley Bus tour which can be booked and picked up from the hotel for $30, which was good value. We also went shopping at Horton Plaza and at Fashion valley. You can get on the no 9 and change at the Old Town transit center for Fashion Valley mall, all for $1.75 fare. Alternatively there is a free shuttle that goes from the hotel twice a day except Sunday. We loved the shopping and got some bargains in the Macys sale. On the downside, we were pleased with the room, but found the carpet to be a bit dirty if we went barefoot- probably because of the bayside location. It did smell a bit musty on arrival, but we didn't notice it after that and it didn't affect my asthma at all - think it's its sea location which causes this- we went to mauritius and had the same problem with mustiness but worse. We didn't have ants- and were generally pleased with the size and facilities in the room- not as bad as painted on here. Gift shop was very pricey for essentials, which was a shame ($7.99 for a sandwich). These aspects stop us giving it a 5- if the prices for rooms were a little lower and the rooms refurbished we would have given the resort 5. Similarly, we found the Spa to be very expensive ($120 for a 50 minute facial), so did not use this, when i would have loved to have gone if it had been a bit cheaper. Overall though, we thought the resort was great and would stay here again if visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grounds, nice location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and upgraded to a standard suite #301. The room was large and clean with a nice patio that faced the adult pool and a nice pond. The kitchen was a joke, with just enough room to walk in but we ended up not needing it anyways. Disappointed we upgraded. The room did smell musty and the everything had a damp feeling to it, but we noticed that if we set the a/c unit to just blow air and close the outside vent, the smell went away. That is the price you pay for being on/by the water. The bed was very comfy and besides the damp feeling, no complaints. Cute room. The grounds were beautiful and extremely well kept. We loved taking evening strolls to burn off our dinner. We only ate breakfast at the Barefoot Bar & Grill and besides being a little pricey, enjoyed our meals and service. The coffee was awful so we went to the Coffee Cart next to the gift shop every morning for a coffee. The gift shop is nice, but again pricey for what is offered. At night, the grounds are beautifully lit with a romantic feel. All the staff we encountered were very friendly. Adult pool was nice and relaxing. The lounge chairs were padded with a thick cushion so we easily fell asleep. Over all, we enjoyed our experience at Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxed stay”
Reviews.Author: stora
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay at this hotel and would rate it as above average. Was given a garden room that opened up at the back to a pretty garden and little pond. The gardens that surround the rooms are beautiful and well kept and coming from a gardener that is praise indeed !! The picture on the website is a little bit misleading as it is of a top price room and all the rooms are in fact joined together one side or the other so they are not detached but we did not hear much noise from next door even though they had a young baby so the walls cannot be that thin. We ate at the bar & grill and it was a Saturday night , great live band, fantastic setting , bit pricey, but the Thunderbird racing was on that weekend so it was fun to see how the others live who have money. Food was nice and well presented and once they had all gone on Monday it was lovely and quiet again and no problem getting a table. It is true what someone wrote before, if you have breakfast there the birds can be a bit of a problem and both times we ate in the morning the food was only lukewarm so I think they had a bit of a delay in the kitchens. There are not any other restaurants in walking distance but a few nice one's within five minutes drive going right out of the hotel. Great hotel if you are into water based activities but we did not go in the beach and the pools were lovely and quiet. The concierge does keep maps of all the local tourist spots so do ask him first, I wish we had before we bought a useless map in the gift shop. Watch the in room movies, as we got charged twice for the same film as it connects really quick even if you are just browsing. One word of warning, on our last day we bought three cakes and three hot drinks from the stall outside the gift shop to have on our homeward jouney and they cost 23 dollars- thirteen pounds in English money- at home it would have been £ 7.50 and that is being generous !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: Cubbies
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left this place was excellent in every category. We arrived on a Friday afternoon check-in was quick and we were hoping to catch a ballgame after a quick conversation with the concierge, he had got us 2 tickets for the game as quick as a flash. The room was lovely and had agreat outlook to a stream with ducks that you woke up to on a morning which was nice. The pillows in the room were the best I have ever slept on in a hotel. The landscaping of the resort was beautiful and there were always staff gardening tidying up reparing putting greens and generally keepinhg the place tidy. The heated pool was lovely and fairly quiet as well. The barefoot grill was a good setting with bar type food that was nice. And at night the mood changed again with beautiful lighting that accentuated the resort and gave it an entirely differnt look again. The only negative I would have if you could call it that was that it was a little far from downtown and if you were catching a cab in each night it could soon add up.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away - not a 4-star as advertised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a nice weekend and booked through Hotwire. Hotwire listed the hotel as a 4-Star property and was NOT. We have stayed at many 4-star Hotwire hotels and been pleased, but this was not the case here. Rooms are very dated, dark - with a strange dim spotlight that highlights the bed. The rooms were large and provate, but the parking area is very dark and not well marked. The secuirty guard banged in my door at midnight to move my car because it was parked in the wrong spot - even though they were 4 empty spaces next to mine and the reason it was not in marked spot was because the numbers were worn off. The pool looked nice, but there was power boat races going on around the property and we were informed that we should leave by 8 AM and come back after 4 PM if we wanted any solitude and not have to face traffic congestion. Beachfront here means a sandy beach overlooking a bay/lake that overlooks mobile homes and camping areas. I give this place a 1-star and advise you to book elsewhere - not value oriented either. Parking was $18/night for a non-urban hotel - crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time here - a few probs but not major.”
Reviews.Author: sarah333
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and our trip down the west coast of America. When we checked in we were upgraded to a bayside view room which was fantastic of them. They seemed really organised at check in and had someone on a golf cart who was lovely ready to show us where our room was - which was really helpful. The room was massive and had such a lovely view, we really liked the complex there were windy roads with gorgeous flowers and vegitatin and ponds with ducks and they also had massive fish and sharks swimming in a river at the back of the restaurant. It was a beautiful setting. There was also a lovely gift shop with all sorts of bits and pieces and food and drink. The pool areas were great and it's nice to have an afult only pool to get away from screaming kids - although when we went there was no staff there to serve drinks so we ended up going to the main pool anyway. We ate at the Baleen restaurant which was expensive as you'd expect but the food was absolutely delicious. The only down sides were the barefoot bar and grill where we had breakfast - the food was gross, we had poached eggs that were liquid. The plates weren't cleared very fast and there were pigeons and seagulls walking over the empty tables trying to pinch food - it was horrible!
