First of all, the setting is just beautiful. The grounds are extremely unique with the lush landscaping, ponds, wildlife, and so forth. Moreover, the main pool/jacuzzi area is equally beautiful and great fun to swim in for kids and adults alike. While the bedroom we stayed in was a little dusty perhaps at first and had a torn screen door, it is hard to find such spacious rooms with such comfortable beds and linens anywhere. Moreover, any issues we asked housekeeping to attend to were promptly addressed. I also really liked how the rooms all had patios that went out to lovely gardens and ponds. It made for some very relaxing morning coffee sessions with my husband! Finally, I found the staff most helpful. At times, the facility seemed a little understaffed, but we also visited at an off-peak time, so this wasn't a big problem. Once Thanksgiving week rolled around, I saw many more staff on site, so I'm sure it is a function of numbers of people checked into the hotel. All in all, I highly recommend the resort and feel it should be highly rated for its uniqueness and character in particular. Any issues encountered while on site will be quickly addressed by the friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but disappointed by the bungalows”
Reviews.Author: spmclw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thought that the location and the landscaping of the resort were beautiful. We stayed in early November 2004. Everything in and around the resort seemed to be very well maintained. Our kids loved the main pool. Unfortunately, I have to agree with some of the other reviews regarding the guestrooms. The bungalow we stayed in had a run down look to it. One of the table lamps barely functioned. The sheets on the sofa bed were worn. One of the doors to the bathroom would not close because it was coming off its hinges. And, the walls had multiple scuff marks. The staff quickly fixed most of these issues. The wood was painted with a faux "distressed" motif. Unfortunately, most of the doors and cabinets were really distressed. On the plus side the bathroom area was very clean. It was a beautiful location, but not a very good value for the money. I was especially annoyed by the $16 a night vehicle fee they charged.

Reviews.Title: “No Better Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Terrific Hotel; a must try when in San Diego. Weather was great and hotel was beautiful. Ate a Baleen and the filet was the best I ever had. Met the GM, Jeff and he really cared about the guests!

Reviews.Title: “A taste of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: meathwoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 04 for 2 nights. We were very surprised when we arrived at the size of the place. Our room was very spacious with large living area and very clean. The only problem was the air conditioning, it was not pumping too much cool air, but we got that problem rectified and someone came to fix it while we were out to dinner. We ate at the restaurant onsite, there was a big crowd there due to it being a saturday night so we had to wait over an hour for food, but there was a band and entertainment outdoors which made up for it. We stayed mostly at the smaller pool (quieter than the larger one) and it was closer to our room. Check out was quick however they added someone elses restaurant bill to our room so make sure to check it. They rectified the problem and found out where the charge was to go and placed it on the correct bill problem solved. Would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in its Class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from Paradise Point and upon reading the previous review I feel compelled to respond Being there on the same date as the previous reviewer I am staggered to read what I did Like others I too was concerned by the less than favourable reviews this hotel had but decided to go with it after being assured by United Vacations of the hotels quality. Having just left the Venetian in Vegas (Brilliant by the way) we headed South for San Diego and Paradise Point. Arriving in darkness did not help our check in as we ended up in a large conference hall foyer which was deserted which we thought was reception, at that point I did have great concerns about where we were staying, but once u grasp the size of this place our mistake was an easy one to make. Once we found reception checking in was simple and quick and CERTAINLY NOT Delapidated!!! we were guided to our room by a man in a golf cart who also took the kids along for a ride. The room was large, Very clean (including the carpet) it looked out on to a stream the patio did have debris on it but after the storms thay had full acceptable, it was cleaned in a couple of days. The Oueen sized bed was the best we had ever slept in really excellent my only critisisim was the bath way too small with a little rusting round the overflow but nothing major. The pools were also very good the groundstaff were having a very difficult time with the weather and the leaves but did a remarkable job my whole family really enjoyed their time at the pool no birds or bird poo NOTHING and as for being overrun with kids this is complete nonsense this was a very quite week, my children were struggling to find other kids to play with for the whole duration, one day we had the whole main pool to the four of us I would recommend this hotel, this is not The Coronado!! its Paradise Point a diffterent style and Class of hotel but never the lees very good in its own right. I have pictures available if anyone wants to see for themselves and I assure u No Poo, No Delapidated Reception, No Hoards of Children, no Dirty looking Pool just a really nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “A real let down!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our honeymoon with Kuoni, we had already spent some time in San Fransisco and Las Vegas and really were having the holiday of a lifetime........that was until we arrived at Paradise Point. I had read some reviews so was a bit concerned but Kuoni had assured me it was a fantastic place. The first thing to hit us was the horrible damp smell everywhere, reception was really run down and dilapidated, and had a smell of air freshener trying to cover up the damp smell. After checking in (took a while), we were taken to our room which was was so dark due to all the overgrown trees and bushes, and the patio outside was really mouldy and damp. The room smelt really damp, the carpet was filthy making our feet black, and the bathroom stank of cooking pasta? We kept hoping things would get better, but when we ventured outside we found the beach to be dirty and smelly, everything was covered in bird poo and everywhere was overrun with kids!! The pool was also green and looked very uninviting. What made matters worse the shop sold bird food to encourage more poo to the resort - I would have thought it would be unhygenic with all of the open pools! I was so upset I would rather have flown home than stay at Paradise Point. Luckily Kuoni managed to move us the next morning to the Del Coronado (fantastic), and we had a great rest of honeymoon. I really wouldn't recommend this resort (& spa - what a joke!) at all we thought it was terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Our Little Bit Of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been going to Paradise Point when it was called "Vacation Village", many years ago. We are there several times a year and have never had any problems. My son is a teenager and P.P.is the only place he wants to stay. We have changed rooms at times and no trouble. Many times I have seen and heard the guests being very rude to the staff who work very hard to make us comfortable and try being helpful. Attitude is something that needs to be controlled when a problem is encountered. We usually never leave the resort but stay there and just enjoy all that is offered. It may be a little pricy but well worth it. Looking forward to our next trip to P.P.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point the good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: RKBB
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Paradise Point on October 4th, 5th and checked out on the 6th. (Family of 5 Dad, Mom, Kids 15, 11 and 6) Upon arriving the grounds look great - you feel like you are arriving at a resort in Hawaii. The Lobby is very attractive. We had booked a Lanai Garden Room, but upon arrival my husband decided to upgrade to a bayside suite. The checkin attendant was quick and friendly. The Bellman that drove us to our room by golf cart was very friendly. Upon arriving my husband told me that the room was not as nice as he expected, but not terrible. The kids slept out in the living room on the pull out couch. We had a king size bed in a separate bedroom. A single bathroom is shared by all. The toiled is in with the shower so one person at a time had the whole bathroom. The room definitely showed it's age. The Bay outside was ok, but there were signs about the water not being safe after a rain (runoff). We did not feel that the bay water was swimmable and was cold. The room had a kitchenette, but no utensils, etc... That night we were cold (being from Phoenix) and turned on the heater. Our room filled with smoke and the fire alarm went off. No one called or noticed from the front desk. We fanned the room out till the alarm stopped. It was late and we did not want to change rooms so we went to bed with the smell of smoke in the room. The next morning we called the front desk. They did not seem to care about it - said they would send a repairman while we were at Seaworld. No apology, etc... We decided to see how the repair went. Seaworld was great. Our daughter got splashed by Shamu so when we got back to the room she layed her wet sweatshirt out on our deck chair. The sweatshirt was from Paris and had sentimental value for her. Well in the morning it was gone. She was crying and called the front desk to see if anyone had turned it in. They did not seem interested - did not act like they cared - and did not have it. I know it should not have been left outside, but they could have been like - oh no! We will definitelykeep our eyes open and watch for it (ie at least feign fake concern). The heater did work the second night so we did not pursue that issue. The last morning we called to see if we could get a late check out (a Weds in the middle of October) and they said no. There hotel book says to ask about late check out, but I guess they were busy?! We did check out then go to the pool for awhile. The pool is very nice. In summary the good points are the beautiful grounds, great pool - nice and heated, the barefoot cafe - where the staff was actually very nice! The bad points are substandard accomodations for the price, mostly uncaring staff. I would only stay here at a discounted rate - definitely not for full price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paradise Point for three nights last week. Check in was a little slow, but overall the staff was very helpful. Our room had a cottage feel to it and was situated right on the bay. The room was clean, had a comfortable bed, and a large bathroom. Given that a lot of children have started their school year, we found the place quiet and peaceful. The breakfasts at Barefoot Bar and Grille were reasonable and tasty. Our dinner at Baleen's was delicious but pricey. We were disappointed that there was a daily fee to use the fitness room as well as a daily parking fee. My spa experience was wonderful and worth the splurge. My biggest complaint would be the cost of everything at the resort, but it seemed to me as if San Diego as a whole is rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose this location based on the amenities that were listed for our children. No where in any write up on this property, was it listed that every single thing you want to do is at an extra EXPENSIVE charge. $20/hour for tennis, $20/hour for use of the basketball court and $8/per person for mini golf. For four of us to enjoy minigolf, it would have cost us an additional $40. The room rates are fairly high for this property. I believe that tennis, mini-golf, and use of the basketball court could have been included in the room rate. It is at the Del and at the Marriott properties. We felt cheated and decided to spend our time off-property! Meals were outrageous. For two of us at lunch, with no drinks and no childrens meals, the bill was $56 (chicken ceaser salad, iced tea, hot dog ($11).....just too much to enjoy our stay. Never again...

Reviews.Title: “Fine Family Resort Minutes from Sea World”
Reviews.Author: m_tusk_04
Reviews.Content: We went with another family and stayed for 2 nights over Labor Day weekend. We booked this vacation from a flyer that we received from our kids' school and got a great price (under $200 per night). This is definitely a FAMILY resort with beautiful, sprawling grounds. It's also a 5 minute drive to Sea World. Because of the great price, I was not asking for too much and therefore very pleasantly surprised. If I had gone there thinking that I was staying at a luxury resort, I probably would have been a bit disappointed as it is an older property. However, I knew what I was getting into and therefore very happy with our stay. We checked in around 3:15 p.m. Our room was ready but our friend's room was not. THey said it would be ready at 4:00 p.m. and sure enough they called at 4 and it was ready. Our rooms were very clean (no problems with carpet) and the beds were really comfortable. We had absolutely no problem with noise. I noticed that another reviewer had bowl of fruit, etc on check in. They must have been staying in the presidential suites as we did not have this but never would have expected it for the price. We had a fine location facing the lagoon and quite close to the kids pool, volley ball court and main pool. The main pool was very busy with children so my 6 and 4 year old fit right in. Drink prices were expensive ($8-9 and $3ish for kids drink) but not out of line. For service we had to go up to bar. We ate at Baleen's one night which has fantastic views on the Bay. Very good service and everyone liked their meals. Although it was not on children's menu, they fixed a grilled cheese sandwich for my daughter. If we went back again, I'd probably skip this place as I don't like to spend $25-$30+ per entree when I am eating with kids. The next night (and morning) we ate at Barefoot Bar and Grill. Highly recommend as they had great food reasonably priced (entrees $10-24). The kids danced on the stage and searched for sea life. Very kid friendly. We had no problems with billing at checkout. Throughout our stay, my friend and I would ask for our bills to be evenly split and charged to each room. They got it right every time with no problems! ONLY NEGATIVE ... We had to call for room service 2x when we got back from Sea World on Sunday at 4:30ish. They finally showed up around 5 and maids were not too friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: NJSunPrincess
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Saturday night, August 21st via LAX, big mistake! The traffic was horrific. I called ahead to the hotel to tell them of our planned arrival time because I was afraid they might give our previously arranged bayfront room away. The receptionist assured me our room was waiting for us and indeed it was. Arriving at 7pm we were immediately escorted to our beautiful and spacious enough room for our family of four. Huge walk-in closet and big bathroom. The room looked exactly like the picture on the internet. A bowl of fruit with fancy water was a nice greeting. The bed was very comfortable and I had the best sleep of my life because it was very, very quiet. Anyone who is a light sleeper like me knows the value of a good nights sleep!! To me, waking up to the peaceful view of the bay is heaven on earth. We had our morning coffee in the Adirondack chairs and watched the birds swim and the fish jump. From there we went to the Barefoot Bar and Grill and had pleasant service and delicious breakfasts every morning of our stay. Our children, ages 9 and 11, had the buffet and my husband and I ordered from the menu. If your children are big eaters, go for the buffet. The granola encrusted french toast was a favorite. The grounds are amazing! You feel like you are in the Carribean with the lush landscaping and tropical trees and flowers. The main pool was teaming with children who act like children! The pool is heated and clean enough. It is partly surrounded by a sandy beach so the water gets murky. Lots of clean towels and waitresses serving drinks by the pool. Yes, the drinks are expensive. Nothing that you wouldn't expect at a resort. My husband and I shopped at Ralph's in Pacific Beach and bought wine and snacks which we enjoyed while watching the sun set over the bay again from our chairs. The kids loved swimming in the calm bay and looking for marine life which is in abundance. The only other pool we went to was the children's pool which oddly enough was quiet with few children. This is a perfect family vacation even without the distractions of all the other San Diego attractions. Because it is so family-friendly, I am not so sure it is ideal for the couples seeking absolute solitude. I loved our room, the view, the peace and quiet, the landscaping. I would mention, if you are mainly visiting San Diego for the tourist attractions, it might be better to stay in a cheaper hotel since you won't have much time to appreciate the tranquility of the bay and surroundings. We also had our children go to the kid's club for an afternoon. They were well cared for and had a great time. Even though it was extremely expensive, it was worth it for a little alone time with hubby!! I recommend this resort to families who like to sightsee but also like to relax.

Reviews.Title: “In addition...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I forgot to include in my review that the room vanity light bulb was out, but was fixed with a simple call to housekeeping. In addition, the refrigerator, which I relied on heavily for baby formula, smelled like fish and the knob was broken so I couldn't adjust the temp. They came and put a knob on, but I had to go to the market and purchase cleaner to clean out the refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but you do pay for it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a honeymoon package in August 2004. First impressions were great, we were able to check-in at 12.30pm (normal check-in time is 4pm) and our room was very pleasant with a huge bed and separate dining table living room area. There are a number of swimming pools in the complex, catering for couples and families alike and the grounds are absolutely beautiful, both ar daytime and night. Sea Wold is about a 25 minute walk away, however if you do not have a car you will struggle to get to other places in San Diego. I would recommend car hire. The own big downside to this resort is the price of food and drink - the value for money is poor and I would recommend eating offsite in the evening. San Diego is a beautiful city, the old town is great for a night out as is The Gaslamp District, two very contrasting places. Del Coronado is picture postcard stuff as is La Jolla. One word of warning - avoid Tijuana in Mexico unless you after bargains on leather and silver. The place is just full of shops selling rubbish and shopowners hassling you to buy their merchandise. Not an enjoyable experience rounded off by the 90 minute wait at Immigration to get back into the USA. But San Diego is beautiful and our weather was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “So-So Paradise”
Reviews.Author: 1JetSetGal1
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went down for the weekend and checked in and were taken to a very bleak room, with a view of the parking lot, we had requested a garden view or bay view room. I called reception and they told us they could move us to a bay view room for $75 more, we decided to move after being tempted by water....The room was very nicely appointed, but there were some issues with smell and must as well. Room service is a disaster in the mornings. Trying to get through is a joke, and after finally getting through being told rudely that the wait would be "90 minutes." The wait on both days for breakfast orering at 8:15 am on both days, was two hours. The food was cold, order was completely wrong on the second day. Thank heavens for the microwave in the room. We rented a hobie catamaran on Saturday morning which was very nice, the staff was very helpful. For the price, we would rather stay at the Coronodo. The grounds at Paradise is gorgeous, just be very specefic when making reservations as to what exactly a garden view room means.

Reviews.Title: “Hum, Nice for families and groups”
Reviews.Author: pinksuit
Reviews.Content: Delighful setting with a wonderful layout concept. Nice for families, especially with young children. Was rather shocked with the $16.00 per day for parking fees, especially since the property is on a secluded location, in addition to not being informed at the time of making reservations. Housekeeping services was somewhat awkward. One day we were left without wash towels and one day it seems as though used bath towels were folded and rehanged. Our particular room, was in need of serious carpet cleaning or carpet replacing. We informed the staff of the mildew smelling odor and was promised that it would be taken care of by housekeeping, but it wasn't. We were also disappointed with the usage of the hot-tub. There is only one on the property approx. 44 acres. The main pool area was always overcrowed. The resort staff was pleasant. This property has wonderful potential in gaining a greater rating if thoughts of investing some bucks in the reception areas, replacing carpets, adding microwaves in all rooms, acquiring quiet refrigerators, updating furnishings, adding additional hot tubs and overhauling the menus in the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “This is my new favorite resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I too was aprehensive about staying at this resort after reading the negative reviews but am glad that I kept my reservation with Paradise Point after all. It was Paradise. Everyone was very polite and very helpful. We stayed 2 nights. We were checked in by 2pm on Saturday afternoon, the 7th of Aug, 2004. (4pm is the posted checkin time). We checked our luggage and were laying by the pool (which did not have any of the dirt mentioned by other reviewers) when the front desk called and said that both our connecting rooms were ready. The bellman helping with our luggage told us about the firepits surrounding the beach and that is where we roasted marshmallows on the first night, under the San Diego lights. The maid came to clean the room as we were leaving for Sea World the next morning around 10 am. The grounds are gorgeous and my kids fed ducks food from the gift shop right off our lanai. The prices at the restaurant, Baleen, are a bit high, but is a classy looking restaurant. We called a pizza place and had sandwiches delivered right to our room, no problem. I would have given this resort 5 stars but when we checked in Martin Quick, a staff member, did not call the bellman as he promised to have our bags checked and held while we waited by the pool for our room to be ready. I waited 10 minutes before asking another employee to please check on the bellman. However, like I said, the bellman and everyone else after was very helpful and curteous. I was offered a ride by a staffmember in one of the many golfcarts down to the firepit when I was seen walking with a bundle of firewood. We are already making our plans to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A bit run down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this resort for a convention. The group rate was about US$195 for a room! It is an impressive looking resort but once you start using the facilities, you start to notice that it's a bit run down. One room had a toilet that wouldn't flush and after calling house keeping several times, still noone showed up. It's a large resort and sometimes it seemed like it was short of staff especially with a convention going on.

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure, Wow!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon Paradise Point by accident and fell in love with it! Who knew a tropical paradise was only a couple hours drive away!!!! Genuine, friendly staff, Beautiful, well maintained gardens, buildings and ponds, lovely garden room with the bay right around the corner, dive-in movie and all the sports were a hit with the little one! I wish I had known about this place 6 years ago, we would have gotten married here! Absolute heaven! I would give it an excellent rating if they would lose the $16/day parking fee. Parking is free at Mission Beach, it seems a little ridiculous and uncouth to charge for parking at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “A Poor Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort was a big disappointment. We made a last-minute decision to take a three-day getaway (late July, 2004) with the kids. We should have kept looking. The furnishings are tired, and despite the wonderful pictures, the entire resort looks a few years past it's prime. Housekeeping is poor, and the carpeting in our unit was filthy. Just walking across the room in your bare feet left your soles black. The main pool area was not very clean, and poorly staffed. The restaurants were very poor. The food was almost inedible, and the only thing worse was the service. VERY poor and inattentive. If you do decide to go, be sure to check your bill carefully. When we arrived, the lobby was full of people checking out and disputing their bills. When we departed, the three people in line in front of us were all disputing their bills, and yes, our bill was wrong as well. The staff needs some serious customer service training. Their common attitude is clear that they could care less if you are there. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced paradise”
Reviews.Author: MTruvillo
Reviews.Content: Myself and a peer stayed at Paradise Point with our families while in San Diego on a business trip July 24 - 28th. We were referred here by our travel agent because it had a kids program that my kids (7 & 9) could stay at while I was in meetings. While the property was very pretty, it was not worth the $300 a night! The rooms were ok but nothing to write home about. The refridgerator knob was broken and it froze our drinks. A light bulb was missing over the bathroom vanity (which is very small) and I killed two spiders in the bathroom. The beds however were comfortable. My co-worker had no chairs on their patio. When they called about it they expected they would bring out nice chairs like the other patios had - they brought $5 plastic chairs. They were disappointed for the money they spent and value they recieved. Plus a $16 a night parking fee is rediculous. I was surprised that they charge for every amenity - tennis, fitness, etc. even the USA Today delivered to your room which most upscale hotels do not. The kids club was not geared for business travelers as the hours were 9:30 to 4:00 at a whopping price of $160 for 6 1/2 hours. There is no actual room for the kids like there is in other resorts they basically take the kids around the resort doing activites like playing tennis, walking on the beach, riding a bike, etc. My kids did have fun but the price and the times were not comparable to the other hotels with kids programs. The food was very overpriced and not very good. We ate at the pool and at the Barefoot restaurant - we would have gone out but there is not much around the resort close. I got a half hour massage at the spa and and found out that it is only for 25 minutes and they automatically charge a 20% gratuity! The treatments are all overpriced too - $72 for a 25 minute massage. On the 28th we moved to the Catamaran Hotel for the rest of our trip. The Catamaran has - which had similar type of grounds like Paradise but was $100 a day cheaper. We booked it through Southwest Airlines Vacation Package. We were pleasantly suprised that kids under 12 eat free at the Atoll restaurant, tickets for complimentary appetizers at the restaurant, complimentary cruise on Mission Bay for the family on the Bahia Bell, and tickets for 2 free hours in the arcade per child. Our room was spacious and had a kitchen with a full size refridgerator, dishes and cookware. Which was great to save money on eating out every meal. Plus the hotel had a schedule of activites most of which were free including surfing lessons, movie on the beach with coke & popcorn, kyak lessons, etc. They also didn't charge like the Paradise Point for all of the amenities like the fitness center, tennis, etc. They did charge for parking but it was $9.00 a night and it was covered in a garage. I would recommend that you save your money and stay at the Catamaran or elsewhere in San Diego instead of Paradise Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: hey19
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I were meeting in San Diego and I wanted a nice place to stay. My travel agent suggested the Paradise Point Resort. It was the most money I had ever spent on a hotel room. When I got there the room wasn't made up and it was 7:30 at night! And the only room they had was with one bed! But when I finally got to the room it was stunning. The decor was bright and cheery. And there was a sofa bed, but the the bed was huge and high and had big, fluffy down pillows, we just picked a spot. The patio had lounge chairs and it was so grown with tropical plants you would have thought you were alone until the sound of an occasional golf cart went by. Paradise-yes. Pricey-yes. I go to San Diego alot, and it was by far the nicest room-but for the price-and the parking-I think I'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found Paradise Point Resort while looking for a spur-of-the-moment weekend trip. We had never heard of this resort, but it was the first item to pop up on Expedia and it looked great, so we booked our weekend. We were pleasantly surprised, when we arrived. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are very quaint. The staff was very friendly & helpful. My goal was to find a place I wouldn't have to leave in order to enjoy my weekend. We found that we were close enough to San Diego to venture out, if we wanted to, OR we could easily stay and at the resort and have a great time. My 6 year old had a blast in the main pool. Live music at the pool by day, and a poolside movie at night. There was also live music at the Marina restaraunt. There was a mixed crowd of people. Retiries, families and college-partiers were all present. I couldn't put my finger on what kind of crowd the resort tried to cater to. I guess my point is - everyone would feel welcome there. It was a great time. We'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: nick3333
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week over the 4th July 2003 and were deeply disappointed. On arrival we were shown directions to our room, only to find it had not been cleaned. Our second room was located next to a smelly pond and was for disabled persons. We stuck to our third room, but the decor was still tired and the whole room needed to be refurbished. Then to our amazement when we tried to get into bed the sheets were dirty. They did come and change them quickly, but we received no apology from the management. We also went to eat in their restaurant baleen and were greeted with oysters that were off and uncooked seabass! The setting of the hotel could be very nice, but I would never stay here again and for the price we would have preferred the Coronado or the Loews, which were comparable.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the 5th July for 4 nights.We checked in and were allocated a garden view room which consisted of approximately 6ft by 6ft, with no garden furniture. When we went into the room we found that we had been given a Queen size bed, when we had actually paid for a King. Contacted reception and were allocated another room, which on inspection had the correct sized bed, but had obviously not been cleaned very well as the two bins were full, and a scrap of used notepaper lying on the table. Allocated another room, found also that the bin had not been empied but everything else appeared to be okay.Worthy of note was that all three rooms had a musty smell. On checking outside we found only one garden chair, again we rectified this ourselves ( next door was vacant and being decorated). Used both of the restaurants and coffee bar on site and found them very expensive. (e.g. $3 for a small regular coffee). A lot of facilities for the younger guest.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for 4th of July Weekend”
Reviews.Author: yukster1
Reviews.Content: Myself and two other travellers from New York stayed here over the 4th of July weekend. The accomodations were okay, a little smaller than expected. In our room, there was 1 small closet, and a couple of drawers. Some of the furniture needed paint renovations, etc, however there is a refrigerator and microwave in case you want to keep food in your room. The property is very nice, although spread out. It is not directly on the beach as it infers in the brochure. Be prepared to spend as most of the amenities (gym, putting green) cost additional funds and even the hotel restaurants are more expensive than normal. The gym facilities are limited. The resort seemed to gear more to kids, there were a lot of families staying there. There are plenty of pools near the room and in the main area for swimming/tanning. It is very close to Sea World (about a 25 minute walk, 5 minute drive), however it is very difficult to get a cab to come (usually around a 15 minute wait). We were under the impression that Pacific Beach was a short distance away (15 minute walk is what we were told) when in actually, it's about 45 minutes to an hour away by foot and you're better off driving or taking a cab ($10). It's about a $20 cab ride into downtown San Diego. Overall, if we ever came back to San Diego, we would look to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Oasis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: B & B Bayside Bungalow Suite June Special $285. Included breakfast and parking. Special because of June Gloom? Specials for sure equals many, many, many kids. Recommend reserving any room with a bayside view. Although the resort is absolutely breathtaking, the big star is the bay. Room was reminiscent of a friend who let you crash at their beach house. Comfortable and very casual. Most amenities are present, except snacks and drinks. There is a very well stocked gift shop on site. A breakfast buffet is offered at $15.95. A bit pricey for breakfast, but convenient and quite tasty. Dinner at Baleen was extraordinary. The view, service, food. I had the Chinese Fried Snapper $26. The presentation included the head and tail. It was the best meal I've eaten all year! The resort offers many, many, many activities. We rented a motor boat at their marina for a couple hours one day, and we had a massage at the spa. The staff with out a doubt is very friendly, but the service can be inconsistent. For as many positives there is regarding this resort, I think I can put up with a few inconveniences. And finally, the location can't be beat, just north of downtown San Diego and just south of La Jolla. We had a fabulous San Diego vacation. Thank you Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “A tropical paradise”
Reviews.Author: WCEAGLE2
Reviews.Content: Great resort in the middle of Mission Bay, within minutes of downtown San Diego. Lagoon room w/2 Q beds - ample room for 2 adults, 2 kids. Great family resort - picked up shells on the beach, rode bikes, played tennis, swam in main pool (5 pools on property) and had a wonderful time playing the putting golf course (all grass, not a pee-wee golf course with dragons or windmills). Nice, well maintained landscaping. Room 170 near main pool is noisy, so we moved to quiet lagoon room #582. Barefoot Grill ok for breakfast... dinner menu weak.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to get away and relax...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I needed to get away from the stress of civilization, and Paradise Point is just the place! It's on it's own little island in Mission Bay. Each couple have their own private cabana, with different sizes and amenities. Great for romance, but it's also made for families too. We had a Bayside cabana, much better than the Garden view cabanas. We had our own patio, and beach front. The place is not brand new, but extremely well maintained, clean with room fridge, cable tv and movies. When you want to shop or go to the restaurants on the property, a hotel employee picks you up (for free) in a six seater golf cart outside of your cabana and whisks you off. They have a beach front bar/cafe, and a great upscale restaurant, Ballens, with the best food I've had at a hotel in a long time. The view of the bay is incredible. Staff is extremely courteous and helpful, when I ordered room service after midnight, they said no problem, even though it was technically too late. We plan on going back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good for kids, was expecting more”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to going to the Paradise Point Resort but was somewhat disappointed in our stay. I had certain expectations based on the price that we paid for our room. Although the room was large with a kitchenette and a nice bathroom with two sinks and a separate shower/tub area, it had a very standard feel. We were a bit lost because there was no information in our room on the resort (places to eat, things to do, spa amenities, room service, etc.). On our last day we didn't even know what time check-out was. There is a $10 a day charge to use the fitness center, which I was told was standard at resorts, however, other than the size I'm not sure what makes this place a resort. Additionally there were no chairs on our patio, when we called housekeeping they said they were all out, when we pushed the issue they said they would find us some. They delivered two plastic chairs that didn't match, one new and the other very dirty. On the brighter side the pool was very kid friendly with a large splash zone, warm temperature, and a sand area for the kids to play. The Paradise Point Resort has great potential but needs work in the area meeting guests expectations - before they have to ask would be great.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed resort atmosphere in metro area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay with family of four. Grounds were beautiful, quiet and gave you the feeling of seclusion and being somewhere other than in a metropolis of 2.3 million. sure beats a downtown highrise hotel. This is not an ocean beach hotel so dont expect crashing waves/ swimming/ surfing on site (those are a couple miles away) our children were older, but a large number of families with young children were guests. families with young children travelled on bicylcles as the resort is more spread out than it seems. bungalows are not large, but comfortable and clean. went spent a good portion of our time at San Diego attractions. the resort is centrally located for sightseeing and car travel is not difficult. A rental car is a must if you fly in. At the price we were paying it seemed a bit over the top for the resort to charge $16/day just to park your car in front of your bungalow; but we were charged extra for parking (in addition to admission price) at every attraction we went to, so I guess this is a California thing, midwesterners just have to get used to. overall, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!”
Reviews.Author: patronlime
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point was indeed paradise! I had a wonderful time from the end of the conference I was attending in San Diego until I left San Diego. The room was beautiful and spacious. There were ducks strolling across our patio one morning! The staff bent over backwards to accommodate our every request. Baleen and the Barefoot Bar were great places to eat and drink. The grounds were unbelievable! I have no idea what anyone could possibly complain about here. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Good Property, overworked stafff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Paradise Point. Check in time not until 4:00. Keep this in mind if you have children. Not enough staff to support the needs of a booked resort. Waited 30 minutes in line just to check in. Resort is very spread out, so if you don't have a car it can be up to a 10 minute walk to get to the main pool. Best friend had his camera stolen by security. Resort "looking into it". Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rezlab
Reviews.Content: Spent four days and three pleasant nights at Paradise Point with my family of four. Made our reservations online about one month in advance and had no problem with check-in or room availability. Our check-in assistant was cheerful, attentive and sincere. The room was bright and airy, and very clean - it would have been immaculate if the carpets were cleaned. No mildew, mold, or ants in sight. We slept well as the beds were firm, yet soft, included lightweight down comforters, and the rooms very quiet.If your idea of a vacation is spending time on an island with populated with single story bungalows nestled among a spectacular garden, pools, water features, the bay and birds, this is the resort hotel for you.If you plan to spend several days sightseeing in the San Diego region - this resort's central location is ideal. Sea World is next door, and it is only a short drive to the Zoo, La Jolla, Balboa Park, Point Loma, the Gaslamp District, Old Town, and Coronado Island.Check for the "package deal" rooms. Your deal may not be the same, but for an extra $20.00/day we received free parking ($16 value) and a $35 credit towards breakfast at the Barefoot Bar & Grill. If it is a sunny morning, the view from the Grill patio is priceless. The breakfasts here are similar in quality and price to Mimi's, and the kids meals are a good deal. If you skip the $3.50 orange juice or coffee drinks - breakfast for a family of 4 (2 pre-teens) can average around $35.00 - and the view of the bay is wonderful.If you are new to the area and need some restaurant suggestions, I'd suggest checking out the San Diego Union Tribune website at http://------------------------------------------------------Other reviewers may have been "bumped" from receiving their rooms as other guests don't leave when originally planned - but this IS a resort hotel you don't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Needs Empowerment”
Reviews.Author: allisonhnewport
Reviews.Content: We arrived without a reservation mid-week in April and undersrtood that this might be a problem. After standing in line for 20+ minutes we were quoted a price, while the man at the desk next to us was told he would have to use the house phone to book a same day reservation. We asked about an upgraded bayfront room and were also told we had to use the house phone as the front desk staff was not able to assist us. We spent another 10 minutes making the reservation, returned to the line and waited another 15 minutes to be told that our room was not available until 4:30. We went to lunch at the outdoor restaurant (VERY overpriced with slow service but our 6 year old enjoyed the lagoon with fish and the birds so it was worth it) and then went to the pool. At 5:15 we were notified by cell phone (a nice touch) that our room was ready. Another 20 minute wait in line and we had a room. The room was small and the windows did not open. This left us with a choice of either being very warm, leaving the screen door open all night or having the air conditioner keep us awake. Why don't the windows open? Overall, the grounds were nice and this was a good place for a 6 year old. The bay was nice to explore. The front desk staff was borderline rude and very cold. We had no utensils or plates in our kitchenette and called to request some. We felt like we were putting someone out by making this request. Overall, it sounds like we had one of the better rooms. We were planning to give it another chance, but with all San Diego has to offer, we may explore elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very leary to stay here b/c of the reviews. We arrived at Paradise Point around noon, however, our room was not ready until 4:30pm. Our room was nice. I think we got a remodeled room b/c the furniture looked like it was newly reupholstered and the carpet was unstained. The room was definitly not up to 4 star rating, though. The bathtub and tile needed to be replaced, the room smelled musty, and there were ants. The view was nice and the pool was great for kids. I would consider staying here again, but only if I find discounted rates.

Reviews.Title: “Gave our room away too!!!”
Reviews.Author: Foodie2006
Reviews.Content: Two days before our arrival, received call from hotel that their internet booking system made a mistake and they overbooked the hotel. Despite the fact that I had emailed directly with the hotel to confirm all details prior to making my online booking, AND putting down a deposit, they canceled our reservation. We are being put up at the Dana Inn for one night of our stay, and we are paying $139 for the second night of our stay - we specifically chose NOT to stay at this hotel originally, and now that is our only option. If we had known back in February when I booked this reservation, we would have had the opportunity to book a room elsewhere. Now, everything is sold out. BEWARE if you are booking online.

Reviews.Title: “Gave room away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Despite booking (and paying a deposit) months in advance we were notified 3 days before our planned arrival date that our room had been given away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Reccomended”
Reviews.Author: michmouse
Reviews.Content: We spent a glorious four day weekend at the Paraside Point Resort...and absolutely loved it !! We had a water-front room, and waking up each morning and sitting outside on the Adirondack chairs while siping coffee was just so wonderful! the view was so peaceful,and the pool was tropical and beautiful.....I could not imagine staying anywhere else when visiting San Diego. When we left to visit other California destinations, we wished we had allowed more time in "Paradise" We will definitely be planning another cross-country trip to Paradise!

Reviews.Title: “"Very Pleasant Stay"”
Reviews.Author: LovinFL24
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 3 nights at Paradise Point Resort and would return there again without hesitation. I had read many reviews for this resort, some good and some bad. So I must admit I was very nervous about the time we were to spend there. I had booked many months in advance for myself, husband, brother, his wife and my nephew. Our rooms were newer with a king size poster bed, fireplace, french doors to a wonderful view and jacuzzi in the room big enough for two! We had wild ducks and birds eating right out of our hands and if it hadn't been somewhat cool weather our stay was wonderful. The staff was very helpful and we avoided the restaurants due to the prices. But overall, we'd return in a second!! Way to go, Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here, Eat Out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family recently spent seven nights at Paradise Point for Spring Break. We are a family a five and it is generally difficult to find a hotel room big enough to suit our families' need. Paradise Point did just that, we were very pleased with the size of the room, adjoining bath and sink area, as well as the separate closet and "kitchen" (small fridge, sink, and microwave) area. During our stay, cooler temps and cloudy weather did not prevent our family from enjoying the pools. When they say "heated" they're not kidding. Don't be fooled by claims that the resort has six pool areas, all others beside the main pool are small and not kept well. We were disappointed with the restaurant, the less formal one seemed completely overpriced when considering the quality of food. We found many nearby restaurants to be much more satisfying and cost effective. I would encourage anyone staying to take advantage of the on-site spa, it was expensive, but well-worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point--Fantastic for Children”
Reviews.Author: MauiMarried
Reviews.Content: Because of the mixed reviews, I wanted to cancel my reservation. Thank goodness I didn't. This is probably the best vacation I've ever taken with my 9-year-old son. The grounds are impeccable, the service phenomonal and the "casual" family restaurant is 4-star quality! The restaurant is outdoors over a lagoon with various sea life. It was great for the children (and adults). The rooms are beach bungalows, although well-appointed and high quality. It is true that some mildew exists and that the carpets are due to be replaced. But because guests are trekking in and out all day--sandy and wet-- it seems nearly impossible to keep clean and without mildew. Perhaps, they should copy their Caribbean counterparts and put tile in, instead of carpet? At any rate, none of this was any cause for concern it was such a slight matter. The property offers a lot to do-- bicycling, a full marina, heated pool, spa and exercise room and small golf course. As well, it is across the street from Sea World. The only reason that I didn't rate this "Excellent" is because the walls are too thin. During crowded months, this could be a problem. It is noteworthy that Forbes rated this one of the Top Family Resorts this year. Take your children!

Reviews.Title: “Paradies Found, but skip breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel in a resort setting. My family of five had a great time making friends with the ducks, walking along the beach and exploring the many trails throughout this tropical paradise. Although we didn't do Seaworld, there was plenty to do nearby. We went to the Zoo, Balboa Park, Legoland, La Jolla and other places of interest in San Diego. This hotel was close to all. The rooms were spacious, clean and the staff friendly; especially the reservation staff. The on-site restaurants were a fortune ($3.50 for a glass of juice!), so I would recommend eating out. There were plenty of places around for that, so it wasn't a problem. It just would have been a lot more convenient to eat at the hotel every day. All in all a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 8 nights in San Diego. The last 4 nights were at The Paradise Point Resort. We had a wonderful time. The room we had was very nice and clean. The service at this hotel was impeccable. Whenever we needed something(family travelling with 2 children) they treated us like we were the only guests and met our needs promptly. The restaurants were very good. Pools were great. The location was perfect for getting to area attractions. Overall this was by far one of our nicest trips. March 6 - 10, 2004.

Reviews.Title: “Has Potential”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the weekend of February 29 for a family vacation at Sea World. The grounds were spectacular and the kids had fun feeding the ducks. The service was amazing. It took them only seconds to bring extra towels, sheets, and fix the toilet...yes, the toilet and the plumbing had problems. And the carpet was dirty. My kids ran around the room with white socks and it turned black in less than 1 hour. There was a heater in the living room but not in the bedroom...so you had to leave the door open. I paid for an upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite, so when I complained of the plumbing/heating problem, they reimbursed me. Like I said, the service was fantastic. If you have patience with a little older hotel with a homey feeling, this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for couples or families”
Reviews.Author: ConcertboyPT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last month and was extremely pleased. The spa was excellent, and my girlfriend can't wait to go back. There is beautiful beachfront for sunning in the day or walking at night. A couple of pools wiht an excellent sundeck area as well as numerous recreational options make this a great place to stay wity a family. Rooms are huge with large bathrooms and closets as well as a nice porch to relax on.

Reviews.Title: “Don't choose this resort for your vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from vacation. Four nights in Las Vegas at the Mirage and three nights at Paradise Point in San Diego. I was conflicted about choosing Paradise Point because of the reviews I read about it. Some great some terrible. I should have believed the terrible ones. The grounds ARE beautiful but I wasn't sleeping under a Palm tree. The rooms are shabby at best. Old, musty, moldy and ant infested. I was thankful to only be spending 3 nights there. I couldn't have taken any more. We were supposed to have a garden view room. That must have been the bush outside our door which looked out to the driveway. For something nice to say... the food and service at the bar and grill was good and it is very pretty to drive in and out of the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: dfctrip
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Paradise Point. I had read the reviews on this site, and I viewed photos from the resort's own website. From the time you enter the driveway of this private hideaway, you feel a tingle of excitement...I am from the East Coast, so it was pretty amazing to feel cradled by palms, bird-of-paradise flowers and pastel colored poppies! The grounds are a wonderland of gardens, pretty bridges over brooks, fountains, etc. The grounds were immaculate and obviously well-tended. The staff was absolutely professional, friendly and courteous. The hotel upgraded our reservation from a garden lanai to a bayside room when they learned we were on our honeymoon, we had not asked for this, but were very pleased! The room we stayed in was just as shown in the internet photos: very clean, albeit slightly worn, maybe just not as crisp as brand new. The on-site restaurant, "Baleen" was classy and served excellent food and wine. Main pool was super! Now, understand that I got a great rate ($150 range) over the internet, and I feel we absolutely got a dose of paradise for this money! I can't imagine paying over $230 for this room...I can't wait to return someday!...I don't understand any negative opinions of this property on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Limited At Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After looking at the net and seeing the reviews from travel guides, I thought this would be a lovely place. While the grounds were lovely, we found the rooms musty and moldy smelly and mean extremely so. We had a bay side view room which was extremely disappointing and nothing of interest to look at. The rooms in general were o.k., but extremely over priced for what you got. The activities there are primary for the ten and younger children and are not appealing to kids over ten. I would not go back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grounds and views”
Reviews.Author: gregdfd
Reviews.Content: The grounds are truly beautiful with ponds, waterfalls and rivulets. The Barefoot Bar & Grill is casual and sides the marina and a salt water pool stocked with sharks, stingrays and other fish. Our room was not ready when we arrived and they took us immediately to another nearby room. It too was not ready but they sent housecleaning over immediately and offered us a $50 credit. We had a bayside room which was small but the view was incredible. We did not like the extra charge to play basketball or the parking add on. Would be a better stay in the summer when you could use the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival found the grounds beautiful. Check in was a cold & unfriendly experience. Room smelled of smoke. Returned to front desk, different person very helpful, upgraded us to nicer room. Room was nice, on the bay, not the cleanest but acceptable. Had drinks & dinner at Bar & Grill. Waitress made it very enjoyable. Very attentive. Food is good, not excellent. Location is Excellent and Relaxing. Decided to stay a second night. Very disappointed comp coffee service was not replenished without two phone calls and 3 hours later. Brought coffee packs but no sugar, cream or stir package. We enjoyed our stay. Found it peaceful & relaxing. Great location to explore San Diego from. However, Management needs to pay attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Dream honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in June 2003 and went to Paradise Point for our honeymoon. Some of the reviews I have read on here are rediculous to me because we had the most amazing time!!! Not just because it was our honeymoon either! As soon as we got to the resort, we checked in and told the guy at the desk that we were on our honeymoon. He bumped us up to the biggest suite they had available for free! A guy came and took our luggage, helped me into a golf cart and drove us to our room. The room was spectacular (by the way...NO ANTS and SMELLED GREAT!) The grounds are BEAUTIFUL with not a thing out of place and no trash to be found anywhere. Yes, food is expensive, but worth the money! Room service was excellent and the consierge was extremely nice and helpful, renting us a car and giving us coupons for Sea World and Disneyland. We will definitely be going there again for an anniversary or with our kids one day! You won't be disappointed. It's paradise! Who needs Hawaii?

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Care”
Reviews.Author: cakintl
Reviews.Content: The most disappointing part to write in this review is the fact that the hotel staff including the management just does not care. Before this review was written, I contacted the management on 2 occasions and explain to them the events and their subsequent results, but they would not even respond. The hotel grounds are beautiful and the restaurants on the property are simply wonderful. However the staff & management is another issue. When me and my wife checked in, we were assigned a room which could be a Motel 6 room (facing the bay). The bed creaked so much that it could be broken, the toilet leaked, and yes you can hear your neigbour shower. Don't ever ask the staff for directions to any local event, because they WILL get you lost and you WILL miss your perfectly planned evening. Quite simply this place could be truly paradise with a management staff who is trained and given to the service of its guests.

Reviews.Title: “My letter to the president of Paradise Point Resorts”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: December 12th, 2003I am writing to let you know of the incredibly disappointing time I and my girlfriend endured at your Paradise Point resort. We d heard a lot of great things about your hotel and spa and, I am sorry to say, experienced none of the pleasure about which others had spoken.For starters, we arrived at 3:15 P.M. on the afternoon of December 6th. Upon checking in, we learned that out room was not ready. I asked the person at the front desk what time check-out occurred and she said Noon. Why it took 45 minutes (we were finally allowed access at 4 PM) for our room to be ready I have no clue.I was led to believe by the person with whom I d spoken that the room was a suite, and that it was, indeed, separate from other structures. This was not the case. Our room, in fact, was attached to three other bungalows. I was also led to believe that this and another room (no ocean view) at $279 were the only two kinds of rooms left available at the resort. When we checked in, I heard a front desk attendant mentioning there were rooms available for far less. Thinking we were locked in to our $299 per night room, plus the fact that the phone reservation person said it was usually a $579 per night room, I figured What the heck? and we waited the 45 minutes until the room was ready. Upon seeing the room, we were surprised by: its small size; the fact that it was referred to as a suite at all; the fact that it was NOT separate but rather an attached structure -- the nearest room to ours housing a screaming child; the two spiders in the kitchen; the rust on the shower fixtures; the incredibly noisy heater; the fact that we bumped into doors all night, fumbling for the bathroom in the dark; and, in the morning, the fact that there were no flats on the windows, allowing the light to flow in at daybreak.The view, yes, was quite lovely from our windows, but other than that, the suite struck us as nothing more than a glorified Holiday Inn room. I, in fact, have been in Holiday Inns where I felt a great deal more comfortable. I took a walk on the private beach in the morning, only to find a bar-b-que pit with beer cans and garbage strewn about. Awful.This is just a note to alert you as to your establishment s deficiencies, in the hopes that other patrons do not suffer similarly in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Accommodations and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Every inch of this spawling complex is absolotely beautiful. The lobby, the grounds, the rooms, restaurants, beaches, pools, spa etc... Bring your camera, lots of breathtaking scenery throughout this place. Worth every penny...I think some reviewers haven't had many hotel stays or maybe they're just cheap. We had 2 adults and 3 kids (including a 9-month old) in the Bayside Bungalow for about $350/night...not a bad rate for a suite even in off-season. We were not dissapointed. I would however caution folks about the room assignment. This place is absolutely huge but all the cool stuff is towards one side so you could end up having quite a hike to the main pool, spa, restaurants and gift shop. I made them re-assign me to a more centrally located room which they were quite accommodating with. Don't let them put you too far from the action (unless you prefer it). Also, the restaurants are beautiful but don't plan on eating there every night because they are a bit over-priced and the menu (especially at Barefoot) is pretty limited. Breakfast room service is excellent and worth it (try the yummy French Toast). Very elegant serving Foot Loops to my 8 year old on a fresh linen tablecloth in his jammies. He was impressed. Lots of activities at this place that we unfortunately missed because we were running all over San Diego doing stuff (Legoland, Sea World etc...) Wish we had more time, you may want to allocate a day just for the hotel. Mission Bay area is great location to base yourself if your sightseeing. Very convenient access to all major roads and beautiful. We went to Sea World twice because it was so close and the tickets were free the 2nd day (and we had missed a show). We love this place and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic and romantic stay we had on our 10th anniversary trip. The resort was everything, and more, that we could have hoped for. Our room was spotless and perfect. You drive into the resort and feel like you are in Hawaii! It is incredibly beautiful. The staff were all exceptionally friendly and helpful. It was a PERFECT week of rest and relaxation. The spa was a wonderful experience also. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! We will deffinatley be back!

Reviews.Title: “Too Expensive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For what you pay for a room here, I would expect alot more! Yes the grounds are beautiful. But for $220 a night, I expect my toilet to flush, and not to be awoken by an ear piercing whine every time the neighbor turns on the water or flushes the toilet. And the price of anything in the gift shop (i.e., pop, juice, yogurt, etc.) is criminal! After getting jabbed for the price of the room, this was just adding insult to injury. Finally, if you don't have a vehicle to get around, stay somewhere else or bring your gold card.

Reviews.Title: “homcoming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with our stay. My sister & Icame to Cal. to see my son in the Navy, he just got back from Iraq. We upgraded our room to the bayside, the room & the view were beautiful!!!! Service was very good.I think its only as nice as you make it, or what you want to spend!!!! It was worth the money. I don't think this is a place for kids , it was perfect for us , so relaxing!!!! The spa was wonderful , & all the staff were very nice!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be duped by the hype!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you have kids look elsewhere. Fortunately we don't, but that doesn't mean this place is OK.We arrived after staying in this resorts sister hotel in Pheonix (which was breathtaking compared) Only to be greeted by stuck up staff at reception.Ok we thought, one person doesn't make this place bad right?? Wrong!If you do not have a car, DO NOT stay here!! Can't stress that enough. Even if you do it is about $14 per day to park!!The so called "Island Market" (a deli with t-shirts) takes full advantage of the monopoly it has over people without a car - $7.50 for a sandwich - which was horrible and $10 for 6 pancakes.The rooms are ok if you get a rear facing patio like we had, otherwise you overlook the road.The main pool isn't anything great, and the smaller pools are not heated and can be VERY cold.However, reception staff do need a lesson in politeness, not once was one pleasant.I must say that the consiege "Bobby" was brilliant, very nice gentleman, very helpful and courteous, and also the barefoot vare & grill was good food and good service.Look closely before you book

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: BrianIthaca_NY
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room at the Paradise Point Resort, and THEN looked at your guest reviews. Needless to say, after reading mixed reviews, we thought about canceling our reservation immediately but decided to "suck it up" and go anyway. Well, that was one of the best decisions we ever made. Our very private 'room' was one half of a cute little bungelow, literally a stone's throw out the front door to Mission Bay and private sandy beach, and a beautifully landscaped rear patio area complete with waterfalls and bubbling streams running right by us. The rooms were charming, well appointed, clean (no mold or ants anywhere!!) and very comfortable....reminding us of a quaint Cape Cod cottage. We couldn't, for the life of us, find anything to complain about. In fact, my wife, who's done alot of traveling and had many stays at resorts said after our first two nights, "I don't know when I've enjoyed a place more!" We are returning to San Diego during the Thanksgiving week and have already rebooked ourselves at the Paradise Resort. My advice (for what it's worth)....ignore the negative comments and find yourself a bit of paradise too!

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay in a "Lanai Garden" room. What we got was a room on the street with 2 chairs by the front door(room #316). The room price was $209, complete rip-off. Parking was $14 per day-another rip-off. The pool across the street from our room was smaller than a residential backyard pool--and very run down. We had booked a 5 night stay, but we checked out after the first night. What a terrible way to start our vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “It is a toss up!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well we had already booked the hotel when I found this site. My assistant had searched for places for the family and the original one we wanted was booked so we thought we would try this. Without a doubt the site and brochure stuff is way different than the hotel. Here is the summary: For kids, it was above average, the movies in the pool every night were cool, and the fun stuff for them to do. The biggest issue we had was a bunch of your Army boys in for the weekend it seemed drinking alcohol and smoking at the kids pool. No security and it was out of control. The hotel needs to think about the fact they have kids around and deal with security issues fast. The beach is nice and quiet for the most part. Restaurants leave a lot to be desired as a "family" type place. I sent my wife to the spa for 6 hours and she said it was probably one of the best ones she had been to..and she knows the best of the best ( bad for me). The room, well we went all out and had to bunbalows joining for our selves. Which with two kids 2 yrs and 1 yr this was great as we got to sleep. Ants, YES we had em...we read about this and we had them all over, they sprayed 3 times and we still had them..I guess when you are right on the water as our room was what can you do!! The room for the most part was very nice, big bathroom good beds, they need to improve the kitchen in the room, the room service ( we used a service 4 times like waiters on wheels it was AWESEOME!!! and way cheaper then room service!!!) overall we would think about going back but not for a long time, maybe after we tried a few more family style places..

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in California”
Reviews.Author: Beamblossom
Reviews.Content: I had to organize a girls getaway weekend for 8 women in June and Paradise Point was at the right price and the right place for it. They were able to give us two bungalows next to each other and the accommodations were very nice. I recommend the rooms with the view of the back patio and the dressing room. It came in very handy! I only wish they were able to accommodate us at the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to relax”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read the neg reviews on this site we were worried about staying here. We need not have worried at all. It was fantastic. We were on a world trip in july and august 2003 and stayed here last for 5 days. The room was very clean and smart with lots of accessories and it was just a standard room near to Mission Bay. The steaks and food in the Balleen Restaurant are excellent. The portions in the Barefoot Bar and Grill were huge and well presented. Service was excellent although check in at 4pm is inflexible. All told we loved this hotel more than most we stayed in on this long trip. We would DEFINITELY say IGNORE the negative reviews - this place is a tropical paradise and we think the bad reveiws are from people who want to keep it a secret really!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort was just wonderful and I plan on going back next year and staying longer. This resort from the time we arrived, service was A+ and I'm from Las Vegas, so I'm use to good service. The rooms were very clean and private. Great place to take the entire family. I would highly recommend this resort for a wonderful family get a way. The views of the bay are magnificant. I went in Aug, so prices would be high, but as I have found, you get what you pay for and this place was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Read your reviews before I went to Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: Mary Frances G
Reviews.Content: I read your reviews and headed to Paradise Island with a room oil deoderizer and ready for the ants. We stayed three nights. What a delightful time we had! No ants. We opened the bungalow door and it was a little musty. We plugged in the deoderizer, turned on the air conditioner, and headed to the Barefoot Bar and Grill for the $11.50 hamburger that is now $12.50. And what a deal it was! We could have spent thousands more for a trip to Hawaii and it would not have been any better than Paradise Island. With that $12.50 burger came a place so beautiful - lushious greenery, a pond next to the Bay so clear you could see the fish swim, a splashing waterfall, a trio of Spanish musicians, and friendly, well-polished service. We climbed the 81 step observatory and watched the 9:50-10:00 PM spectacular fireworks at Sea World (walking distance). I travel for my job and have high standards when it comes to hotels. This resort is not just "a wonderful room with an elevator ride" type of hotel. We want to return and next time get a bungalow on the beach.

HotelInfo.Name: Paradise Point Resort & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 1404 Vacation Road, San Diego, CA 92109
